a) The Ihram

To accomplish the Hajj-e-Tamatto, it is obligatory to put on the Ihram (after making a ghusl).
The best Miqat for the Hajj-e-Tamatto Ihrām is either the Maqam-e-Ibrahim or the Hijr-e-Ismaïl, or the Masjidul Haram (enclosure of the Sacred Mosque).

One can nevertheless put the Ihram in any place of the city of Mecca.
The best time to put the Ihram is 8 Zilhajj after the midday prayer (do not do Tawaf after putting the Ihram).

Make the intention : 'I am putting on the Ihram for the Hajj-e-Tamatto of the obligatory pilgrimage to get closer to Allah', and remember that as soon as the Ihram is put on, the 25 prohibitions have to be followed.

The only way to get closer to God is prayer and Ihram prayer is the best prayer to ask forgiveness for past sins. In making the intention of the Ihram, the pilgrim must also make the intention not to repeat his mistakes and past sins again.

Immediately after putting the Ihram and making the intention, say the Talbiya, then take the departure for Arafat. It is necessary to repeat the Talbiyà until the zohr of the day of Arafat, and not to say after that.43
By saying 'Labbayk' the pilgrim answers the call of God and commits himself to obedience. He must be sincere in his decision-making so as not to receive a negative response saying 'La Labbayk!'

Before arriving at Arafat, it is better to go to Mina. It is necessary to recite prayers in the mosque of Khif and to go to Arafat after the sunrise

By removing his usual clothes to put on the Ihram, the pilgrim also removes all his past sins and puts on a new garment as a sign of repentance. White represents purity and the one and only model of Ihrām is a sign of equality among pilgrims. This is a reminder of the Last Day when all human beings will stand before God with only shroud as their clothes.44

b) The wukuf in Arafàt

During the trip to Arafat, repeat the Talbiyà as much as possible.

It is obligatory to stay at Arafat on the 9th of Zilhajj, during which prayers and invocations are to be recited from noon to sunset.

It is not advisable to remain asleep all afternoon of 09 Zilhajj (from zohr to magrib) in Arafat, because the Hajj can become invalid (batil).

It is obligatory to make the intention of the wukuf to Arafat at the arrival and at the time of the noon prayer : 'I am stopping (wukuf) at Arafat until maghrib for the Hajj-e-Tamatto of the obligatory pilgrimage to bring me closer to Allah'.

Do not leave the region of Arafat before Maghrib.

If someone comes on purpose (consciously) after the midday prayer, he is at fault although his Hajj remains valid.

If someone goes away from Arafat by mistake, and returns to it before Maghrib, it is preferable that he pay a Kaffàro (fine) which is to sacrifice a camel in Mecca on the 10th of Zilhajj. And if he does not have the financial ability to do this, he has to fast for 18 consecutive days.

If one does not return to Arafat before Maghrib, Kaffàro is obligatory.

During the day in Arafat, it is recommended to do a ghusl (before the noon prayer).45

Arafat is the place where Prophet Adam (A) and his wife Eve were gathered, this is the place where all the Prophets acquired signs through the angel Gabriel, it is also the place where Prophet Ibrahim (A) pledged to slaughter his son Ismail, and it is here that the angel Gabriel asked Prophet Adam (A) to repent.46

c) The wukoof in Mash'ar

The Mash'ar (Mouzdalefa) is a long valley between Arafat and Mina, about ten kilometers east of Mecca. The station in this place is the third obligation of the Hajj. After the maghrib of 9 Zilhajj, we must leave Arafat to go to the place called Mash'ar or Mouzdalefa.

If possible, pray the maghrib and ishà in Mouzdalefa.

Then make the intention : 'I am performing the stop (woukouf) in Mouzdaléfà until dawn for the Hajj-e-Tamatto obligatory pilgrimage to bring me closer to Allah'.

We must not move away from Mouzdaléfà until sunrise and make intention again at the time of the dawn prayer.

It is recommended to pray during the stop in Mash'ar (Mouzdalefa) and to collect 70 small pebbles.

After sunrise, take the departure for Mina. We are therefore on the 10 Zilhajj.47

The Qur'an says : « You do no harm if you seek a favor from your Lord. When you break out of Arafat, call on God at the sacred monument; invoke it, since He has directed you, whereas you were previously among the lost. »48

Imam al-Sadiq (A) says : 'The gate of heaven opens when pilgrims address their prayers and ask for forgiveness crying to invoke Allah ; for their rewards, God answer them : I am your Lord and you are my creatures, you have accomplished your tasks, and I accept your prayers and forgive you your sins, and I pour out on you my mercy.'49

d) Mina (stoning, sacrifice and shaving)

Mina is a land located in a valley between the Mash'ar and Mecca. Stoning is the first activity in Minà. We arrive at Mina on the day of Eid-ul-Hajj. There are 3 obligations to fulfill this day :

- The Rummy : The stoning of the Shaytans.

- Kurbani : The sacrifice.

- The Taqssir (cut a lock of hair) or the halk (shave his head).

After these 3 obligations, we must go back to Mecca but we must return to Minà before Maghrib because it is mandatory to spend the night. (You have to stay in Mina either maghrib until the middle of the night, or the middle of the night until dawn).50

1) The Rummy (stoning)

On the 10th of Zilhajj, after sunrise, one should stone the Jamarat-e-Akbà (the great Shaytan) with 7 pebbles.

It is recommended to do wudhoo for rummy. Stoning can be accomplished from sunrise to sunset.

If by forgetfulness we did not do it on the 10th of Zilhajj, we can do it until the 13th of Zilhajj.

The pebbles must be small and have not already used. They must be collected from Mouzdalefa preferably.

Make the intention: 'I am performing the stoning by throwing 7 pebbles at Jamrat-al-Akba for the Hajj-e-Tamatto of the obligatory pilgrimage to bring me closer to Allah' and throwing the pebbles strongly.

The pebble must hit Jamarat-e-Akba directly, because if it hits it after hitting another object, it is not valid.

If in doubt (if the pebble hit it or not), you have to go back. The number of pebbles to hit is 7, no more, no less you have to throw the 7 pebbles one after the other, saying at each throw : "Allaho Akbar".

Today, Shaytans are represented by walls. You have to hit the center of the wall.51

The Devil appeared 3 times in this place and sought 3 times to influence Prophet Ibrahim to disobey God, because God had ordered Prophet Ibrahim to sacrifice his son as a test. On 3 occasions, Prophet Ibrahim chased Satan away by throwing stones at him and was prepared to sacrifice his son. On the advice of the angel Gabriel, the Prophet Ibrahim stoned the apparition 3 times with 7 pebbles, to signify his contempt.52

Imam al-Sadiq (A) says : The angel Gabriel was guiding and guiding Prophet Adam for the ritual of Hajj, and when Satan appeared at this place, the angel Gabriel ordered Prophet Adam to throw him stones.53

Satan is symbolized by 3 pillars of stones : a small, a medium, and a large, spotted by 3 poles 150 meters apart.

2) The Kurbani

This is the second activity in Mina.
The animal for sacrifice should be either a camel, a cow or a sheep, with no difference in gender, any other animal is not accepted. The best is the camel.

The animal should be healthy and complete. It must not be blind, lame, sick, too old, with cut ears, teeth torn off, having defects of horns, castrated, skinny etc …

Make the intention : 'I am doing Kurbani for the Hajj-e-Tamatto of obligatory pilgrimage to bring me closer to Allah'.

If possible, slaughter the animal yourself. Otherwise, the Hajji and the butcher (as representative) must both intend to do so.

Distribute the animal in three :

- for oneself
- for believing friends
- for the poor.54

Prophet Ibrahim was 100 years old and had only one son, Ismail, who was only 13. One day, he told his son that during the nights of 8 and 9 Zilhajj, he had dreamt that he was sacrificing him. Prophet Ibrahim often received Allah's orders in the form of dreams. Ismail replied, 'Father, do what is ordained to you. You will see, if it pleases God, that I am one of those who know how to be patient in the trial.' The prophet Ibrahim (A) then stretched his son on the ground, blindfolded himself and took the knife to but when he took off his blindfold, he was surprised to see his son standing next to him and to see that he had slaughtered a sheep in his place.55
The Qur'an says : « And We called out to him : ‘O Abraham ! ’Indeed, you have proved the dream true ; verily We reward the doers of good ! This is indeed the manifest trial. And We ransomed him with a great sacrifice. And We left (praise) for him among generations (to come) in later times. Peace be on Abraham. »56

Pilgrims perform this ritual of sacrifice on the occasion of the Eid al-Adha in the desert of Mina.

3) Taqssir or Halq

This is the third action to be done in Mina.

After Kurbani, Taqssir consists in having a lock of hair, a little mustache or a fingernail cut. The halk is to shave your head.

For a man who makes the first mandatory Hajj of his life, it is mandatory to have his head shaved.
For women it is forbidden to shave their heads.

Make the intention : 'I am performing the Taqssir for the Hajj-e-Tamatto of the obligatory pilgrimage to bring me closer to Allah'. Shaving or cutting must be done in Mina, it is not permissible to do it elsewhere.57

Imam al-Sadiq (A) says : 'Shaving the hair is a sign of humility and modesty towards his Creator and by shaving the hair, the pilgrim also shaves the internal and external defects.'58

Once the Taqssir is completed, it can be considered that the Ihram is removed even if Ihram's linen is still on the body.

But there are still 3 banned out of 25 : perfume, hunting and sexual intercourse that will disappear only after Tawaf Un-nissa.

When the Taqssir is finished and there is enough time, you have to go to Mecca to fulfill 5 obligations :

a) The Tawaf-e-Hajj-e-Tamatto

Upon arrival in Mecca, you must complete the Tawaf-e-Hajj-e-Tamatto. The same regulation must be observed as that for Tawaf-e-Umrà. Only the intention changes : 'I am performing the Tawaf 7 times for the Hajj-e-Tamatto of the obligatory pilgrimage to bring me closer to Allah'.

b) The prayer for Tawaf-e-Hajj-e-Tamatto

After the Tawaf, do 2 rakaats of prayers at the Maqam-e-Ibrahim, like the dawn prayer.

The intention : 'I am praying two rakaats tawaf-e-Hajj-e-Tamatto prayers of obligatory pilgrimage to bring me closer to Allah'.

c) Sa'yi between Safa and Marwa

To make 7 courses between Safa and Marwa under the same conditions as in Sa'yi of Oumra-e-Tamatto.

The intention : 'I am performing the Sa'yi between Safa and Marwa for the Hajj-e-Tamatto obligatory pilgrimage to bring me closer to Allah'.

After the Sa'yi, you can apply perfume. But the other 2 other bans remain.

This is the place where Ismail's mother walked the distance between Safa and Marwa in search of water. This ritual reminds us of the fatigue, thirst and hunger of the Day of Judgment.

d) Tawafun-nissà

Then you have to perform a Tawaf 7 laps around the Ka'aba. Women's Tawaf is not specific to men, it also applies to women. So if the man does not do this tawaf, his wife remains a stranger to him, and if the woman does not do it, she is not allowed to be with her husband. If someone has not done the women's Tawaf by carelessness and has returned to his country, he should either come back and perform it or appoint someone to do it on his behalf.
The rules remain the same.

The intention : 'I am performing Tawafun-nissa obligatory pilgrimage to bring me closer to Allah'.

e) Prayer for Tawafun-nissa

Perform a 2 rakats prayer of Tawafun-nissà at Maqam-e-Ibrahim.

Do not forget to make the intention.

After the Tawafun-nissà prayer, all prohibitions are lifted.

Remember, however, that hunting around the city of Mecca is prohibited in all cases.

Before Maghrib, you must return to Mina.

f) Mina (Station at night and stoning)

You must stay in Mina on the 11th night and the 12th night of the month of Zilhajj.

Do not forget to make the intention of the wukuf (stop) in Mina at the maghrib of each day.

The intention: 'I am stopping at Mina for the Hajj-e-Tamatto of the obligatory pilgrimage to draw closer to Allah'.

After sunrise on the 11th and 12th days of Zilhajj, each of the 3 Shaytans must be stoned 7 times. 21 stonings per day for 2 days. We must respect the order of stoning : we must start with the small column, then the average, then the big one.

For woukouf, it is obligatory to stay in Mina from maghrib at midnight or midnight at dawn. All night is recommended. If we stay the 13th night (end of the 12th day) in Mina, then it is obligatory to stone the 3 Shaytans on 13 Zilhajj after sunrise, then we can leave Mina.

If someone does not have the physical ability to stone the three Shaytans, he can appoint a representative.

We can definitely leave Mina on the 12th of Zilhajj after the midday prayer, and we must bury the rest of the pebbles in Mina. From Zilhajj 10 at noon until dawn of 13 Zilhajj, we can recite the takbir after each obligatory prayer.

The takbir of Eid-ul-Hajj : Bismillahir rahmanir rahiim, Allahu akbar, Allahu akbar, laa ilaha illa-llahu wallahu akbar, Allahu akbar, 'alaa maa hadana walahul hamdu 'alaa maa awlana, warazaqna min bahimatil an'am.

Before leaving Minà, it is recommended to make 6 rakàts of obligatory prayers (2x3) at Masjid-e-Khif and to say Soubhanallaah, la ilaha ilallah, alhamdolillaah 100 times each.

g) The Tawaf-e-Widah

Tawaf-e-Widah is not obligatory, but highly recommended. With the same conditions and regulations, make a Tawaf 7 laps with the intention of Tawaf-e-Widah.

Then do 2 rakats prayer of Tawaf-e-Widah.

There is also a prayer of 2 rakats towards each corner of the Ka'aba and 2 rakats near the Ka'aba.

It is possible to perform other Tawaf on behalf of believers or relatives.

Each Tawaf must be followed by 2 rakats of prayer at Maqam-e-Ibrahim.

The Prophet (S) said : 'On the Day of Judgment, the true pilgrim will have the right to intercession, and the sign of Hajj's acceptance after his return is that he does not fall back into sins ; if he falls back into sin his Hajj will not be accepted'.59

Mecca is the most sacred place of Islam and the holiest city of Muslims. This is the place of birth of the Prophet (S) and the place where the Qur'an was revealed.

Mecca is mentioned in the Qur'an as "The mother of the cities" (Umm al-Qura) and as "The city of peace" (Al Balad al-Amin).

Mecca is also home to Masjid al-Haram, Ka'aba, Qibla (leadership) of Muslims. Every year, millions of Muslims visit it for Pilgrimage (Hajj).

Masjid al-Haram means "The Sacred Mosque". It is the largest mosque in the world. In the Qur'an, it is mentioned 15 times.
This mosque was built by Prophet Ibrahim (A) and Prophet Ismail (A). Prophet Ismail (A) brought the stones and Prophet Ibrahim (A) put them in place. The angel Gabriel guided them at every step and showed them where to place the black stone (Hajarul Aswad). After the construction, they performed the Hajj, as the Qur'an says : "Abraham and Ismail raised the foundation of the house : Our Lord ! Accept this from us : you are the one who hears and who knows everything."60

In the center is the Ka'aba, the birthplace of Imam Ali (A), in which is embedded a black stone that Muslims touch during the Tawaf (circumambulations) during their pilgrimage (Hajj).

According to Imam al-Baqir (A) : 'The prayer in this holy mosque is worth more than 100,000 prayers in another mosque.’61

The Prophet (S) said : 'Near Allah, no mosque is as valuable as the Masjid al-Haram.’62

Imam as-Sadiq (A) said : 'This place has been called Masjid al-Haram by its sanctity, and that is why the disbelievers can not come to Mecca.'63

Imam as-Sadiq (A) said : 'The Masjid al-Haram is valuable because of the Ka'aba.'64

Imam al-Baqir (A) said : 'To look at the Holy Ka'aba is an act of worship.'65

O my Allah, I am the wrongdoer and sinful, (so) I am extending my hands to You, (just) because of the good opinion that I carry about You. O my Allah, I am the evildoer, sitting before You, confessing to You of my ill deeds and hoping for You to overlook my faults. O my Allah, I am the unjust, raising my hands in the hope of attaining that which You have in possession; so, do not deprive me of Your favors, out of Your mercy. O my Allah, I am the reverted to disobedience, kneeling before You, for I fear the day on which all created beings shall kneel before You. O my Allah, I am the faulty servant, coming to You with panic and fear, raising my sight to You with caution and hope, shedding tears, seeking forgiveness, and showing regret. By Your Might and Dignity I swear! When I disobeyed You, I have not intended to disgrace You and when I disobeyed You, I have never been unaware of You. I have never intended to expose myself to Your punishment, and I have never belittled Your watching over me; rather, my soul has commended to me, my adversity has overcome me, and I was deceived by Your screen that covers all my defects. Ka’aba : The Sacred Mosque of Mecca, the "House of God", by which the earth has been spread out and which has four corners (or angles) :

a) The south-east corner, where the Hajarul Aswad (the Black Stone) is placed about 30 cm, is located in a 10 cm silver frame, the most noble corner of the Ka'aba marking the beginning of each Tawaf. A brown trace on the ground prolongs this demarcation.

b) The Iraqi corner (Iraqi) in the North East facing Iraq.

c) The Syrian corner (Shami) in the north-west facing Syria.

d) The Yemeni corner (Yamani) in the Southwest facing Yemen.

Hajarul Aswad (Black Stone) : The black stone of the Ka'aba is a blessing of Allah. It is located in the southeast corner of Ka'aba. Pilgrims go around the Ka'aba in the circumambulation setting (Tawaf), one of the rites of Hajj (pilgrimage). It is at the sight of the Black Stone that begin and end each of the seven rounds of circumambulation around the Ka'aba. The Black Stone was brought down with the Prophet Adam when he left Paradise. Originally, the Black Stone was white, but it became blackened by being touched by human beings and because of their sins.66

Al-Multazim : Before the Yemeni corner there is 'Al-Multazim', where the supplications are also answered, where the recognized sins are forgiven. Sticking to the wall of the Ka'aba here (body and hands) is a cure for all evil and a protection from the fire of Hell. It is in this place that prophet Adam (A) received forgiveness from Allah. In this same corner, the Ka'aba opened to let Hazrat Fatima bint Assad (A) for the birth of Imam Ali (A). The crack closed behind her as she came out. Until now, this crack is apparent despite efforts to erase it. Between this corner and the Black Stone, 70 prophets are buried.67

The Hatim : It is between the Black Stone and the door of the Ka'aba. It is called so, because the most grievous sins are forgiven. This is where Prophet Adam (A) repented. There are also tombs of Prophets. This is the place where the angel Gabriel will appear before Imam Mahdi (A)-(our 12th Imam).68

Mizab al-Rahmah : Mizab al-Rahmah means "out of water of mercy". The Mizab is the trench (of gold) to evacuate rain from the roof of the Ka'aba on the wall facing Hijr Ismail (north wall). It is reported that the Prophet (S) invoked God under the Mizab.

The station of Ibrahim (Maqame Ibrahim) : It shows the footprints of the Prophet Ibrahim (A). Imam as-Sadiq (A) said that when Prophet Ibrahim (A) ordered people to make the pilgrimage, he climbed onto this stone, which softened under his feet, creating his fingerprints.69

Hijr-e- Ismail : It was the house of the Prophet Ismail ; it is now his grave, that of his mother Hajra, that of his daughters and also of other Prophets.70

Ziyarat of the Prophet Ismail (A) and Bibi Hajra :

اَلسَّلامُ عَلى‏ سَيِّدِنا إِسْماعِيلَ ذَبِيحِ اللَّهِ اِبْنِ إِبْراهِيمَ خَلِيلِ‏اللَّهِ اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا نَبِىَّ اللَّهِ وَابْنَ نَبِيِّهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا صَفِىَّ اللَّهِ وَابْنَ صَفِيِّهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا مَنْ أَنْبَعَ اللَّهُ لَهُ بِئْرَ زَمْزَمَ حِينَ أَسْكَنَهُ أَبُوهُ بِوادٍ غَيْرِ ذِي زَرْعٍ عِنْدَ بَيْتِ اللَّهِ الْمُحَرَّمِ، وَاسْتَجابَ اللَّهُ فِيهِ دَعْوَةَ أَبِيهِ إِبْراهِيمَ ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا مَنْ سَلَّمَ نَفْسَهُ لِلذَّبْحِ طاعَةً لِأَمْرِاللَّهِ تَعالى‏، فَدَفَعَ اللَّهُ عَنْهُ الذَّبْحَ وَفَداهُ بِذِبْحٍ عَظِيمٍ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا مَنْ أَعانَ أَباهُ عَلى‏ بِناءِ الْكَعْبَةِ ،اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا مَنْ مَدَحَهُ اللَّهُ تَعالى‏ فِي كِتابِهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا مَنْ جَعَلَ اللَّهُ مِنْ ذُرِّيَّتِهِ مُحَمَّداً سَيِّدَ الْمُرْسَلِينَ وَخاتَمَ النَّبِيِّينَ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَآلِهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ وَعَلى‏ أَبِيكَ إِبْراهِيمَ خَلِيلِ اللَّهِ، وَعَلى‏ أَخِيكَ إِسْحاقَ نَبِيِّ اللَّهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ وَعَلى‏ جَمِيعِ أَنْبِياءِ اللَّهِ الْمَدْفُونِينَ بِهذِهِ الْبُقْعَةِ الْمُبارَكَةِ الْمُعَظَّمَةِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ وَعَلى‏ أُمِّكَ الطَّاهِرَةِ الصَّابِرَةِ هاجَرَ وَرَحْمَةُ اللَّهِ وَبَرَكاتُهُ، حَشَرَنَا اللَّهُ فِي زُمْرَتِكُمْ تَحْتَ لِواءِمُحَمَّدٍ صلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَآلِهِ، وَلا جَعَلَهُ اللَّهُ آخِرَ الْعَهْدِ مِنْ زِيارَتِكُمْ، وَالسَّلامُ عَلَيْكُمْ وَرَحْمَةُ اللَّهِ وَبَرَكاتُهُ

Assalaamo alaa sayyedena ismaa’il dhabeehil'laahe ibne ibraahima khaleelil'laahe assalaamo a’layka yaa nabiyal'laahe wabna nabiyyehi, assalaamo a’layka yaa safiyallaahe wabna safiyyehi, assalaamo a’layka yaa man anba’a allaaho lahu be’a-ra zamzama heena as-kanahoo abooho be waadin ghayre zee zar’in inda baytil'laahe al-muharrame, was tajaabal'laaho feehe da’awata abeehe ibraahima, assalaamo a’layka yaa man sallama nafsahu lizzab’he taa’atan le amrillaahe ta’aalee, fadafa’a allaaho anhu dhabha wa fadaaho be dhib’hin adheemin, assalaamo a’layka yaa man a’aana abaaho alla bena'ae al-ka’a-bate,as-sallamo a’layka yaa man madahahool'laaho ta’aali fee ketaabehi, assalaamo a’layka yaa man ja’a-lallaaho min dhurriyatehi muhammadan sayyeda al-mursaleena wa khaataman nabiyyina sallalaaho alayhe wa aalehi, assalaamo a’layka wa alaa abeeyaka ibraahima khalilil'laahe, wa alaa akheeka is’haaqa nabiyyil'laahe, assalaamo a’layka wa alaa jamee’e an-biyaa illaahe al-madfoonina be hadhehi al-booq’ate al-mubaara'kate al-ma’az'zamate, assalaamo a’layka wa alaa ummika at-taaherate as-saaberate haajara wa rahmatul'laahe wa barakatohu, hasharana allaaho fee zumrate'kum tahta lewaa’e muhammadin sallallaaho a’layhe wa aalehi, wa laa ja’alahool'laaho aakheral ahde min ziyaaratekum, was salaamo a’laykum wa rahmatullaahe wa barakaatohu.

Peace be upon you and you father Abraham_ the friend of Allah, and upon your brother Is’haq, the Allah’ apostle. Peace be upon you and the entire prophets of Allah who are buried in this blessed, graceful dwelling. Peace, mercy and be upon you and upon your mother Hajar_ the pure and the enduring. May Allah make our resurrection with your group under the banner of Muhammad, peace of Allah be upon him and his progeny. May Allah not decide this time of my visit to be the last! Peace, mercy and blessings of Allah be upon you!

Zam Zam Wells : Zamzam Water is located in the basement of Masjid al-Haram. Water sprang up nearly 4,000 years ago when Hajra, the wife of Prophet Ibrahim (A), desperately sought water for her thirsty son Ismail (A), in the desert valley of Mecca where God had ordered Prophet Ibrahim (A) to abandon them. In her search, Hajra ran seven times the distance between the mounts from Safa and Marwa until the water sprangs under the feet of her son, by the grace of God. This well has never dried up. Pilgrims from around the world who come to perform the rites of Hajj or Oumrà drink this blessed water that refreshes them. Imam Ali (A) said that Zam Zam water is the best water that can ever exist on earth. And Imam as-Sadiq (A) said that drinking Zam Zam water is a cure for diseases.71

Safa and Marwa : Safa and Marwa were 2 hills near the Ka'aba, 400 m apart. They are part of the sacred places. The route between these two hills is part of the mandatory rites of Hajj and Oumra (seven round trips, almost 3 km). Safa and Marwa are the two hills where Hajra went back and forth in search of water, for her son Ismail (A).72

When the Quraysh banished Muslims from Mecca, the Prophet (S) and his family lived for 3 years in the Valley of Abu Talib (A). She'eb Abu Talib is near the Masjid al-Haram. This place is the birthplace of the Prophet (S), Hazrat Khadija (A) and Bibi Fatima az-Zahra (A).73

Today, this place is transformed into a library. The distance between She'eb Abu Talib and Ka'aba is about 250 meters.

73: Rahnamaye Hajj wa atabat, page 50

Address in Arabic to facilitate your movements :

مقبرة المعلاة مقبرة تقع في بداية طريق الحجون على يمين المتوجه إلى الحرم المكي من جهة حي المعابدة في مكة المكرمة

He is also known as "Maqbarat al-Hajun" and is known to Iranians as 'Abu Talib Cemetery'. It is located 1 km north of Masjid al-Haram. Several members of the family of the prophet (S) are buried here.

a) Abd al-Manaf

Abd al-Manaf is the paternal great-grandfather of the Prophet (S). He was an influential member of the Quraysh.

b) Abdul Muttalib

Hazrat Abdul Muttalib (A) is the son of Hashim ibn Abd al-Manaf. He was born in 127 before Hijra, he is the paternal grandfather of the Prophet (S) and the one who raised the Prophet (S) after the death of his parents. He is from the tribe of Quraysh and he was also one of the nobles of Mecca. He always believed in the uniqueness of God, and followed the religion of Prophet Ibrahim (A). When there was drought, the meccans came near him to pray and ask for rain, because his prayers were answered. The Meccans followed what he said, he was respected so much. Hazrat Abdul Muttalib (A) made many changes and improvements in the way of life of the Quraysh, such as the ban on getting married between close relatives, or burying his daughter alive, the ban on drinking alcohol. He was also the first to give the Khums. He died at the age of 82. The Prophet (S) was 8 years old at that time.74

Ziyarat :

اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا سَيِّدَ الْبَطْحاءِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا مَنْ ناداهُ هاتِفُ الْغَيْبِ بِأَكْرَمِ نِداءٍ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يَاابْنَ إِبْراهِيمَ الْخَلِيلِ، السَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا وارِثَ الذَّبِيحِ إِسْماعِيلَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا مَنْ‏ أَهْلَكَ اللَّهُ بِدُعائِهِ أَصْحابَ الْفِيلِ، وَجَعَلَ كَيْدَهُمْ فِي تَضْلِيلٍ، وَأَرْسَلَ عَلَيْهِمْ طَيْراً أَبابِيلَ، تَرْمِيهِمْ بِحِجارَةٍ مِنْ سِجِّيلٍ، فَجَعَلَهُمْ كَعَصْفٍ مَأْكُولٍ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا مَنْ تَضَرَّعَ فِي حاجاتِهِ إِلَى اللَّهِ، وَتَوَسَّلَ فِي دُعائِهِ بِنُورِ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَآلِهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا مَنِ اسْتَجابَ اللَّهُ دُعاءَهُ،وَنُودِىَ فِي الْكَعْبَةِ، وَبُشِّرَ بِالْإِجابَةِ فِي دُعائِهِ، وَأَسْجَدَ اللَّهُ الْفِيلَ إِكْراماً وَإِعْظاماً لَهُ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا مَنْ أَنْبَعَ اللَّهُ لَهُ الْماءَ حَتّى‏ شَرِبَ وَارْتَوى‏ فِي الْأَرْضِ الْقَفْراءِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يَاابْنَ الذَّبِيحِ وَأَبَا الذَّبِيحِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا ساقِيَ الْحَجِيجِ وَحافِرَ زَمْزَمَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا مَنْ‏ جَعَلَ‏اللَّهُ مِنْ نَسْلِهِ سَيِّدَ الْمُرْسَلِينَ وَخَيْرَ أَهْلِ‏السَّماواتِ وَالْأَرَضِينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا مَنْ طافَ حَوْلَ الْكَعْبَةِ وَجَعَلَهُ سَبْعَةَ أَشْواطٍ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا مَنْ رَأى‏ فِي الْمَنامِ سِلْسِلَةَ النُّورِ وَعَلِمَ أَنَّهُ مِنْ أَهْلِ الْجَنَّةِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا شَيْبَةَ الْحَمْدِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ وَعَلى‏ آبائِكَ وَأَجْدادِكَ وَأَبْنائِكَ جَمِيعاً وَرَحْمَةُ اللَّهِ وَبَرَكاتُهُ

Assalaamo a’layka yaa sayyeda al-bat’haae, assalaamo a’layka yaa man naadaaho haatefo al-ghaybe be akrame neda'ain, assalaamo a’layka yabna ibraahima al-khalile, assalaamo a’layka yaa waaretha az-zabeehe ismaa’ila, assalaamo a’layka yaa man ah’lakallaaho be do’aaehi as-haabal feel, wa ja’ala kaydahum fee tadhleelin, wa arsala a’layhim tayran abaabila, tarmeehim be hejaaratin min sijiilin, faja’alahum ka asfin maa kulin, assalaamo a’layka yaa man tadhar’ra’a fee fee hajaatehi ilallaahe tawassala fee do’aaehi be noore rasoolillaahe sallalaaho a’layhe wa aalehi, assalaamo a’layka yaa manis tajaabal'laaho do’aa’ahoo, wa noode’ya fee al ka’a-bate, wa bushhera bil ijaabate fee do’aa-ehi, wa as-jadal'laaho al-feela ikraaman wa I’a-zaaman lahoo, assalaamo a’layka yaa man an’ba-allaaho lahoo al-maa’a hatti shareba war tawee feel ardhe al-qafraa’e, assalaamo a’layka yabna dhabihe wa aba dhabeehe, assalaamo a’layka yaa saaqeya al-hajeeje wa haafera zamzama, assalaamo a’layka yaa man ja’alallaaho min naslehi sayyedal mursaleen wa khayra ahle as-samaawaate wal aradheena, assalaamo a’layka yaa man taafa hawla al-ka’a-bate wa ja’alahoo sab’a-ta ash-waatin, assalaamo a’layka yaa man raayee feel manaame silsilata an-noore wa alema annahu min ahlil jannate, assalaamo a’layka yaa shaybata al- hamde, assalaamo a’layka wa alaa aabaaeka wa aj-daadeka wa abnaaeka jamee’aan wa rahmatullaahe wa barakaatohu.

Peace be on you, O the leader of Mecca! Peace be upon you, O the one whom an unseen spirit called with a kind voice. Peace be upon you, O the son of Abraham, the friend (of Allah)! Peace be upon you, the inheritor of Ismail, the slaughtered (for Allah)! Peace be upon you, the one by whose prayer Allah demolished the people of the elephant, and put their scheme into ruin and sent flocks of birds upon them which hit them with stones of baked clay; so, He left them like the leftover devoured leaves of farms. Peace be upon you, O the one who wept for his needs in front of Allah and made the light of Allah’s Apostle a means in his supplications. Peace be upon you, O the one whose prayer was acknowledged by Allah, whose name was called in Ka’bah, who was given the glad tiding during his prayer, before whom Allah made an elephant to bow for his respect and dignity. Peace be upon you, O the one for whom Allah instigated the water which he dran and tossed into the craving land. Peace be upon you, O he son of the slaughtered one and father of the slaughtered one. Peace be upon you, O who provided the water to pilgrims and excavated the Zamzam. Peace be upon you, O the one from whose generation Allah made the leader of the messengers and the best person among the inhabitants of heavens and earths. Peace be upon you, O walked around the Ka‛bah and made it seven runs. Peace be upon you, O one who saw in dream the chain of light and came to know that it was from paradise. Peace be upon you, O Shaiba-tul-Hamd! Peace, mercy and blessings of Allah be upon you and upon your entire forefathers and descendants!

c) Abu Talib (A)

Hazrat Abu Talib (A) was born 35 years before the birth of the Prophet (S) in Mecca. He is the son of Abdul Muttalib (A), the father of Imam Ali (A) and the paternal uncle of the Prophet (S). After the death of Abdul Muttalib (A), the Prophet (S) was raised by Abu Talib (A). He loved the Prophet (S) immensely and placed him above his own sons in his home.

He was the leader of the Bani Hashim tribe and being a powerful man from Mecca, he protected the Prophet (S) and hid his faith from the Quraysh who opposed Islam. Abu Talib (A) had four sons (Talib, Akil, Jaf'are Tayyar and Ali (A)), and two daughters (Um Hani and Asma) with Fatima bint Asad (A). He died on 26 Rajab, 3 years before the Hijra.75

According to ibn Abi al-Hadid, if Abu Talib (A) and his son Ali (A) were not present, the pillars of Islam would have collapsed.76

Ziyarat :

اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا سَيِّدَ الْبَطْحاءِ وَابْنَ رَئِيسِها، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا وارِثَ الْكَعْبَةِ بَعْدَ تَأْسِيسِها، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا كافِلَ الرَّسُولِ وَناصِرَهُ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا عَمَّ الْمُصْطَفى‏ وَأَبَا الْمُرْتَضى‏، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا بَيْضَةَ الْبَلَدِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ أَيُّهَا الذَّابُّ عَنِ الدِّينِ، وَالْباذِلُ نَفْسَهُ فِي نُصْرَةِ سَيِّدِ الْمُرْسَلِينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ وَعَلى‏ وَلَدِكَ أَمِيرِالْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَرَحْمَةُ اللَّهِ وَبَرَكاتُهُ.

Assalaamo a’layka yaa sayyedal bat-haa’e wab'na ra’eesehaa, assalaamo a’layka yaa waarethal ka’a-bate ba’a-da taasi'sehaa,assalaamo a’layka yaa kaafela ar-rasoole wanaaserahu, assalaamo a’layka yaa amma al-mustafee wa abal murtazee, assalaamo a’layka yaa bayzata al-balade, assalaamo a’layka ayyoha dha’abbo anid dine, wal baadhelo nafsahu fee nusrate sayyedil mursaleena, assalaamo a’layka wa alaa waladeka ameeral momeenina wa rahmatullaahe waba rakaatohu.

Peace be upon you, O the leader of Mecca and the son of its chief. Peace be upon you, O the inheritor of the Holy Kabah after its foundation. Peace be upon you, O the guardian and assistant of the Messenger of Allah. Peace be upon you, O the uncle of Al-Mustafa and the father of Al–Murtaza. Peace be upon you, O the chief of the city (Mecca). Peace be upon you, O the protector of the religion (Islam). (Peace be upon) who sacrificed himself in assistance of the leader of apostles (of Allah). Peace, mercy and blessing be upon you and your son the Commander of faithful!

d) Hazrate Khadija (A), the first wife of the Prophet (S)

Hazrat Khadija (A) was Khouwaylid's daughter ; She was born in Mecca 68 years before the Hijra. She was from a very rich and noble family. Although she was a well-known shopkeeper, she spent part of her time in prayer. Her door was always open and no poor man left her home empty-handed. In her time, idolatry reigned in society, but she practiced monotheism. She was the first woman to accept Islam. The Prophet (S) did not marry any other woman while Khadija (A) was still alive. They had 2 sons and 4 daughters, all died, except Fatima az-Zahra (A), thanks to whom the descendants of the Prophet (S) continued. She died in the month of Ramadhan in the 10th year of the prophetic mission, in Mecca, at the age of 65. The Prophet (S) performed her ghusl and buried her in the cemetery of al-Ma'ala.77

Ziyarat :

اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا اُمَّ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا زَوْجَةَ سَيِدِ الْمُرْسَلِينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا اُمَّ فاطِمَةَ الزَّهْراءِ سَيِّدَةِ نِساءِ الْعالَمِينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا أَوَّلَ الْمُؤْمِناتِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا مَنْ أَنْفَقَتْ مالَها فِي نُصْرَةِ سَيِّدِ الْأَنْبِياءِ، وَنَصَرَتْهُ مَااسْتَطاعَتْ وَدافَعَتْ عَنْهُ الْأَعْداءَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا مَنْ سَلَّمَ عَلَيْها جَبْرَئِيلُ، وَبَلَّغَهَا السَّلامَ مِنَ اللَّهِ الْجَلِيلِ، فَهَنِيئاً لَكِ بِما أَوْلاكِ اللَّهُ مِنْ فَضْلٍ، وَالسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ وَرَحْمَةُ اللَّهِ وَبَرَكاتُهُ

Assalaamo a’layka yaa umma al-momeenina,assalaamo a’layka yaa zawjata sayede al-mursaleena, assalaamo a’layke yaa umma faatemata az-zahraa e sayyedate nesaa’il aalameena assalaamo a’laayke yaa awwala al-momenaate, assalaamo a’layke yaa man anfaqat maalahaa fee nusrate sayyedil anbiyaae, wa nasarat’hu maa as-tataa’at wa daafa’at anhul a’a-daa’a, assalaamo a’layke yaa man sallama alayhaa jabraeelo, wa ballaghahaa assalaamo menallaahe al-jaleele, fahaneea’n lake bemaa awlaakillaaho min fazlin, wassalaamo alayke wa rahmatullaahe wabarkatohu.

Peace be upon you, O the mother of the believers. Peace be upon you, O the wife of the leader of apostles. Peace be upon you, O the mother of Fatima Al-Zahra, the leader of the women of worlds. Peace be upon you, O the preceding of female believers. Peace be upon who consumed whatever she possessed for the assistance of the leader of apostles, helped her as much as she could and protected him from enemies. Peace be upon you, the one upon whom Hazrat Jabrail said salām (salutation) and conveyed salām (salutation) from Allah the Majestic. Greetings for you on having such a blessing of Allah! Peace, mercy and blessings of Allah be upon you!

e) Qassim son of the Prophet (S)

Qassim was the first child of the Prophet (S) and Khadija (A). He was born before revelation in Mecca and died while still a child at the age of 2. He was buried in the cemetery of al-Ma'ala.78

f) Abdallah son of the Prophet (S)

Abdallah was also called 'al-Tahir' (the pure). He also died very young and is buried in the cemetery of al-Ma'ala.79

74: Al kafi , volume 3 , page 287 ; Sireye siassi payambare azam , page 41 ; Ba ham be Hajj wa oumre , page 180 ; Bihar al Anwar , volume 22 , page 151
75: Bihar al Anwar, volume 19, page 24.
76: Sharh Nahj al-Balagha, Ibn Abil Hadid, volume 14, page 84
77: A’yan al-shi’a , volume 6, page 308
78: Bihar al Anwar , volume 2 , page 166
79: A’yan al-shi’a, volume 1 , page 223

Address in Arabic to facilitate your movements :

يقع في حي الغزة أحد أقدم الأحياء القريبة من المسجد الحرام وقرب الطريق المؤدي إلى مقبرة المعلاة وشارع المعلاة

This mosque is near the cemetery of al-Ma'ala. It was called Masjid al-Jinn because it is the place where the Jinn gathered to listen to the Quran recitations. It is also known as Masjid al-Bai'et because some Jinns have accepted Islam by taking an oath of allegiance to the Prophet (S). Surah al-Jinn was revealed to the Prophet (S) in this mosque.80

80: Ba ham be Hajj wa oumre , page 180-181

Address in Arabic to facilitate your movements :

يقع مسجد التنعيم في الجهة الشمالية من حدود الحرم المكي، على طريق المدينة المنورة ، وهو أقرب مواضع الحل للمسجد الحرام

This mosque is 5 km from Masjidul Haram. This mosque is also known as Masjid-e-Aisha, because Aisha, the Prophet's (S)’s wife, had put her ihràm in this place in the year 10 AH.81

81: Ba ham be Hajj wa oumre , page 182

Address in Arabic to facilitate your movements :

غار حراء يقع في شرق مكة المكرمة على يسار الذاهب إلى ،'عرفات في أعلى 'جبل النور' أو 'جبل الإسلام

Jabal al-Nour "The Mountain of Light" is a mountain located 4 km northeast of Masjid al-Haram. It shelters the cave of Hira where the Prophet (S) withdrew to worship God, and this is the place where the Prophet (S) received his first revelation, the first 5 verses of Surah al-Alaq. It is important for pilgrims to climb the summit of this mountain, walk in the footsteps of the Prophet (S) and contemplate what the Prophet (S) has contemplated.82

82: Rahnamaye Hajj wa atabat, page 50

Address in Arabic to facilitate your movements :

غار ثور يقع في الجهة الشمالية من جبل ثور جنوب مكة المكرمة، وعلى بعد نحو أربعة كيلو مترات في الجهة الجنوبية من المسجد الحرام

The cave bears the name of the mountain that shelters it (Jabal Thawr), located south of Mecca and 3 km from Masjid al-Haram. It is inside this cave the Prophet (S) took refuge at the time of his migration to Medina, when he was sought by the Quraysh.83

83: Ba ham be Hajj wa oumre , page 184

Formerly called Yathrib, Medina is a city in Saudi Arabia. It was called 'Madinatun Nabi' (The City of the Prophet (S)) after the Hijrah, when the Prophet (S) entered and settled in this city.

The distance between Mecca and Medina is 430 km. The name of Medina is mentioned 4 times in the Koran, and Yathrib only once. The city of Medina is the second holiest place of Islam after Mecca.

The Prophet (S) left Mecca and settled in Medina by order of Allah, and it was there that he died and was buried in the mosque known as 'Masjidun Nabavi'. On the 1st of Rabbi-ul-Awwal in the year 622, the Prophet (S) left Mecca, which had become a threat and unfavorable place, until the companions of the Prophet (S) complained of the severe treatment they received from the Quraysh.84

The Prophet (S) was forced to migrate, especially after the death of his principal protector, his uncle Abu Talib (A) and his wife Khadija (A).

The Muslims also left Mecca and most of them had to give up their property and their fortunes.When the Quraysh realized that the Muslims were leaving Mecca, they decided that the only action that could prevent the spread of Islam would be the killing of the Prophet (S). The same night the Quraysh planned to kill the Prophet (S), Angel Gabriel informed him of the evil intentions of the Quraysh and the Prophet (S) said to Imam Ali (A) : 'Sleep in my bed this evening and cover up with the sheet I usually cover myself with when I sleep. 'when the Quraysh came to kill the prophet (S), they saw Imam Ali (A).

The prophet (S) then ordered Imam Ali (A) to follow him to Medina after returning the belongings of the people of Mecca who had given the Prophet (S) their belongings for safe keeping.

Imam Ali (A) remained in Mecca for 3 days until all the goods were properly handed over to their owners. Then he gathered the women of the family of the Prophet (S) and other Muslims still present in Mecca and prepared to leave. The group then left Mecca for Medina.85

The Prophet (S) said concerning the importance of the city of Medina : « The earth and the dust of Medina are a cure for all the pains. »86

In another story he says : « In truth Mecca is the house of Allah, and Medina is my house. »87

Imam as-Sadiq (A) said : « Before entering the city of Medina, perform ghusl for his respect. »88

85: Rahnemaye Hajj wa atabaate, page 52 ; Bihar al Anwar, volume 19, page 60
86: Ba ham be Hajj wa oumre, page 62
87: Wasail al-Shia, volume 10, page 283
88: Ba ham be Hajj wa oumre, page 63

children.name: 1) The mosque of the Holy Prophet (S) (Masjidun Nabavi)

text.html:
When the Prophet (S) entered Medina, the chiefs of the various tribes hastened to catch the reins of his camel, each insisting that the Prophet (S) be their guest.

The Prophet (S) to not displease anyone said : 'I let the camel walk, I will settle where it will stop'.

The camel sat in a field that belonged to two orphans named Sahl and Sohayl and the nearest house was that of Abu Ayub al-Ansari.89

The Prophet (S) therefore decided to become Abu Ayub al-Ansari's guest for about seven months while his own house was built near the mosque.

The Prophet (S) wanted to build a mosque on the ground where the camel had stopped. The orphans to whom the land belonged wanted to offer their land to the Prophet (S), but he refused and wanted to pay the price of 10 dinars of gold.

Apartments were built for the Prophet (S) and his family, as well as rooms for about 70 destitute in Medina who did not have a home. These rooms were called 'Suffah'.90

The mosque of the Prophet (S) in Medina is the most noble mosque in the world after that of Mecca, and as the Prophet (S) said : « Every prayer in my mosque is equal to 1000 prayers in the rest of the places except the Masjidul Haram (Mecca) because its virtue is higher than that. »91

Imam as-Sadiq (S) said : « As long as you have the opportunity and time permitting, pray in this mosque, because this mosque will not always be within your reach or availability. »92

89: Abu Ayub al-Ansari was one of the close companions of the Prophet (S). He had a tender heart and loved the Prophet (S). He was generous and had date palms that he cultivated and shared with the needy. He did not renounce any battle in the time of the Prophet (S).
90: Ba ham be Hajj wa oumre, page 68
91: Ba ham be Hajj wa oumre, page 66
92: Same

children.name: 2) The Sanctuary of the Holy Prophet (S)

text.html:
The Prophet (S) was born on the 17th of Rabi ul-Awal, 40 years before the prophetic mission to Mecca. He was born during the year of the Elephant when Abraha tried to destroy the Holy Ka'aba. The parents of the Prophet (S) were called Abdullah and Amina (A). He belonged to the Bani Hashim family and the Quraysh tribe. Mohammad (S) was the last prophet sent.93

Before he was born, he lost his father and his mother died when he was only six, leaving him in the care of his grandfather, Abdul Muttalib (A).

He was handed over to his uncle Abu Talib (A) 2 years later, when Abdul Muttalib (A) died. The Prophet (S) was then 8 years old. Abu Talib (A) raised Mohammad (S) as his own son. This permanent support was confirmed until the Hijra.

When the Prophet (S) was 25 years old, Lady Khadija (A) who was wealthy and widowed offered him the marriage. The Prophet (S) did not marry any woman while Khadija (A) was still alive.

The Prophet (S) had 2 sons and 4 daughters, all dead during his lifetime, except Fatima az-Zahra (A), thanks to whom the descendants of the Prophet (S) continued.

The Prophet (S) used to spend a lot of time in the cave of Mount Hira, a mountain next to the Holy Ka'aba. On the night of 27 Rajab while he was in the cave, he heard a voice calling him and a light appeared before him.

It was the angel Gabriel in a human form. The angel asked him to read what was written on silk that he unrolled in his hand. The Prophet (S) read the words that were the first Revelation of Allah, and which would later become the first 5 verses of Surat al-Alaq.

Back home, the Prophet (S) told his wife Khadija (A) and Imam Ali (A), 12 years old, what had happened, and they both believed him, becoming the first two Muslims.

The Prophet (S) received other revelations from Allah and he slowly began to spread Islam. In the first three years he did not tell anyone except a few people in particular that he thought he was worthy to follow the religion of Allah. Only 30 people became Muslim in the first 3 years.

At the end of his life, it was Imam Ali (A) who gave him the ghusl and buried him in his own home.

Imam Ali (A) who was the closest person to the Prophet (S) said that Allah did not take away his soul in a place that was not blessed, so the Prophet (S) was buried in the holiest place, that is to say, at home.

Imam as-Sadiq (A) said that the Prophet (S) was poisoned during the Battle of Khaybar and the Prophet (S) himself said that the piece of meat that he had eaten that day destroyed parts of his body. All the prophets sent from God also died like martyrs.94

The tomb of the Prophet (S) is located east of the city. The Prophet (S) lived 63 years. He died on the 28th of Safar in the year 11 AH.

Abu Bakr and Omar ibn al-Khattab (1st and 2nd caliphs) are buried right next to the Prophet (S).95

93: Rahnemaye Hajj wa atabaate, page 52 ; Bihar al Anwar, volume 18, page 219 ; Tarikhe tahliliye islam, Shahidi, page 37
94: Basair al-Darajat, volume 1, page 503
95: Tarikhe tahliliye islam, Shahidi, page 37 ; Nahj ul-Balagha, Shahidi, page 237 ; Tarikhe tahliliye islam, Shahidi, page 39 ; Ba ham be Hajj wa oumre, page 61

children.name: 3) The importance of the Ziyarat of the Holy Prophet (S)

text.html:
The Qur'an tells us that whoever obeys the Prophet (S) also obeys Allah : « Those who obey the Prophet obey God. As for those who turn away, leave them : We did not send you to them as guardians. »96

And the Qur'an also tells us that if you love Allah, you must love his Prophet (S), and because of this, you will be loved by Allah :
« Say, 'Follow me, if you love God ; God will love you and forgive your sins. God is the one who forgives, he is merciful. »97
With these verses, it is concluded that the pilgrim of the Prophet (S) is like the pilgrim of Allah, and to visit the Prophet (S) is therefore like visiting Allah.

And with these verses, we also understand that going to visit the Prophet (S) is the cause of the fulfillment of the vows and the forgiveness of the sins.

« We only sent a Prophet to be obeyed, with the permission of God. If those people who wrong themselves come to you imploring the forgiveness of God and the Prophet asked for forgiveness for them, they would surely find God willing to come back to them and to show them mercy. »98

The Prophet (S) said : « He who comes to the pilgrimage to Mecca, and who does not come to visit my grave, has done an injustice to me. On Judgment Day, I will ask him for an explanation and I will ask him the cause. And he who comes to visit me, I will be his intercessor and Paradise will be obligatory. »99

The Prophet (S) said : « Whoever comes to visit me after my death, is considered as if he came to visit me during my lifetime. »100

To visit the tomb of the Prophet (S) is therefore a religious duty.

The Muslim must send greetings to the Prophet (S) daily after the completion of his prayers in these terms : 'Asalamu alaykah ayuhan Nabiyu wa rahmatullhahe wa barakat (May the salvation, mercy and blessings of Allah be upon you, O Prophet)'.

Our greetings are addressed to the pure soul of the Prophet (S) who is alive. The Prophet (S) hears the words of the pilgrim and responds to his greetings. According to the Qur'an and the Sunnah, after death, the human body is degraded while the soul remains in the intermediate world (Barzakh). The soul of the prophets, saints, martyrs and pure believers rank very high with Allah :
« Do not especially believe that those who are killed in the path of God are dead. They are alive! They will be provided with rizk from their Lord. »101

96: Qu’ran : chapter 4, verse 80
97: Qu’ran : chapter 3, verse 31
98: Qu’ran : chapter 4, verse 64
99: Al kafi, volume 4, page 548 ; Wasail al-Shia, volume 10, page 261
100: Wafa al-wafa, volume 4, page 1336
101: Qu’ran : chapter 3, verse 169

children.name: 4) The ways of the visit of the Holy Prophet (S)

text.html:
a) Make the intention (niyat) to visit the grave of the Prophet (S), perform ghusl and go in humility while doing the salawat because even the angels send the salawat to the Prophet (S) : « Yes, God and his angels bless the Prophet, O you who believe! Send you also blessings on him. »102

b) Arriving at the Masjidun Nabavi, through the entrance of the Bab-e-Jibraeel, recite the Izne Dukhul, because the Quran forbids us to enter without permission:« O you who believe! Do not enter the houses of the Prophet without permission ... »103

c) Next, go to the tomb side, in front of the Qibla, and recite the ziyarat of the Prophet (S) gently and calmly. Because the Qur'an has ordered us not to raise our voices : « O you, the believers! Do not raise your voice above that of the Prophet. Do not speak to him aloud, as you do between yourselves, lest your works be vain, and you will not doubt it. »104

« Indeed, those who lower their voices in the presence of Allah’s Messenger (for the sake of good manners and their respect for him], they are the ones whose hearts Allah has tested [and prepared] for [entertaining] piety. For them are forgiveness and a great reward. »105

Then from the grave, you will have an answer to the salutation, as the Qur'an says : « And when those who believe in Our Signs come to you, say : Peace be on you. Your Lord has prescribed mercy on Himself. »106

The ziyarat of the Holy Prophet (S) :

Izne Dukhul

اَللَّهُمَّ إِنّى قَدْ وَقَفْتُ عَلى‏ بابٍ مِنْ أَبْوابِ بُيُوتِ نَبِيّكَ صَلَواتُكَ عَلَيْهِ وَآلِهِ، وَقَدْ مَنَعْتَ النَّاسَ أَنْ يَدْخُلُوا إِلّا بِإِذْنِهِ، فَقُلْتَ: «يا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا لا تَدْخُلُوا بُيُوتَ النَّبِيّ إِلّا أَنْ يُؤْذَنَ لَكُمْ»، اَللَّهُمَّ إِنّي أَعْتَقِدُ حُرْمَةَ صاحِبِ هذَا الْمَشْهَدِ الشَّرِيفِ فِي غَيْبَتِهِ، كَما أَعْتَقِدُها فِي حَضْرَتِهِ، وَأَعْلَمُ أَنَّ رَسُولَكَ وَخُلَفاءَكَ عَلَيْهِمُ السَّلامُ أَحْياءٌ عِنْدَكَ يُرْزَقُونَ، يَرَوْنَ مَقامِي وَيَسْمَعُونَ كَلامِي وَيَرُدُّونَ سَلامِي، وَأَنَّكَ حَجَبْتَ عَنْ سَمْعِي كَلامَهُمْ، وَفَتَحْتَ بابَ فَهْمِي بِلَذِيذِ مُناجاتِهِمْ، وَإِنّي أَسْتَأْذِنُكَ يا رَبّ أَوَّلًا، وَأَسْتَأْذِنُ رَسُولَكَ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَآلِهِ ثانِياً ... ءَأَدْخُلُ يا رَسُولَ اللَّهِ، ءَأَدْخُلُ يا مَلائِكَةَ اللَّهِ الْمُقَرَّبِينَ الْمُقِيمِينَ فِي هذَا الْمَشْهَدِ، فَأْذَنْ لِى يا مَوْلايَ فِي الدُّخُولِ أَفْضَلَ ما أَذِنْتَ لِأَحَدٍ مِنْ‏أَوْلِياءِكَ، فَإِنْ لَمْ أَكُنْ أَهْلًا لِذلِكَ فَأَنْتَ أَهْلٌ لِذلِكَ»،

Allaahumma inni qad wa qafto alla baabin min abwaabe boyute nabiyyeka salwaatoka alayhe wa aalehi, wa qad mana’a-ta an-naasa ann yadkholu illaa beiznehi, faqulta, yaa ayyohal ladheena aamanu laa tadkholu boyuta an-nabiyyin illaan an yo’a zana lakum, allaahumma inni a’a-taqedo hurmata saahebe hadhaa al-mash’hade ash-shareefe fee ghaybatehi kamaa a’a-taqedo haa fee hadhratehi, wa aa’lamo anna rasoolaka wa khulafaa’aka alayhemo assalaamo ahyaa’o ‘indaka yurzaquna, yarawna maqaamiwa yasma’una kalaami wa yarudduna salaami, wa annaka hajabta ann sam'ee kalaamahum wa fatahta baaaba fahmi beladheedhe monaajaatehim, wa inni as-taadhenoka yaa rabba awwalan, wa as taadheno rasoolaka sallallaaho alayhe wa aalehi thaaneyan... wa adkholu yaa rasoolallaahe, a-adkholo yaa malaaekatallaahe al moqarrabina al-moqeemina fee haazal mash-hade, fa’a dhan lee yaa mawlaayi fee ad-dokhule afzala maa azinta le ahadin min awleyaaeka, fa inn lam akoon ahlann le dhaaleka fa anta le dhaaleka fa anta ahlu le dhaaleka.

O Allah, I am standing at the door of one of the houses of Your Prophet; Your peace be upon him and his family. You have prohibited the people from entering his house except by the permission of Your Prophet. You said: « O You who believe do not enter the house of the Prophet unless permitted to do so ». O Allah, I believe in the integrity of the inhabitant of this noble grave in his absence, just as I believe it in his presence and I know that Your Prophet and Your vicegerents upon whom be peace of Allah, are alive in Your presence, they are being nourished, they see my position and hear my speech and they return my greetings and (I believe) that You have covered my ears from hearing their speech and have opened the door of perception of their secret conversations (with You). I seek Your permission first, O’ my Lord; then I seek the permission of Your Prophet_ peace be upon him and his family_ secondly, and I seek the permission of Your vicegerent, Imam Hussain Bin Ali (A) whose obedience is obligatory upon me and (the permission of) Your angels entrusted over this blessed site thirdly. May I enter, O Prophet of Allah, may I enter O the proof of Allah, may I enter, O angels of Allah who are stationed close to this shrine, so permit me O my master to enter the best of way that You have permitted any of Your friends, if I am not deserving of that then You surely are deserving of that.

اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا رَسُولَ اللَّهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا نَبِيَّ اللَّهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا مُحَمَّدَ بْنَ عَبْدِاللَّهِ،َ السَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا خاتَمَ النَّبِيِينَ، أَشْهَدُ أَنَّكَ قَدْ بَلَّغْتَ الرِ سالَةَ، وَأَقَمْتَ الصَّلَاةَ، وَآتَيْتَ الزَّكَاةَ، وَأَمَرْتَ بِالْمَعْرُوفِ، وَنَهَيْتَ عَنِ الْمُنْكَرِ، وَعَبَدْتَ اللَّهَ مُخْلِصاً حَتّى‏ أَتاكَ الْيَقِينُ، فَصَلَواتُ اللَّهِ عَلَيْكَ وَرَحْمَتُهُ وَعَلى‏ أَهْلِ بَيْتِكَ الطَّاهِرِينَ.أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لا إِلهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لا شَرِيكَ لَهُ، وَأَشْهَدُ أَنَّ مُحَمَّداً عَبْدُهُ وَرَسُولُهُ، وَأَشْهَدُ أَنَّكَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ، وَأَنَّكَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ عَبْدِاللَّهِ، وَأَشْهَدُ أَنَّكَ قَدْ بَلَّغْتَ رِسالاتِ رَبِكَ، وَنَصَحْتَ لِأُمَّتِكَ، وَجاهَدْتَ فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ، وَعَبَدْتَ اللَّهَ مُخْلِصاً حَتّى‏ أَتاكَ الْيَقِينُ بِالْحِكْمَةِ وَالْمَوْعِظَةِ الْحَسَنَةِ، وَأَدَّيْتَ الَّذِي عَلَيْكَ مِنَ الْحَقِ، وَأَنَّكَ قَدْ رَؤُفْتَ بِالْمُؤْمِنِينَ، وَغَلُظْتَ عَلَى الْكافِرِينَ، فَبَلَغَ اللَّهُ بِكَ أَفْضَلَ شَرَفِ مَحَلِ الْمُكَرَّمِينَ، الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِي اسْتَنْقَذَنا بِكَ مِنَ الشِرْكِ وَالضَّلالَةِ. اَللَّهُمَّ فَاجْعَلْ صَلَواتِكَ وَصَلَواتِ مَلائِكَتِكَ الْمُقَرَّبِينَ وَأَنْبِيائِكَ الْمُرْسَلِينَ وَعِبادِكَ الصَّالِحِينَ، وَأَهْلِ السَّماواتِ وَالْأَرَضِينَ، وَمَنْ سَبَّحَ لَكَ يا رَبَّ الْعالَمِينَ مِنَ الْأَوَّلِينَ وَالْآخِرِينَ، عَلى‏ مُحَمَّدٍ عَبْدِكَ وَرَسُولِكَ وَنَبِيِّكَ وَأَمِينِكَ وَنَجِيِّكَ وَحَبِيبِكَ‏ وَصَفِيِّكَ وَخاصَّتِكَ وَصَفْوَتِكَ، وَخِيَرَتِكَ مِنْ خَلْقِكَ. اللَّهُمَّ أَعْطِهِ الدَّرَجَةَ الرَّفِيعَةَ، وَآتِهِ الْوَسِيلَةَ مِنَ الْجَنَّةِ، وَابْعَثْهُ مَقاماً مَحْمُوداً يَغْبِطُهُ بِهِ الْأَوَّلُونَ وَالْآخِرُونَ. اللَّهُمَّ إِنَّكَ قُلْتَ: «وَلَو أَنَّهُمْ إِذْ ظَلَمُوا أَنْفُسَهُمْ جاؤُوكَ فَاسْتَغْفَرُوا اللَّهَ وَاسْتَغْفَرَ لَهُمُ الرَّسُولُ لَوَجَدُوا اللَّهَ تَوَّاباً رَحِيماً»، وَإِنِي أَتَيْتُكَ مُسْتَغْفِراً تائِباً مِنْ ذُنُوبِي، وَإِنِي أَتَوَجَّهُ بِكَ إِلَى اللَّهِ رَبِي وَرَبِكَ لِيَغْفِرَ لِي ذُنُوبِي. اَللَّهُمَّ إِنِي صَلَّيْتُ وَرَكَعْتُ وَسَجَدْتُ لَكَ، وَحْدَكَ لا شَرِيكَ لَكَ، لِأَنَّ الصَّلاةَ وَالرُّكُوعَ وَالسُّجُودَ لا تَكُونُ إِلّا لَكَ، لِأَنَّكَ أَنْتَ اللَّهُ لا إِلهَ إِلّا أَنْتَ. اَللَّهُمَّ وَهاتانِ الرَّكْعَتانِ هَدِيَّةٌ مِنِي إِلى‏ سَيِّدى وَ مَولايَ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ صلى الله عليه و آله فَتَقَبَّلْهُما مِنِّي بِأَحْسَنِ قَبُولِكَ وَأْجُرْنِي عَلى‏ ذلِكَ بِأَفْضَلِ أَمَلِي وَرَجائِي فِيكَ وَفِي رَسُولِك، يا وَلِيَّ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ.

Assalaamo a’layka yaa rasoolallaahe, assalaamo a’layka yaa nabiyyinllaahe, assalaamo a’layka yaa Muhammad abna abdillaahe, assalaamo a’layka khaataman nabiyyin, ash-hado annaka qad ballaghta risaalata, wa aqamta as-salaata, wa aataytaz zakaata, wa amarta bil ma’a-roofe wa nahayta anil munkare, wa abad’tallaaha mukhlesan hatti ataaka al-yaqeeno, fa salawaatullaahe a’layka wa rahmatohu wa alaa ahle bayteka at-taaherina ash-hado ann laa elaaha illallaaho wah dahu laa sharika lahoo, wa ash-hado anna muhammadan abdohu wa rasoolohu, wa ash-hado annaka rasoolullaahe, wa annaka Muhammad abno abdillaahe, wa ash-hado annaka qad ballaghta risaalate rabeka, wa nasah’ta le ummateka, wa jaahad ta fee sabilillaahe, wa abad’tallaaho mukhlesan hatti ataakal yaqeeno bil hiqmate wal maw edhate al-hasanate, wa addaytal ladhee a’layka menal haqe, wa annaka qad ra’oufat bil momeneena, wa ghaludhta alal kaaferina, fa balaghallaaho beka afdhala sharafe mahalil mukarrameena, al-hamdo lillaahil ladhee as-tanqadhanaa beka menal shirke waz dhalaalate, allahumma faj’al salawaateka wa salawaate malaaekateka al moqarrabina wa anbeyaaeka al-mursaleena wa ebaadekas saaleheena, wa ahlis samaawaate wal ardheena, wa man sabbaha laka yaa rabbal aalameena menal awwaleena wal aakhereena, alaa muhammadin ab’deka wa rasooleka wa nabiyyeka wa ameeneka wa najiyyeka wa habeebeka wa safiyyeka wa khaassateka wa safwateka, wa khirateka min khalqeka, allaahumma a’a-tehi ad-darajata ar-rafee’ata, wa aatehil waseelata menal jannate, wab ath’hu maqaaman mahmudan yaghbetohu behil awwaloona wal aakheruna, allaahumma innaka qulta: wa law annahum idh dhalamoowa anfosahum jaa’oka fastaghfarullaaha wastaghfara lahumo ar-rasulo lawajado wallaah tawwaaban raheeman, wa ini ataytoka mustaghferan taaeban min dhonubee, wa ini atawajjahu beka ilallaahe rabee wa rabeka le yaghfera lee dhonubee, allaahumma inni sallayto waraka’ato wa sajad’to laka, le annaka antallaaho laa elaaha illaa anta. Allaahumma wa haatane ar-rakataane hadiyyato menee elaa sayyedi wa mawlaayi rasoolillaahe sallallaaho alayhe wa aalehi fataqabbalhoma minni be ahsane qabooleka wa’a jurnee alaa dhaaleka be afdhale amalee wa rajaayee feeka wa fee rasooleka, yaa waliyyal momimeena.

Peace be upon you, O Messenger of Allah. Peace be upon you, O Prophet of Allah. Peace be upon you, O Muhammad the son of the Abdullah. Peace be upon you, O seal of the Prophets. I bear witness that you conveyed the message and established the prayer and paid the zakat and ordered to perform the good deeds and prevented from the bad deeds and you worshipped Allah with all sincerity until death overtook you. May the blessings and mercy of Allah be upon you and on your pure family! I bear witness that there is no god except Allah, the Unique, there is no partner unto Him and I bear witness that Muhammad is His slave and Prophet. I bear witness that you are the Prophet of Allah and you are Muhammad, the son of Abdullah. I bear witness that you declared the messages of your Lord and that you advised your nation and strived in the path of Allah and you worshiped God with all faith, until the certainty came to you with wisdom and good exhortation. You fulfilled the duty imposed on you and that you were kind to the believers and severe on the disbelievers. Allah has made you attain the highest position of honor and nobility. Praise be to Allah who, through you, has saved us from polytheism and from going astray. O Allah send Your blessings and the blessings of Your close angels and Your Messengers and those of Your upright slaves and the pious people of the heavens and the earths and those who have glorified You from the beginning to the end, on Muhammad Your slave and Messenger and Your Prophet and Your trustworthy and saved one, Your beloved one and Your chosen one, Your special one, the pure and most virtuous one from Your creatures. O Allah, grant him an higher status and make him a cause to heaven and raise him in a praiseworthy status, which the first and the last people will wish to attain. O Allah, You have said: “If they wrong themselves and come to you and seek pardon from Allah, and if the Prophet seeks pardon for them, they will find Allah forgiving and merciful”. I have come to you seeking forgiveness, repenting on my sins and I seek your intercession for me before Allah, who is my Lord and Your Lord, so that He may forgive my sins. O Allah, I have offered a prayer, genuflected, and prostrated myself for Your sake without setting any partner with You, since prayer, genuflections, and prostrations suit none except You. Because You are Allah, there is no god except You. O Allah, these two units of prayer are present from me to my leader and master the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him and his progeny. So (please) accept these two (units of prayer) from me with your generous acceptance and in return of it reward me in the best rewarding that I anticipate and hope from You and from Your Messenger, O the Master of believers!

Farewell ziyarat to the Holy Prophet (S) :

اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا رَسُولَ اللَّهِ، أَسْتَودِعُكَ اللَّهَ وَأَسْتَرْعِيكَ وَأَقْرَأُ عَلَيْكَ السَّلامَ، آمَنْتُ باللَّهِ بِما جِئْتَ بِهِ وَدَلَلْتَ عَلَيهِ، اَللَّهُمَّ لاتَجْعَلْهُ آخِرَ الْعَهْدِ مِنِي لِزِيارَةِ قَبْرِ نَبِيِكَ، فَإِنْ تَوَفَّيْتَنِي قَبْلَ ذلِكَ فَإِنِّي أَشْهَدُ فِي مَماتِي عَلى‏ ما شَهِدْتُ عَلَيْهِ فِي حَياتِي، أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لا إِلهَ إِلّا أَنْتَ، وَأَنَّ مُحَمَّداً عَبْدُكَ وَرَسُولُكَ، صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَآلِهِ.

Assalaamo a’layka yaa rasoolallaahe, as-tawdeokallaaha wa astar ika wa aqrao alaykas salaama, aamanto billaahe bemaa je’a-ta behi wa dalalta alayhe, allaahumma laa taj’alhu aaakheral ahde minee le ziyaarate qabre nabiyyeka, fa inn tawaffaytani qabla dhaaleka fainnee ash-hado fee mamaatee alaa maa shahid’to alayhe fee hayaati, ash-hado ann laa elahaa illaa anta, wa anna muhammadan abdoka wa rasooloka, sallallaaho alayhe wa aalehi.

Peace be upon you, O Messenger of Allah, I entrust you with Allah and say salam (salutation) on you. I believe in Allah, in what you brought and guided towards. O my Lord don’t consider my this visit of Your Prophet’s grave the last one. Even though You had deprived me of life before that I will bear witness in my death what I bore witness in my life. I bear witness that there is no god except You and Muhammad is Your servant and Your Messenger, Peace of Allah be upon him and his progeny.
