children.name: 5) The other sacred places in the mosque of the Holy Prophet (S)

text.html:
a) Le The Rawza of Nabi

It is located between the tomb of the Prophet (S) and the Minbar ; it is highly recommended to pray in this place. It is said that it is a place that is a piece of Paradise.107

b) The Mimbar (the pulpit) of the Prophet (S)

On the right side of the mehrab is the mimbar where the Prophet (S) used to preach from. At first, the Masjidoun Nabavi did not have a mimbar. The Prophet (S) recited his preaching while leaning against a palm trunk. Then, from the 7th year of the Hijra, the Prophet (S) was offered the mimbar which was built of wood.108

c) The Mehrab-un-Nabi

On the left side of the mimbar is the mehrab : it is the place where the Prophet (S) performed his prayers. It is highly recommended to pray and make supplications in this place.109

d) The Maqam Jibrail (Gabriel)

The Maqam Jibrail is the location of the angel Gabriel : he stopped there and waited for the Prophet (S) to give him permission to return to his home. Bab al-Jibrail is on the opposite side of Bab al-Baqi.

After the revelation of the verse : « Pray prayer to your family, persevere yourself in prayer »110 , the Prophet (S) stopped every day at dawn for six months beside the Maqam Jibrail and said : « O Ahl-ul-Bayt! My greetings and peace be upon you. » Then he recited the following verse : « O you, the people of the House! God only wants to remove defilement from you and purify you completely. »111

In this place, the Prophet (S) also welcomed new converts to Islam ; he also used to sit with the eminent companions at this place to receive various delegates and visitors. In this place, pilgrims must pray and recite the Qur'an.

e) The house of Fatima az-Zahra (A)

The house of Fatima az-Zahra (A) is inside the tomb of the Prophet (S), who can no longer be seen now.

In Hijra 1, when the Masjidun Nabavi was built, some companions of the Prophet (S) lived nearby. Their doors had direct access to the mosque, but in the 3rd year of the Hijra and before the battle from Uhud, the angel Gabriel gave the order to close all the doors, except the door of Imam Ali (A) and that of the Prophet (S).

f) The tomb of Fatima az-Zahra (A)

There is a great divergence among scholars regarding her grave. However, it is certain that before leaving this world, Fatima az-Zahra (A) insisted and left a will to be buried at night and her tomb remains hidden.

Her tomb has remained hidden until today. Some scholars assume that the daughter of the Prophet (S) was buried either in the cemetery of Baqi or inside her house. On the other hand, others believe that she was buried in the mosque of the Prophet (S), Rawzatun Nabi.

Imam Hussein (A) says that when his mother died, his father (Ali (A)) secretly buried her, and hid the trace of the tomb.112

The biography of Fatima az-Zahra (A)

The Noble Fatema (A) is the daughter of the Prophet (S) and Khadija (A). She was born on 20th Jamaadi ul-Thani in Mecca around 604 Christian era, 8 years before the Hijra and five years after the mission of the Prophet (S).

FatIma (A) has many attributes, but the best known is 'Zahra' which means 'bright, radiant.' She grew up in the arms of prophecy and revelation.

One day, a revelation invited the Prophet (S) to retreat out of the city and meditate for 40 days. At the end of this period, Paradise food was brought to the Prophet (S) with the good news that Allah would fill him with a child. Shortly after, Khadija (A) felt a refreshing scent that never left her. The Prophet (S) told him that it was because she was bearing Fatima (A).

The Prophet (S) had never hidden his deep love for his daughter. Fatima (A) was raised in her father's house and educated by himself. Her childhood coincided with the beginning of Islam and therefore the conflicts between the polytheists and the Muslims. It was a very busy time of complex trials and persecutions. Economic and social boycott, famine, thirst and suffering were imposed on the Prophet (S) and his followers in the dry and fiery valley of Shib-e-Abu Talib.

When Fatima (A) reached the age of maturity, many of the Companions of the Prophet (S) asked for her hand in marriage, but the Prophet (S) said to each one of them, 'In this matter, I am waiting for the revelation.'

The angel Gabriel finally came to the Prophet (S) and told him that God had married FatIma (A) to Ali (A), after which Ali (A) solicited the hand of the Prophet (S)'s daughter. The marriage of Ali (A) and Fatima (A) was celebrated during the 2nd year of the Hijra in Medina.

Fatima (A) later lived in a house close to that of the Prophet (S). The abode was offered by a companion of the Prophet (S) who knew that the Prophet (S) would rejoice to have his daughter as neighbor. Fatima (A) and Ali (A) shared the hectic daily life in Medina, as much in joy and success as in pain and difficulty.

She became an exemplary mother of four children : Imam Hassan (A), Imam Hussein (A), Zaynab (A), and Um Kulthum (A). In her piety, worship, and nobility, she was at home, example of her father. Indeed, God gave Fatema (A) magnificence and splendor such that no woman could reach her rank.

The Prophet (S) used to regard her as 'The Lady of the women of the world'. He respected her so much that every time she entered the room of the Prophet (S), He rose to greet her, made her sit down in his place and kissed her hand. Whenever the Prophet (S) was injured by the throwing of stones and the various blows of the oppressors of Mecca, it was Fatima (A) who provided him with the necessary care. She healed his wounds and talked to him about anything that could console him.

She thus deserved the nickname that her father had given her : "The mother of her own father", a nickname that will remain engraved in all the memories of Muslims over the days.

After the death of the Prophet (S), Fatima (A) did not smile again until her own death. She witnessed the event of Saqifa113 and was deprived of her inheritance from the plot of Fadak114 She defended the right of Imam Ali (A) and claimed his succession after the Prophet (S). All of these important events took place after the end of prophet (s)’s life; her house was also burnt down because of her refusal to accept the caliphate and her support for Imam Ali (A).

She became ill as a result of her injuries, and did not live long after her father's death. She died on 3rd Jamaadi ul-Thani in the year 11 AH at the age of 18 years. She is buried in Medina, but the exact location of her tomb is actually unknown.115

The ziyarat of Hazrat Fatima az-Zahra (A) :

اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا بِنْتَ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ، السَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا بِنْتَ نَبِيِ اللَّهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا بِنْتَ حَبِيبِ اللَّهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا بِنْتَ خَلِيلِ اللَّهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا بِنْتَ صَفِيِ اللَّهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا بِنْتَ أَمِينِ اللَّهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا بِنْتَ خَيْرِ خَلْقِ اللَّهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا بِنْتَ أَفْضَلِ أَنْبِياءِ اللَّهِ وَرُسُلِهِ وَمَلائِكَتِهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا بِنْتَ خَيْرِ الْبَرِيَّةِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا سَيِدَةَ نِساءِ الْعالَمِينَ، مِنَ الْأَوَّلِينَ وَالْآخِرِينَ. اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا زَوْجَةَ وَلِيِ اللَّهِ وَخَيْرِ الْخَلْقِ بَعْدَ رَسُولِ‏اللَّهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا أُمَّ الْحَسَنِ وَالْحُسَيْنِ سَيِدَيْ شَبابِ أَهْلِ الْجَنَّةِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ أَيَّتُهَا الصِدِّيقَةُ الشَّهِيدَةُ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ أَيَّتُهَا الرَّضِيَّةُ الْمَرْضِيَّةُ،َ السَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ أَيَّتُهَا الْفاضِلَةُ الزَّكِيَّةُ، السَّلامُ‏ عَلَيْكِ أَيَّتُهَا الْحَوْراءُ الْإِنْسِيَّةُ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ أَيَّتُهَا التَّقِيَّةُ النَّقِيَّةُ، َالسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ أَيَّتُهَا الْمُحَدَّثَةُ الْعَلِيْمَةُ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ أَيَّتُهَا الْمُضْطَهَدَةُ الْمَقْهُورَةُ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا فاطِمَةُ بِنْتَ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ، وَرَحْمَةُ اللَّهِ وَبَرَكاتُهُ.صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْكِ وَعَلى‏ رُوحِكِ وَبَدَنِكِ، أَشْهَدُ أَنَّكِ مَضَيْتِ عَلى‏ بَيِنَةٍ مِنْ رَبِكِ، وَأَنَّ مَنْ سَرَّكِ فَقَدْ سَرَّ رَسُولَ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ، وَمَنْ جَفاكِ فَقَدْ جَفا رَسُولَ اللَّهِ، وَمَنْ آذاكِ فَقَدْ آذى‏ رَسُولَ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَآلِهِ، وَمَنْ وَصَلَكِ فَقَدْ وَصَلَ رَسُولَ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ، وَمَنْ قَطَعَكِ فَقَدْ قَطَعَ رَسُولَ اللَّهِ، لِأَنَّكِ بَضْعَةٌ مِنْهُ، وَرُوحُهُ الَّتِي بَيْنَ جَنْبَيْهِ، كَما قالَ عَلَيْهِ أَفْضَلُ سَلامِ اللَّهِ وَأَفْضَلُ صَلَواتِهِ، اُشْهِدُ اللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُ أَنِي راضٍ عَمَّنْ رَضِيتِ عَنْهُ، ساخِطٌ عَمَّنْ سَخِطْتِ عَلَيْهِ، مُتَبَرِّءٌ مِمَّنْ تَبَرَّاْتِ مِنْهُ، مُوالٍ لِمَنْ والَيْتِ، مُعادٍ لِمَنْ عادَيْتِ، مُبْغِضٌ لِمَنْ أَبْغَضْتِ، مُحِبٌّ لِمَنْ أَحْبَبْتِ، وَكَفى‏ بِاللَّهِ شَهِيداً وَحَسِيباً وَجازِياً وَمُثِيباً.

Assalaamo a’layke yaa binte rasoolillaahe, assalaamo a’layke yaa binta nabiyyillaahe, assalaamo alayke yaa binte safiyillaahe, assalaamo a’layke yaa binte ameenillaahe, assalaamo a’layke yaa binte khayre khalqillaahe, assalaamo a’layke yaa binta afdhale anbiyaaillaahe wa rasoolehi wa malaaekatehi, assalaamo alayke yaa binta khayril bariyyate, assalaamo a’layke yaa sayyedata nesaail aalamina, menal awwalina wal aakharina, assalaamo alayke yaa zawjata waliyillaahe wa kahyril khalqe ba’da rasoolillaahe, assalaamo a’layke yaa ummal hasanil husayne sayyeday shabaabe ahlil jannate, assalaamo a’layke ayyatohas siddeeqato ash-shahidato, assalaamo alayke ayyatohal haeraaul insiyyato, assalaamo a’layke ayyatoha at-taqiyyato an-naqiyyato, assalaamo a’layke ayyatohal mohaddathatul alimto, assalaamo a’layke ayyatohal mudhtaahadatul maqhoorato, assalaamo a’layke yaa faatemato binta rasoolillahe, wa rahamtoolilaahe wabrakaatohu,sallallaaho a’layke wa alaa rooheka wa badaneke,ash-hado annake madhayte alaa bayinatin min rabeke, wa anna man sarrake faqad sarra rasoolallaahe sallallaaho a’layhe wa aalehi, wa man jafaake faqad jafaa rasoolallaahe, wa man adhaake faqad aadhee rasoolallaahe sallallaaho a’layhe wa aalehi, wa man wa salake faqad wa sala rasoolillaahe sallallaaho alayhe wa aalehi, wa man qata’ake faqad qata’a rasoolallaahe, le innake baz’ato minho, wa ru hohullati bayna janbayhe, kamaa qaala alayhe afzalo salaamillaahe wa afdhalo salawaatehi,ash-hado lilaahe wa rasoolahu aynee raadhin amman radhiyate anhu, saakheto amman sakhit’te alayhe, motabarreo mimman tabrraate minho, mowaalin le man waa layte, moaadin leman aadayte, mubghidho leman ab’ghadhte, mohibbun leman ah-bayte, wa kafee billaahe shahidan wa haseeban wa jaazeyan wa muthiban.

Peace be upon you O daughter of the Messenger of Allah! Peace be upon you O daughter of the Prophet of Allah! Peace be upon You O daughter of the beloved of Allah! Peace be upon you O daughter of the friend of Allah! Peace be upon you O daughter of the chosen one by Allah! Peace be upon you O daughter of the trustworthy one of Allah! Peace be upon you O daughter of the best of the creation of Allah! Peace be upon you O daughter of the most worthy one from the Prophets and Messengers and angels of Allah! Peace be upon you O daughter of the best of mankind! Peace be upon you O leader of all women of the worlds, from the beginning to the end! Peace be upon you O the wife of the friend of Allah and the best of Allah’s creation after His Prophet! Peace be upon you O mother of (Imam) Hassan and Hussain, the two leaders of the youngsters in paradise. Peace be upon you O truthful martyr!
Peace be upon you O content and serene one! Peace be upon you O favored and pure one! Peace be upon you O one who has traits of an angel! Peace be upon you O virtuous and pure one! Peace be upon you O learned one! Peace be upon you O one who was oppressed and overpowered. Peace, mercy and blessings of Allah be upon you O Fatima, the daughter of the Messenger of Allah. May Allah bless you and your soul and body! I bear witness that you lived a life while you were well aware of your Lord. (I bear witness) that one who pleased you (in fact) pleased the Messenger of Allah. Peace be upon him and his progeny. (I bear witness) one whoever displeased you (in fact) displeased the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him and his progeny, and one who stressed you (in fact) stressed the Prophet of Allah, peace be upon him and his progeny, and one who made relation with you (in fact) made relation with the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him and his progeny and one who cut relations with you (in fact) cut relations with the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him and his progeny, because you are part of him and his spirit within him, as said by the Messenger, the best of Allah’s salam (salutation) and peace be upon him. I bear witness before Allah and His Messenger and his angels that I am pleased with one whom you are pleased and I am annoyed with one whom you are annoyed. I dissociate myself, from one whom you have dissociated yourself. I befriend myself with one whom you have befriended and I am the enemy of one with whom you have enmity. I hate one whom you loathe and I love whom you love. Allah is enough as a witness and as one accounting for deeds and as one who reimburses and rewards.

g) Ashaab-as-Suffah

Beside the tomb of the Prophet (S), there is a place known as Ashaab-as-Suffah, Suffah means 'shadow'. They were part of a group of companions of the Prophet (S) who came from Mecca and were homeless because most of them had to give up their possessions and fortunes. Their number was about 400. They devoted themselves to prayers at night, and to fasting and studying religious sciences in the day. They learned the Quran and listened to the sermons and lessons of the Prophet (S). They also took part in battles. The Prophet (S) supported them and gave them money from the public deposit to live and sometimes he brought them food and ate with them. Among them were Abu Dhar al-Ghafari, Miqdad, Salman-e-Farsi, Bilal al-Habashi.116

h) The tomb of Abdullah ibn Abdul Muttalib

He was the father of the Prophet (S) and was the eldest son of Abdul Muttalib (A), who married Amina Bint Wahb. Shortly after their union, Abdullah went on a business trip to Syria, and on his return when he arrived in Medina, he fell seriously ill and died at the age of 25, 2 months before the birth of the Prophet (S). There is a discrepancy among scholars because he died before or after the birth of the Prophet (S). Concerning the tomb of Abdullah, there is no traceability and we do not know the exact place, but according to certain assumptions, it would be at the entrance of Masjidun Nabavi, at the entrance of Bab-e-Salam.117

Ziyarat :

اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا وَلِيَّ اللَّهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا أَمِينَ اللَّهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا نُورَ اللَّهِ، َالسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا مُسْتَوْدَعَ نُورِ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا والِدَ خاتَمِ الْأَنْبِياءِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا مَنِ انْتَهى‏ إِلَيْهِ الْوَدِيعَةُ وَالْأَمانَةُ الْمَنِيعَةُ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا مَنْ أَوْدَعَ اللَّهُ فِي صُلْبِهِ الطَّيِّبِ الطَّاهِرِ الْمَكِينِ نُورَ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ الصَّادِقِ الْأَمِينِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا والِدَ سَيِّدِ الْأَنْبِياءِ وَالْمُرْسَلِينَ، أَشْهَدُ أَنَّكَ قَدْ حَفِظْتَ الْوَصِيَّةَ، وَأَدَّيْتَ الْأَمانَةَ عَنْ رَبِّ الْعالَمِينَ فِي رَسُولِهِ، وَكُنْتَ فِي دِينِكَ عَلى‏ يَقِينٍ، وَأَشْهَدُ أَنَّكَ اتَّبَعْتَ دِينَ اللَّهِ عَلى‏ مِنْهاجِ جَدِّكَ إِبْراهِيمَ خَلِيلِ اللَّهِ فِي حَياتِكَ وَبَعْدَ وَفاتِكَ، عَلى‏ مَرْضاتِ اللَّهِ فِي رَسُولِهِ، وَأَقْرَرْتَ وَصَدَّقْتَ بِنُبُوَّةِ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَآلِهِ، وَوِلايَةِ أَمِيرِالمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلَيْهِ السَّلامُ، وَالْأَئِمَّةِ الطَّاهِرِينَ عَلَيْهِمُ السَّلامُ، فَصَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْكَ حَيّاً وَمَيِّتاً، وَرَحْمَةُ اللَّهِ وَبَركاتُهُ.

Assalaamo a’layka yaa waliyyallaahe, assalaamo a’layka yaa ameenallaahe, assalaamo a’layka yaa waaleda khaatamil anbiyaae, assalaamo a’layka yaa manintahi elayhil wal amaanato al maneeato, assalaamo a’layka yaa man awda’allaaho fee sulbehi attayyebit taaheril makeene noora rasoolilaahe as-saadeqil ameene, assalaamo a’layka yaa waaleda sayyedil anbiyaae wal murasalina, ash-hado annaka qad hafidhtal wasiyyata, wa addaytal amaanata ann rabbil aalamina fee rasoolehi, wa kunta fee deeneka alaa yaqeenin, wa ash-hado annakat taba’a-ta dinallaahe alaa minhaaze jaddeka ibraahima khalillaahe fee hayaateka wa ba’a-da wa faateka, alaa mardhaatillaahe fee rasoolehi, wa aqrarta wa saddaqta be nobuwwate rasoolillaahe sallallaaho a’layhe wa aalehi, wa wilaayate amireel momineena alayhis salaamo, wal aimmatit taaherina alayhemussalaamo, fa sallallaaho a’layka hayyan wa mayyetan, wa rahmatullaahe wa barakaatohu

Peace be upon you O the friend of Allah! Peace be upon you O the trustworthy of Allah! Peace be upon you O the light of Allah! Peace be upon you O one entrusted with the light of the Messenger of Allah. Peace be upon you O the father of the Seal of prophets. Peace be upon you O the one to whom the preventive trust ends. Peace be upon you O the one in whose pure and purified backbone God had kept the light of Allah’s truthful and trustworthy Messenger. Peace be upon you O the father of the leader of Prophets and Messengers! I bear witness that you protected the commandment and performed your duty regarding His Messenger (that was) assigned to you from the Benefactor of the worlds. (I bear witness) You had unshaken believe in your religion. I bear witness that you followed the religion of Allah in your life and after death on the same way as your grandfather Abraham the friend of Allah did, regarding pleasures of Allah in His Messenger. (I bear witness) You acknowledged and affirmed the prophet-hood of the Messenger of Allah_ peace be upon him and his progeny, and the commandment of the Commander of faithful and that of other infallibles, peace be upon them. Peace, mercy and blessings of Allah may shower upon you during your life time and death.

The Baqi cemetery, often called Jannat-ul-Baqi, refers to the cemetery located in Medina at the southeast corner of the Prophet's mosque (S). From the mosque of the Prophet (S), the pilgrims make their way to this cemetery.

Baqi was a memory for the Prophet (S), he regularly came to this place, he remembered those who were buried there and kept praising them.

We send blessings to martyrs and those who are asleep in this place.

In this cemetery are buried great figures of Islam, companions of the Prophet (S) of Mecca, the wives of the Prophet (S) (with the exception of Khadija (A) and Mariya al-Qibtiyya) and other relatives of the family of the Prophet (S).

Baqi is best known for being the shrine of 4 Imams of the direct descent of the Holy Prophet (S): Imam Hassan (A), Imam Sajaad (A), Imam al-Baqir (A) and Imam as-Sadiq (A).

It was the Prophet (S) himself who named this cemetery 'Baqi' because it used to be a garden.118

Ziyarat :

اَلسَّلامُ عَلى أَهْلِ لا إِلهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ، مِنْ أَهْلِ لا إِلهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ، يا أَهْلَ لا إِلهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ، بِحَقِّ لا إِلهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ، كَيْفَ وَجَدْتُمْ قَوْلَ لا إِلهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ، مِنْ لا إِلهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ، يا لا إِلهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ، بِحَقِّ لا إِلهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ، اِغْفِرْ لِمَنْ قالَ لا إِلهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ، وَاحْشُرْنا فِي زُمْرَةِ مَنْ قالَ لا إِلهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ، مُحَمَّدٌ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ عَلِيٌّ وَلِيُّ اللَّهِ.

Assalaamo alaa ahle laa elaaha illalaaho, min ahle laa elaaha illalaaho,yaa ahla laa elaaha illallaaho, be haqqe laa elaaha illaallaaho, kayfa wa jadtum qawla laa elaaha illallaaho, min laa elaaha illaallaaho, yaa laa elaaha illaallaaho, be haqqe laa elaahaa illallaaho, ighfir leman qaala laa elaaha illallaaho, wah shurna fee zumrate man qaala laa elaaha illaallaaho, ighfir leman qaala laa elaaha illallaaho,wah shurna fee zumrate man qaala laa elaaha illaallaaho, muhammadun rasoolullaahe aliyyun waliyyunlaahe.

Peace be upon the people, having faith (that) there is no god but Allah from the people, having faith (that) there is no god but Allah. O the people, having faith (that) there is no god but Allah; (I beseech You) with the faith (that) there is no god but Allah; how did you find the word ‘there is no god but Allah, from (the people who said) there is no god but Allah. O (Almighty) there is no god except Allah, (I beseech You) with the faith (that) there is no god but Allah (please) forgive one who says (that) there is no god but Allah and make my resurrection with those who say that there is no god but Allah; Muhammad is the messenger of Allah; Ali is Allah’s representative.

a) Imam Hassan (A)

Imam Hassan (A) was born on 15 Ramadhan in year 3 of Hijra. He was the first grandson of the Prophet (S) and his name was given by the Prophet (S) himself. The Prophet (S) recited the call to prayer (Azan) in the right ear of the newborn, then the announcement of the prayer (Iqama) in the left ear.

He looked a lot like the Prophet (S) and used to listen carefully to his sermons. Imam Hassan (A) was 7 years old when the Prophet (S) died. He lived with his father for 30 years and after the death of Imam Ali (A), he was Imam for 10 years. During his Imamate, he prepared the companions to fight with Imam Hussein (A). The followers of Imam Hussein (A) during the Battle of Karbala are the result of the efforts of Imam Hassan (A). Imam Hassan (A) died on 7 Safar of 49 AH, he lived 47 years and was poisoned by his wife Jou'da and deceived by Mu'awiyah. In fact, he had promised Jou'da a marriage with his son Yazid. Imam Hassan (A) takes his poisoned cup from his wife's hands and died after 40 days of illness. He is buried in Baqi Cemetery near his grandmother Fatima Binte Assad (A).

b) Imam as-Sajjad (A)

Imam as-Sajjad (A) is the son of Imam Hussein (A) and his mother is Hazrat Shahrbanu (A), the daughter of the King of Iran. He was born on 5th Shabaan in year 38 of the Hijra and remained Imam for 35 years. With his wife Fatima, the daughter of Imam Hassan (A), he had Imam al-Baqir (A) who succeeded the Imamate. Imam as-Sajjad (A) had a total of 11 sons and 4 daughters. He was the only survivor of the sons of Imam Hussein (A) after the tragedy of Karbala. He performed countless rakaats of prayers a day. During the prayer, his body trembled like a palm leaf and his face turned pale for fear of Allah. On his forehead were the traces of prostration, which is why he was nicknamed 'as-Sajjad' (the prostrator). He owes his nickname 'adorers' adornment' (Zaynul Abidine) to his great piety and his many invocations. After the last return to Medina, Imam as-Sajjad (A) withdrew from public life and spent his time in prayer. He was in contact only with the Shiite elites who spread the religious sciences among them and in this way Shiism expanded considerably with Imam al-Baqir (A). Imam as-Sajjad (A) died on 25 Moharram in year 95 of the Hegira, poisoned by al-Walid ibn Abdal Malik (6th Umayyad caliph).119

c) Imam al-Baqir (A)

Imam Mohammad al-Baqir (A) is the son of Imam as-Sajjad (A) and his mother is Fatima the daughter of Imam Hassan (A). He was born on the 1st Rajab of 57 AH. He stayed Imam for 19 years. With his wife Umm Farwa, he had his son Imam al-Sadiq (A) who succeeded him to the Imamate. Imam al-Baqir (A) had a total of 7 children. He was present and was 4 years old at the Karbala event and was therefore with his father among the survivors. He was the first to be the descendant of Imam Ali (A) on both sides (paternal and maternal). He was nicknamed 'Baqir al-Ulum' (the one who pierces the sciences). During his Imamate, a large number of illustrious men and Shi'a scholars were trained by him in the different Islamic sciences. These names are recorded in the biographies of famous men of Islam.

Imam al-Baqir (A) died on 7 Zilhajj in AD 114 at the age of 57, poisoned on the orders of Hisham ibn Abd al-Malik (10th Umayyad Caliph).120

d) Imam al-Sadiq (A)

He was born on the 17th of Rabi al-Awal in the year 83 after the Hijra. His imamate was for 34 years. His father was Imam al-Baqir (A) and his mother Umm Farwa. Imam al-Sadiq (A) had 7 boys and 3 girls including Imam al-Kazim (A) with his wife Hazrat Hamida. During his Imamate, he had great freedom and a more favorable climate for the propagation of religious teachings. The Umayad government was weakening and the Abbasid government wanted to seize power ; a conflict erupted between these two governments and imam al-Sadiq (A) took the opportunity to spread the religious sciences. He trained several scientists in the different fields of science. He had about 4000 students. Towards the end of his life, Imam al-Sadiq (A) was subjected to severe restrictions by the Caliph Abbassid al-Mansur who ordered the torture and murder of many descendants of the Prophet (S). It was so much that he surpassed the Umayas in cruelty. Imam as-Sadiq (A) was considered the master of all jurisprudence and the teacher of all Islamic knowledge. Many of the great Islamic scholars and founders of schools of Islamic thought were among his students. Imam As-Sadiq (A) died on the 25th of Shawal in the year 148 of the Hijra. He was poisoned on the order of Mansour.121

Ziyarat to Imams of Baqi :

اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكُمْ أَئِمَّةَ الْهُدى‏، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكُمْ أَهْلَ التَّقْوى‏، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكُمْ أَيُّهَا الْحُجَجُ عَلى‏ أَهْلِ الدُّنْيا، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكُمْ أَيُّهَا الْقُوّامُ فِي الْبَرِيَّةِ بِالْقِسْطِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكُمْ أَهْلَ الصَّفْوَةِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكُمْ آلَ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكُمْ أَهْلَ النَّجْوى‏، أَشْهَدُ أَنَّكُمْ قَدْ بَلَّغْتُمْ وَنَصَحْتُمْ وَصَبَرْتُمْ فِي ذاتِ اللَّهِ، وَكُذِّبْتُمْ وَأُسِي‏ءَ إِلَيْكُمْ فَعَفَوْتُمْ، وَأَشْهَدُ أَنَّكُمُ الْأَئِمَّةُ الرَّاشِدُونَ الْمُهْتَدُونَ، وَأَنَّ طاعَتَكُمْ مَفْرُوضَةٌ، وَأَنَّ قَوْلَكُمُ الصِدْقُ، وَأَنَّكُمْ دَعَوْتُم فَلَمْ تُجابُوا، وَأَمَرْتُمْ فَلَمْ تُطاعُوا، وَأَنَّكُمْ دَعائِمُ الدِّينِ وَأَرْكانُ الْأَرْضِ، لَمْ تَزالُوا بِعَيْنِ اللَّهِ، يَنْسَخُكُمْ مِنْ أَصْلابِ كُلِّ مُطَهَّرٍ، وَيَنْقُلُكُمْ فِي أَرْحامِ الْمُطَهَّراتِ، لَمْ تُدَنِسْكُمُ الْجاهِلِيَّةُ الْجَهْلاءُ، وَلَمْ تَشْرَكْ فِيكُمْ فِتَنُ الْأَهْواءِ، طِبْتُمْ وَطابَ مَنْشَؤُكُمْ، مَنَّ بِكُمْ عَلَيْنا دَيَّانُ الدِّينِ، فَجَعَلَكُمْ فِي بُيُوتٍ أَذِنَ اللَّهُ أَنْ تُرْفَعَ وَيُذْكَرَ فِيهَا اسْمُهُ، وَجَعَلَ صَلاتَنا عَلَيْكُمْ رَحْمَةً لَنا وَكَفَّارَةً لِذُنُوبِنا، إِذِ اخْتارَكُمْ لَنا، وَطَيَّبَ خَلْقَنا بِما مَنَّ بِهِ عَلَيْنا مِنْ وِلايَتِكُمْ، وَكُنَّا عِنْدَهُ مُسَمَّينَ بِعِلْمِكُمْ، مُعْتَرِفِينَ بِتَصْدِيقِنا إِيَّاكُمْ، وَهذا مَقامُ مَنْ أَسْرَفَ وَأَخْطَأَ وَاسْتَكانَ وَأَقَرَّ بِما جَنى‏، وَرَجا بِمَقامِهِ الْخَلاصَ، وَأَنْ يَسْتَنْقِذَهُ بِكُمْ مُسْتَنْقِذُ الْهَلْكى‏ مِنَ الرَّدى‏، فَكُونُوا لِي شُفَعاءَ، فَقَدْ وَفَدْتُ إِلَيْكُمْ إِذْ رَغِبَ عَنْكُمْ أَهْلُ الدُّنْيا، وَاتَّخَذُوا آياتِ اللَّهِ هُزُواً، وَاسْتَكْبَرُوا عَنْها، يا مَنْ هُوَ قائِمٌ لايَسْهُو، وَدائِمٌ لا يَلْهُو، وَمُحِيطٌ بِكُلِ شَيْ‏ءٍ، لَكَ الْمَنُّ بِما وَفَّقْتَنِي، وَعَرَّفْتَنِي بِمَا ائْتَمَنْتَنِي عَلَيْهِ، إِذْ صَدَّ عَنْهُ عِبادُكَ وَجَحَدُوا مَعْرِفَتَهُ، وَاسْتَخَفُّوا بِحَقِهِ، وَمالُوا إِلى‏ سِواهُ، فَكانَتِ الْمِنَّةُ لَكَ وَمِنْكَ عَلَيَّ مَعَ أَقْوامٍ خَصَصْتَهُمْ بِما خَصَصْتَنِي بِهِ، فَلَكَ الْحَمْدُ إِذْ كُنْتُ عِنْدَكَ فِي مَقامِي مَذْكُوراً مَكْتُوباً، فَلا تَحْرِمْنِي ما رَجَوْتُ، وَلا تُخَيِبْنِي فِيما دَعَوْتُ.

Assalaamo a’laykum a’immatal hoda, assalaamo a’laykum ahlal taqwee, assalaamo a’laykum ayyohal hojajo alaa ahlid dunyaa, assalaamo alaykum ayyohal quvvaamo feel bariyyate bil qiste, assalaamo alaykum ahlal safwate, assalaamo alaykum aala rasoolillaahe, assalaamo a’laykum ahlan najwee, ash-hado annakomul a’immato ar-raashedunal muhtaduna, wa anna taa’atakum mafrujatun, wa anna qawlakumus sidqo, wa annakum da’a-watum falam tojaabo, wa amartum falam totaa’uw,wa annakum da’aaemo ad-deenewa arkaano al-ardhe, lam tazaalu be aynillaahe, yansakhokum min aslaabe kulle mutahharin, wa yanqolokum fee arhaamil mutahharaate, lam tudaniskomo al-jaahiliyyato al-jahlaao, walam tashrak feekum fitanul ahwaae, tibtum wa taaba manshaokum, manna be kum alaynaa dayaanud deene, faja’alakum fee boyutin azinallaaho ann turfa’a wa yuzkara feeha asmohu, wa ja’ala salaatana alaykum rahmatan lanaa wa kaffaaratan lezonubena, izikh taarakum lanaa, watayyaba khalaqna bemaa manna behi alaynaa min welaayatekum, wa kunna indahu musammayna be ilmekum, mu’atarefina be tasdeeqinaa iyyaakum,wa hadhaa maqaamo man asrafa wa akhta’a wastakaana wa aqarra bemaa janee, wa rajaa be maqqamehi al-khalaasa, wa ann yastanqedhahu bekum mustanqidho al-halkee mena ar-radee, fakunuwa lee shofa-aa’a, faqad wafto ilaykum idh raghiba ahlu dunya wattakhadhu aayaatillahe huzuwa wastakbaroo anhaa,yaa man howa qaaemo laa yas-ho, wa daaemo laa yalho, wa moheetun be kule shay-inn, lakal manno bemaa waffaqtanee wa arraftanee bemaa atamtanee alayhe, idhaa sadda anhu ebaadeka wa jahado waa ma’a-refatahu, wastakhaffuwa be haqehi, wa maalu ilaa siwaaho, fakaanatil minnato laka wa minka alayyaa ma’a aqwaamin khasastahum bemaa khasastanee behi, falakal hamdo idh kunto indaka fee maqaami madhkurann maktuban, falaa tahrimnee maa rajawto, wa laa tukhyibnee feema da’a-to.

Peace be upon you O leaders of guidance! Peace be upon you O people of piety! Peace be upon you O arguments (of Allah) against the people of the world! Peace be upon you who were steadfast in dealing with people with justice. Peace be upon you O the chosen people! Peace be upon you the member of the family of the Messenger of Allah! Peace be upon you O people of confidential conversations (with Allah). I bear witness that you delivered and advised and persevered for the sake of Allah and that you were belied and maltreated but you forgave. I bear witness that you are the rightly guided leaders and that obedience of you is incumbent and that your words are true and that you invited (to the truth) but were not answered and you commanded but were not followed. I bear witness that you are the pillars of religion and support of the earth, you were always under the (caring) sight of Allah who moved you from the wombs of the pure ones, the era of ignorance could not contaminate you; the sedition of desires could not attract you. You have become pure; your origin is pure. Through you He (Allah) has favored us (with His religion). He caused you to be in the houses in which Allah has allowed His name to be elevated and remembered. He has made our salutations upon you the mercy for us and expiation of our sins as Allah has chosen you for us and has made our creation pure because of our loyalty to your (Divinely commissioned) leadership with which He has conferred upon us. (Thus) We have been nominated in front of Him due to our acknowledgment of you and our giving credence to you. This is the position of one who has committed mistakes and sins; He has submitted and acknowledged what he has committed and hoped of his sincere position and through you he will be saved from destruction, so (please) become my intercessors. I have come to you when the people of the world turned away from you and took the signs of Allah for a jest and became arrogant. O’ One who is upright and does not overlook; O Eternal One who does not neglect and Who encompasses all things. You favored me with Your help and You introduced me the path which You established for me when Your servants turned away from it and ignored the recognition of it, belittled its right and inclined to elsewhere. It is Your favor on me as well as on other people whom You have granted same exclusively. So I praise be to You, for I have been mentioned and written with You due to the position in which I am now.
So do not deprive me of what I hoped for and, by the sanctity of Muhammad and his pure family, do not disappoint me what I have asked from You.

Farewell Ziyarat to Imams of Baqi :

اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكُمْ أَئِمَّةَ الْهُدى‏ وَرَحْمَةُ اللَّهِ وَبَرَكاتُهُ، أَسْتَوْدِعُكُمُ اللَّهَ وَأَقْرَأُ عَلَيْكُمُ السَّلامَ، آمَنَّا باللَّهِ وَبالرَّسُولِ وَبِما جِئْتُم بِهِ وَدَلَلْتُمْ عَلَيْهِ. اللَّهُمَّ فَاكتُبْنا مَعَ الشَّاهِدِينَ.

Assalaamo a’laykum a’immaatal huda wa rahamtullaahe wa barakaatohu, as-tawde’okomullaaha wa aqra o, alaykumus salaama, aamannaa billaahe wa barrasoolehi wa bemaa je’a-tum behi wa dalalatum alayhe, allahumma faqtubna ma’asshaahedin.

Peace, mercy and blessings of Allah be upon you O the leaders of guidance! I entrust you with Allah and pay salutations (salam) to you. We believe in Allah and the Messenger and in that which You have conveyed and to which You have guided. O Allah write our names among those who bear witness.

e) Fatima bint Assad (A)

She was born in AD 55 and was the wife of Abu Talib ibn Abdul Mutallib (A) and the mother of 7 children including Imam Ali (A). She migrated to Medina on foot to join the Prophet (S). After the death of Abdul Mutallib (A), the Prophet (S) was 8 years old and was under the responsibility of Abu Talib (A) where he lived for 10 years. The Prophet (S) says that after his mother Amina (A), Fatima Binté Assad (A) was his 2nd mother, she behaved the best way with him. She died in year 4 of the Hijra. The Prophet (S) covered her with his shirt as her shroud, wrapped her body in his cloak and recited the prayer for her. He then descended into her grave and lay her inside.122

Ziyarat :

اَلسَّلامُ عَلى‏ نَبِيِ اللَّهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى‏ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى‏ مُحَمَّدٍ سَيِدِ الْمُرْسَلِينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى‏ مُحَمَّدٍ سَيِدِ الْأَوَّلِينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى‏ مُحَمَّدٍ سَيِدِ الْآخِرِينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى‏ مَنْ بَعَثَهُ اللَّهُ رَحْمَةً لِلْعالَمِينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ أَيُّهَا النَّبِيُّ وَرَحْمَةُ اللَّهِ وَبَرَكاتُهُ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى‏ فاطِمَةَ بِنْتِ أَسَدٍ الْهاشِمِيَّةِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ أَيَّتُهَا الصِدِّيقَةُ الْمَرْضِيَّةُ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ أَيَّتُهَا التَّقِيَّةُ النَّقِيَّةُ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ أَيَّتُهَا الْكَرِيمَةُ الرَّضِيَّةُ، السَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا كافِلَةَ مُحَمَّدٍ خاتَمِ النَّبِيِينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا والِدَةَ سَيِدِ الْوَصِيِينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا مَنْ ظَهَرَتْ شَفَقَتُها عَلى‏ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ خاتَمِ النَّبِيِينَ، السَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا مَنْ تَربِيَتُها لِوَلِيِ اللَّهِ الْأَمِينِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ وَعَلى‏ رُوحِكِ وَبَدَنِكِ الطَّاهِرِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ وَعَلى‏ وَلَدِكِ، وَرَحْمَةُ اللَّهِ وَبَرَكاتُهُ

Assalaamo alaa nabiyillaahe, assalaamo rasoolillaahe, assalaamo alaa muhammadin sayidil aakherina, assalaamo alaa man ba’thahullahu rahmataan lil’alameen, assalaamo alayka ayyuha nabiyyu warahmatullahi wabarakatuh, assalaamo alaa faatemata binte aasadil haashimiyyate, assalaamo alayke ayyatoha as siddiqato al-mardhiyyato, assalaamo alayke ayyatoha at taqiyyato an naqiyyato, assalaamo alayke ayyatohal karimato ar radhiyyato, assalaamo alayke yaa kaafelata muhammadin khaatamin nabiyyina, assalaamo alayke yaa waaledata sayidil wasiyyina, assalaamo alayke yaa man dhaharat shafaqatohaa alaa rasolillaahe khaatamin nabiyyina, assalaamo alayke yaa man tarabiyatoha le waliyillaahil aalamina, assalaamo alayke wa alaa rooheke wa badanekit taahere, assalaamo alayke wa alaa waladeka wa rahmatullaahe wa barakaatohu.

Peace be upon you, the Prophet of Allah! Peace be upon you, the Messenger of Allah! Peace be upon Muhammad the leader of the Messengers! Peace be upon Muhammad the leader of the foremost ones! Peace be upon Muhammad the leader of the preceding ones! Peace be upon one whom Allah sent as a mercy to all worlds. Peace, mercy and blessings of Allah be upon you, O Prophet of Allah. Peace be upon Fatima, the daughter of Asad, the Hashemite. Peace be upon you O truthful and contented one! Peace be upon you O virtuous and pure one! Peace be upon You O generous and contented one! Peace be upon you O one who looked after Muhammad, the seal of the Prophets. Peace be upon you O mother of the leader of the successors. Peace be upon you who displayed compassion for the Prophet of Allah, the seal of the Prophets. Peace be upon you O one who brought up the trustworthy friend of Allah! Peace be upon you, upon your soul and upon your pure body! Peace, mercy and blessings of Allah be upon you and upon your son.

f) Abbas ibn Abdul Mutallib

He was born in the year 56 before Hijra and he was the youngest uncle of the Prophet (S). He was 3 years older to the Prophet (S) and grew up with the Prophet (S). Before he became a Muslim, he was protecting the Prophet (S) and he was highly respected by Muslims. He lost his sight towards the end of his life. He died on 14 Rajab of the year 32 AH. It was Imam Ali (A) who gave him the ghusl.123

Ziyarat :

اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا عَبَّاسَ بْنَ عَبْدِ الْمُطَّلِبِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا عَمَّ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ، السَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا صاحِبَ السِّقايَةِ وَرَحْمَةُ اللَّهِ وَبَرَكاتُهُ.

Assalaamo a’layka yaa abbas abna abdil muttalibe, assalaamo alayaka yaa saaheba as siaqaayate wa rahmatullaahe wabarakaatohu.

Peace be upon you O Abbas Bin Abdul Muttalib! Peace be upon you O the uncle of the Messenger of Allah. Peace, mercy and blessings of Allah be upon you O the one who obsessed the duty of supplying water (to pilgrims).

g) The 3 daughters of the Holy Prophet (S)

The Prophet (S) had four daughters with Hazrat Khadija (A) : Zaynab, Umm Kulthum, Ruqaya and Fatima az-Zahra (A). Zaynab, the first daughter of the Prophet (S), died in year 8 of the Hijra. Ruqaya, the 2nd daughter of the Prophet (S), died in the month of Ramadhan in year 2 of Hijra. Umm Kulthum, the 3rd daughter of the Prophet (S), died on 3 Shabaan in year 9 of Hijra.124

Ziyarat :

اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا رَسُولَ رَبِّ الْعالَمِينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا صَفْوَةَ جَمِيعِ الْأَنْبِياءِ وَالْمُرْسَلِينَ، السَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا مَنِ اخْتارَهُ اللَّهُ عَلَى الْخَلْقِ أَجْمَعِينَ، وَرَحْمَةُ اللَّهِ وَبَرَكاتُهُ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى‏ بَناتِ السَّيِّدِ الْمُصْطَفى‏، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى‏ بَناتِ النَّبِيِ الْمُجْتَبى‏، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى‏ بَناتِ مَنِ اصْطَفاهُ اللَّهُ فِي السَّماءِ، وَفَضَّلَهُ عَلى‏ جَمِيعِ الْبَرِيَّةِ وَالْوَرى‏، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى‏ ذُرِّيَّةِ السَّيِدِ الْجَلِيلِ، مِنْ‏نَسْلِ إِسْماعِيلَ، وَسُلالَةِ إِبْراهِيمَ الْخَلِيلِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا رَسُولَ رَبِّ الْعالَمِينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا صَفْوَةَ جَمِيعِ الْأَنْبِياءِ وَالْمُرْسَلِينَ، السَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا مَنِ اخْتارَهُ اللَّهُ عَلَى الْخَلْقِ أَجْمَعِينَ، وَرَحْمَةُ اللَّهِ وَبَرَكاتُهُ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى‏ بَناتِ السَّيِّدِ الْمُصْطَفى‏، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى‏ بَناتِ النَّبِيِ الْمُجْتَبى‏، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى‏ بَناتِ مَنِ اصْطَفاهُ اللَّهُ فِي السَّماءِ، وَفَضَّلَهُ عَلى‏ جَمِيعِ الْبَرِيَّةِ وَالْوَرى‏، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى‏ ذُرِّيَّةِ السَّيِدِ الْجَلِيلِ، مِنْ‏نَسْلِ إِسْماعِيلَ، وَسُلالَةِ إِبْراهِيمَ الْخَلِيلِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى‏ بَناتِ النَّبِيِ‏الرَّسُولِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى‏ أَخَواتِ فاطِمَةَ الزَّهْراءِ الْبَتُولِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى‏ زَيْنَبَ وَأُمِ كُلْثُومَ وَرُقَيَّةَ، َالسَّلامُ عَلَى الشَّرِيفاتِ الْأَحْسابِ، وَالطَّاهِراتِ الْأَنْسابِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى‏ بَناتِ الْآباءِ الْأَعاظِمِ، وَسُلالَةِ الْأَجْدادِ الْأَكارِمِ الْأَفاخِمِ، عَبْدِالْمُطَّلِبِ وَعَبْدِ مَنافٍ وَهاشِمٍ، وَرَحْمَةُ اللَّهِ وَبَرَكاتُهُ.

Assalaamo a’layka yaa rasoola rabbil aalamina, assalaamo a’layka yaa safwate jamee’il anbiyaa’e wal mursaleena, assalaamo a’layka yaa manikhtaa rahullaahe alal khalqil ajmaeena, wa rahamtullaahe wa barakaatohu, assalaamo alaa banaate sayyedil mustafee, assalaamo alaa banaatin nabiyyil mujatabi, assalaamo alaa banaatin nabiyyin al mujatabee, assalaamo alaa banaate menas tafaahullaaho fees samaa’e, wa fadhlahu alaa jamee’e al bariyyate wal waree, assalaamo alaa dhurriyate as-sayyedil jaleele, min nasle ismaaila, wa sulaalate ibraahimal khaleele, assalaamo alaa banaatin nabiyyir rasoole, assalaamo alaa akhawaate faatemataz zahraail batoole, assalaamo alaa zaynaba wa ume kulthuma wa ruqayyata, assalaamo alash sharifaatil ah-saabe, wat taaheraatil ansaabe, assalaamo alaa banaatil aabaa’il a aaheema, wa sulaalatil aj-daadil akaareme al-faakheme, abdil muttabalibe wa abde manaafin wa haashimin, wa rahmatullaahe wabrakaatohu.

Peace be upon you, O the Messenger of the Benefactor of worlds! Peace be upon you, O the chosen one among all the prophets and messengers! Peace, mercy and blessings of Allah be upon you, O the one Allah has given authority over the entire creature. Peace be upon the daughters of the chosen leader! Peace be upon the daughters of chosen prophet! Peace be upon the daughters of one whom Allah has chosen in heavens and preferred over entire mankind and creatures. Peace be upon you O the offspring of majestic leader, the generation of Ismail and descendants of Abram. Peace be upon the daughters of Prophet, Messenger. Peace be upon the sisters of Fatima Al-Zahra Al-Batool. Peace be upon Zainab, Umm-e-Kalthoom and Ruqayya. Peace be upon the ladies of noble lineage and pure family. Peace be upon the daughter of glorious, honorable and noble forefathers (like) Abd-ul- Muttalib, Abd-e- Munaf and Hashim, mercy and blessings of Allah be upon you.

h) The wives of the Holy Prophet (S)

Allama Tabatabai’i, the author of Tafsir al-Mizan says that the Prophet (S) had 11 wives, 9 of whom are buried in the Baqi cemetery, apart from Hazrat Khadija (A) and Maria al-Qibtiyya.
The 9 wives of the Prophet (S) who are buried in the Baqi cemetery are :

- Zaynab bint Khuzayma : She only lived for 8 months of marriage with the Prophet (S), she died in the year 4 of Hijra.

- Zaynab bint Jahsh : She helped orphans, the poor and widows a lot, she was very generous. When she died, she left no fortune, she had shared everything. She died in the year 20 AH.

- Hafsa bint Omar ibn al-Khattab : She was the daughter of Omar ibn al-Khattab (2nd Caliph). She died in the year 20 AH.

- Oum Habiba : Her name was Roumleh, known by Oum Habiba. She was the daughter of Abu Sufiyan ibn Harb and the sister of Mou’awiyah. She was born 17 years before the prophetic mission.
She converted to Islam secretly because her father Abu Sufiyan was a great enemy of the Prophet (S). She suffered a lot because she remained very faithful to Islam. Abu Sufiyan used every means to bring back his daughter to the religion of their ancestors, but he did not succeed. One day, Abu Sufiyan came to his daughter Um Habiba and wanted to sit on the Prophet (S) 's carpet. Umm Habiba picked up the rug and told his father that he could not sit on the carpet on which the Prophet (S) was sitting ; she also told him that he was idolatrous and impure. She died in year 44 of the Hijra.

- Safiya bint Ho-Yay : She was smart, cultivated, and had good manners. Gentleness and patience were her main qualities. She died in the year 50 AH.

- Sauda bint Zema’a : She was the 2nd wife of the Prophet (S) after the death of Hazrat Khadija (A). The Prophet (S) took all his wives on his Farewell Pilgrimage (Hajj al Wida), except Sauda who recited the verse: « Stay in your houses, do not show yourself in your garments as did women in the days of the old ignorance »125 She has never gone out of her house. She died in the year 50 AH.

- Juwayriya bint al-Harith : She was a slave that the Prophet (S) had liberated. Then she married the Prophet (S). She died in the year 56 AH.

- Aisha bint Abu Bakr : She was the daughter of Abu Bakr (1st caliph), she was the 3rd wife of the Prophet (S). She died in year 58 of the Hijra.

- Oum Salama Hind bint Abu Ummayah : Her name was Hind, known by Oum Salama. She was one of the first converts to Islam. For months, Oum Salama refused to deny Islam, despite all the torment her family inflicted on him. Imam as-Sadiq (A) said : 'Um Salama after Hazrat Khadija (A) was the best wife of the Prophet (S). She loved the Ahl-ul-Bayt (A) and defended them. 'Imam Hussein's (A) education was entrusted to her, as she loved the Ahl-ul-Bayt (A) so much. After the death of Imam Hussein (A), she did the azadari (mourning). The Prophet (S) had given her the sand of Karbala and she had preserved it in a bottle; the Prophet (S) had told her that when this sand would turn into blood, at that time his grandson Hussein (A) would be killed. She died at the age of 84 in the year 62 AH.128.126

Ziyarat to the wives of the Holy Prophet (S) :

السَّلامُ عَلَيْكُنَّ یا زوْجاتِ رَسولِ اللَّهِ، السَّلامُ عَلَيْكُنَّ یا زوْجاتِ نَبِيِّ اللَّهِ، اُمَّهاتِ الْمُؤْمِنِینَ وَ رَحْمَةُ اللّهِ وَ بَرَکاتُهُ، اَللّهُمَ ارْضِ عَنْهُنَّ، وَارْفَعْ دَرَجاتِهِنَّ، وَ اَکْرِمْ مَقامَهُنَّ، واَجْزِلْ ثَوابَهُنَّ، آمِینَ یا رَبَّ الْعالَمِینَ.

Assalaamo alaykunna yaa zawjaati rasoolillaahe, assalaamo alaykunna yaa zawjaate nabiyyillaahe, ummahaatil momineena wa rahmatullaahe wa barakaatohu, allahummar dhe anhunna, warfa’a darajaatehinna, wa akrim maqaamahunna, wa ajzeel thawaabahunna, aameena yaa rabbal aalameena.

Peace be upon you, O the spouses of the Messenger of Allah. Peace, mercy and blessings of Allah be upon you, O the wives of the Prophet of Allah, the mothers of believers. O Allah be content with them, elevate their status, respect their position, increase their reward. So it be ! O the Benefactor of worlds.

i) Abdullah ibn Ja'far at-Tayaar

Abdullah was the son of Ja'far son of Abu Talib, and his mother was Asma bint Umais. He was the husband of Sayeda Zaynab (A) and the son-in-law of Imam Ali (A). He was among the companions of the Holy Prophet (S). In 60 AH, when Imam Hussein (A) left Medina, he not only accepted that Sayeda Zaynab (A) accompany his brother, but he ordered his two children, Awn and Muhammad, to be taken away. Abdullah could not attend the battle of Karbala because he had lost his sight. He died in the year 80 of the Hijra.127

j) Aqil ibn Abi Talib

Aqil is the son of Abu Talib (A), and his mother is Fatema bint Asad (A). He was among the companions of the Prophet (S), the brother of Imam Ali (A) and the father of Hazrat Muslim (A) (the ambassador of Imam Hussein (A) in Kufa). He was 20 years older than Imam Ali (A). He died in the year 50 AH.128

The ziyarat of Abdullah ibn Ja'far al-Tayaar and Aqil ibn Abi Talib :

اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا سَيِّدَنا ياعَقِيلَ بْنَ أَبي‏طالِبٍ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يَابْنَ عَمِّ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ،َ السَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يَابْنَ عَمِّ نَبِيِّ اللَّهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يَابْنَ عَمِّ حَبِيبِ اللَّهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يَابْنَ عَمِ‏ الْمُصْطَفى‏، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا أَخا عَلِيٍ الْمُرْتَضى‏، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى‏ عَبْدِاللَّهِ بْنِ جَعْفَرٍ الطَّيَّارِ فِي الْجِنانِ، وَعَلى‏ مَنْ حَوْلَكُما مِنْ أَصْحابِ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ رَضِيَ اللَّهُ تَعالى‏ عَنْكُما وَأَرْضاكُما أَحْسَنَ الرِّضا، وَجَعَلَ الْجَنَّةَ مَنْزِلَكُما وَمَسْكَنَكُما وَ مَحَلَّكُما وَمَأْواكُما، السَّلامُ عَلَيْكُما وَرَحْمَةُ اللَّهِ وَبَركاتُهُ.

Assalaamo alayka yaa sayyadena yaa aqeel abna taalebin, assalaamo a’layka yabna ammi rasoolillaahe, assalaamo alayka yabna ammin nabiyillaahe, assalaamo a’layka yabna ammi habeebillaahe, assalaamo alayka yabna amil mustafi, assalaamo alayka yaa akhaa aliyyil murtadha, assalaamo alaa abdillaah ibne ja’farin attayaare feel jeenaane, wa alaa man hawlakomaa min ashaabe rasoolillaahe radheyallaaho ta’aalee ankoma wa ardhaa’akomaa ahsanar redhee, wa ja’alal jannata manzelakuma wa maskanakomaa wa mahal-lakomaa wa maawaakomaa, assalaamo alaykomaa wa rahmatullaahe wa barakaatohu.

Peace be upon you, O our lord Aqeel Bin Abu Talib! Peace be upon you, O son of the uncle of the Messenger of Allah! Peace be upon you, O son of the uncle of Prophet of Allah! Peace be upon you, O son of the uncle of beloved one of Allah! Peace be upon you, O son of the uncle of the chosen one! Peace be upon you, O the brother of Ali Al-Murtaza! Peace be upon Abdullah Bin Jafar Al-Tayyar in paradise, and upon the companions of the Messenger of Allah lying around you both, May Allah be pleased with both of you, and confer you the best of contentment. He may make your house, dwelling, palace and abode in paradise! Peace, mercy and blessings of Allah be upon you both!

k) Ibrahim the son of the Prophet (S)

Ibrahim was the son of the Prophet (S) and Maria al-Qibtiyya. He was born during the month of Zilhajj in the year 8 of the Hijra and died during the month of Rabi ul Awal in the year 10 of the Hijra at the age of 18 months. The Prophet (S) cried a lot and was very saddened by his passing. When the Prophet (S) was reproached for crying, he replied that he was a human being like all and that his heart could be sad, just as his eyes could cry.129

Ziyarat :

اَلسَّلامُ عَلى رَسُولِ اللهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى نَبِىِّ اللهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى حَبیبِ اللهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى صَفِىِّ اللهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى نَجیِّ اللهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَبْدِاللهِ، سَیِّدِ الاْنْبِیآءِ وَخاتَمِ الْمُرْسَلینَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَیْکَ یَابْنَ النَّبِىِّ الْمُجْتَبى، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَیْکَ یَابْنَ الْمَبْعُوثِ اِلى کافَّةِ الْوَرى،اَلسَّلامُ عَلَیْکَ یَا بْنَ الْبَشیرِ النَّذیرِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَیْکَ یَابْنَ السِّراجِ الْمُنیرِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَیْکَ یَا بْنَ الْمُؤَیَّدِ بِالْقُرآنِ، اَللّـهُمَّ اِنّى اَسْئَلُکَ بِحَقِّ مُحَمَّد صَفِیِّکَ، وَاِبْراهِیمَ نَجْلِ نَبِیِّکَ،اَنْ تَجْعَلَ سَعْیى بِهِمْ مَشْکُوراً، وَذَنْبى بِهِمْ مَغْفُوراً، وَحَیاتى بِهِمْ سَعیدَةً، وَعاقِبَتى بِهِمْ حَمیدَةً، وَحَوآئِجى بِهِمْ مَقْضِیَّةً، آمینَ رَبَّ الْعالَمینَ.

Assalaamo alaa rasoolillaahe, assalaamo alaa nabiyyillaahe, assalaamo alaa muhammadibne abdillaahe, sayyadil anbiyaae wa khaatemil mursaleena, assalaamo alayka yabna nabiyyil mujtabee, assalaamo alayka yabnal mab’uthe ilaa kaaffatil waree, assalaamo alayka yabnal basheere an-nadheere, assalaamo alayka yabna as siraajil muneere, assalaamo yabnal moayyade bil quraane, allaahumma inni as’aloka be haqqin muhammada safiyyeka, wa ibraahima najle nabiyyeka,ann taj’ala sa’a-yee behim mashkuran, wa dhanbi behim maghfuran,wa hayaati behim saeedatan, wa aaqebati behim hamidatan, wa hawaaejee behim maqdhiyyatan, aameena rabbal aalameena.

Peace be upon the Messenger of Allah! Peace be upon the Prophet of Allah! Peace be upon the beloved one of Allah! Peace be upon the Chosen one of Allah! Peace be upon the Confidant of Allah! Peace be upon Muhammad Bin Abdullah, the leader of Prophets and seal of Messengers. Peace be upon you, O the son of the selected prophet! Peace be upon you, O the son of one who is sent to whole creatures. Peace be upon you, O the son of the bearer of glad tidings and the warner. Peace be upon the son of bright lamp. Peace be upon you, O the son one corroborated by Quran! O Allah, I beseech You by the right of Muhammad, Your Chosen one, and that of Abrahim, the son of Your prophet, make my this visit of them accredited to You, pardon my sins, make my life graceful, make my end brilliant and fulfil my desires because of them. So it be ! O the Benefactor of the worlds.

I) Othman ibn Madhoun

He was one of the companions of the Prophet (S) and was among the first converts to Islam. He was a very pious man, for whom the Prophet (S) and Imam Ali (A) had much admiration. Imam Ali (A) called one of his children 'Uthman' by thought for him. The Prophet (S) went to the cemetery to do his ziyarat. He died in the year 2 of the Hijra.130

He was the first of the muhajiruns131 buried in Baqi. Ibrahim the son of the Prophet (S) is buried next to him.

Ziyarat :

اَلسَّلامُ عَلى رَسُولِ اللهِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ اللهِ خاتَمِ النَّبِيّينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى اَميرِ الْمُؤْمِنينَ سَيِّدِ الْوَصِيّينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَى الْاَئِمَّةِ الْمَعْصُومينَ الرّاشِدينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلـَى الْمَلائِكَةِ الْمُقَرَّبينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ يا صاحِبَ رَسُولِ اللهِ الْاَمينِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ يا مُودَعَ اَسْرارِ السّادَةِ الْمَيامينِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ يا مَنْ اُوتِیَ الْعِلْمَ بِاَسْمَاءِ الْمُنَافِقِینَ، اَشْهَدُ اَنَّکَ اَطَعْتَ اللهَ كَما اَمَرَکَ، وَاتَّبَعْتَ الرَّسُولَ كَما نَدَبَکَ، وَتَوَلَّيْتَ خَليفَتَهُ كَما اَلْزَمَکَ، وَدَعَوْتَ اِلَى الْاِهْتِمامِ بِذُرِّيَّتِهِ كَما وَقَفَکَ، وَعَلِمْتَ الْحَقَّ يَقيناً وَاعْتَمَدْتَهُ، كَما اَمَرَکَ، وَاَقَمْتَ الصَّلاةَ، وَ آتَيْتَ الزَّكاةَ، وَ اَمَرْتَ بِالْمَعْرُوفِ، وَنَهَيْتَ عَنِ الْمُنْكَرِ، وَاَدَّيْتَ الْاَمانَةَ، وَنَصَحْتَ لِلهِ وَلِرَسُولِهِ، صَلَّى اللهُ عَلى رُوحِکَ الطَّيِّبِ، وَ جَسَدِکَ الطّاهِرِ، وَاَلْحَقَنا بِکَ وَبِمَحَلَّةِ السّادَةِ الْمَيامينِ، وَجَمَعَنا مَعَهُمْ بِجِوارِهِمْ فى جَنّاتِ النَّعيِمِ، وَلا جَعَلَهُ اللهُ آخِرَ الْعَهْدِ مِنَّا لِزِیَارَتِکَ والسَّلامُ وَرَحْمَةُ اللهِ وَبَرَكاتُهُ.

Assalaamo alaa rasoolilaahe muhammadibne abdillaahe khaatamin nabiyyin, assalaamo alaa ameeril momineena sayyadil wasiyyina, assalaamo alal aimmatil ma’a-soomina ar raashedina, assalaamo alaa al malaaekatil muqarrabina, assalaamo a’layka yaa saaheba rasoolillaahil ameene,assalaamo alayka yaa moda’a asraaris saadatil mayaameene, assalaamo alayka yaa man uteya al ilme be asmaail munaafeqina, ash-hado annaka ata’a-tallaaha kamaa amaraka, wat-taba’atar rasoola kamaa nadabaka watawallayta khalifatahu kamaa al zamaka, wada’awta ilal ehtimaame be dhurriyatehi kamaa wa qafaka, wa alimtal haqqa yaqeenan wa’atamad’tahu, kamaa amraka, wa aqamtas salaata, wa aataytaz zakaata, wa amratal bil ma’a-roofe, wa nahayta anal munkare, wa addayatal amaanata, wa nasahta lillaahe wa le rasoolehi, sallallaaho alaa rooheka at-tayyebe, wa jasadeka at-taahere, wa alhaqanaa beka wa be mahallatis saadate al mayaamine, wa jama’anaa ma’ahum be jiwwaarehim fee jannatin naeeme, wa laa ja’alahullaaho aakhiral ahde minnaa ziyaarateka wassalaamo wa rahmatullaahe wa barakaatohu.

Peace be upon the Messenger of Allah Muhammad bin Abdullah, the Seal of the Prophets. Peace be upon the Emir of believers and the master of successors! Peace be upon the guided, infallible imams. Peace be upon the angels, close to Allah, peace be upon you the companion of the faithful messenger of Allah. Peace be upon you who is given the secrets of gentlemen. Peace be upon you who knew the names of hypocrites. I bear witness that you obeyed Allah as He commanded you and followed the Prophet as he asked you and showed loyalty to his successor as he took promise from you and you called people as your duty towards the significance of his progeny and you recognized the right (path) with surety and trusted upon it as you were required. You offered the prayers, gave alms (zakat), you enjoined the right, forbade the wrong, and did your duty, advised for Allah and His prophet. Peace be upon your pure soul and body. May Allah join us with you and gentle leaders by his mercy and sympathy and gather us with them in their neighborhood in the gardens of blessings. May Allah not decide this time of our visit to be the last! Peace, mercy and blessing of Allah be upon you!

m) Halimah al-Sa 'diyah (the nurse of the Prophet (S))

She was the nursing mother of the Prophet (S) until the age of 4 years. Halima after giving milk to the Prophet (S) saw the blessing come in her life. The Prophet (S) greatly respected Halima and helped her a lot too. Sometimes when Halima came, the Prophet (S) put down his cloak on the floor for her to sit down. She died in Ramadan in year 8 of the Hijra.132

Ziyarat :

اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا أُمَّ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا أُمَّ صَفِيِ اللَّهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا أُمَّ حَبِيبِ اللَّهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا أُمَّ الْمُصْطَفى‏، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا مُرْضِعَةَ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا حَلِيمَةَ السَّعْدِيَّةِ، فَرَضِيَ اللَّهُ تَعالى‏ عَنْكِ وَأَرْضاكِ، وَجَعَلَ الْجَنَّةَ مَنْزِلَكِ وَمَأْواكِ، وَرَحْمَةُ اللَّهِ وَبَرَكاتُهُ.

Assalaamo alayke yaa umma rasoolillaahe, assalaamo alayke yaa umma safiyllaahe, assalaamo alayke yaa umma habibillaahe, assalaamo alayke yaa ummal mustafee, assalaamo alayke murdheata rasoolillaahe, assalaamo alayke yaa haleemata as sa’adiyyate, faradheyallaaho taaali anke wa ardhaake, wa ja’ala al-jannata manzilake wa maawaake, warahmatullaahe wabarakatohu

Peace be upon you, O the mother of the Messenger of Allah! Peace be upon you, O the mother of the Chosen one of Allah! Peace be upon you, O the mother of the beloved one of Allah! Peace be upon you, O the mother of the Preferred one! Peace be upon you, O the foster of the Messenger of Allah! Peace be upon you, O Halima Sadiya, May Allah be pleased with you and make you contented and make the paradise your house and abode! Mercy and blessings of Allah be upon you !

n) The martyrs of Uhud

In the year 3 of the Hijra, the battle of Uhud took place. Some martyrs were buried directly at the battle site. And some who were wounded were brought to Medina, but unfortunately they did not survive and were buried in the Baqi cemetery.133

Ziyarat :

السَّلامُ عَلَيْكُمْ یا شُهَدَاءُ یا سُعَداءُ یا نُجَباءُ یا نُقَباءُ یا أَهْلَ الصِّدْقِ وَالْوَفاءِ، السَّلامُ عَلَيْكُمْ یا مُجاهِدُونَ فِی سَبِیلِ الِلّهِ حَقَّ جِهادِهِ، السَّلامُ عَلَيْكُمْ بِمَا صَبَرْتُمْ فَنِعْمَ عُقْبَى الدَّارِ، السَّلامُ عَلَيْكُمْ یا شُهَدَاءُ کافَّةً عامَّةً وَ رَحْمَةُ اللّهِ وَ بَرَکاتُهُ

Assalaamo a’laykum yaa shohdaa’o yaa soadaa’o yaa nojabaa’o yaa noqabaa’o yaa ahla as sidqe wal wafaae, assalaamo alaykum yaa mojaaheduna fee sabeelillaahe haqqa jehaadehi, assalaamo alaykum bemaa sabartum fane’a-ma uqabeed daare, assalaamo a’laykum shohadaa’o kaaffata aammata wa rahmatullaahe wa barakaatohu.

Peace be upon you, O the martyrs, the dignified, the nobles, the supporters of the truth and faithfulness. Peace be upon you, O who fought for the sake of Allah, as it ought to be. Peace be upon you for the patience which you have exercised for, what a wonderful abode that is! Peace, mercy and blessings of Allah be upon you, O all the martyrs of the general public.

o) Ismail ibn Ja'far as-Sadiq (A)

Ismail was the eldest son of Imam as-Sadiq (A). He died in the year 143 of the Hijra. His father was still alive when he died.134

Ziyarat :

اَلسَّلامُ عَلى‏ جَدِّكَ الْمُصْطَفى‏، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى‏ أَبِيكَ الْمُرتَضَى الرِّضا، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَى السَّيِدَيْنِ الْحَسَنِ وَ الْحُسَينِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى‏ خَدِيجَةَ أُمِ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ أُمِ سَيِّدَةِ نِساءِ الْعالَمِينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى‏ فاطِمَةَ أُمِ الْأَئِمَّةِ الطَّاهِرِينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَى النُّفُوسِ الْفاخِرَةِ، بُحُورِ الْعُلُومِ الزَّاخِرَةِ، شُفَعائِي فِي الْآخِرَةِ، وَ أَوْلِيائِي عِنْدَ عَوْدِ الرُّوحِ إِلَى الْعِظامِ النَّخِرَةِ، أَئِمَّةِ الْخَلْقِ وَوُلاةِ الْحَقِّ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ أَيُّهَا الشَّخْصُ الشَّريِفُ، الطَّاهِرُ الْكَرِيمُ، أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لا إِلهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ، وَأَنَّ مُحَمَّداً عَبْدُهُ وَمُصْطَفاهُ، وَأَنَّ عَلِيّاً وَلِيُّهُ وَمُجْتَباهُ، وَأَنَّ الْإِمامَةَ فِي وُلْدِهِ إِلى‏ يَوْمِ الدِّينِ، نَعْلَمُ ذلِكَ عِلْمَ الْيَقِينِ، وَنَحْنُ لِذلِكَ مُعْتَقِدُونَ، وَفِي نَصْرِهِمْ مُجْتَهِدُونَ.

Assalaamo alaa jaddekal mustafee, assalaamo alaa aabaayekal murtadhaa redhaa, assalaamo alaa sayyedinal hasane wal husayne, assalaamo alaa khadijata ummil momineena umme sayyedate nesaail aalamina, assalaamo alaa faatemata ummil aimmatit taaherina, assalaamo alan nofusil faakherate, bohuril olumij jaakherate, shofa’aayee, feel jaakherate, a’immatil khalqe wa wulaatil haqqin, assalaamo a’layka ayyohash shakhso ash-shareefo, at-taaherul kareemo, ash-hado ann laa elaaha illallaaho wa anna muhammadan abdohu wa mustafaaho, wa anna aliyyan waliyyohu wa mujatabaaho, wa annal imaamata fee wuldehi ilaa yawmid deene,na’a-lamo zaaleka ilmal yaqeene,wa nahno le zaaleka mu’a-taqduna, wa fee nasrehim mujtahedoun.

Peace be upon your grandfather Mustafa! Peace be upon your father Murtaza Al- Reza! Peace be upon the masters, Hasan and Hussain. Peace be upon Khadija the mother of the leader of women of all worlds. Peace be upon Fatima mother of immaculate Imams! Peace be upon the gratified souls, the deep oceans of knowledge and my intercessors on Doomsday, my powers when the spirit returns to bones, (you are) Imams of creatures and powers of righteousness. Peace be upon you the honest, pure and gracious soul. I bear witness that there is no God but Allah, and that Muhammad is his servant and his choice. Ali is his representative and selected and Imamat is in his family till Doomsday. We know that for sure and we have firm faith in it and we struggle to assist them.

p) Hazrat Ummul Baneen (A) (the mother of Hazrat Abbas (A))

She was born around the year 5 of the Hijra, her name was Fatima (A), but after being married to Imam Ali (A), she was known as Ummul Banine (the mother of boys).

Imam Ali (A) asked his brother Aqil to choose a woman whose ancestors were known for their bravery and courage, and as his brother specialized in genealogy, he advised Fatima bint Kouzam (Ummul Baneen (A)).

When Hazrat Ummul Baneen (A) came to Imam Ali (A), she told the children of Imam Ali (A), 'I am not your mother, but your servant. Do not consider me superior, I will sacrifice all that I have for you and if Allah gives me children, I will dedicate them to you.'

She later had 4 children who all fell martyrs in Karbala : Hazrate Abbas (A), Abdullah, Ja'far and Uthman. She did not remarry after the death of Imam Ali (A), it shows the immense respect she had for him. She was yet young and had requests. She left this world during the month of Jamadi-ul-Akhir in the year 64 AH.135

Ziyarat :

اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا زَوْجَةَ وَلِيِ اللَّهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا زَوْجَةَ أَمِيرِ المُؤْمِنِينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا أُمَّ الْبَنِينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا أُمَّ الْعَبَّاسِ بْنِ أَمِيرِ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلِيِّ بْنِ أَبِي طالِبٍ، رَضِيَ اللَّهُ تَعالى‏ عَنْكِ، وَجَعَلَ الجَنَّةَ مَنْزِلَكِ وَمَأْواكِ، وَرَحْمَةُ اللَّهِ وَبَرَكاتُهُ.

Assalaamo alayke yaa zawjata wa liyillaahe, assalaamo alayke yaa zawjata ameeril momineena, assalaamo alayke yaa ummal baneena, assalaamo alayke yaa ummal abbaas ibne ameeril momineena aliy ibne abi taalebin, raziyallaaho ta’aalee anke, wa ja’ala jannata manzelake wa mawaalake, wa rahmatullaahe wa barakaatohu.

Peace be upon you, O the spouse of Allah’s representative! Peace be upon you, O the spouse of Emir of believers! Peace be upon you, O the mother of sons! Peace be upon you, O the mother of Abbas Bin Emir of believers Ali Bin Abu Talib. May Allah be pleased with you and make paradise your house and abode! Mercy and blessings of Allah be upon you !

q) Safia and Atika (the aunts of the Prophet (S))

Safia and Atika are the daughters of Abdul Muttalib (A), and the aunts of the Prophet (S), Hazrat Hamza was their brother.136

Ziyarat :

اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكُما يا عَمَّتَيْ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكُما يا عَمَّتَيْ نَبِيِ اللَّهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكُما يا عَمَّتَيْ حَبِيبِ اللَّهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكُما يا عَمَّتَيِ الْمُصْطَفى‏، رَضِيَ اللَّهُ تَعالى‏ عَنْكُما وَجَعَلَ الجَنَّةَ مَنْزِلَكُما وَرَحْمَةُ اللَّهِ وَبَرَكاتُهُ.

Assalaamo alaykomaa yaa ammatee rasoolillaahe, assalaamo alaykoma yaa ammatil mustafee raziyalllaaho ta’aalee ankomaa waja’ala jannata manzelakomaa wa rahmatullaahe wa barakaatohu.

Peace be upon both of you, O the aunts of the Messenger of Allah! Peace be upon both of you, O the aunts of the Prophet of Allah! Peace be upon both of you, O the aunts of the beloved one of Allah! Peace be upon both of you, O the aunts of the Chosen one. May Allah be pleased with both of you and make paradise your abode! Mercy and blessings of Allah be upon you both !

r) The martyrs of Harrah

The battle of Harrah took place at the end of Zilhajj in the year 63 AH, two years after the martyrdom of Imam Hussein (A). The battle of Harrah took place inside the city of Medina. The people of Medina rebelled against Yazid for killing Imam Hussein (A) and Yazid's army looted the entire city of Medina for three days. Many people were slaughtered, including infants. They were also raped and many companions of the Prophet (S) died. Nearly 4,000 people were reportedly killed at the Harrah event. They are all buried in the cemetery of Baqi.137

Ziyarat :

السَّلامُ عَلَيْكُمْ یا شُهَدَاءُ یا سُعَداءُ یا نُجَباءُ یا نُقَباءُ یا أَهْلَ الصِّدْقِ وَالْوَفاءِ، السَّلامُ عَلَيْكُمْ یا مُجاهِدُونَ فِی سَبِیلِ الِلّهِ حَقَّ جِهادِهِ، السَّلامُ عَلَيْكُمْ بِمَا صَبَرْتُمْ فَنِعْمَ عُقْبَى الدَّارِ، السَّلامُ عَلَيْكُمْ یا شُهَدَاءُ کافَّةً عامَّةً وَ رَحْمَةُ اللّهِ وَ بَرَکاتُهُ

Assalaamo alaykum yaa shohadaa’o yaa so’adaao yaa nojabaa’o yaa nuqabaa’o yaa ahla as-siddqe wal wafaae, assalaamo alaykum yaa mojaaheduna fee sabilillaahe haqqan jehaadehi, assalaamo alaykuma bemaa sabartum fane’a-ma uqbeed daare, assalaamo alaykum yaa shohadaa’o kaaffatan aammatan wa rahmatullaahe wa barakaatohu.

Peace be upon you, O the martyrs, the dignified, the nobles, the supporters of the truth and faithfulness. Peace be upon you, O who fought for the sake of Allah, as it ought to be. Peace be upon you for the patience which you have exercised for, what a wonderful abode that is! Peace, mercy and blessings of Allah be upon you, O all the martyrs of the general public.

Uhud Mountain is 6km from Medina. The battle of Uhud which took place against the polytheists of Mecca took place in year 3 of the Hijra. 70 companions of the Prophet (S) fell martyrs, and among them Hazrat Hamza ibn Abdul Muttalib (A).

Hazrat Hamza was the paternal uncle of the Prophet (S) and was 2 years older than him. They were raised and breastfed by the same nurse, they are considered "milk brothers". Hamza was among the protectors of the Prophet (S) and strongly supported him. He was among the first Muslims. He was well known and above all highly respected by the Quraysh tribe. He was assassinated on 15 Shawwal in year 3 of the Hijra during the battle of Uhud by an Ethiopian slave named Wahshi. He was 58 years old. Hamza was an excellent fighter on the battlefield and a formidable warrior.138

It is recommended to the pilgrim to visit the martyrs of Uhud because the Prophet (S) visited them as well as his daughter Fatima az-Zahra (A) who visited them every Thursday and prayed for them. The Prophet (S) mentions the importance of Hazrate Hamza's visit by saying, 'Anyone who visits me but does not visit my uncle Hamza persecutes me.'

Ziyarat :

اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا عَمَّ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ، صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَآلِهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا خَيْرَ الشُّهَداءِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا أَسَدَ اللَّهِ وَأَسَدَ رَسُولِهِ، أَشْهَدُ أَنَّكَ قَدْ جاهَدْتَ فِي اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَجَلَّ، وَجُدْتَ بِنَفْسِكَ، وَنَصَحْتَ رَسُولَ اللَّهِ، وَكُنْتَ فِيما عِنْدَ اللَّهِ سُبْحانَهُ راغِباً، بِأَبِي أَنْتَ وَأُمِي، أَتَيْتُكَ مُتَقَرِّباً إِلَى اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَجَلَّ بِزِيارَتِكَ، وَمُتَقَرِّباً إِلى‏ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَآلِهِ بِذلِكَ، راغِباً إِلَيْكَ فِي الشَّفاعَةِ، أَبْتَغِي بِزِيارَتِكَ خَلاصَ نَفْسِي مُتَعَوِّذاً بِكَ مِنْ نارٍ اسْتَحَقَّها مِثْلِي بِما جَنَيْتُ عَلى‏ نَفْسِي، هارِباً مِنْ ذُنُوبِيَ الَّتِي احْتَطَبْتُها عَلى‏ ظَهْرِي، فَزِعاً إِلَيْكَ رَجاءَ رَحْمَةِ رَبِي، أَتَيْتُكَ مِنْ شُقَّةٍ بَعِيدَةٍ، طالِباً فَكاكَ رَقَبَتِي مِنَ النَّارِ، وَقَدْ أَوْقَرَتْ ظَهْرِي‏ ذُنُوبِي، وَأَتَيْتُ ما أَسْخَطَ رَبِي، وَلَمْ أَجِدْ أَحَداً أَفْزَعُ إِلَيْهِ خَيْراً لِي مِنْكُمْ أَهْلَ بَيْتِ الرَّحْمَةِ، فَكُنْ لِي شَفِيعاً يَوْمَ فَقْرِي وَحاجَتِي، فَقَدْ سِرْتُ إِلَيْكَ مَحْزُوناً، وَأَتَيْتُكَ مَكْرُوباً، وَسَكَبْتُ عَبْرَتِي عِنْدَكَ باكِياً، وَصِرْتُ إِلَيْكَ مُفْرِداً، وَأَنْتَ مِمَّنْ أَمَرَنِيَ اللَّهُ بِصِلَتِهِ، وَحَثَّنِي عَلى‏ بِرِّهِ، وَدَلَّنِي عَلى‏ فَضْلِهِ، وَهَدانِي لِحُبِهِ، وَرَغَّبَنِي فِي الْوِفادَةِ إِلَيْهِ، وَأَلْهَمَنِي طَلَبَ الْحَوائِجِ عِنْدَهُ، أَنْتُمْ أَهْلُ بَيْتٍ لا يَشْقى‏ مَنْ تَوَلّاكُمْ، وَلايَخِيبُ مَنْ أَتاكُمْ، وَلا يَخْسَرُ مَنْ يَهْواكُمْ، وَلا يَسْعَدُ مَنْ عاداكُمْ.

Assalaamo a’layka yaa amma rasoolilaahe, sallallaaho alayhe wa aalehi, assalaamo a’layka yaa khayrash shohdaa’e, assalaamo a’layka yaa asadallaahe wa asada rasoolehi, ash-hado annaka qad jaa’hadta feellaahe azza wa jalla, wa judta, be nafseka, wa nasah’ta rasoolalaahe, wa kunta feema indal'laahe subhaanahu raagheban, be abee anta wa ummi, a’taytoka mutaqarreban elallahe azza wa jalla be ziyaratek waa motaqarreban ela rasoolillaahe sallallaaho alayhe wa aalehi be dhaaleka, raagheban elayka fee shafaa’ate, abt'ghee be ziyaarateka khalasa nafsee mota'awwedhan beka min naaris tahaqqahaa mithlee bemaa janayto, alaa nafsee, haareban min dhonubiyal latee ah-tabtohaa alaa dhahree, fazeann elayka rajaa’a rahmate rabee, aataytoka min shuqqatin ba’idatin, taalebal fakaaka raqabati menannaare, wa qad awqarat dhahree dhonubee, wa atayto maa askhata rabee, wa lam ajid ahadan afza’o, elayhe khayran lee minkum ahlabaytir rahmate, fakun lee shafeean yawma faqreya wa haa jatee, faqad sirto elayka mahzenaa wa ataytok makruba wa sakabto ab ratee indak bakeyaa wa sirtoo elayek mufaridan wa anta mim'man amaraneel laaho be silatehi, wa hatthayni alaa birrehi, wa dallani alaa fadhlehi, wa hadaani, le hubehi, wa ragghabaniee feel wefaadate ilayhe, wa al-hamani talabal hawaaeje indahu, antum ahlobaytin laa yashqee man tawallaakum, walaa yajeebo man ataakum, wa laa yakheebo man ataakum, wa laa yakhsaru man yahwaakum, wa laa yas’adu man aadaakum.

Peace be upon you O uncle of the Prophet of Allah peace be upon him and his progeny! Peace be upon you O the best of martyrs! Peace be upon you, O lion of Allah and His Prophet. I bear witness that you fought for the sake of Allah, the Most Honorable and Magnificent and you exerted yourself and counseled the Prophet of Allah and desired (the rewards) available through Allah, the Most Glorious. May my father and mother be sacrificed for you, I have come to you seeking closeness to Allah, the Most Honorable and Magnificent, by visiting you and seeking nearness to the Prophet of Allah, peace be upon him and his progeny; through that desiring from (your) intercession; seeking from my visit of you the freedom of myself and seeking refuge, through you, from the fire; those like me deserve it for the wrong I have done to myself. (I come) fleeing from my sins which I have committed; seeking refuge of you hoping for the mercy of My Lord. I have come to you from a remote land seeking the freedom from the fire as my back is loaded with my sins. I have committed what rages my Lord. I did not find anyone more worthy to flee to than you, the Ahl-e-Bayt of mercy, so be my intercessors on the day of my poverty and need. I have traveled to you in a sad state and in distress. I shed tears in front of you, I have come to you lonely; you are amongst those whom Allah has commanded to join with and has urged me towards piety and guided me to His grace and love; He urged me to come to you and inspired me to ask my needs to Him; You are the Ahl-e-Bayt, no one who befriends you is miserable; one who comes to you is not disappointed and one who is inclines towards you does not lose, one who shows enmity towards you does not remain happy.

children.name: 8) Amina bint Wahb (the mother of the Prophet (S))

text.html:
Address in Arabic to facilitate your movements :

على طريق الهجرة القديم بين مكة والمدينة تقع تلة جبلية شهيرة يتوسد قمتها قبر معروف طوال قرون، ظل المتعارف عليه بين الناس بأنه ترقد فيه السيدة آمنة بنت وهب أم النبي محمد عليه السلام

Amina Bint Wahb is the mother of the Prophet (S). While carrying the Prophet (S), her husband Abdullah ibn Abdul Moutallib died during a trip shortly after their union. After the death of her husband, she lived with Abdoul Mouttalib (A). One day, she asked her father-in-law's permission to take her son Mohammad (S) who was only 6 years old to see his father's grave. When their journey ended on the return from Medina to Mecca, she fell seriously ill and died, seven years after the year of the Elephant at the age of thirty. She was buried in Abwa, 45 km from Medina.139

139: Ba ham be Hajj wa oumre, page 121

Address in Arabic to facilitate your movements :

یقع المسجد قباء الی الجنوب من المدينة المنوره

When the Prophet (S) migrated from Mecca to Medina, he left Mecca the 1st Rabbi-ul-Awwal and he stopped in a suburb called 'Quba’ about 3 km south of Medina on the 12th Rabbi-ul-Awwal of the Hijra.
The Holy Prophet (S) stayed 4 days in Quba and the first mosque of Islam was erected there. He transported the stones and the sand for the construction with his followers. The Prophet (S) said, 'The one who makes the prayer at the Quba Mosque will have the reward of 1 Umrah.'140 This mosque was a very important place in the eyes of the Prophet (S). He came there once a week to pray.141

140: Wasail al-Shia, volume 10 , page 278

children.name: 10) The Mashrabah of Um Ibrahim (the tomb of Maria al-Qibtiyya and Najma khatoun)

text.html:
This place is next to the Masjid-e-Quba. Mashrabah means 'garden'. Maria al-Qibtiyya, one of the wives of the Prophet (S) lived there and gave birth to Ibrahim son of the Prophet (S). The Prophet (S) came and prayed in this place. This place is known as Mashrabah of Um Ibrahim.142

a) Maria al-Qibtiyya

She was the mother of Ibrahim, the son of the Prophet (S) who died in infancy. Maria died during the month of Moharam in the year 16 AH.143

b) Najma khatoun

She was the wife of Imam al-Kadhim (A) and the mother of Imam ar-Redha (A) and Hazrate Masuma-e-Qom (A). We do not have the exact date of her death in history.144

children.name: 11) The mosque of the two Qiblas (Masjid al-Qiblatain)

text.html:
Address in Arabic to facilitate your movements :

مسجد القبلتين في منطقة بني سَلِمَهْ على هضاب حرة الوبرة في الطريق الشمالي الغربي للمدينة المنورة. وتحديداً على طريق خالد بن الوليد وتقاطعه مع شارع سلطانة (المركز التجاري في المدينة المنورة)

Masjid al-Qiblatain is 4 km from Masjidun Nabawi. The Prophet (S) prayed at Masjid al-Aqsa (Jerusalem) for 17 months and one day when he began the dhohr prayer, Jibrail arrived with the verse for the change of Qibla and turned the face of the Prophet (S) to the Kaaba : « We often see you face upwards ; we will orient you towards a Qibla that will please you. Turn your face in the direction of the Holy Mosque. Wherever you are, turn your face in its direction.»145

It is recommended to pray 2 raka'ats.

145: Qu’ran , Chapter 2 , verse 144 ; Ba ham be Hajj wa oumre , page 109

Address in Arabic to facilitate your movements :

مَسجد الإجابة يقع بالمدينة المنورة الى الشمال من مقبرة البقيع ويعرف أيضا باسم (مسجد بني معاوية) أو (مسجد المباهلة)

This masjid is located 300m from Masjidun Nabavi. He is also known as Masjid al-Mubahalah.

He is called Masjid al-Ijabah because one day, in this masjid, the Prophet (S) prolonged his prostration considerably. When he arose, people asked why all this time, he replied: 'I asked Allah for three wishes, two of which were granted : the first wish that was granted was that my community should not perish in famine. And in drought ; the second vow that was granted is that my community can not drown at sea ; the third wish was that the people of my community should not quarrel with each other, but this was not granted.'

This mosque was called Masjid al-Ijabah because of the acceptance of the two wishes of the Prophet (S).146

This masjid is also known as 'Masjid al-Mubahalah' because in the year 10 of the Hijra, a Christian delegation from Najran came to Medina to discuss with the Prophet (S) and try to contradict him. So, Allah commanded His Messenger (S), in verse 64 of Surah Al-Imran, to call Imam Ali (A), Hazrat Fatima (A), Imam Hassan (A), and Imam Hussein (A) to go with them in the valley. Christians were also asked to summon their sons and wives to come with them, and to pray to Allah to bring down the curse on the liars of the two parties. It was the day of 24 Zilhajj.147

It is recommended to pray 2 raka'ats.

146: Ba ham be Hajj wa oumre , page 110-111
147: Tarikhe madinatoul mounawarra , volume 1 , page 67

Address in Arabic to facilitate your movements :

يقع هذا المسجد في الجهة الشمالية للمسجد النبوي على بعد 900 متر منه ، عند إلتقاء شارع أبي ذر رضي الله عنه بشارع المطار بجانب محطة النقل الجماعی

This masjid is located 500 m from Masjidun Nabavi. It is known as Masjid-e-Abu Dhar because the alley is in the name of Abu Dhar. It is also known as masjid-e-Buhayr, because before there was a garden of that name nearby, and it is also known as masjid-e-Sajda because one day, in this place, the Prophet (S) prolonged his prostration, and the angel Gabriel appeared and said to him : 'Whoever will do the salawat on you, Allah will send 10 salawat on him.148

It is recommended to pray 2 raka'ats.

148: Ba ham be Hajj wa oumre , page 112

Address in Arabic to facilitate your movements :

The Masjid-e-Ghamama is at exit number 6 of Masjid-e-Nabavi and is 20m from the exit.

يقع مسجد الغمامة في الجهة الغربية الجنوبية للمسجد النبوي الشريف على بعد 500م من باب السلام

This masjid is located 500 m southwest of Masjidun Nabavi. When the Prophet (S) arrived in Medina, he celebrated his first prayer of eid in this masjid, and after the prayer he asked for the rain that fell immediately.149

It is recommended to pray 2 raka'ats

149: Ba ham be Hajj wa oumre , page 113

Qum is the oldest Shiite city in Iran. It was conquered in year 23 AH by an army of Arab Muslims led by Abu Musa Ach'ari.

Nearly 6,000 members of the Ash'ari clan settled in Qum in year 93 AH.

The Ash'ari were originally from Hijaz (western region of the Arabian Peninsula) and settled in Kufa.

The Ash'ari were from the beginning of the Twelver Shiites, and had contacts with the descendants of Imam Ali (A).

By taking control of the city of Qum, they made it a refuge for the descendants and followers of Imam (A).

Qum became from the middle of the 2nd century AH an important center of Shiite theology.

Before this period, Iran was predominantly Sunni, only the inhabitants of some regions in Iran were Shiites.

Qum is a center of Shia teaching from Imam as-Sadiq (A). Many Hadith scholars in the 2nd and 3rd centuries AH were native to Qum or lived there.

It was around the middle of the 2nd century AH that the Shiite school of theology of Qum, by its importance, preceded the school of Kufa.

The mausoleum of Imam ar-Redha (A) in Iran, in the year 200 AH, and the burial of his sister Hazrat Fatima Ma’suma, in Qum a year later, made this city a center of learning.1

Hadiths about the importance of the city of Qum :

The Holy Prophet Muhammad (S) said that during his night trip, he saw a dome in the 4th heaven and he asked the angel Gabriel : « I did not see anything better in the 4th heaven ». The angel Gabriel replied, « This is a city called Qum, and the believers will gather there and wait for your intercession on the Day of Judgment. »2

The 6th Imam as-Sadiq (A) said : « When grief and Misfortune comes to you, take refuge in Qum, for Qum is a place of refuge for believers. »3

The 6th Imam as-Sadiq (A) said : « When the trouble and temptation (fitna) take all the cities, go to Qum because Qum pushes and removes the difficulties. »4

The 6th Imam as-Sadiq (A) said : « Qum was called Qum because the people will be companions of the 12th Imam (A) and they will rise up with him. »5
