children.name: The sanctuary of Hazrat Fatima Ma’suma e Qum (A)

text.html:
She was born on the 1st Dhul Qa’dah of year 173 AH. Her mother was Lady Najma Khatoon (A). It was the 8th Imam (A) who gave her the title of Ma’suma e Qum, but her original name is Fatima Kubra (A). The 7th Imam al-Kadhim (A) had 3 daughters, she was the eldest.

In 179 AH, the 7th Imam (A) was imprisoned on the orders of Harun Rashid. Hazrat Ma’suma-e-Qum (A) was then 6 years old. When he died, she took care of by her brother the 8th Imam (A) who was 25 years older than her.

She spent 21 years with the 8th Imam (A) but in the year 200AH, the 8th Imam ar-Redha (A) left Medina for Khorasan (Mashhad, Iran).

Hazrat Ma’suma-e-Qum (A) did not get married because there was no man equal to her at the time and men were very worried about the Abbasid regime.

One year after the departure of the 8th Imam for Khorasan, Hazrat Ma’suma e Qum (A) decides to find her brother and leaves Medina accompanied by 4 other brothers, nephews and nieces.

The welcome was warm from town to town and her caravan stopped in Sava (Iran).

By order of Mamun, caliph of the time and son of Harun, many enemies who had links with the regime of Baghdad barred the road and went to war against her. Her four brothers and 23 other members of the caravan fell as martyrs. Hazrat Fatima Ma’suma (A) fell ill because of this event and she decided to leave Sava for Qum.

When the nobles of the city of Qum heard the news, they all welcomed her. She was welcomed by Musa ibn Khazraj (member of the Ash'ari family) on 23rd Rabi ul-Awal in the year 201 AH.

She spent her last 17 days in Qum in prayer and worship. Her place of prayer called 'Bayt an-Nur' (The House of Light) has today become a place to visit.

She left this world on the 10th or the 12th of Rabi al-Thani 201 AH.

She was buried in the garden of Babylon. Two men with a veiled face came out of the direction of the Qibla at her burial, and after the funeral prayer, one of them entered the Tomb and the other gave him the body. After that, they left without talking to anyone. They were envoys of God : the 8th Imam ar-Redha (A) and the 9th Imam al-Jawad (A).6

6: Al irshad , volume 2 , page 244

children.name: 1- Importance of the Ziyarat of Hazrat Ma’suma e Qum (A)

text.html:
The 6th Imam as-Sadiq (A) said : « A Lady of my family named Fatema will be buried in Qum ; Paradise becomes obligatory on the one who visits her. »7

The 8th Imam ar-Redha (A) said : « The visit of the Tomb of Ma’suma e Qum is similar to the visit of my Tomb. »8

The 9th Imam al-Jawad (A) said : « He who visits my aunt paradise will be granted. »9

7: Nasikh al-Tawarikh, volume 3, page 68
8: Nasikh al-Tawarikh, volume 3, page 68
9: Bihar al-Anwar, volume 102, page 266

children.name: 2- Miracles of Hazrat Ma’suma e Qum (A)

text.html:
The healing of a 2-year-old baby told by a servant of the mausoleum :

« My child was very sick and one night I decided to go see a doctor and leave my wife at home.

Unfortunately, the medical office was already closed and I went to the haram of Bibi Ma’suma e Qum (A). I went to her blessed head and left my child on the floor and told her that she was the one who could heal him.

I told her that I will not come out of this place until she cures my son, and that she can ask Allah to kill me with him if he does not get cured. Moments later, my son got up and walked. I went home immediately with him and told my wife that I had taken our son to a doctor. She asked me for the medicine and I told her the story. My wife cried and told me that she had dreamed of a woman who told her that our child was cured ! ».

The healing of a paralyzed man, told by a servant of the mausoleum :

« I had a loss of mobility and the doctors told me that my illness was intractable, so I had to amputate both legs.

I decided to spend a night at Hazrat Ma’suma e Qum (A). Towards the end of the night, during the closing of the mausoleum, someone accompanied me to the Tomb and I vowed to her.

I then fell asleep and a woman came near me.

She asked me how I was going and with the tip of her veil, she rubbed my feet several times. I asked her name and she said : « Do not you know me ? You are the servant of my mausoleum, and I am Ma’suma e Qum ! ».

At dawn, I woke up and shouted to open the door because she had healed me ! »10

10: Besharatoul Momineen, page 52

a) Idhni Dukhul

(Standing in front of the court and reciting the Idhni Dukhul) :

اَلّلهُمَّ اِنّى وَقَفْتُ عَلى بابٍ مِنْ اَبْوابِ بُيُوتِ نَبِيِّکَ صَلَواتُکَ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ، وَ قَدْ مَنَعْتَ النّاسَ اَنْ يَدْخُلُوآ اِلّا بِاِذْنِهِ، فَقُلْتَ يآ اَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنُوا لا تَدْخُلوُا بُيُوتَ النَّبِىِّ اِلّا اَنْ يُؤْذَنَ لَكُمْ، اَلّلهُمَّ إِنّى اَعْتَقِدُ حُرْمَةَ صاحِبِ هذَا الْمَشْهَدِ الشَّريفِ، فى غَيْبَتِهِ كَمآ اَعْتَقِدُها فى حَضْرَتِهِ، وَاَعْلَمُ اَنَّ رَسُولَکَ وَ خُلَفآئَکَعَلَيْهُمِالسَّلامُ اَحْيآءٌ عِنْدَکَ يُرْزَقُونَ، يَرَوْنَ مَقامى وَ يَسْمَعُونَ كَلامى وَ يَرُدُّونَ سَلامى، وَ اَنَّکَ حَجَبْتَ عَنْ سَمْعى كَلامَهُمْ وَ فَتَحْتَ بابَ فَهْمى بِلَذيذِ مُناجاتِهِمْ، وَ اِنّى اَسْتَأْذِنُکَ يا رَبِّ اَوَّلاً، وَ اَسْتَاْذِنُ رَسُولَکَ صَلَّى‌اللّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ ثانِياً، وَ اَسْتَأْذِنُ خَليفَتَکَ الاْمامَ الْمَفْرُوضَ عَلَىَّ طاعَتُهُ اَلْحُسَيْنَ بْنَ عَلىٍّ عَلَيْهِ السَّلامُ، وَالْمَلائِكَةَ الْمُوَكَّلينَ بِهذِهِ الْبُقْعَةِ الْمُبارَكَةِ ثالِثاً، ءَاَدْخُلُ يا رَسُولَ اللّهِ، ءَاَدْخُلُ يا حُجَّةَ اللّهِ، ءَاَدْخُلُ يا مَلائِكَةَ اللّهِ الْمُقَرَّبينَ الْمُقيمينَ فى هذَا الْمَشْهَدِ، فَاْذَنْ لى يا مَوْلاىَ فِى الدُّخُولِ، اَفْضَلَ مآ اَذِنْتَ لاَحَدٍ مِنْ اَوْلِيآئِکَ، فَاِنْ لَمْ اَكُنْ اَهْلاً لِذلِکَ فَاَنْتَ اَهْلٌ لِذلِکَ.

Allahhumma innee wa qafto alla babinn min abwabe boyute nabiyyeka salawaatoka a’layhe wa alehi, wa qad mana’ta ann-nasa ann yad kholu illa be idhnehi faqulta yaa ayyohal ladhina aamanu laa tad kholu boyutan-nabiyeenn illa ann yu dha na lakum, allahhumma inni aa’ataqedo hurmata sahebe hadha al mash-hade ash-shareefe, fee ghaybatehi kamaa aa’ataqedoha fee hazratehi,wa aa’alamo anna rasoolaka wa kholafaoka alayhome assalaamo ahhyao indaka yurzaqoona,yarawna maqaamee wa yasmaoona kalamee wa yarudduna salamee,wa annaka hajabta ann sam’ee kalamahum wa fatahhta baba fahmi be ladide munajatehim,wa inni astadhenoka yaa rabbe awwalan,wa astadenu rasoolaka sallallaaho a’layhe wa aalehi thaneyan, wa asstadheno khalayafataka al-imamal mafruza alaiyya ta aatohu al-hussaynabna Aliyan alayhissalamo,wal malaaa-ekata al-mowakkalina behadhehi al-buq’aatil mobarakate thalethan, aa adkhulu yaa rasoolallahe, aa adkhulu yaa hujjatallaahe, aa adkhulu yaa malaaa-ekatallahe al-moqarrabina al-muqimeena fee hadha al mash-hade,fa dann lee yaa maulaee feedd-dokhule,afdhala maa adinta laa hadinn min awleyaaa-eka, fa inn lam akun ahlann ledaleka fa anta ahlun le dhaleka.

O Allah, I am standing at the door of one of the houses of Your Prophet; Your peace be upon him and his family. You have prohibited the people from entering his house except by the permission of Your Prophet and You said : “O You who believe do not enter the house of the Prophet unless permitted to do so”. O Allah, I believe in this in his absence just as I believe it in his presence and I know that Your Prophet and Your vicegerents upon whom be peace, are Alive in Your presence, they are being nourished, they see my position and hear my speech and they return my greetings and (I believe) that You have covered my ears from hearing their speech and have opened the door of perception of their secret conversations (with You); I seek Your permission first, O’ my Lord; then I seek the permission of Your Prophet_ peace be upon him and his family_ secondly, and I seek the permission of Your vicegerent, Imam Hussain Bin Ali (A) whose obedience is incumbent upon me and (the permission of) Your angels entrusted over this blessed site thirdly. May I enter, O Prophet of Allah, may I enter O the proof of Allah, may I enter, O angels of Allah who are stationed close to this shrine, so permit me O my master to enter the best of way that You have permitted any of Your friends, if I am not deserving of that then You surely are deserving of that.

b) Ziyarat of Hazrat Ma’suma e Qum (A)

If you arrive at her grave, go to the level of her head, face the Qiblah and say:

Repeat 34 times :

اللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ

Allah O Akbar

Allah Is The Great

Repeat 33 times each of the following litanies :

سُبْحانَ اللَّهِ

Subhaan Allah

Glory Be to Allah

الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ

Alhamdulillah

Praise Be To Allah

Then say :

السَّلامُ عَلَى ادَمَ صِفْوَةِ اللَّهِ
السَّلامُ عَلَى نُوحٍ نَبِيّ اللَّهِ
السَّلامُ عَلَى إِبْراهِيمَ خَلِيلِ اللَّهِ
السَّلامُ عَلَى مُوسَى كَلِيمِ اللَّهِ
السَّلامُ عَلَى عِيسى رُوحِ اللَّهِ
السَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا رَسُولَ اللَّهِ
السَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا خَيْرَ خَلْقِ اللَّهِ
السَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا صَفِيَّ اللَّهِ
السَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا مُحَمَّدَ بْنَ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ خاتَمَ النَّبِيّينَ
السَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا أَمِيرَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ عَلِيَّ بْنَ أَبِي طالِبٍ وَصِيَّ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ
السَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا فاطِمَةُ سَيّدَةَ نِساءِ الْعالَمِينَ
السَّلامُ عَلَيْكُما يا سِبْطَيْ نَبِيّ الرَّحْمَةِ وَسَيّدَيْ شَبابِ أَهْلِ الْجَنَّةِ
السَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا عَلِيَّ بْنَ الْحُسَيْنِ سَيّدَ الْعابدينَ وَقُرَّةَ عَيْنِ النَّاظِرِينَ
السَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا مُحَمَّدَ بْنَ عَلِيّ باقِرَ الْعِلْمِ بَعْدَ النَّبِيّ
السَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا جَعْفَرَ بْنَ مُحَمَّدٍ الصَّادِقَ الْبارَّ الأَمِينَ
السَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا مُوسَى بْنَ جَعْفَرٍ الطَّاهِرَ الطُّهْرَ
السَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا عَلِيَّ بْنَ مُوسَى الرِّضَا الْمُرْتَضَى
السَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا مُحَمَّدَ بْنَ عَلِيّ التَّقِيَّ
السَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا عَلِيَّ بْنَ مُحَمَّدٍ التَّقِيَّ النَّاصِحَ الأَمِينَ
السَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يا حَسَنَ بْنَ عَلِيّ
السَّلامُ عَلَى الْوَصِيّ مِنْ بَعْدِهِ
اللَّهُمَّ صَلّ عَلَى نُورِكَ وَسِراجِكَ وَوَلِيّ وَلِيِّكَ وَوَصِيِّ وَصِيِّكَ وَحُجَّتِكَ عَلَى خَلْقِكَ
السَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا بِنْتَ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ
السَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا بِنْتَ فاطِمَةَ وَخَدِيجَةَ
السَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا بِنْتَ أَمِيرِ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
السَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا بِنْتَ الْحَسَنِ وَالْحُسَيْنِ
السَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا بِنْتَ وَلِيّ اللَّهِ
السَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا أُخْتَ وَلِيِّ اللَّهِ
السَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا عَمَّةَ وَلِيِّ اللَّهِ
السَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا بِنْتَ مُوسَى بْنِ جَعْفَرٍ وَرَحْمَةُ اللَّهِ وَبَرَكاتُهُ السَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ
عَرَّفَ اللَّهُ بَيْنَنا وَبَيْنَكُمْ فِي الْجَنَّةِ وَحَشَرَنا فِي زُمْرَتِكُمْ وَأَوْرَدَنا حَوْضَ نَبِيّكُمْ وَسَقانا بِكَأْسِ جَدِّكُمْ مِنْ يَدِ عَلِيّ بْنِ أَبِي طالِبٍ صَلَواتُ اللَّهِ عَلَيْكُمْ
أَسْأَلُ اللَّهَ أَنْ يُرِيَنا فِيكُمُ السُّرُورَ وَالْفَرَحَ
وَأَنْ يَجْمَعَنا وَإِيَّاكُمْ فِي زُمْرَةِ جَدّكُمْ مُحَمَّدٍ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَآلِهِ وَأَنْ لا يَسُلُبَنا مَعْرِفَتَكُمْ إِنَّهُ وَلِيٌّ قَدِيرٌ
أَتَقَرَّبُ إِلَى اللَّهِ بِحُبّكُمْ وَالْبَرَاءَةِ مِنْ أَعْدائِكُمْ وَالتَّسْلِيمِ إِلَى اللَّهِ راضِياً بِهِ غَيْرَ مُنْكِرٍ وَلا مُسْتَكْبِرٍ وَعَلَى يَقِينِ ما أَتَى بِهِ مُحَمَّدٌ وَبِهِ راضٍ
نَطْلُبُ بِذلِكَ وَجْهَكَ يا سَيّدِي اللَّهُمَّ وَرِضاكَ وَالدَّارَ الآخِرَةَ
يا فاطِمَةُ اشْفَعِي فِي الْجَنَّةِ فَإِنَّ لَكِ عِنْدَ اللَّهِ شَأْناً مِنَ الشَّأْنِ
اللَّهُمَّ إِنّي أَسْأَلُكَ أَنْ تَخْتِمَ لِي بِالسَّعادَةِ فَلا تَسْلُبَ مِنّي ما أَنَا فِيهِ وَلا حَوْلَ وَلا قُوَّةَ إِلاَّ بِاللَّهِ الْعَلِيّ الْعَظِيمِ
اللَّهُمَّ اسْتَجِبْ لَنا وَتَقَبَّلْهُ بِكَرَمِكَ وَعِزَّتِكَ وَبِرَحْمَتِكَ وَعافِيَتِكَ
وَصَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَى مُحَمَّدٍ وَالِهِ أَجْمَعِينَ وَسَلَّمَ تَسْلِيماً يا أَرْحَمَ الرَّاحِمِينَ

Assalaamo a’laa Adama Saf’watillaahe, assalaamo a’laa Noohin Nabiyyilaahe, assalamo a’laa Ibraaheema Khaleelillaahe,assalaamo a’laa Moosaa Kaleemillaahe, asaalamao a’laa E’esaa Roohillahe, assalaamo a’layka yaa Rasoolallahe, assalamo a’layka yaa khayra khaliqillaahe, assalamo a’layka yaa Safeeyallahe, assalaamo a’layka ya Mohammadabna A’b-di-laahe khaatamin nabeeyeena, assalaamo a’layka yaa Ameeral momineenna A’liyyabna abee taalebin wasiyaa rasoolillaahe, assalaamo a’layke yaa Faatemato Sayyedata nesaaa-il a’alameena, assalaamo a’laykomaa yaa sibtay nabiyyir rahmate wa sayyeday shabaabe ahlil jannate, assalaamo a’layka yaa A’liyyabnal Husayne sayyedal A’abedeena wa qurrata a’ynin naazereena, assalaamo a’layka yaa Mohammadabna A’liyyin Baaqeral I’ilme ba’dan nabiyyeena, assalaamo a’layka yaa Ja’-farabna Mohammadenis Saadeqal Baaar-ral ameena, assalaamo a’layka yaa moosabna Ja’-Farin at-taaherat-tuhra, assalaamo a’layka yaa Mohammadabna A’liyyenit Taqiyyo, assalamo a’layka yaa A’liyyabna Mohammadenin Naqiyyan Naasehal Ameena, assalaamo a’layka yaa Hasanab-na A’liyyin, assalaamo a’lal-wasiyye mim ba’dehi, allaahumma sale a’laa norreka wa seraajeka wa walliye waliyyeka wa wasiyye wasiyeka wa hujjateka a’laa khalqeka, assalaamo a’layke yaa binta rassolillaahe, assalaamo a’layke yaa binta Faatemata wa Khadeejata, assalaamo a’layke yaa binta Ameeril momineena, assalaamo a’layke yaa bintal Hassane wal Husayne, assalaamo a’layke yaa binta waliyyillahe, assalaamo a’layke yaa ukhta walliyillaahe, assalaamo a’layke ya a’mmata walliyillahe, assalaamo a’layke yaa binta Moosabna Ja’-farin wa rahmatullaahe wa barakaatohu, assalaamo a’layke a’rrafallaho bay-nanaa wa baynakum fil jannate wa hasharanaa fee zum-ratekum wa aw-radanaa haw-za nabiyyekum wa saqaana beka-se jaddekum miyn-yade A’liyyibne abee Taalebin salawaatullaahe a’laykum as-alullaaha ayn-yoreyanaa feekomus-soroora wal faraja wa ayn-yajma-a’naa wa iyyakum fee zumrate jaddekum Mohammadin sallaallaalho a’laykum wa an laa yaslobanaa ma’-refatekum innahu waliyyun qadeerun, ataqarrabo elallahe be hubbekum wal baraa-ate min aa’-daa-ekum wat-tas leeme elallaahe raazeyan behi ghayra munkerin wa laa mustakberin wa a’laa yaqeene maa ataa behi mohammadin wa behi raazin natlobo bezaaleka Wajhaka yaa sayyedee allaahumma wa rezaaka wad-daaral aakherata yaa Faatema tush fae’e lee fil jannate fa inna lake I’ndallaahe shanaan men ash-shane, allaahumma inee aoka an takhtema lee bis-sa-a’date falaataslub minnee maa anaa feehe wa laa hawla walaa quwwata illaa billaahil A’liyil a’zeeme, allahumaas tajib lanaa wa taqabbalho bekarameka wa I’zzateka wa be rahmateka wa a’afeyateka wa sallal laaho a’laa mohammadin wa aalehi ajmae’ena wa sallama tasleeman yaa arhamar raahemeena.

Allah is the great, Glory be to Allah, Praise be to Allah, Peace be on Adam, the Choice of Allah! Peace be on Noah, the Prophet of Allah, Peace be on Ibraheem, the Friend of Allah, Peace be on Mosa who spoke to Allah, Peace be on Isa, the Spirit of Allah. Peace be on you, O Messenger of Allah, Peace be on you, O the best of the Mankind, Peace be on you, O Choice of Allah! Peace be on you. O Mohammed bin Abdullah, the last of the Prophets! Peace be on you, O Ali bin Abi Talib, Commander of the faithful and the Successor of the Messenger of Allah. Peace be on you, O Fatimah, the Leader of the women of the worlds, peace be on you, O the grandsons of the Prophet of Mercy, and the leaders of the youth of Paradise. Peace be on you, O Ali bin Husain, the leader of worshippers, O Coolness of investigating eyes, peace be on you, O Mohammed bin Ali, O the explorer of the knowledge. Peace be on you, O Jafar bin Mohammed, the truthful the benign, the trustworthy, peace be on you, O Mosa bin Jafar, the pure, the purified, peace be on you, O Ali bin Mosa, the pleased, the gratified, peace be on you, O Mohammed bin Ali, the pious one Peace be on you, O Ali bin Mohammed, the pure, the advising guardian, and the trustworthy peace be on Hasan bin Ali, peace be on the successor after him. O Allah, bless your light, the successor and vicegerent of Thy Messenger and Thy decisive argument over mankind Peace be on you, O daughter of the Messenger of Allah! Peace be on you, O, daughter of Fatimah and Khadeejah! Peace be on you, O, daughter of the Commander of the faithful! Peace be on you, O, daughter of Hasan and Husain! children.name: 4 - Imamzadeh (children of imams) buried in the mausoleum of Hazrat Ma’suma e Qum (A)

text.html:
In Persian, the word 'Imamzadeh' refers to the children or grandchildren of the twelve imams.

'If anyone visits me or visits one of my children on the day of judgment, I will come to visit him and I will save him from the fear, the fear of this day."The prophet"11

Ayatullah Bahjat said that asking for the intercession of Imamzadeh is beneficial. Visiting Imamzadeh is like eating fruit. Each fruit has specific vitamins and each of them has special benefits.

In the Tomb of Hazrat Ma’suma e Qum, there are mostly women such as :

- Maimouna, the daughter of Musa al Mubarak.
- Umm Mohammad, the 9th Imam al-Jawad's granddaughter (A)
- Umm Qassim, the 4th Imam as-Sajjad's granddaughter (A)
- Umm Habiba, the maid of Abu Ali who was the grandson of the 8th Imam ar-Redha (A)
- Umm Ishaq, the servant of Mohammad the son of Musa al Mubarak
- Zaynab,the daughter of the 9th Imam al-Jawad (A), the sister of Musa al Mubarak
- Umm Mohammad, , the daughter of the 9th Imam al-Jawad (A), Sister of Musa al Mubarak
- Maimuna, , the daughter of the 9th Imam al-Jawad (A), the sister of Musa Al Mubarak12

children.name: 5- Tombs of the great scholars buried at the mausoleum of Hazrat Ma’suma e Qum (A)

text.html:
« [...] Only fear [respectfully] God, among His worshipers, scholars. »13

Many great scholars are buried near the grave of Hazrat Ma’suma e Qum (A). We will not be able to quote them all. Here are the most important ones.

a) Allama Tabatabai

Allama Tabatabai comes from a family with great ulemas. It is the fruit of 14 generations of scholars and scholars of Tabriz. He came into the world in this city in 1282 AH and died in Qum in 1360.

He attended primary school in his hometown and at age 22 traveled to Najaf (Iraq). He spent 10 years in a theology center to deepen his religious knowledge. He took courses in fiqh, Islamic dogma and mathematics.

It was in 1314 that Allama Tabatabai returned to Tabriz because his financial situation did not allow him to stay in Najaf. He remained in Tabriz for 11 years and a few months without being able to continue to teach, the necessities of life forcing him to work in agriculture to live.

After the Second World War, Tabriz was plagued by insecurity, killings and looting. That's why Allama Tabatabai decided to go to Qum.

He spent 35 years teaching, training, or writing about religion, philosophy, metaphysics, and other sciences.

One of the successes he achieved in Qum, by the grace of God, was to bring about the revival of the commentary of the Holy Quran. For this purpose he composed the 'Tafsir al Mizan', (the commentary of al Mizan) in Arabic, in 20 volumes.

Allama Tabatabai's pupils adopted his character and knowledge to such an extent that they claimed that if they had not had a teacher like Allama Tabatabai, they would not have reached the degree of piety they had acquired.14

b) Ayatollah Sayed Husayn Burujerdi

He was born in Burujerd in 1292 AH. He specialized in fiqh and studied the laws of all schools of Islamic thought. He studied in Isfahan (Iran) and then in Najaf (Iraq) where he excelled and became one of the masters in the field.

In 1310, at the age of 18, he left for Isfahan, one of the great scientific centers of the time. He benefited from the courses of the great masters of this region, and during the 10 years of his stay he ascended the ladder in the scientific field, and finally, 3 of his teachers authorized him to practice Ijtihad (personal interpretation of the Law from the texts of the Qur'an and Sunnah).

In 1320, he left for the city of Najaf, and presented himself at the courses of the great masters.

He was the only Marja after the death of Ayatollah Isfahani. His students became the ulema leaders in the Islamic government of Iran. Unlike Imam Khomeini who was his pupil, he refrained from entering politics. He died on 13 Shawwal 1381 in Qum.15

c) Ayatollah Mohammad Taqi Behjat Foumani

He was born in 1334 AH in Fouman (Iran). His father Mohamad Karbalai was a trustworthy man and wrote a lot about Imam Hussein (A). His mother died when he was only 16 months old.

He refrained from playing during his childhood and faith was read on his face from an early age.

He studied grammar and literature in Qum. At the age of 14, he went to Karbala and attended Sayed al-Khoi courses for 4 years. He then left Karbala for Najaf where he followed the lessons of Akhund Khorasani.

In 1363, he returned to Qum and attended the Ayatollah Burujerdi courses in fiqh.

At the age of 28, he obtained Ijtihad and decided to stay in Qum despite the many deaths of his teachers in Iraq.

It took a long time for him to spread his book in fiqh because he wanted to promote and highlight other scholars.

According to Imam Khomeini, he was at such a high spiritual level that he had the power and the will to die when he wanted to.

He was fleeing celebrity and he educated many students. At the request of the people, his works were finally published but without the appearance of his name ; it was only after the 6th publication that he decided to put as a signature al-Abd (the servant).16

d) Ayatollah Morteza Motahari

He was born on 12 Jamadi Awal 1338 AH, 75 km from the city of Mashhad in Fariman, north-eastern Iran, in the province of Khorasan.

He was a professor of philosophy and an interpreter of the Qur’an. He was one of the elites of the Republic of Iran.

During his childhood, he did not play. His friends often complained about him and his parents thought he had a mental health problem.

At the age of 5, his knowledge was already apparent and at the age of 12, he went to Qum for a period of 15 years.

He then left Qum for Tehran for teaching and writing. He lived in poverty but never used the right of the 12th Imam (A) (sehme imam).

He lived from his writings and worked in matrimonial offices. He was in the political circle of Imam Khomeini, who loved him very much and listened to him attentively. He went to prison because he spoke ill of the Shah of Iran. He was banned from the Mimbar because of his political speeches and was murdered by a terrorist group after a meeting.

Imam Khomeini went into mourning after his death.17

e) Sayed Rida Baha al-Dini

He was born in the year 1327 AH in Qum. A descendant of the 4th Imam Sajjad (A), he was a jurisconsult and a Gnostic. His father was a servant of the mausoleum of Ma’suma-e-Qum (A).

Sayed Rida's parents Baha al-Dini had a first child who died at the age of 2. Her mother was very saddened by this loss but she still thanked Allah and she asked for another son. Her wish was granted and Sayed Rida was born.

At the age of 25, he obtained Ijtihad. His students were Ayatollah Motahari, Mohammad Fazel Lankarani, Sayed Mostafa Khomeini, Sheikh Abbas Qumi.

He announced his death to his son a week before and told him that Salman and Abu Dharr would come to his funeral.

It is said that one day he passed a grave and stopped to recite a Fatiha Surah.

The buried man suffered a severe punishment but thanks to the prayer of Sayed Rida, his punishment was reduced. He died on 14 Rabiul Awal 1418.18

f) Sayed Shahab al-Din Mar'ashi Najafi

Address in Persian to facilitate your movements :

آدرس . مزار مطهر ایشان نزدییک حضرت معصومه ع در کتابخانه خودشان است . در خیابان ایت الله مرعشی نجفی . این کتابخانه در صد متری حرم فاطمه معصومه در قم قرار دارد

The Tomb of Ayatollah Mar'ashi Najafi is a 3-minute walk from Hazrat Ma’suma e Qum (A) Mausoleum.

He was born in 1315 AH in Najaf and his father was a jurisconsult. His lineage goes back to the 4th Imam, Imam Sajjad (A). He studied in Najaf, Karbala, Kazmain, Samarra, Qum and Tehran.

In 1342, he left Najaf for Iran, and settled in Qum where he taught for 70 years. His students were Sayed Mostafa Khomeini, Nouri Hamadani, Morteza Motahari.

At the age of 27, he got Ijtihad.

After the death of Ayatollah Burujerdi in 1380, he became the only Marja. He was very simple and moved away from materialism, he lived little and gave everything to the poor and the needy. He said nothing belonged to him. He taught in the mausoleum of Hazrat Ma’suma-e-Qum (A) and set up prayer in congregation. He often waited for 1 hour before the beginning of the prayer and continued for 60 years.

He wrote extensively and was at the origin of many cultural works in Qum. He never made the major pilgrimage (Hajj) for lack of means. He never accepted other people's money. His son asked him the reason and he replied that he did not know if their money was legal or not. He said that the money of the 12th Imam (A) should be used where it was needed.

After his death in 1411 at the age of 96, hundreds of people went on pilgrimage on his name. He is buried 100 meters from the mausoleum of Hazrat Ma’suma-e-Qum (A), in his library.

Every Thursday night, he cried for Imam Hussein (A) and kept a handkerchief on him that he took to his grave in hope for intercession (Shafa’a).19

children.name: Imamzadeh (children of Imams) buried in Qum

text.html:
In the city of Qum, there are nearly 450 Imamzadeh. Here is a list of the most important ones.

For the Imamzadeh, Baytan Nour, Khidhr Mountain and Jamkaran Mosque tours, we advise you to follow the following route for ease :

- Imamzadeh Mohammad Sharif
- Imamzadeh Ibrahim and Ahmad
- Imamzadeh Ali and Mohammad
- Bayt an Nour
- Imamzadeh Nassiroudine Ali Ibn Mahdi
- Imamzadeh Hamzah , his father and grandfather
- Imamzadeh Zayd
- Chehel Akhtaran
- Imamzadeh Ismail (Sayed Sarbaksh)
- Imamzadeh Sayed Ali
- Imamzadeh Abu Ahmad Mohammad
- Imamzadeh HusaynIbn Ali and his 3 children
- Imamzadeh Ali and Ahmad
- Imamzadeh Mohammad Ibn Ja’far and Safoura
- Imamzadeh Ibrahim and his father Sayed Abu Jaffar Mohammad
- Imamzadeh Ja’far
- The mosque of Jamkaran
- Imamzadeh Djamal
- Imamzadeh Sayed Ja’far Garib
- Imamzadeh Nassiroudine Mohammad and his 4 children
- Khidhr Mountain

a) Imamzadeh Ibrahim and his father Sayed Abou Jaffar Mohammad

Address in Persian to facilitate your movements :

آدرس . آرامگاه امامزاده ابراهیم . خیابان امامزاده ابراهیم نزدیک ایستگاه راه آهن

In Qum, there are two domes in their names. Father and son are buried under the same dome. Shâh Imamzadeh Ibrahim (also known as Shahzadeh Ibrahim) had done a lot of work, He was a great scholar and he was among the transmitters. His father was an Arab from Iraq who immigrated to Qum. They were descendants of the 7th Imam al-Kadhim (A). He died around 400 AH, without more precision by the scholars on the date of death.20

b) Imamzadeh Ja’far

Address in Persian to facilitate your movements :

آدرس آرامگاه امامزاده جعفر . خیابان امامزاده ابراهیم ع بعد از میدان معصومیه (بقعه امامزاده جعفر موسوی کمی بالاتر از بقعه امامزاده ابراهیم است)

A highly respected personality, Ja'far lived in the 7th century. It should be known that among scholars there is a difference of opinion about Ja'far-e-Musawi's kinship with an imam. The majority say he is the child of Imam al-Kadhim (A). He died during an assault on a Mongolian army in Qum.21

c) Imamzadeh Ali and Ahmad (father and son)

Address in Persian to facilitate your movements :

آدرس آرامگاه امامزاده حارث بن احمد .خیابان امام موسی صدر خاکفرج . میدان الهادی

It is the Tomb of two Imamzadeh : the father is Imamzadeh Abul HusaynAhmad ibn Mohammad and son Imamzadeh Aboul Qassim Ali. Their title is Hârith. They are of the descendants of Imam Sajjad (A). The Tomb of Imamzadeh Mohammad Ibn Ja'far and Safoura is next to it.22

d) Imamzadeh Mohammad Ibn Ja'far and Safoura

Address in Persian to facilitate your movements :

آدرس آرامگاه امامزاده صفورا و محمد بن جعفر . ابتدای خیابان کیوانفر (خیابان خاکفرج)

For the majority of researchers, these two people are from the lineage of Imam Ali (A).

Safoura Khatoune lived in the 3rd century AH. She is buried near her paternal uncle, Mohamad Ibn Ja'far. And as Safoura Khatoun was the first to be buried there, the name of this place took its name, "mausoleum of Safoura". The story does not mention the date of her death. But the construction of this mausoleum was done in 378 AH, which gives us a rough idea of the date of her death.23

e) Imamzadeh Sayed Ali

Address in Persian to facilitate your movements :

آدرس آرامگاه امامزاده سید علی . خارج دروازه ری (بلوار 15 خرداد) در قسمت شمال شرقی قم

The people of Qum often go to the mausoleum of Sayed Ali to grant their wish. There are rumors that he is the descendant of Hazrat Abul Fazlil Abbass, son of Imam Ali (A) but this claim has not been proven.

On the threshold of the door, it is also indicated this line but it is not proved. In reality, Imamzadeh Sayed Ali is a descendant of Mohammad Hanafi, the son of Imam Ali (A). This personality lived in Qum. He had 5 girls and 7 boys with several wives.24

f) Imamzadeh Abu Ahmad Mohammad

Address in Persian to facilitate your movements :

آدرس آرامگاه امامزاده ابو احمد محمد (میانی) . خارج دروازه ری . بلوار 15 خرداد در قسسمت شمال شرقی قم

Near the mausoleum of Imamzadeh Sayed Ali is the mausoleum of Imamzadeh Abu Ahmad Mohammad who is a descendant of Mohammad Hanafi.25

g) Imamzadeh Husayn Ibn Ali and his 3 children

Address in Persian to facilitate your movements :

آدرس آرامگاه امامزاده حسین بن علی و سه فرزندش . خیابان 15 خرداد . 20 متری حائری . در جنب مدرسه علمیه امام خمینی (ره)

Imamzadeh HusaynIbn Ali is buried with his three children. They are called : Abu Mohammad Hassan, Abu Ali Mohammad, Abu Talib Mohsin. This Imamzadeh and his three children are of the descent of Imam Sajjad (A).26

h) Imamzadeh Nassiroudine Ali Ibn Mahdi

Address in Persian to facilitate your movements :

آدرس آرامگاه امامزاده ناصر الدین علی (شاه زاده ناصر الدین ) . بقعه او در خیابان آذر روبروی در بزرگ مسجد امام . نزدیک پل قرار دارد

This personality lived in the late 8th century and early 9th century. He is among the descendants of Imam Al-Hassan (A).27

i) Imamzadeh Hamzah, his father and grandfather

Address in Persian to facilitate your movements :

آدرس آرامگاه امامزاده حمزه . در خیابان آذر (طالقانی) رو به روی میدان تره بار میدان فروشی کهنه داخل کوچه

Imamzadeh Hamzah, his father named Husayn and his grandfather Ahmad Ibn Ishaaq are buried under the same dome. The mausoleum is known by the name of Hamzah because it was a great scholar. They are descendants of Imam Al-Kadhim (A).28

j) Imamzadeh Zayd

Address in Persian to facilitate your movements :

آدرس آرامگاه امامزاده زید . در خیابان آذر (طالقانی) رو به روی میدان تره بار میدان فروشی کهنه داخل کوچه

Near the Imamzadeh Hamza Mausoleum is the Mausoleum of Imamzadeh Zayd, who is one of the descendants of Imam Sajjad (A).

k) Chehel Akhtaran

Address in Persian to facilitate your movements :

آدرس آرامگاه امامزاده موسی مبرقع (چهل اختران ) . خیابان آذر کوچه چهل اختران

At this place, there are different personalities buried among which :
• Musa Al Mubarak
• Ahmad Ibn Mohammad Al-Aaraj
• Zayd
• Chehel Akhtaran : see below

The Chehel Akhtaran includes 40 people among the descendants of the prophets. The names of 14 people who are part of Imamzadeh Musa Al Mubarak's family have been recorded. The names of other people are unknown to date.

Here are the names of the 14 people :

1. Mohammad the son of Musa Al Mubarak
2. Ahmed the son Musa Al Mubarak
3. Zaynab the daughter of Musa Al Mubarak
4. Mohammad Al-Aaraj, grandson of Musa Al Mubarak
5. Umm Mohammad, granddaughter of Musa Al Mubarak
6. Umm Habiba, granddaughter of Musa Al Mubarak
7. Fatema, the great granddaughter of Musa Al Mubarak
8. Borayha, the great-granddaughter of Musa Al Mubarak
9. Umm Kulthum Borayha, the great-granddaughter of Musa Al Mubarak
10. Umm Salama, the great granddaughter of Musa Al Mubarak
11. Yahya, the great-grandson of Musa Al Mubarak
12. Mohammad, the great-grandson of Musa Al Mubarak
13. Abul Fadhl Abdullah, the great-grandson of Musa Al Mubarak
14. Borayha, Mohammad's wife and daughter-in-law Musa Al Mubarak29

Imamzadeh Musa Al Mubarak

Imamzadeh Musa Al Mubarak is the son of Imam Al-Jawad (A). He is also the brother of Imam Ali Al-Hadi (A), they are born from the same mother whose name is Bibi Sumana Khatoon. It should be noted that Bibi Summana Khatoon is of North African origin.30

He is the first son of the Imam who came to Qum during the 256 AH. He was famous for being elegant, bright, resplendent. He covered his face with a veil, that's why it was called Mubarak.31

He spent his childhood in Medina with his mother and his brother Imam Ali Al-Hadi (A). Education and the basics of Islam were taught to him through his brother. Thanks to these teachings, Imamzadeh Musa Al Mubarak was so popular with society that people came to meet him to ask Islamic questions. He had so much respect for his brother that he redirected people to him and avoided answering difficult questions.32

His father, Imam Al-Jawād (A) had so much confidence in him that he named him collector of donations. He was trustworthy and depositary. In the year 255 after the Hijra, he left Medina for Kufa. In the year 256 AH, he moved to Qum where he stayed for 40 years. This is where he is buried today.33

Musa Al Mubarak and his sister had the chance to build the mausoleum of Hazrat Ma’suma e Qum (A). Musa Al Mubarak died on Rabi al-Thâni 22, during the year 296 AH in Qum at the age of 82.

He is buried where he lived.34

Ahmad Ibn Mohammad Al-Aaraj

Grandson of Musa Al Mubarak, he is buried near him under the same dome. This personality was born in the year 311 AH in Qum. He was known for his virtue, piety and generosity. He died in 357 AH at the age of 46.35

Zayd

He is among the descendants of Imam Sajjad (A).36

l) Imamzadeh Ismail (Sayed Sarbaksh)

Address in Persian to facilitate your movements :

آدرس آرامگاه امامزاده اسماعیل (سید سربخش ) . خیابان آذر (طالقانی) داخل کوچه روبروی چهل اختران . کوچه 80

Grandson of Imam As-Sadiq (A), the Tomb of Imamzadeh Ismail is near Chekhel Akhtaran.37

m) Imamzadeh Mohammad Sharif

Address in Persian to facilitate your movements :

آدرس آرامگاه امامزاده سلطان محمد شرییف . در خیابان چهار مردان . خیابان انقلاب کوچه 17

Coming from a pious family, he was born in 343 AH. His title was Abul Fazl. He came from the lineage of Imam Sajjad (A). He died in 398 AH at the age of 55.38

n) Imamzadeh Ibrahim and Ahmad

Address in Persian to facilitate your movements :

آدرس آرامگاه امامزاده ابراهیم . در کنار گلزار شهداء (در بهشت ) آخر چهار مردان

Imamzadeh Ibrahim is from the descendants of Imam Al-Kadhim (A) and Imamzadeh Ahmad is from Imam Sajjad (A).39

o) Imamzadeh Ali and Mohammad

Address in Persian to facilitate your movements :

آدرس آرامگاه امامزاده علی و محمد . در کنار گلزار شهداء (در بهشت ) آخر چهار مردان

Imamzadeh Ali is the son of Imam as-Sadiq (A). He was born in 129 or 130 AH and died in the year 233 AH.

Next to him is one of the grandchildren of Imam al-Kadhim (A) named Imamzadeh Mohammad ibn Ishaq.40

p) Imamzadeh Jamal

Address in Persian to facilitate your movements :

آدرس آرامگاه امامزاده جمال . در جاده کاشان ( داخل قبرستان بقیع )

He is among the descendants of Imam al-Kadhim (A).41

q) Imamzadeh Sayed Ja’far Garib

Address in Persian to facilitate your movements :

آدرس آرامگاه امامزاده سید جعفر غریب . در جاده کاشان (نزدیک قبرستان بقیع )

He is among the descendants of Imam al-Kadhim (A).42

r) Imamzadeh Nassiroudine Mohammad and his 4 children

Address in Persian to facilitate your movements :

آدرس آرامگاه امامزاده ناصر الدین محمد (آستان مقدس پنج امامزاده ) . جمکران بلوار پیامبر اعظم (ص) میدان آل یاسین . خیابان پنج امامزاده

Imamzadeh Nassiroudine Mohammad is buried near the Masjid Jamkarane with his four children named Hadi, Mahdi, Ja'far and Sakina. These 5 people are of the descent of Imam Sajjad (A).

Khidhr (The Green) was so named because he had once seated himself on a barren ground which later became luxuriously green thanks to the vegetation. It is also said that when he prayed, everything became green around him.

Khidhr is mentioned in the Quran in Surah 18, from verse 65 to verse 82. These verses tell of his encounter with Prophet Musa.

Some say of him that he was a prophet, a saint, a sage, a holder of the sciences of the unknown. But the Qur'an does not affirm it. He is one of those who are still alive and embodies the initiator of Musa.

The green color in Islam symbolizes the spiritual color par excellence designating the divine wisdom, as the Holy Prophet (S) Mohammad.

Khidhr Mountain is 6 km from Qum. It is not far from the Jamkaran mosque. This mountain has existed for 5000 years. Khidhr often went to its summit and built a mosque there.

The name of Khidhr is not mentioned in the Qur'an, but only his history. He had relations with the 12 Imams (A). He greets us but we do not see him. He also participates in the major pilgrimage (Hajj).

Allama al-Majlissi said he can not be a prophet because he taught Moses.

On the other hand, Allama Tabatabai said that he was indeed a prophet according to hadiths.44

a) Ariza

One of the methods of using Allah and Ahlul Bayt is to write an ariza.

The ariza is a letter written to Allah to ask for a wish. It is highly recommended according to our scholars to go through the Ahlul Bayt to ask for a wish.

The ariza is used in different ways. Either it is thrown at the grave of the Ahlul Bayt, or it is put in water that flows continuously, or is thrown into the sea water, the water of the river or in a pit.46

b) Ways to achieve Ziyarat

The prayer of al-Hujjah (A) in the mosque of Jamkaran

It is said in à hadith that al-Hujjah (A) says to Hassan bin Muthlih Jamkarani :

Tell people to go to this place, give it importance, and pray four raka’ats :

-Two raka'ats to greet the mosque by reciting for each raka'at al-Hamd (1) once Al Ikhlas(112)

- Two raka'ats prayer for [Imam] al-Hujjah (A) reciting for each raka'at al-Hamd(1).

When we come to the fifth verse ({'We worship you, and you are the ones to whom we ask for help} – Iyyaka na'budu wa iyyaka nasta'inu), repeat it 100 times. Then complete the surah.

Do the same during the second raka'at. Likewise glorify God seven times during inclinations and prostrations.

When the prayer is over, say : "There is no God but God" and glorify God with the glorification of Zahra (A). Tasbih Bibi Fatema (A).

After finishing the glorifications, prostrate (sajdah) and pray over the Prophet and his family (salawat) 100 times.

These words were reported from a text of Imam al-Hujjah (A) which says :« The one who prays is like one who prays in the "House al-'Atiq" (la Ka'abah). »

-It is also reported in the book an-Najem ath-Thaqeb, the bearer of the book Kunûz an-Najah of Sheikh Tabursi, as coming from "an-Nâhiyah al-Muqadassah" of Imam al-Hujjah (A) who says, "He who has a need [to ask] of God, to perform the ritual shower (ghusl), the night of Friday after the middle of the night, let him go to this place of prayer and pray to two raka there" by reciting for each raka'at al-Hamd (I), having arrived at the fifth verse and saying, "We are worshiping and it is you whose help we are asking for." – Iyyaka na'budu wa iyyaka nasta'inu), let him repeat it 100 Once he finishes the Surah and recites Surah Ikhlas (112) once, he makes the inclinations (ruku) and the prostrations (sajdah) by repeating during the inclinations, seven times :

سُبْحانَ رَبّيَ الْعَظِيمِ وَبِحَمْدِهِ

Subhan rabbil a’dheeme wabe hamdeeh.

Glory be to my Lord the Greatest and praise belongs to Him.

And during double prostrations, seven times :

سُبْحانَ رَبّيَ الأَعْلَى وَبِحَمْدِهِ

Subhan rabbil a’ala wabe hamdeeh.

Glory be to my Lord the Exalted and praise belongs to Him.

Do the same during the second raka'at. At the end of the prayer, invoke God from this invocation. God will completely satisfy his need whatever it may be, unless it is a break in kinship. Here is this invocation :

اللَّهُمَّ إِنْ أَطَعْتُكَ فَالْمَحْمَدَةُ لَكَ، وَإِنْ عَصَيْتُكَ فَالْحُجَّةُ لَكَ، مِنْكَ الرُّوحُ وَمِنْكَ الْفَرَجُ،

Allahumma in a’tooatok fal mahmadtoo lak, wa in asaytooka fal hujjatoo lak, minka ruhoo wa min kal farajo.

O my Lord! If have obeyed your orders so the all praise is for You. (But) if disobeyed You then You have proof against me, all ease and relief are from You.

Then he says to the point of losing his breath :

سُبْحانَ مَنْ أَنْعَمَ وَشَكَرَ سُبْحانَ مَنْ قَدَّرَ وَغَفَرَ اللَّهُمَّ إِنْ كُنْتُ عَصَيْتُكَ فَإِنّي قَدْ أَطَعْتُكَ فِي أَحَبّ الأَشْياءِ إِلَيْكَ وَهُوَ الإْيْمانُ بِكَ لَمْ أَتَّخِذْ لَكَ وَلَداً وَلَمْ أَدْعُ لَكَ شَرِيكاً مَنَّاً مِنْكَ بِهِ عَلَيَّ لا مَنّاً مِنّي بِهِ عَلَيْكَ وَقَدْ عَصَيْتُكَ يا إِلهِي عَلَى غَيْرِ وَجْهِ الْمُكابَرَةِ وَلا الْخُرُوجِ عَنْ عُبُودِيَّتِكَ وَلا الْجُحُودِ لِرُبُوبِيَّتِكَ وَلكِنْ أَطَعْتُ هَوايَ وَأَزَلَّنِي الشَّيْطانُ فَلَكَ الْحُجَّةُ عَلَيَّ وَالْبَيانُ فَإِنْ تُعَذِّبْنِي فَبِذُنُوبِي غَيْرُ ظالِمٍ لِي، وَإِنْ تَغْفِرْ لِي وَتَرْحَمْنِي فَإِنَّكَ جَوادٌ كَرِيمٌ

Subhan man an aama wa shakara subhan man qaddara wa ghafara, allahumma in kuntoo asaytoka fa inni qad ata’tooka fi ahabbal ashyae elayka wa howal imano bek. Lam attakhidh lak waladan wa lam ad'oo laka sharikan manna mink behee alyaa la manna minni bihi alayka wa qad asaytoka yaa elahee aala ghai'ree waj'hil mokabartee wala'l khorujee an obudiyatek walal johode li robubiyatek wala'kin a’ataa to hawaya wa azallani'sh shaytanoo fa lakal hujja'too alayya wal bayanoo fa in toaadhib nee fabi dhunubee ghairoo dhalemil'lee, wa in taghfeer lee wa tarhamnee fa innak jawadun kareem.

Glory be to He who bestowed rewards and was gratified, Glory be to He who retains the power but pardons. O Allah, even though I have disobeyed You, but I have obeyed You among the thing You love the most i.e. believing in You. I have not ascribed offspring to You and I have not ascribed partner to You. You have bestowed upon me and I have not bestowed anything upon You. O my God, verily I have offended You but not as a result of arrogance nor to depart from your service and not renunciation of Your Divinity but I have obeyed my longings and Satan has tripped on me. So, You possess the proof against me, You will not be oppressor if You punish me due to my sin, but if You forgive and have mercy on me, verily You are Openhanded and Generous.

Then he says after that :

يا كَرِيمُ يا كَرِيمُ

Ya kareemo ya kareemo

Then he says after that :

يا امِناً مِنْ كُلّ شَيْءٍ وَكُلُّ شَيْءٍ مِنْكَ خائِفٌ حَذِرٌ

Ya amenan min kulla shayin wa kullo shayin mink khae’ifun hadheerun.

O He who is secured from everything, O He from whom everything is afraid and cautious.

أَنْ تُصَلّيَ عَلَى مُحَمَّدٍ وَالِ مُحَمَّدٍ وَأَنْ تُعْطِيَنِي أَمَاناً لِنَفْسي وَأَهْلِي وَوَلَدِي وَسائِرِ ما أَنْعَمْتَ بِهِ عَلَيَّ حَتَّى لا أَخافَ وَلا أَحْذَرَ مِنْ شَيْءٍ أَبَداً إِنَّكَ عَلَى كُلّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ وَحَسْبُنا اللَّهُ وَنِعْمَ الْوَكِيلُ

An tosalli aala mohammad wa aale mohammad wa an to’ teeyani amanan le nafsee wa ahlee wa waladee wa saeere ma an am'ta behee alyaa. Hatta la aakhaf wala ahzar min shayii’n Abadan innaka aala kulli, shay’in qadeerun wa has'bonallaho wa neamal wakeel

(I requested You) to send Your blessings upon Muhammad and his progeny, and grant Your refuge for me, my family and my offspring and for everyone because of whom You bestowed upon me so that I don’t get frightened from anyone and wary of anything forever. Verily You have the power over all things. Allah is sufficient for us, an excellent Trustee.

يا كافِيَ إِبْراهِيمَ نُمْرُودَ وَيا كاهفيَ مُوسَى فِرْعَوْنَ
أَسْأَلُكَ أَنْ تُصَلّيَ عَلَى مُحَمَّدٍ وَالِ مُحَمَّدٍ وَأَنْ تَكْفِيَنِي شَرَّ فلان بْن فلان

Ya kafee ibraheem nomrood way a kafee mosa fir‘awn

As'alok an toswallee aala mohammadin wa aale mohammad wa antakfiyaniy sharra fulan bin fulan

O He who supported Ibrahim against Namrud, O He who supported Musa against Fir'aun, (I beseech You) to bless Muhammad and his family and help me against the evils of so and so person son of so and so person.

The Supplication of Allegiance to Imam Mahdi (A) ( Dua-e-Ahad )

Imam as-Sadiq (A) narrates that "one who recites this supplication for 40 mornings ; he will be accounted amongst the helpers of Imam Mahdi (A). And if he happens to die before the reappearance of Imam Mahdi (A), Allah will raise him up from his rave so that he may assist the holy Imam (A). For every word that he recites in this supplication, Allah will grant him 1000 good deeds and will erase from his scroll of deeds 1000 sins."

As the title suggests, this supplication is of allegiance (ahad) to the holy Imam (A). Its recitation every morning ensures the renewal of this covenant. The reciter finds himself under the leadership of Imam (A). The reciter beseeches All to include him among the helpers and aides of Imam (A) and to grant him the opportunity to attain martyrdom in his presence. Also, he requests Allah that should he die before the reappearance of Imam (A). Allah should raise him up from his grave so that he may assist him (A) in his mission.

There is a fervent appeal to Allah to grant him the honour of seeing Imam (A). In this there is also an acknowledgement that the difficulties of this nation can be solved only by the reappearance of Imam (A) and that believers see it as being close while others deem it to be distant.

اللَّهُمَّ رَبَّ النُّورِ الْعَظِيمِ وَرَبَّ الْكُرْسِيِّ الرَّفِيعِ وَرَبَّ الْبَحْرِ الْمَسْجُورِ . وَمُنْزِلَ التَّوْراةِ وَالإْنْجِيلِ وَالزَّبُورِ وَرَبَّ الظِّلِّ وَالْحَرُورِ وَمُنْزِلَ الْقُرْآنِ الْعَظِيمِ
وَرَبَّ الْمَلائِكَةِ الْمُقَرَّبِينَ وَالأَنْبِياءِ وَالْمُرْسَلِينَ

أَسْأَلُكَ بِاسْمِكَ الَّذِي أَشْرَقَتْ بِهِ السَّماواتُ وَالأَرَضُونَ
وَبِاسْمِكَ الَّذِي يَصْلَحُ بِهِ الأَوَّلُونَ وَالآخِرُونَ
يا حَيَّاً قَبْلَ كُلِّ حَيٍّ وَيا حَيَّاً بَعْدَ كُلِّ حَيٍّ وَيا حَيَّاً حِينَ لا حَيَّ يا مُحْيِيَ الْمَوْتَى وَمُمِيتَ الأَحْياءِ يا حَيُّ لا إِلهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ
اللَّهُمَّ بَلِّغْ مَوْلانَا الإْمامَ الْهادِيَ الْمَهْدِيَّ الْقائِمَ بِأَمْرِكَ صَلَواتُ اللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ وَعَلَى آبائِهِ الطَّاهِرِينَ
عَنْ جَمِيعِ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَالْمُؤْمِناتِ فِي مَشارِقِ الأَرْضِ وَمَغارِبِهَا سَهْلِها وَجَبَلِها وَبَرِّها وَبَحْرِها
وَعَنِّي وَعَنْ والِدَيَّ مِنَ الصَّلَواتِ زِنَةَ عَرْشِ اللَّهِ وَمِدادَ كَلِماتِهِ وَمَا أَحْصاهُ عِلْمُهُ وَأَحاطَ بِهِ كِتابُهُ . اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أُجَدِّدُ لَهُ فِي صَبِيحَةِ يَوْمِي هذَا وَما عِشْتُ مِنْ أَيَّامِي عَهْداً وَعَقْدَاً وَبَيْعَةً لَهُ فِي عُنُقِي لا أَحُولُ عَنْها وَلا أَزُولُ أَبَداً
اللَّهُمَّ اجْعَلْنِي مِنْ أَنْصارِهِ وَأَعْوانِهِ وَالذَّابِّينَ عَنْهُ وَالْمُسارِعِينَ إِلَيْهِ فِي قَضاءِ حَوائِجِهِ
وَالْمُمْتَثِلِينَ لأَوامِرِهِ وَالْمُحامِينَ عَنْهُ وَالسَّابِقِينَ إِلَى إِرادَتِهِ وَالْمُسْتَشْهَدِينَ بَيْنَ يَدَيْهِ . اللَّهُمَّ إِنْ حالَ بَيْنِي وَبَيْنَهُ الْمَوْتُ الَّذِي جَعَلْتَهُ عَلَى عِبادِكَ حَتْمَاً مَقْضِيَّاً
فَأَخْرِجْنِي مِنْ قَبْرِي مُؤْتَزِراً كَفَنِي شاهِراً سَيْفِي مُجَرِّداً قَناتِي مُلَبِّياً دَعْوَةَ الدَّاعِي فِي الْحَاضِرِ وَالْبادِي .
فَأَخْرِجْنِي مِنْ قَبْرِي مُؤْتَزِراً كَفَنِي شاهِراً سَيْفِي مُجَرِّداً قَناتِي مُلَبِّياً دَعْوَةَ الدَّاعِي فِي الْحَاضِرِ وَالْبادِي . اللَّهُمَّ أَرِنِي الطَّلْعَةَ الرَّشِيدَةَ وَالْغُرَّةَ الْحَمِيدَةَ وَاكْحُلْ ناظِرِي بِنَظْرَةٍ مِنِّي إِلَيْهِ . وَعَجِّلْ فَرَجَهُ وَسَهِّلْ مَخْرَجَهُ وَأَوْسِعْ مَنْهَجَهُ وَاسْلُكْ بِي مَحَجَّتَهُ وَأَنْفِذْ أَمْرَهُ وَاشْدُدْ أَزْرَهُ وَاعْمُرِ اللَّهُمَّ بِهِ بِلادَكَ وَأَحْيِ بِهِ عِبادَكَ . ظَهَرَ الْفَسادُ فِي الْبَرِّ وَالْبَحْرِ بِما كَسَبَتْ أَيْدِي النَّاسِ . فَأَظْهِرِاللَّهُمَّ لَنا وَلِيَّكَ وَابْنَ بِنْتِ نَبِيِّكَ الْمُسَمَّى بِاسْمِ رَسُولِكَ (صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ) حَتَّى لا يَظْفَرَ بِشَيْءٍ مِنَ الْباطِلِ إِلاَّ مَزَّقَهُ وَيُحِقَّ الْحَقَّ وَيُحَقِّقَهُ
وَاجْعَلْهُ اللَّهُمَّ مَفْزَعاً لِمَظْلُومِ عِبادِكَ وَناصِراً لِمَنْ لا يَجِدُ لَهُ ناصِراً غَيْرَكَ . وَمُجَدِّداً لِما عُطِّلَ مِنْ أَحْكامِ كِتابِكَ وَمُشَيِّداً لِما وَرَدَ مِنْ أَعْلامِ دِينِكَ وَسُنَنِ نَبِيِّكَ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَآلِهِ . وَاجْعَلْهُ اللَّهُمَّ مِمَّنْ حَصَّنْتَهُ مِنْ بَأْسِ الْمُعْتَدِينَ . اللَّهُمَّ وَسُرَّ نَبِيِّكَ مُحَمَّداً صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَالِهِ بِرُؤْيَتِهِ وَمَنْ تَبِعَهُ عَلَى دَعْوَتِهِ وَارْحَمْ اسْتِكانَتَنا بَعْدَهُ . اللَّهُمَّ اكْشِفْ هذِهِ الْغُمَّةَ عَنْ هذِهِ الأُمَّةِ بِحُضُورِهِ وَعَجِّلْ لَنا ظُهُورَهُ إِنَّهُمْ يَرَوْنَهُ بَعِيداً وَنَرَاهُ قَرِيباً بِرَحْمَتِكَ يا أَرْحَمَ الرَّاحِمِينَ.

Hit his thigh three times with his right hand [as a sign of sadness], saying each time :

الْعَجَلَ ، يا مَوْلايَ يا صَاحِبَ الزَّمانِ .

bismillā alrrahmāni alrrahīmi, allāhumma salli'alā muhammadin wa āli muhammadin, allāhumma rabban‐nooril adhweemi, wa rabbal qursiyyir‐rafee'I, wa rabbil bahril masjoori, wa munzilat‐tawraati wal injeeli waz‐zaboori, wa rabbadh‐dhilli wal haroori, wa munzilal qur'aanil adhweemi, wa rabbal malaaikatil muqarrabeen, wal ambiyaai wal mursaleen, allāhumma innee as' aluka bi waj'hikal kareem, wa bi noori wajhikal muneeri, wa mulkikal qadeemi, yaa hayyu yaa qayyoomu, as'aluka bismikal‐ladhee ashrakat bihis‐samaawaatu wal ardhoona, wa bismikal‐ladhee yaslahu bihil awwaloon wal aakhiroon, yaa hayyan qabla kulli hayyin, wa yaa hayyan ba'ada kulli hayyin, wa yaa hayyan heena laa hayya yaa muhyiyal mawta, wa mumeetatal ahyaa'I, yaa hayyu laa ilaaha illa anta, allāhumma balligh mawlaanal imaamal haadiyal mahdiyyal, qaaima bi amrika swalawaatullaahi alayhi wa alaa aabaaihit‐twaahireen, an jamee'il mu'mineena wal mu'minaati, fi mashaarikil ardhi, wa maghaaribihaa, sahlihaa wa jabalihaa, barrihaa wa bahrihaa, wa annee wa an waalidayya, minas‐swalawaati zinata arshillaahi, wa midaada kalimaatihi, wamaa ahswaahu ilmuhu wa ahaatwa bihi kitaabuhu, allāhumma innee ujaddidu lahoo fi swabeehati yawmi haadha, wamaa ishtu min ayyaami, ahdan wa aqdan wa bay'atan lahu fi unuqee, laa ahoolu anha walaa azoolu abadan, allāhummaj'alnee minanswaaarihi wa a'awaanihi, wadh‐dhaabbeena anhu, wal musaari'eena ilayhi, fi qadhaai hawaaijihi wal mum'tathileena li awaamirihi, wal muhaa‐meena anhu, was‐saabiqeena ilaa iraadatihi, wal mustash'hadeena bayna yadayhi, allāhumma in haala bayni wa baynahul mawtul‐ladhee, ja'altahu alaa ibaadik hatman maqdhiyyan, fa akhrijni min qabree, mu'taziran, kafanee shaahiran, swayfee, mujarridan, qanaatee mulabbiyan, da'awatad‐daaii fil haadhiri wal baadee, allaahuma arinit‐twal'atar‐rasheedata, wal ghurratal hameedata, waqhul naadhiri bi nadhratin minnee ilayhi, wa ajjil farajahu, wa sahhil makhrajahu, wa awsi'a man'hajahu, wasluk bi muhajjatahu, wa anfidh amrahu, washdud azrahu, wa'murillaa‐humma bihi bilaadak, wa ahyi bihi ibaadak, fa innaka qulta wa qawlukal haqqu, dhwahral fasaadu fil barri wal bahri, bimaa kasabat aydinnaasi, fa azhiri‐llaahumma lanaa waliyyik, binti nabiyyikal, musamma, bismi rasoolik, hattaa laa yadhfara, bi shay'in minal baatwili illaa mazzaqahu, wa yuhiqqal haqqa, wa yuhaqqiqahu, waj'alhu allāhumma mafza'an li madhloomi ibaadik, wa naaswiran liman laa yajidu lahu naaswiran ghayrak, wa mujaddidan lima uttwila min ahkaami kitaabik, wa mushayyidan limaa warada min a'alaami deenik, wa sunani nabiyyik swallallaahu alayhi wa aalihi, waj'alhu, allāhumma mimman hasswantahu min ba'asil mu'tadeen, allāhumma wa surra nabiyyik muhammadin swallallaahu alayhi wa aalihi, bi ru'ayatihi waman tabiahu alaa da'awatihi, warhamistikaantina ba'adahu, allaahumakshif haadhihil ghummata an haadhihil ummatai, bi hudhoorihi wa ajjil lanaa dhuhoorahu, innahum yarawnahu baeedan wa naraahu qareeban, bi rahmatik yaa arhamar‐raahimeen.

Hit his thigh three times with his right hand [as a sign of sadness], saying each time :

al`ajala al`ajala ya mawlaya ya sahiba alzzamani

O Allah! Lord of the Great Light, Lord of the Elevated Throne, Lord of the tumultuous seas, and the revealer of the Tawrah, Injeel, and Zaboor, Lord of the shadows and the warmth’s, And the revealer of the Great Quran. Lord of the proximate angels and prophets and messengers. O Allah I beseech thee, for the sake of Your Nobel Visage. And for the sake of Your Enlightening Visage, and Your ever existing kingdom. O Ever Living! O Controller! I beseech Thee in Your Name which lit the heavens and the earths; and in Your Name, by which the ancient and the latter ones become upright. O Ever living who has before every living being. O Ever Living Who shall (exist) after every living being. O Ever Living Who existed when there was no life. O Giver of life to dead. O One Who causes death to the living one. O Ever Living. There is no god except Thou.

O Allah send our master the leader, the guide, the guided, the upriser with Your command. Blessings of Allah be on him and his pure forefathers from all the believing men and believing women. In the east’s of the earth and it’s west’s, in its plains and its mountains, its lands and its seas, from me and my parents. Blessings, which are the weight of Allah’s throne and ink of His words, and whatever His knowledge enumerates and His book encompasses.

O Allah renew for him my covenant, pledge and allegiance on my neck in the morning of this day of mine and whatever days (of my life) I live. I shall never turn away from it nor let it ever vanish. O Allah appoint me among his helpers, aides, and his protectors. Those who hasten to fulfill his commands and obey his orders. Those who are his supporters and compete with each other to (fulfill) his intention and seek martyrdom in his presence.

O Allah! If death occurs between me and him (before the reappearance) (death) which you have made obligatory and decreed for your servants, then raise me from my grave, wrapped in my shroud, my sword unsheathed, my spear bared, answering the call of the caller in cities as well as deserts.

O Allah! Show me the rightly guided face of (Imam A), the praiseworthy moon (referring to the face of Imam A) and enlighten my vision by looking at him. And hasten his reappearance, make his arrival smooth, vasten his path, make me tread on his way and implement his authority and strengthen his back. O Allah inhabit Your cities through him and give life to Your servants due to him for surely You have said and Your word is truth, "Corruption will become rampant in land and on sea because of the evil which men’s hand have earned" Then O Allah manifest for us Your slave and the son of Your Prophet’s daughter, whose name is the same as that of Your messenger, so that nothing from falsehood is victorious except that he tears them (falsehood) to pieces, establishes the truth and the truth confirms him. And O Allah! Appoint him as a refuge for Your oppressed servants and a helper for the one who does not find any helper for himself except You and the renewer of all the laws of Your book which have been tampered with and the rebuilder of the science of Your religion and the traditions of Your Prophet (peace of Allah be on him and his progeny) and O Allah! make him among those whom you have protected from the evils of the adversaries.

O Allah! and provide joy to Your Prophet Mohammed (peace be on him and his progeny) by his vision and (the vision of) the one who follows him on his call and have mercy on our poverty after his arrival O Allah remove his sorrow (of occultation) from this nation with his presence and hasten for us his reappearance. They (the disbelievers) consider it to be distant while we consider it to be near. For the sake of Your mercy, O the most Merciful of all Mercifuls.

Hit his thigh three times with his right hand [as a sign of sadness], saying each time :

Hasten! Hasten! O my Master, O Master of the era.
