Allaahumma lebaabeka waqafto, wa befenaa-eka nazalto, wa behableka’ taswamto, wa lerahmateka ta a’rradhto, wa bewAliyyeka salawaatoka a’layhe tawassalto, faj-a’lhaa zeyaaratan maqboolatan, wa do-a’aa-an mustajaaban

1: Qur'an : Chapter 20, verse 12
2: Wasa'il al-Shia, volume 10, page 299
3: Irshad al quloob, volume 2, page 238
4: Bihar al Anwar, volume 100, page 232
5: Wasa'il al-Shia, volume 10, page 308

Imam Ali (A) was born on 13 Rajab, about ten years before the beginning of the mission of the Holy Prophet (S) and 23 years before the Hijra. His parents were Abu Talib and Fatima binte Assad. A unique privilege granted by God, his birth took place within the Holy Kaaba itself, and the Holy Prophet (S) granted him the hand of his daughter Fatima az-Zahra (A), denying it to all the other suitors.

Imam Ali (A) was the first man to accept Islam and believe in God and His Prophet (S). He was brought up by The Prophet and remained with him throughout his life.

He is the one for whom the verse was revealed : «Your only guardians are Allah, His Messenger, and fellow believers—who establish prayer and pay alms-tax with humility.” » (Qur’an 5 : 55).6

The Holy Prophet (S) said to him : « You are for me, as Aaron was for [the Prophet] Mussa (A), except there will be no prophet after me. »

Whenever the Holy Prophet (S) needed help or support, Imam Ali (A) would be the first to know and help. E.g. on the night of Hijra, when the Prophet (S) left Mecca for Medina and was on the hunt by his enemies, Imam Ali (A) did not hesitate to lie down in his place even at the risk of being murdered.

Imam Ali (A) defended Islam against the aggression of unhappy pagans with determination and steadfastness. Imam Ali (A) demonstrated his bravery during his biggest battles – Badr, Ohud, Khandaq and Khaybar. He participated in all holy wars, except that of Tabouk, because of particular circumstances.

Finally, on his return from his last pilgrimage, the Prophet (S) ordered the caravan to stop and regroup in a place called Ghadir e Khom. He then announced an unforgettable sermon, and at the end seized the hand of Imam Ali (A) and raised it high so everyone could observe it from the top of the mimbar which was made from the saddles of the caskets. He proclaimed solemnly: « To whom I am the Master, Ali is also the Master ». This was his last testament announced before an immense crowd of pilgrims, charged with bringing back these precious words into their homes and circulating them throughout Arabia. The people hastened to congratulate Imam Ali (A) and to give him their allegiance in his noble presence.

In spite of all these testimonies, as soon as the death of the Holy Prophet (S) was announced, Imam Ali (A) went through a difficult period. The Prophet (S) had designated Imam Ali (A) as the best person to lead the Muslims after him in the right direction. But he was promptly dismissed and humiliated after the Prophet’s death.

Imam Ali (A) had the physical strength to react and demand for his right. But the valiant defender of Islam who could fearlessly fight any enemy on the outside, he now was faced with a serious threat that could shatter the community. Therefore, he placed the interest of the Ummah (community) above his own. He loved Islam but not for greed or power. He withdrew himself from the political scene and showed immense patience towards the mistreatment and injustice inflicted upon him for 25 years. However, he was always available to help with the interpretation and application of Quranic texts, even to the caliphs who had usurped the khilafat. He was able to guide them out of embarrassing situations especially in front of foreign delegations of Islam.

However, after the death of the 3rd Caliph, Othman, he was urged to put himself forwards in order to prevent the political chaos and the collapse of society. He remained as the Caliph for four years and nine months due to his righteousness and during this time he was correcting all injustices towards the people. However, his reign came to an end after he was murdered unjustly.

He followed the path traced by the Holy Prophet (S) diligently and he acted with equity and fairness. However, the privileges sought despite all the ethics had perverted the hearts of many people among the former companions of the Prophet (S). But the one whose right had been deprived and wanted to restore necessity and incompetence, he was still indeed the true protector of the oppressed.

Imam Ali (A) had to face many internal conflicts, initiated by all who did not accept his legal authority for various reasons of their own. Thus, he had to face Aisha, supported by Talha and Zubair, at the battle of Jamal (the « battle of the camel »), Mu'awiya at the Battle of Siffin, or the Kharijites at the Battle of Nehrawan.

Imam Ali (A) received a poisoned sword on his head, whilst he was in prayer at the Masjid-e-Kufa, on the 19th of Ramadhan, 40 A.H., by a Kharijites named Ibne Muljim. He died as a martyr 2 days later, on the 21st of this blessed month. He was 63 years old.

6: Qur'an : Chapter 5, verse 55

Imam Ali (A) rests in Najaf. His tomb remained a secret for a long time, in order to avoid being desecrated by his enemies.

Indeed, before dying, Imam Ali (A) told his children to dig four graves in different places. « Once you have prepared my body, hold only the back of my coffin; the angels will help you. Bury me at the exact spot where my coffin will stop. »7

On the night of 21 Ramadhan 40 AH, the funeral procession of Imam Ali (A) left Kufa in the direction of Najaf. The coffin stopped on the land of Najaf. And his grave was dug at the exact spot where he landed.

On the tomb, written in Syriac language by Prophet Nuh himself is the following: « In the name of God, the Most Beneficent, the Most Merciful, this tomb was dug by Prophet Nuh (A), 700 years before the storm, for Imam Ali (A), the heir of Prophet Mohammad (S). »8

The tomb remained hidden for 93 years. Only the descendants as well as some privileged ones knew where it is situated.

According to some Riwayat (narrations), the Abbasid caliph Haroun ar-Rashid, on a hunting expedition, sent his dogs in pursuit of gazelles, which immediately took refuge on a hill. The dogs could not access it. This incident was repeated three times.

Haroun was intrigued by this and told his close inhabitants to enquire about the place. He ended up discovering the tomb of Imam Ali (A) and gave the order to build a mausoleum.9

7: Bihar al Anwar, volume 100, page 250
8: Muntaha al ‘Amal, volume 1, page 183
9: Bihar al Anwar, volume 100, page 252

According to some Riwayat, the mausoleum of Imam Ali (A) is surrounded by the graves of hundreds of Prophets. Prophet Adam (A) and Nuh (A) are buried there. According to the Imam as-Sadiq (A) - (6th Imam) : « When you visit the mausoleum of Imam Ali (A), know that there is also the frame of the Prophet Adam (A) and the body of the Prophet Nuh (A). »10

According to Imam as-Sadiq (A), these two Prophets are buried at the head of the tomb of Imam Ali (A).

The Prophets Hud and Saleh (A) also have a courtyard built northeast of Najaf, at the entrance to the Wadi-Salama cemetery. That is why at the time of his death, Imam Ali (A) had urged his relatives to bury him on the hill of Najaf, near the tomb of his brothers Hud and Saleh (A).11 On the other hand, Marhum Allama Majlissi and Sheikh Abbass Qumi, throughout their studies of this hadith, indicate that according to the narrations of the Ahlulbayt, the holy head of Imam Hussein (A) and the sacred bodies of Adam, Nuh, Hud and Saleh (A) are buried near the tomb of Imam Ali (A).12

10: Wasa'il al-Shia, volume 10, page 299
11: Same, page 308
12: Bihar al Anwar, volume 100, page 251

This place is in the mausoleum, near the tomb of Imam Ali (A), on the side of his head. It is also considered as part of the sacred places. It is reported that a tyrannical governor by the name of Mourra ibn Qays once engaged in a discussion of his ancestors. He learned that many of them had been killed in the war by Ali ibn Abi Talib (A). Mourra then planned to take revenge on Imam Ali’s (A) grave. He went with 2,000 of his soldiers to Najaf. The inhabitants resisted for 6 days. Mourra then entered the mausoleum of Imam Ali (A) and began to ravage the place. He wanted to exhume the holy body, but from the tomb appeared two fingers and Mourra's body was sliced into two. Part of it froze in stone.13

13: Al anwar al ‘Alawiya, page 423

children.name: 1- The benefits of visiting Imam Ali’s shrine (A)

text.html:
A man named Yunus ibne Abi Wahab relates : « Having gone to Medina, I went directly to Imam as-Sadiq (A) - (6th Imam). During our discussion, he learned that I had failed to visit the mausoleum of Imam Ali (A) before coming to his home. He felt affected and said : « What bad action did you do there? If you were not my supporters, I too would have refused your visit, O Yunus! You neglected to visit my grandfather Imam Ali (A), while God, the Angels, the Prophets and the sincere believers make his pilgrimage! Know that Ali (A) is near God better than all Imams, and his actions are worth more than the actions of all Imams !»14

Our 8th Imam, Imam ar-Redha (A) said : 'Every day, 70,000 angels, after visiting the tomb of the Holy Prophet (S), go to the mausoleum of Imam Ali (A). Know that whoever goes there with humility and wisdom (ma'refat) will have the reward of 100,000 martyrs (shahids), his sins will be forgiven and the angels will welcome him and then escort him until his return home. If he falls ill, they will come to visit him, and if he dies, they will attend his burial and will invoke his pardon.'15

Imam as-Sadiq (A) said the reward to visit the tomb of his grandfather Imam Ali (A) : « Near the city of Kufa is a tomb, and every sick person who goes on a pilgrimage and prays 2 or 4 rakaats of salaah, God will solve his problems and grant his wishes. »He was asked: « Does this hadeeth relate to Imam Hussein (A) ? » He replied: « No, it concerns the grave of my grandfather Amir al-Mo'minin (A). »16

Imam as-Sadiq (A) also said : « Whoever goes with wisdom and humility to the pilgrimage of my grandfather the Amir al-Mo'minin (A), God will grant him for every step [he will conduct in this direction], a reward equivalent of Hajj and an Umrah accepted. And each of its dusty footsteps, whether on foot or on a mount, will not burn in Hell. »17

14: Al Kafi, volume 4, page 579
15: Bihar al Anwar, volume 100 page 257
16: Wasa'il al-Shiʿa, volume 10 page 295
17: Same, volume 10, page 294

children.name: 2- How to carry out the visit correctly?

text.html:
Just as the thirsty throws himself on water and the hungry on bread, we must also put ourselves in the spiritual condition of feeling such an impulse to make the pilgrimage.

Imam as-Sadiq (A) said : « If the Qur'an orders : « Put on your adornment in every place [and during] prayers »18 , which means doing the ghusl for the pilgrimage of each Imam. »19

He also said : « When you want to go to the pilgrimage of Imam Ali (A), do the ghusl, put on beautiful clothes, clean or new, and wear a specific perfume. »20

The washing ordinance (ghusl) symbolizes washing one's sins away. To wear clean and neat clothing and a specific perfume is to make efforts to elevate one's soul, improve one's physical appearance and have a sincere desire to perform the pilgrimage.

Perfume yourself with the perfume of Ali (A) and other Imams in order to keep away from you the bad smells of sins, that is, bad deeds, such as annoying others or transgressing others’ rights.

It appears from many Riwayat that certain specific rites must be respected during the pilgrimage :

1- To carry out the ablution (ghusl) of the whole body
2- Avoid inappropriate words and behavior
3- To remove external and internal impurities from the body and all clothing.
4- Walk slowly
5- Cultivate humility and wisdom (ma'refat),
6- To perfume, except for the pilgrimage of Imam Hussein (a) (or on the contrary, it is not advised to be perfumed),
7- To devote oneself to invocations (dhikr), praises to God (tasbih) and blessings to the Holy Prophet (S)
8- Recite the permission to enter (Izne Dukhul)
9- Recite the ziyarat taught to us by our Imams
10- During ziyarat, turn your attention to God in order to feel the sensitivity of the heart and not to disturb others.

18: Qur’an : Chapter 7, verse 31
19: Wasa'il al-Shia, volume 10 page 303
20: Bihar al Anwar, volume 100 page 281

There are two kinds of ziyarat : a general ziyarat, which can be recited any day, and the other specific, which is recited on certain days.

Concerning the general ziyarat, when one is about to go out :

اَللّهُمَّ اِنّى خَرَجْتُ مِنْ مَنْزِلى، اَبْغى فَضْلَکَ وَ اَزوُرُ وَصِىَّ نَبِيِّکَ، صَلَواتُکَ عَلَيْهِما، فَيَسِّرْ ذلِکَ لى وَ سَبِّبِ الْمَزارَ لَهُ وَ اخْلُفْنى فى عاقِبَتى وَ حُزانَتى بِاَحْسَنِ الْخِلافَةِ يا اَرْحَمَ الرّاحِمينَ

O Allah, I leave my house seeking Your bounties and visiting the Viceroy of Your Prophet—peace of You be upon both of them. So, O Allah, (please do) make it easy for me, help me pay this visit to him, and take my place, while I am away, in my affairs and possessions in the best manner of taking place. O’ the most Merciful of all those who show mercy!

Aallahumma inni kharajto min manzely, abghi fadhlak wa azooro waswiya nabiyek, swalawatoka alayhema, fayassir dhaleka lee wa sabbebil mazeera lahu wakhlufni fee ‘aakebatee wa hoznatee be-eHasanil khilafate ya arhamar raahemin.

Recite the dhikr and the salawat, while going to the haram of Imam Ali (A). When we see the dome of the haram, recite :

اَلْحَمْدُلِلّهِ عَلى مَا اخْتَصَّنى بِهِ مِنْ طيبِ الْمَوْلِدِ وَ اسْتَخْلَصَنى اِكْرامآ بِهِ مِنْ مُوالاةِ الاَبْرارِ السَّفَرَةِ الاَطْهارِ وَ الْخِيَرَةِ الاَعْلامِ،
اَللّهُمَّ فَتَقَبَّلْ سَعْيى اِلَيْکَ وَ تَضَرُّعى بَيْنَ يَدَيْکَ وَ اغْفِرْ لى الذُّنوُبَ الَّتى لا تَخْفى عَلَيْکَ، اِنَّکَ اَنْتَ اللّهُ الْمَلِکُ الْغَفّارُ

All praise be to Allah, for He has conferred upon me exclusively the legitimacy of birth, and for He has bestowed me, out of His honoring me, with the loyalty to the pious, immaculate representatives (of Him), who are the best of all, and the most knowledgeable. O Allah, (please do) accept my search for for You and my earnest imploration in Your Presence and (please do) forgive my sins that cannot be hidden from You. Verily, You are Allah, the King, the All-forgiving.

Alhamdu lillaahe a’laa makh-tassanee behi min teybil mawlede was-takhlasanee ikraaman behi min mowaalaatil abraaris safaratil at haare wal kheyaratil aa’-laame, allaahumma fataqabbal sa’-yee elayka wa tadharro’e bayna yadayka waghfirley dhonoobal latee laa takhfaa a’layka, innaka antallaahul malekul ghaffaar

When you arrive at the inner courtyard gate, say :

اللّهُمَّ اِنَّ هذَا الْحَرَمَ حَرَمُکَ، وَالْمَقامَ مَقامُکَ، وَاَنَا اَدْخُلُ اِلَيْهِ، اُناجيکَ بِما اَنْتَ اَعْلَمُ بِهِ مِنّى وَمِنْ سِرّى وَنَجْواىَ، اَلْحَمْدُلِلّهِ الْحَنّانِ المَنّانِ، المُتَطَوِّلِ الَّذى مِنْ تَطَوُّلِهِ سَهَّلَ لى زِيارَةَ مَوْلاىَ بِاِحْسانِهِ، وَلَمْ يَجْعَلْنى عَنْ زِيارَتِهِ مَمْنُوعآ، وَلا عَنْ وِلايَتِهِ مَدْفُوعآ، بَلْ تَطَوَّلَ وَمَنَحَ، اَللّهُمَّ كَما مَنَنْتَ عَلَىَّ بِمَعْرِفَتِهِ، فَاجْعَلْنى مِنْ شيعَتِهِ وَاَدْخِلْنى الجَنَّةَ بِشَفاعَتِهِ يا اَرْحَمَ الرّاحِمينَ

O Allah, this holy zone is verily Yours, this place is Yours, and I am entering here so as to reveal to You things that You are more knowledgeable than I am. As well as You are more knowledgeable than I am as regards my secrets and my confidential speech.
All praise be to Allah, the All-benevolent, the All-favorer, the All-munificent, Who, out of His munificence, has made it easy for me to visit my master, Who has not made me banned from visiting him, and Who has not included me with those who are prevented from being loyal to his (Divinely commissioned) leadership; rather, He has bestowed upon me and donated me (this favor).
Mon O Allah, just as You have conferred upon me with the favor of recognition of him, so also (please do) include me with his adherents (Shias) and allow me to enter Paradise by means of his intercession, O most merciful of all those who show mercy.

Allaahumma inna haadhal haram haramoka, wal maqaam maqaamoka, wa anna adkholo elayhe, onaajeeka bemaaa anta aa’lamo behi minnee wa min sirree wa najwaaya, alhamdu lillaahil hannaanil-mannaanil motaa tawwelil ladhee min ta-tawwolehi sahhala lee zeyaarat mawlaaya be ehsaanehi, wa lam yaj-aa’lnee a’n zeyaaratehi mamnooan, wa laa a’n welaayatehi madfooa’n, bal tatwawwala wa manaha, allaahumma kamaa mananta a’layya be ma’refatehi, faj-a’lnee min sheea’tehi wa adkhilnil jannata be shafaa-a’tehi yaa arhamar raahemeen

Enter the courtyard (riwaq) and recite :

اَشْهَدُ اَنْ لا اِلهَ اِلاَّ اللّهُ، وَحْدَهُ لا شَريکَ لَهُ، وَاَشْهَدُ اَنَّ مُحَمَّداً عَبْدُهُ وَرَسُولُهُ، جآءَ بِالْحَقِّ مِنْ عِنْدِهِ وَصَدَّقَ الْمُرْسَلينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ يارَسُولَ اللّهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ ياحَبيبَ اللّهِ وَخِيَرَتَهُ مِنْ خَلْقِهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى اَميرِالْمُؤْمِنينَ عَبْدِاللّهِ وَاَخى رَسُولِ اللّهِ، يامَوْلاىَ يا اَميرَالْمُؤْمِنينَ عَبْدُکَ وَابْنُ عَبْدِکَ وَابْنُ اَمَتِکَ، جآءَکَ مُسْتَجيراً بِذِمَّتِکَ، قاصِداً اِلى حَرَمِکَ مُتَوَجِّهاً اِلى مَقامِکَ، مُتَوَسِّلاً اِلَى اللّهِ تَعالى بِکَ، ءَاَدْخُلُ يامَوْلاىَ ءَاَدْخُلُ يا اَميرَالْمُؤْمِنينَ، ءَاَدْخُلُ ياحُجَّةَ اللّهِ، ءَاَدْخُلُ يااَمينَ اللّهِ، ءَاَدْخُلُ يامَلائِكَةَ اللّهِ الْمُقيمينَ الْمُقَرَّبينَ فى هذَا الْمَشْهَدِ، يامَوْلاىَ اَتَاْذَنُ لى بِالدُّخُولِ اَفْضَلَ ما اَذِنْتَ لاِحَدٍ مِنْ اَوْلِيآئِکَ، فَاِنْ لَمْ اَكُنْ لَهُ اَهْلاً فَاَنْتَ اَهْلٌ لِذلِکَ.

I bear witness that there is no god but Allah, alone without having any associate, and I bear witness that Muhammad is His servant and Messenger. He has conveyed the truth from Him and verified the (past) Messengers.
Peace be upon you, O Messenger of Allah! Peace be upon you, O most-beloved of Allah and best of His beings! Peace be upon the Commander of the Faithful: the servant of Allah and the brother of Allah’s Messenger. O master, O commander of the faithful!
I, your slave and the son of your slave and your bondmaid, have come to you seeking the refuge of your protection, directing to your shrine, turning my face toward your place, and begging Almighty Allah in your name.
May I enter, O master? May I enter, O commander of the faithful? May I enter O argument of Allah? May I enter O trustee of Allah? May I enter O angels of Allah who reside in this shrine? O master, may you permit me to enterin the best way of permission you have ever given to any of your devotees? If I am not able to deserve your permission, then You are too glorious to deprive me of it.

Ash hado an laa elaaha illallaaho, wahdahu laa shareeka lahu, wa ash hado anna mohammadan a’bdohu wa rasoolohu, jaaa-a bilhaqqe min i’nde hi wa swaddaqal mursaleen, assalaamo a’layka yaa rasoolallaahe ,assalaamo a’layka yaa habee ballaahe wa kheyaratahu min khalqehi, assalaamo a’laa ameeril momineen A’bdillaahe wa akhee rasoolillaahe, yaa mawlaaya yaa ameeral momineen, a’bdoka wabno a’bdeka wabno amateka, jaaa-aka mustajeeran, be dhimmateka, qaasedan elaa harameka mutawajjehan elaa maqaa meka, mutawasselan elallaahe ta-a’alaa beak, a-adkholo yaa mawlaaya a-adkholo yaa ameeral momineen, a-adkholo yaa hujjatallaahe, a-adkolo ya ameenallaahe, a-adkholo yaa malaa ekatillaahil moqeemeenal moqarrAbain fee haadhal mash-hade, yaa mawlaaya a-taadhano lee bid dokhoole afdhwala maa adhinta le-ahadin min awleyaaa-eka, fa-in lam akun lahu, ahlan fa-anta ahlun ledhaalek

Then, after having kissed the door of the mausoleum (where the tomb is), enter by advancing the right foot then the left, saying :

بِسْمِ اللّهِ وَبِاللّهِ وَفى سَبيلِ اللّهِ وَعَلى مِلَّةِ رَسُولِ اللّهِ صَلَّى اللّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ اَللّهُمَّ اغْفِرْلى وَارْحَمْنى وَتُبْ عَلَىَّ اِنَّکَ اَنْتَ التَّوّابُ الرَّحيمُ

In the Name of Allah (I begin), in Allah (I trust), on the way of Allah, and on the norm of the Messenger of Allah (I proceed), may Allah bless him and his Progeny. O Allah, (please do) pardon me for You are verily the benevolent forgiver.

Bismillaahe wa billaahe wa fee sabeelillaahe wa a’laa millate rasoolillaahe swallallaaho a’layhe wa aalehi, allaahummagh-fir lee war-hamnee wa tub a’layya innaka antat tawwaabur raheem.

Advance to near the grave, then stop and recite, face to face (and before reaching the grave) :

اَلسَّلامُ مِنَ اللهِ عَلى مُحَمَّدٍ رَسوُلِاللهِ، اَمينِ اللهِ عَلى وَحْيِهِ وَرِسالاتِهِ، وَعَزائِمِ اَمْرِهِ وَمَعْدِنِ الْوَحْىِ، وَالتَّنْزيلِ الْخاتِمِ لِما سَبَقَ، وَالْفاتِحِ لِمَا اسْتُقْبِلَ، وَالْمُهَيْمِنِ عَلى ذلِکَ كُلِّهِ، الشّاهِدِ عَلَى الْخَلْقِ، السِّراجِ الْمُنيرِ وَالسَّلامُ عَلَيْهِ وَرَحْمَةُ اللهُ وَبَرَكاتُهُ، اَللّهُمَّ صَلِّ عَلى مُحَمَّدٍ وَاَهْلِ بَيْتِهِ الْمَظْلوُمينَ، اَفْضَلَ وَاَكْمَلَ وَاَرْفَعَ وَاَشْرَفَ ما صَلَّيْتَ عَلى اَحَدٍ مِنْ اَنْبِيآئِکَ وَرُسُلِکَ وَاَصْفِيآئِکَ، اَللّهُمَّ صَلِّ عَلى اَميرِالْمُؤْمِنينَ عَبْدِکَ وَخَيْرِ خَلْقِکَ بَعْدَ نَبِيِّکَ وَاَخى رَسوُلِکَ وَوَصِىِّ حَبيبِکَ، الَّذِى انْتَجَبْتَهُ مِنْ خَلْقِکَ، وَالدَّليلِ عَلى مَنْ بَعَثْتَهُ بِرِسالاتِکَ وَدَيّانِ الدّينِ بِعَدْلِکَ وَفَصْلِ قَضآئِکَ بَيْنَ خَلْقِکَ، وَالسَّلامُ عَلَيْهِ وَرَحْمَةُ اللهِ وَبَرَكاتُهُ، اَللّهُمَّ صَلِّ عَلَى الاَئِمَّةِ مِنْ وُلْدِهِ، الْقَوّامينَ بِاَمْرِکَ مِنْ بَعْدِهِ، الْمُطَهَّرينَ الَّذينَ ارْتَضَيْتَهُمْ اَنْصاراً لِدينِکَ وَحَفَظَةً لِسِرِّکَ، وَشُهَدآءَ عَلى خَلْقِکَ وَاَعْلاماً لِعِبادِکَ صَلَواتُکَ عَلَيْهِمْ اَجْمَعينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى اَميرِالْمُؤْمِنينَ عَلِىِّ بْنِ اَبي طالِبٍ وَصِىِّ رَسوُلِ اللهِ وَخَليفَتِهِ وَالْقآئِمِ بِاَمْرِهِ مِنْ بَعْدِهِ، سَيِّدِ الْوَصِيّينَ وَرَحْمَةُ اللهِ وَبَرَكاتُهُ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى فاطِمَةَ بِنْتِ رَسوُلِ اللهِ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ الِهِ سَيِّدَةِ نِسآءِ الْعالَمينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَى الْحَسَنِ وَالْحُسَيْنِ سَيِّدَىْ شَبابِ اَهْلِ الْجَنَّةِ مِنَ الْخَلْقِ اَجْمَعينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَى الاَئِمَّةِ الرّاشِدينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَى الاَنْبِيآءِ وَالْمُرْسَلينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَى الاَئِمَّةَ الْمُسْتَوْدَعينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى خآصَّةِ اللهِ مِنْ خَلْقِهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَى الْمُتَوَسِّمينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَى الْمُؤْمِنينَ الَّذينَ قاموُا بِاَمْرِهِ، وَوازَرُوا اَوْلِياءَ اللهِ وَخافوُا بِخَوْفِهِمْ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَى الْمَلائِكَةِ الْمُقَرَّبينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْنا وَعَلى عِبادِاللهِ الصّالِحينَ.

Peace of Allah be upon Muhammad the Messenger of Allah, the trustee of Allah over His Revelations, Messages, and determined commandments, the core of the Divine Inspiration and Revelation, who sealed the previous Messages, paved the way to the coming blessings, who prevails over all that, the witness over the creatures, and the luminous torch. Peace and Allah’s mercy and blessings be upon him.
O Allah, (please do) send blessings upon Muhammad and his Progeny, the oppressed ones, with the best, most perfect, most exalted, and most honored blessings that You have ever showed on anyof Your Prophets, Messengers, and Chosen servants.
O Allah, (please do) send blessings upon the Commander of the Faithful, Your servant, the best of Your creatures after Your Prophet, the brother of Your Messenger, the successor of Your most-beloved one, whom You have selected from among Your beings, the guide to those whom You sent with Your messages, the establisher of the true religion by means of Your justice, and the decisive judge among Your beings. Peace and Allah’s mercy and blessings be upon him. O Allah, (please do) send blessings upon the Imams from his offspring, (who are) the holders of Your commandments after him, and the immaculate ones whom You have accepted as supporters of Your religion, keepers of Your secret, witnesses over Your created beings, and signs (of example) for Your servants. May Your blessings be upon them all. Peace be upon the Commander of the Faithful, Ali the son of Abu-TAlib, the successor of Allah’s Messenger, his representative, who managed his affairs after him, and the master of all Prophet’s successors. May Allah’s mercy and blessings be upon him! Peace be upon Fatimah, the daughter of Allah’s Messenger, may Allah’s blessings be upon her, (she is) the leader of all the women of this world. Peace be upon Hasan and Hussain, the chiefs of the youth of Paradise among all beings. Peace be upon the guiding Imams. Peace be upon the Prophets and the Messengers.!
Peace be upon the Imams whom are entrusted (with the religion by Allah). Peace be upon the elite creatures of Allah. Peace be upon those who understand by symbols.
Peace be upon the faithful believers who have carried out His orders, supported the saints of Allah, and have feared for their fear. Peace be upon the Favorite Angels. Peace be upon us and upon the righteous servants of Allah.

Assalaamo menallaahe a’laa Mohammadin rasoolillaahe, ameenillaahe a’laa wahyehi wa resaalaatehi, wa a’zaa-eme amrehi wa ma’-denil wahye, wa tanzeelil khaateme lemaa sabaqa, wal faatehe lemas-tuqbela, wal mohaymene a’laa dhaaleka kullehish shaahede a’lal khalqis, seraajil moneere, wassalaamo a’layhe wa rahmatullaahe wa barakaatohu, allaahumma swalle a’laa mohammadin wa ahle baytehil madhloomeen, afdhwala wa akmala wa arfa-a’ wa ashrafa maa swallayta a’laa ahadin min ambeyaaa-eka wa rosooleka wa aswfeyaa-eka, allaahumma swalle a’laa ameeril momineen a’bdeka wa khayre khalqeka ba’da nabiyyeka wa akhee rasooleka wa wasiyye habeebekal, ladhin-tajabtahu min khalqeka, wad-daleele a’laa man baa’th-tahu beresaalaa teka wa dayyaanid deene be-a’dleka wa faswle qadhwaaa-eka bayna khalqeka, wassalaamo a’layhe wa rahmatullaahe wa barakaatohu,
Allaahumma swalle a’lal a-immatemin wuldehil qawwaameena be-amreka min baa’-dehil, motwahhareenal ladheenar tadhwaytahum ansaaran le-deeneka wa hafadhwatan le sirreka wa shohadaaa-a a’laa khalqeka wa aa’-laaman le-e’baadeka swalawaatoka a’layhim ajma-e’en .
Assalaamo a’laa ameeril momineena a’lyyibne abee taalebin wasiyye rasoolillaahe wa khaleefatehi wal qaaa-eme be-amrehi min baa’-dehi, sayyedil wasiyyeen wa rahmuatullaahe wa barakaatoh.
Assalaamo a’laa faatemata binte rasoolillaahe salallaaho a’layhe wa aalehi sayyedate nesaaa-il a’alameena, assalaamo a’lal Hasane wal hussayne sayyeday shabaabe ahlil jannate menal khalqe ajma-e’en.
Assalaamo a’lal a-immatir raashedeena, assalaamo a’lal ambeyaaa-e wal mursaleen, assalaamo a’lal a-immatil mustawde-e’ena, assalaamo a’laa khesswatillaahe min khalqehi, assalaamo a’lal motawasse meena. assalaamo a’lal momineenal ladheena qaamoo be-amrehi wa waazaroo awleyaaa-allaahe wa khaafoo be khawfehim , assalaamo a’lal malaaa-ekatil moqarra beena, assalaamo a’laynaa wa a’laa e’baadillaahis saaleheena.

Then, approach the tomb, stop in front of it (back to the Qiblah), and say :

اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ يااَمْيرَالْمُؤْمِنينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ ياحَبيبَ اللّهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ ياصَفْوَةَ اللّهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ ياوَلِىَّ اللّهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ ياحُجَّةَ اللّهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ يااِمامَ الْهُدى، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ ياعَلَمَ التُّقى، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ اَيُّهَا الْوَصِىُّ الْبَرُّ التَّقِىُّ النَّقِىُّ الْوَفِىُّ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ يااَبَاالْحَسَنِ وَالْحُسَيْنِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ ياعَمُودَ الدّينِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ ياسَيِّدَ الْوَصِيّينَ وَاَمينَ رَبِّ الْعالَمينَ، وَدَيّانَ يَوْمِ الدّينِ وَخَيْرَ الْمُؤْمِنينَ، وَسَيِّدَ الصِّدّيقينَ وَالصَّفْوَةَ مِنْ سُلالَةِ النَّبِيّينَ، وَبابَ حِكْمَةِ رَبِّ الْعالَمينَ، وَخازِنَ وَحْيِهِ وَعَيْبَةَ عِلْمِهِ، وَالنّاصِحَ لاُمَّةِ نَبِىِّهِ وَالتّالِىَ لِرَسُولِهِ وَالْمُواسِىَ لَهُ بِنَفْسِهِ، وَالنّاطِقَ بِحُجَّتِهِ وَالدّاعِىَ اِلى شَريعَتِهِ وَالْماضِىَ عَلى سُنَّتِهِ، اَللّهُمَّ اِنّى اَشْهَدُ اَنَّهُ قَدْ بَلَّغَ عَنْ رَسُولِکَ ما حُمِّلَ وَرَعى مَا اسْتُحْفِظَ، وَحَفِظَ مَااسْتَوْدِعَ وَحَلَّلَ حَلالَکَ وَحَرَّمَ حَرامَکَ وَاَقامَ اَحْكامَکَ، وَجاهَدَ النّاكِثينَ فى سَبيلِکَ وَالْقاسِطينَ فى حُكْمِکَ وَالْمارِقينَ عَنْ اَمْرِکَ صابِراً مُحْتَسِباً، لاتَاْخُذُهُ فيکَ لَوْمَةُ لائِمٍ، اَللّهُمَّ صَلِّ عَلَيْهِ اَفْضَلَ ماصَلَّيْتَ عَلى اَحَدٍ مِنْ اَوْلِيآئِکَ وَاَصْفِيآئِکَ وَاَوْصِيآءِ اَنْبِيآئِکَ، اَللّهُمَّ هذا قَبْرُ وَلِيِّکَ الَّذى فَرَضْتَ طاعَتَهُ، وَجَعَلْتَ فى اَعْناقِ عِبادِکَ مُبايَعَتَهُ، وَخَليفَتِکَ الَّذى بِهِ تَأْخُذُ وَتُعْطى وَبِهِ تُثيبُ وَتُعاقِبُ، وَقَدْ قَصَدْتُهُ طَمَعاً لِما اَعْدَدْتَهُ لاَوْلِيآئِکَ، فَبِعَظيمِ قَدْرِهِ عِنْدَکَ وَجَليلِ خَطَرِهِ لَدَيْکَ وَقُرْبِ مَنْزِلَتِهِ مِنْکَ، صَلِّ عَلى مُحَمَّدٍ وَالِ مُحَمَّدٍ وَافْعَلْ بى ما اَنْتَ اَهْلُهُ فَاِنَّکَ اَهْلُ الْكَرَمِ وَالْجُودِ، وَالسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ يامَوْلاىَ وَعَلى ضَجيعَيْکَ آدَمَ وَنُوحٍ وَرَحْمَةُ اللّهِ وَبَرَكاتُهُ.

Peace be upon you, O Commander of the Faithful. Peace be upon you, O beloved by Allah. Peace be upon you, O choice of Allah. Peace be upon you, O intimate servant of Allah. Peace be upon you, O Argument of Allah (against His creatures). Peace be upon you, O leader of true guidance. Peace be upon you, O sign of piety. Peace be upon you, O successor, religious, pious, pure, and loyal. Peace be upon you, O father of al-Hasan and al-Hussain. Peace be upon you, O pillar of the religion. Peace be upon you, O chief of the successors (of Prophets), trustee of the Lord of the worlds, judge on the Judgment Day, best of the believers, chief of the most truthful ones, elite of the Prophets’ lineage, door to the wisdom of the Lord of the worlds, keeper of His Revelation, container of His knowledge, advisor of His Prophet’s people, next to His Messenger, who sacrificed himself for him (i.e. for the Messenger), speaker with his arguments, inviter to his principles, and steadfast on his instructions.

O Allah, I do bear witness that he carried out the mission conveyed to him by Your Messenger, achieved what he was ordered to keep, kept what has been stored with him, deemed lawful that which You deem lawful, deemed unlawful that which You deem unlawful, put into practice Your laws, struggled against the contraveners for Your sake, against the wrongdoers according to Your laws, and against the apostates from Your decree, did all that with steadfastness, expecting Your reward, and no blame of any blamer could ever influence him.

O Allah, (please do) send blessings upon him with the best wayYou have ever blessed any of Your intimate servants, Your selected ones, and Your Prophet’s successors.

O Allah, this is the tomb of Your representative the obedience to whom has been made by You incumbent (upon us), the loyalty to whom has been made by You in the necks of Your servants, and (it is the tomb of) Your viceroy through whom You will give and take, and through whom You will reward and punish. I have directed to him, seeking for what You have prepared for Your intimate servants. So, (I beseech You) in the name of his eminent standing with You, in the name of his great status in Your view, and in the name of the closeness of his position to You, to bless Muhammad and the Progeny of Muhammadand to do to me that which is expected from You, for You are verily worthy of honoring and generous granting. Peace be upon you, O my master, and upon your partners in the place, (Prophet) Adam and (Prophet) Noah. May Allah’s mercy and blessings be upon you!

Assalaamo a’layka ya ameeral momineen, assalaamo a’layka yaa habeeballahe, assalaamo a’layka yaa swafwatallaahe, assalaamo a’layka yaa wAliyyallaahe, assalaamo a’layka yaa hujjatallaahe, assalaamo a’layka yaa emaamal hodaa, assalaamo a’layka ya a’lamat toqaa, assalaamo a’layka ayyohal wasiyyul barrut taqiyyun naqiyyul wafiyyo , asaaaamo a’layka yaa Abal Hasane wal hussayne, assalaamo a’layka yaa a’moodad deene assalaamo a’layka yaa sayyedal wasiyyeena wa ameen rabbil a’alameen wa dayyaana yawmid deene wa khayral momineena wa sayyedas siddeeqeena wa swafwata min solaalatin nabiyyeen wa baab hikmate rabbil a’alameena wa khaazena wahyehi wa a’ybata i’lmehi wan naaseha le-ummata nabiyyehi wat-taaleya, le rasoolehi wal mowaaseya lahu benafsehi wan naateqa ,behujjatehi wa daa-e’ya ilaa sharee aa ‘tehi wal maadhweya a’laa sunnatehi.
Allaahumma innee ash-hado annahu qad ballagha a‘n rasooleka, maa hummela wa ra-a’a mas-tohfedha wa hafedha mas-toode-a’ wa hallala halaalaka wa harrama haraamaka wa aqaama ahkaameka wa jaahadan naakeseena fee sabeeleka wal qaaseteena fee hukmeka wal maareqeena a’n amreka saaberan mohtaseban laa taakhodhohu feeka lawmato laaa-em, allaahumma swalle a’layhe afdhwala maa sallayta a’laa ahadin min awleyaaa-eka wa asfeyaaa-eka wa awseyaaa-e ambeyaaa-eka allaahumma haazaa qabro wAliyyekal ladhee faradhta taa-aa’tahu wa ja-a’lta fee aa’-naaqe e’baadeka mobaaaya –a’tahu,wa khaleefatekal ladhee behi taakhodho wa toa’-tee wa behi, toseebo wa to-a’aqebo wa qad qasadtohu tama-a’n lemaa, aa’-dad-tahu le-awleyaaa-eka fabe-a’dheeme qadrehi i’ndaka wa jalee le khatarehi ladayka wa qurba manzela tehi minka sale aa’laa mohammadin wa aale mohammad waf-a’l bee maa anta ahlohu fa-innaka ahlul karame wal joode wassalaamo a’layka yaa mawlaaya wa a’laa dhwajee-a’yka Aadama wa noohin wa rahmatullaahe wa barakaatohu .

Then, kiss the grave, stop at the level of the head and say :

يا مَوْلاىَ اِلَيْکَ وُفوُدى وَبِکَ اَتَوَسَّلُ اِلى رَبّى فى بُلُوغِ مَقْصُودى، وَاَشْهَدُ اَنَّ الْمُتَوَسِّلَ بِکَ غَيْرُ خآئِبٍ، وَالطّالِبَ بِکَ عَنْ مَعْرِفَةٍ غَيْرُ مَردُودٍ اِلّا بِقَضآءِ حَوآئِجِهِ، فَكُنْ لى شَفيعاً اِلىَ اللّهِ رَبِّکَ وَرَبّى، فى قَضآءِ حَوآئِجى وَتَيْسيرِ اُمُورى وَكَشْفِ شِدَّتى وَغُفْرانِ ذَنْبى وَسَعَةِ رِزْقى وَتَطْويلِ عُمْرى وَاِعْطاءِ سُؤْلى فى آخِرَتى وَدُنْياىَ، اَللّهُمَّ الْعَنْ قَتَلَةَ اَميرِالْمُؤْمِنينَ، اَللّهُمَّ الْعَنْ قَتَلَةَ الْحَسَنِ وَالْحُسَيْنِ، اَللّهُمَّ الْعَنْ قَتَلَةَ اَلاَئِمَّةِ وَعَذِّبْهُمْ عَذاباً اَليماً لا تُعَذِّبُهُ اَحَداً مِنَ الْعالَمينَ، عَذاباً كَثيراً لاَ انْقِطاعَ لَهُ وَلا اَجَلَ وَلا اَمَدَ بِماشآقّوُا وُلاةَ اَمْرِکَ، وَاَعِدَّ لَهُمْ عَذاباً لَمْ تُحِلَّهُ بِاَحَدٍ مِنْ خَلْقِکَ، اَللّهُمَّ وَاَدْخِلْ عَلى قَتَلَةِ اَنْصارِ رَسُولِکَ وَعَلى قَتَلَةِ اَميرِالْمُؤْمِنينَ وَ عَلى قَتَلَةِ الْحَسَنِ وَالْحُسَيْنِ، وَعَلى قَتَلَةِ اَنْصارِ الْحَسَنِ وَالْحُسَيْنِ، وَقَتَلَةِ مَنْ قُتِلَ فى وِلايَةِ آلِ مُحَمَّدٍ اَجْمَعينَ، عَذاباً اَليماً مُضاعَفاً فى اَسْفَلِ دَرَکٍ مِنَ الْجَحيمِ، لايُخَفَّفُ عَنْهُمُ الْعَذابُ وَهُمْ فيهِ مُبْلِسُونَ مَلْعُونُونَ، ناكِسُوا رُؤُسِهِمْ عِنْدَ رَبِّهِمْ قَدْ عايَنُوا النَّدامَةَ وَالْخِزْىَ الطَّويلَ لِقَتْلِهِمْ عِتْرَةَ اَنْبِيآئِکَ وَرُسُلِکَ وَاَتْباعَهُمْ مِنْ عِبادِکَ الصّالِحينَ، اَللّهُمَّ الْعَنْهُمْ فى مُسْتَسِرِّ السِّرِّ وَظاهِرِ الْعَلانِيَةِ فى اَرْضِکَ وَسَمآئِکَ، اَللّهُمَّ اجْعَلْ لى قَدَمَ صِدْقٍ فى اَوْلِيآئِکَ وَحَبِّبْ اِلَىَّ مَشاهِدَهُمْ وَمُسْتَقَرَّهُمْ حَتّى تُلْحِقَنى بِهِمْ وَتَجْعَلَنى لَهُمْ تَبَعاً فِى الدُّنْيا وَالاْخِرَةِ يا اَرْحَمَ الرّاحِمينَ.

O my master, to You is my approaching and in your name do I beseech my Lord so that I may achieve my goal. I bear witness that he who beseeches (Allah) in your name shall never be disappointed and he who implores (Allah) in your name, with full cognizance, shall never be rejected; rather, all his needs shall be settled. So, (please) be my interceder to Allah—my and your Lord—for purpose of settling my needs, making easy my affairs, relieving my melancholies, forgiving my sins, expanding my sustenance sources, extending my lifetime, and granting me all my requests for the world to come as well as this world.

O Allah, curse the murderers of the Commander of the Faithful. O Allah, curse the murderers of Hasan and Hussain. O Allah, curse the murderers of the Imams, and subject them to such a painful punishment that You have never subjected any of Your creatures to it, such an enormous punishment that never ceases, nor comes to an end, nor reaches a deadline, for what they contended against Your authorities. And (please do) prepare for them such an intense torture that You have not decided for any of Your creatures.
O Allah, (please do) impose upon the murderers of Your Messenger’s supporters, the killers of the Commander of the Faithful, the killers of Hasan and Hussain, the murderers of the supporters of Hasan and Hussain, and the killers of all those whom were killed because of their loyalty to the Children of Muhammad, a painful, cyclic punishment in the lowest class of Hellfire that the punishment shall not be lightened for them and they shall lay there in utter despair and endless curse; they shall be hanging down their heads before their Lord after they shall find out with certainty regret and long-lasting disgrace, for they killed the members of the offspring of Your Prophets and Messengers and the righteous servants from their followers.

O Allah, (do) curse them in the most concealed secrecy and in the most apparent openness, in Your lands and in Your heavens. O Allah, (please do) decide for me a truthful step with Your intimate servants and make me long for their shrines and their residing-places until You include me with them and make me among their followers in this world as well as the world to come. O most Merciful of all those who show mercy!

Yaa mawlaaya elayka wofoodee wa beka atawassalo elaa rabbee fee bolooghe maqsoodee wa ash-hado annal motawassela beka ghayro khaaa-ebin wat taaleba beka a’maa’-refatin ghayro mardoodin illaa beqadhaaa-e hawaa-ejehi fakun lee shafee-a’n elallaahe rabbeka wa rabbee fee qadhwaaa-e hawaaa-eje wa tayseere omooree wa kashfe shiddatee, wa ghufraane dhambee wa sa-a’te rizqee wa tatweele u’mree wa ea’-taaa-eso –oolee fee aakheratee wa dunyaaya
Allaahummal a’n qatalata ameeril momineena, allaahummal a’n qatalatal Hasane wal hussayne, allahummal-a’n qatalatal aa-immate wa a’dhibhum a’dhaaban aleeman laa to-a’dhibohu ahadan menal aa’alameena a’dhaaban kaseeran lan-qetaa a’lahu wa laa ajala wa laa amada bemaa shaaqqoo wolaate amreka wa a-i’dda lahum adhaban lam tohillahu be-ahadin min khalqeka
Allahummaa wa adkhil a’laa qatalate ansaare rasooleka wa a’laa qatalate ameeril momineen wa a’laa qatalatil Hasane wal hussayne wa a’laa qatalate ansaaril Hasane wal hussayne wa qatalate man qotela fee welaayate aale mohammadin ajma-e’ena adhAban aleeman mozaa-e’fan fee asfale darakin menal jaheeme laa yukhaffafo a’nhomul a’zaabo wa hum feehi mublesoona mal-o’onoona naakesoo ro-oosehim i’nda rabbehim qad a’ayanun nadaamata wal jiizyat taweela leqatlehim i’trata ambeyaaa-eka wa rosoleka wa atbaa-a’hum, min e’baadekas saaleheena
Allaahummal a’nhum fee mustasirris sirre wa dhwaaheril a’laaneyate fee ardhweka wa samaaa-eka allaahummaj-a’l lee qadama sidqin fee awleyaaa-eka wa habbib elayya mashaaheda hum wa mustaqarrahum hatta tulheqanee behim wa taj-a’lanee lahum taba-a’n fid dunyaa wal aakherate yaa arhamar raahemeen

Then, kiss the grave, and stand in the direction of the tomb of Imam Hussein (A) in Karbala, back to the Qiblah, and say :

اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ يا اَباعَبْدِاللّهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ يَاَبْنَ رَسُولِ اللّهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ يَابْنَ اَميرِالْمُؤْمِنينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ يَابْنَ فاطِمَةَ الزَّهْرآءِ سَيِّدَةِ نِسآءِ الْعالَمينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ يااَبَا الاَئِمَّةِ الْهادينَ الْمَهْدِييّنَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ ياصَريعَ الدَّمْعَةِ السّاكِبَةِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ ياصاحِبَ الْمُصيبَةِ الرّاتِبَةِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ وَعَلى جَدِّکَ وَاَبيکَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ وَعَلى اُمِّکَ وَاَخيکَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ وَعَلَى الاَئِمَّةِ مِنْ ذُرِّيَّتِکَ وَبَنيکَ، اَشْهَدُ لَقَدْ طَيَّبَ اللّهُ بِکَ التُّرابَ، وَاَوْضَحَ بِکَ الْكِتابَ وَجَعَلَکَ وَاَباکَ وَجَدَّکَ وَاَخاکَ وَبَنيکَ عِبْرَةً لاِوُلِى الاَلْبابِ، يَابْنَ الْمَيامينِ الاَطْيابِ التّالينَ الْكِتابَ، وَجَّهْتُ سَلامى اِلَيْکَ صَلَواتُ اللّهِ وَسَلامُهُ عَلَيْکَ، وَجَعَلَ اَفْئِدَةً مِنَ النّاسِ تَهْوى اِلَيْکَ، ماخابَ مَنْ تَمَسَّکَ بِکَ وَلَجَأَ اِلَيْکَ.

Peace be upon you, O Aba Abdillah. Peace be upon you, O son of Allah’s Messenger. Peace be upon you, O son of the Commander of the Faithful. Peace be upon you, O son of Fatimah, the luminous lady, the leader of all women of the worlds. Peace be upon you, O father of the Imams—the guides and well-guided. Peace be upon you, O victim of the pouring tears. Peace be upon you, O man of the disastrous misfortune. Peace be upon you and upon your grandfather and father. Peace be upon you and upon your mother and brother. Peace be upon you and upon the Imams from your offspring and descendants. I bear witness that Allah has purified the soil (on which you fell down) through you, has made clear His Book through you, and has made you, your father, your grandfather, your brother, and your descendants examples for the owners of intellects. O son of the blessed, purified oneswho recite (and apply) the Book utterly, I direct my greetings to you. May Allah make His peace and blessings to be upon youand may He make the hearts of some people yearn toward you. Disappointment shall never chase him who adheres to you and resorts to you.

Assalaamo a’layka yaa Abaa Abdillaahe
assalaamo a’layka yabna rasoolillaahe
assalaamo a’layka yabna ameeril momineenassalaamo a’layka yaa Abal a –immatil haadeenal mahdiyyeena
asalaamo a’layka yaa saree-a’d dam-a’tis saakebate
assalaamo a’layka ya saahebal moseebatir raatebate
assalaamo a’layka wa a’laa jaddeka wa abeeka
asaallamo a’layka wa a’laa ummeka wa akheeka
assalaamo a’layka wa a’lal a-immate min dhurreeyateka wa baneeka
ash-hado laqad tayyAballaaho bekat toraaba
waawzaho bekal ketaaba wa ja-a’laka wa Abaaka wa jaddaka waakhaaka wa baneeka i’bratan leoolil albaabe
yabnal mayaameenal atyaabit taaleenal ketaaba
wajjahto salaamee elayka salawaatullaahe wa salaamohu a’layka
wa ja-a’la af-edatan menan naase tahwee elayka
maa khaba man tamassaka beka wa laja-a elayka.

Then, stand at the level of the legs and say :

اَلسَّلامُ عَلى اَبِى الاَئِمَّةِ وَخَليلِ النُّبُوَّةِ وَالْمَخْصُوصِ بِالاُخُوَّةِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى يَعْسُوبِ الدّينِ وَالاْيمانِ وَكَلِمَةِ الرَّحْمنِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى ميزانِ الاَعْمالِ وَمُقَلِّبِ الاَحْوالِ وَسَيْفِ ذِى الْجَلالِ وَساقِى السَّلْسَبيلِ الزُّلالِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى صالِحِ الْمُؤْمِنينَ وَوارِثِ عِلْمِ النَّبِيّينَ وَالْحاكِمِ يَوْمِ الدّينِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى شَجَرَةِ التَّقْوى وَسامِعِ السِّرِّ وَالنَّجْوى، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى حُجَّةِ اللّهِ الْبالِغَةِ وَنِعْمَتِهِ السّابِغَةِ وَنِقْمَتِهِ الدّامِغَةِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَى الصِّراطِ الْواضِحِ وَالنَّجْمِ الّلائِحِ وَالاِمامِ النّاصِحِ وَالزِّنادِ الْقادِحِ وَرَحْمَةُ اللّهِ وَبَرَكاتُهُ

Peace be upon the father of the Imams, the intimate friend of Prophethood, and the marked, exclusively, by fraternity (with the Holy Prophet). Peace be upon the head of the religion and faith, and the word of the All-beneficent Lord. Peace be upon the Scale of the deeds the turner over of manners, the sword of the Lord of Majesty, and who supplies with the fresh water of Salsabil. Peace be upon the most righteous of the believers, the inheritor of the Prophet’s knowledge, and the judge on the Judgment Day. Peace be upon the tree of piety and the hearer of hidden and confidential speeches. Peace be upon Allah’s conclusive argument, His flowing boon, and His forceful punishment. Peace be upon the clear-cut path, the patent star, the advising leader, and the igniting firelock. May Allah’s mercy and blessings be upon him!

assalaamo a’laa abil a-immate wa khaleelin nobuwwate wal makhsoose bil okhuwwate
assalaamo a’laa yaa’-soobid deene wal eemaane wa kalematir rahmaane
assalaamo a’laa meezaanil aa’-maale wa moqallebil ahwaale
wa sayfe dhil halaale wa saaqis salsabeeliz dholaale
assalaamo a’laa saAlihil momineena wa waaresei’lmin nabiyyeena wa haakeme yawmid deene
assalaamo a’laa shajaratit taqwaa wa saame-is sirre wan najwaa
assalaamo a’laa hujjatillaahil baaleghate wanea’-matehis saabeghate wa niqmatehid daameghate
asaalaamo a’las seraatil waadhehe wan-najmillaa-ehe wal immaamin naasehe waz zenaadil qaadehe wa rahmatullaahe wabarakaatohu

Then say :

اَللّهُمَّ صَلِّ عَلى اَميرِالْمُؤْمِنينَ عَلِىِّ بْنِ اَبي طالِبٍ، اَخى نَبِيِّکَ وَوَلِيِّهِ وَناصِرِهِ وَوَصِيِّهِ وَ وَزيرِهِ وَ مُسْتَوْدَعِ عِلْمِهِ، وَمَوْضِعِ سِرِّهِ وَبابِ حِكْمَتِهِ وَالنّاطِقِ بِحُجَّتِهِ وَالدّاعى اِلى شَريعَتِهِ وَخَليفَتِهِ فى اُمَّتِهِ، وَمُفَرِّجِ الْكَرْبِ عَنْ وَجْهِهِ، قاصِمِ الْكَفَرَةِ وَمُرْغِمِ الْفَجَرَةِ الَّذى جَعَلْتَهُ مِنْ نَبِيِّکَ بِمَنْزِلَةِ هرُونَ مِنْ مُوسى، اَللّهُمَّ والِ مَنْ والاهُ وَعادِ مَنْ عاداهُ وَانْصُرْ مَنْ نَصَرَهُ وَاخْذُلْ مَنْ خَذَلَهُ وَالْعَنْ مَنْ نَصَبَ لَهُ مِنَ الاَوَّلينَ وَالاْخِرينَ وَصَلِّ عَلَيْهِ اَفْضَلَ ماصَلَّيْتَ عَلى اَحَدٍ مِنْ اَوْصِيآءِ اَنْبِيآئِکَ يارَبَّ الْعالَمينَ.

O Allah, (please do) send blessings upon the Commander of the Faithful, Ali the son of Abu-TAlib: the brother, ally, supporter, successor, and patron of Your Prophet, the store of his knowledge, the depot of his secrets, the door to his wisdom, the spokesman with his arguments, the caller to his code of law, his viceroy in his community, the reliever of agony from his face, the terminator of the infidels, the conqueror on the wicked ones, whom You have made, with regard to his position to Your Prophet, to occupy the same position that (Prophet) Haroon enjoyed with (Prophet) Moses.

O Allah, (please do) give support to any one who supports him, be the enemy of every one who antagonizes him, give victory to any one who gives him his victory, disappoint every one who disappoints him, and lay curse on any one who incurs the hostility of himfrom the past and the coming generations. And (please do) bless him with the best blessingsthat You have ever poured on any of Your Prophet’s successors. O Lord of the worlds!

allaahumma s’alli a’laa ameeril moomineena a’liyyibni abee ta’alibin akhee nabiyyika wa waliyyihi wa naas’irihi wa s’afiyyihi wa wazeerihi wa mustawda-i’ i’lmihi wa mawdhe”i-i’ sirrihi wa baabi h’ikmatihi wan nat’iqi bih’ujjatihi wad daa-e’e ilaa sharee-a’tihi wa khaleefatihi fee ummatihi wa mufarrijil karbi a’n wajhihi qaas’imil kafarati wa murghimil ..fajaratillad’ee ja-a’ltahu min nabiyyika bimanzilati haroona min Moosaa allaahumma waali man waalaahu wa a’adi man a’adaahu wans’ur man nas’arahu wakhd’ul man khad’alahu wal-a’n man nas’aba lahu minal awwaleena wal aakhireen wa s’alli a’layhi afdha”ala maa s’allayta a’laa ah’adin min aws’iyaaa-i ambiyaaa-ika yaa rabbal a’alameen

It is better to recite the ziyarat of Prophet Adam (A) and Nuh (A) after the ziyarat of Amir al-Mo'minin (A).

children.name: 4- The ziyarat to the Prophet Adam (A)

text.html:
اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ يا صَفِىَّ اللّهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ يا حَبيبَ اللّه، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ يا نَبِىَّ اللّهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ يا اَمينَ اللّهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ يا خَليفَةَ اللّهِ فى اَرْضِهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ يا اَبَا الْبَشَرِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ وَعَلى روُحِکَ وَبَدَنِکَ، وَعَلَى الطّاهِرينَ مِنْ وُلْدِکَ وَذُرِّيَّتِکَ، وَ صَلَّى‌اللّهُ عَلَيْکَ صَلوةً لا يُحْصيها اِلّا هُوَ وَرَحْمَةُ اللّهِ وَبَرَكاتُهُ.

Peace be upon you, O choice of Allah. Peace be upon you, O beloved by Allah. Peace be upon you, O Prophet of Allah. Peace be upon you, O trustee of Allah. Peace be upon you, O representative of Allah in His lands. Peace be upon you, O father of all mankind. Peace be upon you and upon your soul and body, and upon the pure ones from your sons and descendants. May Allah pour upon you such innumerable blessings that none can count except Him. May Allah’s mercy and blessings be upon you!

asaalaamo a’layka yaa safiyyallahe
assalaamo a’layka ya habeeballaahe
assalaamo a’layka yaa nabiyyalaahe
assalaamo a’layka yaa ameenallaahe
assalaamo a’layka ya khaleefatallaahe fee ardhehi
assalaamo a’layka yaa Abal bashare
assalaamo a’layka wa a’laa rooheka wa badaneka wa a’lat taahereena min wuldeka wa dhurriyateka wa sallaallaaho a’layka salaatan laa yohseehaa illaa howa wa rahmatullaahe wa barakaatohu

children.name: 5- The ziyarat to the Prophet Nuh (A)

text.html:
اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ يا نَبِىَّ اللهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ يا صَفِىَّ اللهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ يا وَلِىَّ اللهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ يا حَبيبَ اللهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ يا شَيْخَ الْمُرْسَلينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ يا اَمينَ اللهِ فى اَرْضِهِ، صَلَواتُ اللهِ وَسَلامُهُ عَلَيْکَ وَعَلى روُحِکَ وَبَدَنِکَ، وَعَلَى الطّاهِرينَ مِنْ وُلْدِکَ وَرَحْمَةُ اللهِ وَبَرَكاتُهُ

Peace be upon you, O Prophet of Allah. Peace be upon you, O choice of Allah. Peace be upon you, O intimate servant of Allah. Peace be upon you, O beloved by Allah. Peace be upon you, O chief of the Messengers. Peace be upon you, O trustee of Allah in His lands. May Allah’s peace and blessings be upon you, upon your soul and body, and upon the pure ones from among your sons! May Allah's mercy and blessings be upon you!

assalaamo a’layka yaa nabiyyaallahe
assalaamo a’layka yaa safiyyallaahe
assalaamo a’layka wa wAliyyallaahe
assalaamo a’layka yaa habeeballaahe
assalaamo a’layka yaa shaykhal mursaleena
assalaamo a’layka yaa ameenallaahe fee ardhehi salawaatullaahe wa salaamohu a’layka wa a’laa rooheka wa badaneka wa a’lat taahereena min wuldeka wa rahmatullaahe wa barakaatohu

Then pray 2 rakaats salaah for ziyarat of Imam Ali (A) : it is better to recite in the 1st rakaat after surah al-Hamd, Surah ar-Rahman and in the 2nd rakaat surah Yasin. But we can recite any other surah as well. Then recite this dua :

اَللّهُمَّ اِنّى صَلَّيْتُ هاتَيْنِ الرَّكْعَتَيْنِ، هَدِيَّةً مِنّى اِلى سَيِّدى وَمَوْلاىَ، وَلِيِّکَ وَاَخى رَسُولِکَ، اَميرِ الْمُؤْمِنينَ، وَسَيِّدِ الْوَصِيّينَ، عَلِىِّ بْنِاَبى طالِبٍ، صَلَواتُ اللّهِ عَلَيْهِ وَعَلى الِهِ، اَللّهُمَّ فَصَلِّ عَلى مُحَمَّدٍ والِ مُحَمَّدٍ، وَتَقَبَّلْها مِنّى، وَاجْزِنى عَلى ذلِکَ جَزاءَ الْمُحْسِنينَ، اَللّهُمَّ لَکَ صَلَّيْتُ وَلَکَ رَكَعْتُ وَلَکَ سَجَدْتُ، وَحْدَکَ لا شَريکَ لَکَ، لِاَنَّهُ لا تَكُونُ الصَّلاةُ وَالرُّكُوعُ وَالسُّجُودُ اِلّا لَکَ، لِاَنَّکَ اَنْتَ اللّهُ لا اِلهَ اِلّا اَنْتَ، اَللّهُمَّ صَلِّ عَلى مُحَمَّدٍ وَالِ مُحَمَّدٍ، وَتَقَبَّلْ مِنّى زِيارَتى، وَاَعْطِنى سُؤْلى، بِمُحَمَّدٍوَالِهِ الطّاهِرينَ

O Allah, I have offered these two units of prayer as present from me to my master and chief: Your intimate servant, the brother of Your Messenger, the Commander of the Faithfuland, and the chief of the Prophets’ successors; namely, Ali the son of Abu-TAlib, may Allah’s blessings be upon him and his progeny. So, O Allah, (please do) send blessings upon Muhammad and the Offspring of Muhammad, accept that prayer from me, and confer upon me with the reward that You give to the good-doers. O Allah, to You have I offered prayer, genuflected, and prostrated myself; to You alone without associating anyone with You, because prayers, genuflections, and prostrations are submitted to none except You, because You are Allah; there is no god but You. O Allah, (please do) bless Muhammad and the Progeny of Muhammad, admit my visit, and respond to my requestsin the name of Muhammad and his Progeny—the immaculate ones.

allaahum inny sallayto hataynee raka aatyne hadiyatan minny elaa sayyady wa mawlay, wAliyek wa akhy rasoolek, ameeral momeenin, wa sayyadil wasiyeen, Ali eibne abi taleeb, salwatoollahe alayhe wa ala aalehee, allahoomma faswalle ala mohammadin wa aale mohammad, wa taqabbalha minny, wa-ajzeeny ala dhalek jazaa al mohaseneen, allahumma lak sallaytoo wa lak rak aato wa lak sajadtoo, wahdak la shareek lak, le annahu la takunoo as salato wa rookuo wa sujudoo illa lak, le annak antllahoo la elaha illa ant, allahumma sawlealla mohammad wa aale mohammad, wa taqbbal minni ziyaraty, wa aatyni sooly be mohammadiw wa aaleheet tahereen

Thenpray 2 rakaat for Ziyarat of Prophet Adam (A) and 2 rakaat for Ziyarat of Prophet Nuh (A).

Bow down and say :

اَللّهُمَّ اِلَيْکَ تَوَجَّهْتُ وَ بِکَ اعْتَصَمْتُ، وَعَلَيْکَ تَوَكَّلْتُ، اَللّهُمَّ اَنْتَ ثِقَتى وَرَجائى، فَاكْفِنى ما اَهَمَّنى وَما لا يُهِمُّنى، وَما اَنْتَ اَعْلَمُ بِهِ مِنّى، عَزَّ جارُکَ وَجَلَّ ثَناؤُکَ، وَلا اِلهَ غَيْرُکَ، صَلِّ عَلى مُحَمَّدٍوَآلِ مُحَمَّدٍ،وَقَرِّبْ فَرَجَهُمْ

O Allah, to You I direct my face, to You I resort, and on You I rely. O Allah, You are my trust and my hope; so, (please do) save me from whatever anxieties me, whatever does not distress me, and whatever You know more than I do. Certainly, protected is he who lies under Your protection, glory be to Your praise, and there is no deity except You. (Please do) send blessings upon Muhammad and the Progeny of Muhammad, and hasten their Relief.

allahumma elayk tawjjahtoo wabeka tasamtoo, wa elayk tawakkalto, allahumma ant theqaty wa rajay, fak feny ma ahammany wama la yohimmony, wama ant aalamoo behi minni, aaz za jarook wa jallaa sanaok, wala elayh ghayrok, swallealla mohammad wa aale mohammad, wa qarreeb farajahoom.

Put your right cheek on the ground and say :

اِرْحَمْ ذُلّى بَيْنَ يَدَيْکَ، وَتَضَرُّعى اِلَيْکَ ، وَوَحْشَتى مِنَ النّاسِ، وَاُنْسى بِکَ، ياكَريمُ يا كَريمُ يا كَريمُ.

(Please do) have mercy on my humiliation before You, on my earnest imploring to You, on my loneliness among people, and on my amiability with You. O All-generous! O All-generous! O All-generous!

irham dhully bayna yadaik, wa tadhwarroy elayk , wa wahshatee menan nasee, wa onsee bek, ya kareemo ya kareemo ya kareemo.

Put your left cheek on the ground and say :

لا اِلهَ اِلّا اَنْتَ، رَبّى حَقّاً حَقّاً، سَجَدْتُ لَکَ يا رَبِّ تَعَبُّداً وَرِقّاً، اَللّهُمَّ اِنَّ عَمَلى ضَعيفٌ فَضاعِفْهُ لى، يا كَريمُ يا كَريمُ يا كَريمُ

There is no god but You, my Lord; truly, truly. O Lord, I prostrate myself before You as a sign of my worshipfulness and servitude to You. O Allah, my deed is certainly feeble; so, (please do) grant it strength by increasing it many times, O All-generous! O All-generous! O All-generous!

la elaha illa ant, rabby haqqan haqqa, sajadtoo lak ya rabby, taabbodan wa riqqan, allahumma inna aamaly dhwaaifoon fadhwaifhoo lee, ya kareemo, ya kareemo, ya kareemo

Return to prostration and say 100 times « Shokran » (« Thank you »).

Then, take care to multiply your requests of forgiveness, because it is the appropriate place, and to expose your needs because it is the place of their satisfaction.

There is a specific prayer of Imam Ali (A) that pilgrims can recite in the haram in this way :

Pray 4 rakaat, divided into 2 pairs of 2 rakaat. In each rakaat, after Surah al-Hamd, recite 50 times Surah Tawhid.

children.name: 6- Ziyarat of the holy head of Imam Hussein (A)

text.html:
There are several Riwayat concerning the place where the head of Imam Hussein (A) was buried. Thus, it is said that Imam Sajjad (A) - (4th Imam), brought Imam Hussein's head back to Karbala and buried him close to his body. This hypothesis is the most probable and confirmed by many scientists.

There is, however, a rival theory that the head of Imam Hussein (A) is buried in Najaf near Imam Ali (A). Indeed, Imam as-Sadiq (A) - (6th Imam) said one day to a companion: « Do you want me to show you the tomb of Amir al-Mo'minine (A)? ». They set out, accompanied by Ismail, the son of the Imam, and arrived on a small hill in Najaf. They prayed there and the Imam then said to his son Ismail:« Arise and greet your grandfather Hussein (A). » The companion asked : « That I am sacrificed for you, is Imam Hussein (A) not in Karbala? » Imam as-Sadiq (A) replied : « Yes. But while the head of Imam Hussein (A) was taken away to Shaam (Syria), one of our Shias took it and buried it with Imam Ali (A). »21

Ziyarat :

اَلسَّلامُ عَلَیْکَ یَا بْنَ رَسوُلِ اللَّهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَیْکَ یَا بْنَ اَمیرِ الْمُؤْمِنینَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَیْکَ یَا بْنَ الصِّدیقَةِالطّاهِرَةِ سَیِّدَةِ نِسآءِ الْعالَمینَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَیْکَ یا مَوْلاىَ یا اَبا عَبْدِ اللَّهِوَرَحْمَةُ اللَّهِ وَبَرکاتُهُ، اَشْهَدُ اَنَّکَ قَدْ اَقَمْتَ الصَّلوةَ، وَآتَیْتَ الزَّکوةَ، وَاَمَرْتَ بِالْمَعْروُفِ، وَنَهَیْتَ عَنِ الْمُنْکَرِ، وَتَلَوْتَ الْکِتابَ حَقَّتِلاوَتِهِ، وَجاهَدْتَ فِى اللَّهِ حَقَّ جِهادِهِ، وَصَبَرْتَ عَلَى الاَذى فى جَنْبِهِ، مُحْتَسِباً حَتّى اَتیکَ الْیَقینُ، وَاَشْهَدُ اَنَّ الَّذینَ خالَفوُکَ وَحارَبوُکَوَاَنَّ الَّذینَ خَذَلوُکَ وَالَّذینَ قَتَلوُکَ مَلْعوُنوُنَ عَلى لِسانِ النَّبِىِّالاُمِّىِ، وَقَدْ خابَ مَنِ افْتَرى، لَعَنَ اللَّهُ الظّالِمینَ لَکُمْ مِنَ الاَوَّلینَوَالاْخِرینَ، وَضاعَفَ عَلَیْهِمُ الْعَذابَ الاَلیمَ، اَتَیْتُکَ یا مَوْلاىَ یَا بْنَرَسوُلِ اللَّهِ زائِراً عارِفاً بِحَقِّکَ، مُوالِیاً ِلاَوْلِیآئِکَ، مُعادِیاً لِاَعْدآئِکَ، مُسْتَبْصِراً بِالْهُدَى الَّذى اَنْتَ عَلَیْهِ، عارِفاً بِضَلالَةِ مَنْ خالَفَکَ، فَاشْفَعْ لى عِنْدَ رَبِّکَ

Peace be upon you, O son of Allah’s Messenger. Peace be upon you, O son of the Commander of the Faithful. Peace be upon you, O son of the veracious and pure leader of all women of the world. Peace be upon you, O my master, Aba-Abdillah. So be upon you Allah’s mercy and blessings. I bear witness that you offered the prayers, gave alms (zakat), you enjoined the right, forbade the wrong, recited the Book as it ought to be read, struggled for the sake of Allah as it ought to be struggled, and stood harm for His sake, seeking His reward, until death came upon you. And I witness that those who dissented with you, those who fought against you, those who disappointed you, and those who slew you—all those are accused in the words of the Ummi Prophet. And the falsifier must suffer frustration! May Allah curse those who prosecuted you from the past and the coming generationsand may He double for them the painful punishment. O my master and son of Allah’s Messenger, I have come visiting you and recognizing your status, showing loyalty to your adherents, incurring the hostility of your enemies, acknowledging the true guidance that you follow, and understanding the deviation (from the right path) of any one who disagrees with you. So, (please) intercede for me with your Lord.

assalamo alyek yabn rasoolillah, assalamo alyek yabn ameeril momeneen, assalmo alyek yabn siddiqateet taheerate sayyedate nisael aalameen, assalamo alyek ya mowlay ya aAba Abdillah warah matoolahe wAba rakatooh, ashhado annak kad aqamtas sallat, wa aataytz zakat, wa amratal bil marrofe, wa nahyat anil munkaree, wa talawtal keetab haqqa teelawate hee, wa jahadat fillahee haqqa jihadeehi, wa sAbarat alal adhi fee janbehee, moohtaseban hatta aataykal yaqeen, wa ash hadoo al ladhin khalofak wa harabook wa annal ladhin khadhalok wal ladhin qatalok maloonun aly lisanin nabiyeel ummy, wa qad khab manif taraa, laanallahoodh dhaleemin lakum menal aawwAlin wal aakhereen, wa zak alayhemul adhabal aleem, ataytok ya mawlay yabn rasoolillahe zayeran aarefan be haqqek, mawwaleyen le awliyaek, moaadeyen le aadayek, mustabseran beel hodal ladhi ant alyhee, aarefan be dhalalte min khalafak, fashfaa’li indaa rabbek.

21: Bihar al Anwar, volume 45, page 178

اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ يا اَمينَ اللّهِ فى اَرْضِهِ وَ حُجَّتَهُ عَلى عِبادِهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ يا اَميرَالْمُوْمِنينَ اَشْهَدُ اَنَّکَ جاهَدْتَ فِى اللّهِ حَقَّ جِهادِهِ، وَ عَمِلْتَ بِكِتابِهِ وَاتَّبَعْتَ سُنَنَ نَبِيِّهِ صَلَّى اللّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَالِهِ، حَتّى دَعاکَاللّهُ اِلى جِوارِهِ فَقَبَضَکَ اِلَيْهِ بِاخْتِيارِهِ وَاَلْزَمَ اَعْدآئَکَ الْحُجَّةَ مَعَ مالَکَ مِنَ الْحُجَجِ الْبالِغَةِ عَلى جَميعِ خَلْقِهِ، اَللّهُمَّ فَاجْعَلْ نَفْسى مُطْمَئِنَّةً بِقَدَرِکَ، راضِيَةً بِقَضآئِکَ مُولَعَةً بِذِكْرِکَ وَ دُعآئِکَ مُحِبَّةً لِصَفْوَةِ اَوْلِيآئِکَ، مَحْبُوبَةً فى اَرْضِکَ وَ سَمآئِکَ صابِرَةً عَلى نُزُولِ بَلائِکَ شاكِرَةً لِفَواضِلِ نَعْمآئِکَ، ذاكِرَةً لِسَوابِغِ آلائِکَ مُشْتاقَةً اِلى فَرْحَةِ لِقآئِکَ، مُتَزَوِّدَةًنِ التَّقْوى لِيَوْمِ جَزآئِکَ مُسْتَنَّةً بِسُنَنِ اَوْلِيآئِکَ، مُفارِقَةً لاَخْلاقِ اَعْدائِکَ مَشْغُولَةً عَنِ الدُّنْيا بِحَمْدِکَ وَثَنآئِکَ، اَللّهُمَّ اِنَّ قُلُوبَ الْمُخْبِتينَ اِلَيْکَ والِهَةٌ، وَسُبُلَ الرّاغِبينَ اِلَيْکَ شارِعَةٌ، وَ اَعْلامَ الْقاصِدينَ اِلَيْکَ واضِحَةٌ، وَاَفْئِدَةَ الْعارِفينَ مِنْکَ فازِعَةٌ، وَاَصْواتَ الدّاعينَ اِلَيْکَ صاعِدَةٌ، وَ اَبْوابَ الاِجابَةِ لَهُمْ مُفَتَّحَةٌ، وَ دَعْوَةَ مَنْ ناجاکَ مُسْتَجابَةٌ، وَ تَوْبَةَ مَنْ اَنابَ اِلَيْکَ مَقْبُولَةٌ، وَ عَبْرَةَ مَنْ بَكى مِنْ خَوْفِکَ مَرْحُومَةٌ وَالاِغاثَهَ لِمَنِ اسْتَغاثَ بِکَ مَوْجُودةٌ، وَالاِعانَةَ لِمَنِ اسْتَعانَ بِکَ مَبْذُولَةٌ، وَ عِداتِکَ لِعِبادِکَ مُنْجَزَةٌ، وَ زَلَلَ مَنِ اسْتَقالَکَ مُقالَةٌ، وَ اَعْمالَ الْعامِلينَ لَدَيْکَ مَحْفُوظَةٌ، وَ اَرْزاقَکَ اِلَى الْخَلائِقِ مِنْ لَدُنْکَ نازِلَةٌ، وَعَوآئِدَ الْمَزيدِ اِلَيْهِمْ واصِلَةٌ، وَ ذُنُوبَ الْمُسْتَغْفِرينَ مَغْفُورَةٌ وَ حَوآئِجَ خَلْقِکَ عِنْدَکَ مَقْضِيَّةٌ، وَ جَوآئِزَ السّائِلينَ عِنْدَکَ مُوَفَّرَةٌ، وَ عَوآئِدَ الْمَزيدِ مُتَواتِرَةٌ، وَ مَوآئِدَ الْمُسْتَطْعِمينَ مُعَدَّةٌ، وَ مَناهِلَ الظِّمآءِ مُتْرَعَةٌ، اَللّهُمَّ فَاسْتَجِبْ دُعآئى وَاقْبَلْ ثَنآئى وَاجْمَعْ بَيْنى وَ بَيْنَ اَوْلِيآئى، بِحَقِّ مُحَمَّدٍ وَ عَلِىٍّ وَ فاطِمَةَ وَ الْحَسَنِ وَالْحُسَيْنِ اِنَّکَ وَلِىُّ نَعْمآئى وَ مُنْتَهى مُناىَ، وَغايَةُ رَجائى فى مُنْقَلَبى وَ مَثْواىَ.

Peace be upon you, O trustee of Allah on His domains and argument of Allah against His servants. Peace be upon you, O Commander of the Faithful. I bear witness that you struggled for the sake of Allah as it ought to be struggled, acted upon His Book, and followed the instructions of His Prophet, peace of Allah be upon him and his Progeny, until Allah called you to be in His vicinity. So, He grasped you to Him by His will and put your enemies under the claim although you have inclusive claims against all of His creatures. O Allah, (please do) cause my soul to be fully tranquil with Your decrees, satisfied with Your acts, fond of mentioning and praying to You, bearing love for the choicest of Your intimate servants, beloved in Your lands and heavens, steadfast against the affliction of Your tribulations, thankful for Your graceful bounties, always bearing in mind Your incessant gifts, longing for the gladness of meeting You, supplied with piety for the day of Your rewarding, pursuing the morals of Your intimate servants, quitting the conducts of Your enemies, and distracted from this world by praising and thanking You.

O Allah, the hearts of those humbling themselves to You are fascinated, the paths of those desiring for You are open, the sings of those directing to You are evident, the hearts of those having recognition of You are resorting to You, the voices of those beseeching You are mounting up to You, the doors of responding to them are wide open, the prayer of him who speaks to You confidentially is responded, the repentance of him who turns to You modestly is admitted, the tear of him who weeps on account of fear from You is compassionated, the aid of him who seeks Your aid is available, the help of him who seeks Your help is obtainable, Your promises to Your servants are fulfilled, the slips of him who implore You to excuse him are forgivable, the deeds of those who act for You are preserved, Your sustenance to the creatures are descending from You, Your gifts for further conferrals are reaching them, the sins of those imploring Your forgiveness are forgiven, the requests of Your creatures are granted by You, the prizes of those begging You are offered, Your gifts for further conferrals are uninterrupted, the dining tables for those seeking Your feeding are prepared, and the springs of quenching their thirst are overfull.

O Allah, (so) respond to my prayer, accept my thanks giving for You, and join me to my masters, (I beseech You) in the name of Muhammad, Ali, Fatimah, Hasan, and Hussain. You are verily the only source of my boons, the ultimate goal of my wishes, and the target of my hope in my recourses and settlement.

assalaamu a'layka yaa ameenallah fee ardhihi wa hujatahu alaa ibadihi assalaamu a'layka yaa ameeral moomineen ash-hadu annaka jaahadta fillaahi h'aqqa jihaadihi wa a'milta bikitaa bihi wattabaa'-ta sunana nabiyyihi s'allallaahu a'layhi wa aalihi h'atta da-a'akallahu ilaa jiwaa rihi faqabadh aka ilayhi bi-ikhtiyaarihi wa alzama aa'-daaa-ikal h'ujjata ma-a' maalaka minal h'ujijal baalighati a'laa jamee-i' khalqihi allaahumma faj-a'l nafsee mutma-innatan biqadarika raaz''lyatan biqadh''aaa-ika muh'ibbatan lis'afwati awliyaaa-ika mah'boobatan fee ardh''ika wa samaaa-ika s'aabiratan a'laa nuzoooli balaaa-ika shakiratan lifawaaz''ili naa'-maaa-ika d'aakiratan lisawaaighi aalaaa-ika mushtaaqatan ilaa farh'ati liqaaa-ika mutazawwidatat taqwaa liyawmi jazaaa-ika mustannatan bisunani awliyaaa-ika mufaariqatan li-akhlaaqi aa'-daaa-ika mashghoolatan a'nid dunyaa bih'amdika wa thanaaa-ika allaahummaa innaquloobal mukhbiteena ilayka waalihatun wa subular raaghibeena ilayka shaari-a'tun wa aa'-laamal qaas'ideena ilayka waaz''ih;atun wa af-idatal a'arifeena minka faazi-a'tun wa as'waatad daa-e'ena ilayka s'aa-i'datun wa ab-waabal ijaabati lahum mufattah'atun wa daa'-wata man naajaaka mustajaabatun wa tawbata man naaba ilayka maqboolatun wa a'brata man bakaa min khawfika marh'oomatun wal ighaathata limanis-taghaatha bika mawjoodatun wal i-a'anata limanis ta-a'ana bika mabd'oolatun wa i'daatika li-i'baadika munjazatun wa dhalala manis-taqaalaka muqaalatun wa aa'-maalal aa'mileena ladayka mah'foodh'atun wa ardhwaaqaka ilal khalaaa-iqimin ladunka naazilatun wa a'waaa-idal mazeedi ilayhim waas'ilatun wa du'unoobal mustaghafireena maghfooratun wa h'awaaa-ija khalqika i'ndaka maqdhw''iyyatun wajawaaa-izas saa-ileena i'ndaka muwaffaratun wa a'waa-idal mazeedi mutawaatiratun wa mawaaa-idal mustat'-i'meena mu-a'ddatun wa manaahuladhi'imaa-i mutra-a'tun allahumma fas-tajib du-a'aa-ee waqbal thanaa-ee waj-maa'-baynee wa bayna awliyaaa-ee bih'aqqi Muhammadin wa a'liyyin wa Faati’mata wal h'asani wal h'usayn innaka waliyyu naa'-maaa-ee wa muntahaa munaaya wa ghaayatu rajaaa-ee fee munqalabee wa mathwaaya .

children.name: 8- The ziyarat of Amir al Mo'minin, narrated by Imam al-Hadi (A)

text.html:
اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ يا وَلِىَّ اللّهِ، اَنْتَ اَوَّلُ مَظْلُومٍ وَ اَوَّلُ مَنْ غُصِبَ حَقُّهُ، صَبَرْتَ وَ احْتَسَبْتَ حَتّى اَتيکَ الْيَقينُ، فَاَشْهَدُ اَنَّکَ لَقِيْتَ اللّهَ وَ اَنْتَ شَهيدٌ، عَذَّبَ اللّهُ قاتِلَکَ بِاَنْواعِ الْعَذابِ، وَجَدَّدَ عَلَيْهِ الْعَذابَ، جِئْتُکَ عارِفاً بِحَقِّکَ مُسْتَبْصِراً بِشَأْنِکَ مُعادِياً لاَعْدآئِکَ وَ مَنْ ظَلَمَکَ، اَلْقى عَلى ذلِکَ رَبّى اِنْشآءَ اللّهُ، يا وَلِىَّ اللّهِ اِنَّ لى ذُنُوباً كَثيرَةً فَاشْفَعْ لى اِلى رَبِّکَ فَاِنَّ لَکَ عِنْدَاللّهِ مَقاماً مَعْلُوماً، وَ اِنَّ لَکَ عِنْدَاللّهِ جاهاً وَ شَفاعَةً وَ قَدْ قالَ اللّهُ تَعالى وَ لا يَشْفَعُونَ اِلّا لِمَنِ ارْتَضى.

Peace be upon you, O intimate servant of Allah. You are the first to have been oppressed and the first to have had his right grabbed. You, nevertheless, acted patiently, seeking the reward of Allah, until death came upon you. I thus bear witness that you met Allah as martyr. May Allah torture him who killed you with the various kinds of torture and may He renew torture for him ceaselessly. I have come to you, recognizing your right, acknowledging your position, and bearing enmity against your enemies and against those who wronged you.
I, by Allah’s willing, will meet my Lord carrying these principles. O intimate servant of Allah, I have (committed) numerous sins; so, (please) intercede for me before your Lord, for you verily enjoy a famous rank with Allah and you have verily enjoyed a high status and intercession with Allah. Allah, the All-exalted, has said (in this respect), 'And they do not intercede except for him whom He accepts.'

Assalamo alayk ya waleeillah, anta awwalo mazlumiw wa awwalo man ghoseb haqquhu, sabartaa wah tasabt hatta ataykal yaqeen, fash hadoo annak lakytallah wa ant shaheedun, adhAballahoo qatelak be anwayil adhaab, wa jaddad layheel adhab, jeeatok aarefan be haqqek mustabsheran be shaanek mowadeyal aaadayek wa man dhalamak, alqa ala dhalek rabbee inshaallah, ya waliallahe inna le dhonuban kaseeratan fash faalee ela rabbek fa inna lak indallahe makamam maaluma, wa inna lak indallahe jahaw wa shafa ataw wakad qal lahoo taala wala yashfaaon illal lemaneer tadha.

children.name: 9- The farewell ziyarat of Amir al Mo'minin, reported by Imam al-Kadhim (A)

text.html:
اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ وَ رَحْمَةُ اللّهِ وَ بَرَكاتُهُ، اَسْتَوْدِعُکَ اللّهَ وَ اَسْتَرْعيکَ وَ اَقْرَءُ عَلَيْکَ السَّلامَ، امَنّا بِاللّهِ وَ بِالرُّسُلِ وَ بِما جآئَتْ بِهِ وَ دَعَتْ اِلَيْهِ وَ دَلَّتْ عَلَيْهِ، فَاكْتُبْنا مَعَ الشّاهِدينَ، اَلّلهُمَّ لا تَجْعَلْهُ آخِرَ الْعَهْدِ مِنْ زِيارَتى اِيّاهُ، فَاِنْ تَوَفَّيْتَنى قَبْلَ ذلِکَ فَاِنّى اَشْهَدُ فى مَماتى عَلى ما شَهِدْتُ عَلَيْهِ فى حَياتى، اَشْهَدُ اَنَّ اَميرَالْمُؤْمِنينَ عَلِيّاً وَ الْحَسَنَ وَ الْحُسَيْنَ وَ عَلِىَّ بْنَ الْحُسَيْنِ وَ مُحَمَّدَ بْنَ عَلِىٍّ وَ جَعْفَرَ بْنَ مُحَمَّدٍ وَ مُوسَى بْنَ جَعْفَرٍ وَ عَلِىَّ بْنَ مُوسى وَ مُحَمَّدَ بْنَ عَلِىٍّ وَ عَلِىَّ بْنَ مُحَمَّدٍ وَ الْحَسَنَ بْنَ عَلِىٍّ وَ الْحُجَّةَ بْنَ الْحَسَنِ صَلَواتُکَ عَلَيْهِمْ اَجْمَعينَ اَئِمَّتى، وَ اَشْهَدُ اَنَّ مَنْ قَتَلَهُمْ وَحارَبَهُمْ مُشْرِكُونَ، وَ مَنْ رَدَّ عَلَيْهِمْ فى اَسْفَلِ دَرَکٍ مِنَ الْجَحيمِ، وَ اَشْهَدُ اَنَّ مَنْ حارَبَهُمْ لَنا اَعْدآءٌ، وَ نَحْنُ مِنْهُمْ بُرَآؤُ وَ اَنَّهُمْ حِزْبُ الشَّيْطانِ، وَ عَلى مَنْ قَتَلَهُمْ لَعْنَةُ اللّهِ وَالْمَلائِكَةِ وَ النّاسِ اَجْمَعينَ، وَ مَنْ شَرِکَ فيهِمْ وَ مَنْ سَرَّهُ قَتْلُهُمْ، اَلّلهُمَّ اِنّى اَسْئَلُکَ بَعْدَ الصَّلوةِ وَ التَّسْليمِ اَنْ تُصَلِّىَ عَلى مُحَمَّدٍ وَعَلِىٍّ وَ فاطِمَةَ وَ الْحَسَنِ وَالْحُسَيْنِ وَ عَلِىٍّ وَمُحَمَّدٍ وَ جَعْفَرٍ وَ مُوسى وَ عَلِىٍّ وَ مُحَمَّدٍ وَعَلِىٍّ وَالْحَسَنِ وَالْحُجَّةِ، وَلا تَجْعَلْهُ اخِرَ الْعَهْدِ مِنْ زِيارَتِهِ، فَاِنْ جَعَلْتَهُ فَاحْشُرْنى مَعَ هؤُلاءِ الْمُسَمَّيْنَ الاَئِمَّةِ، اَلّلهُمَّ وَ ذَلِّلْ قُلُوبَنا لَهُمْ بِالطّاعَةِ وَالْمُناصَحَةِ وَالْمَحَبَّةِ وَ حُسْنِ الْمُوازَرَةِ وَ التَّسْليمِ.

Peace and Allah’s mercy and blessings be upon you. I entrust you with Allah and ask Him to keep you under His custody and to send blessings upon you. We believe in Allah, in the Messengers, and in what they have conveyed to us, in that to which they have called, and in that to which they have guided. So, (please, our Lord,) include us with the witnesses. O Allah, (please) do not decide this visit of mine to him (the Imam) to be the last, and if you cause me to die before that, then I bear witness in my death to the same things to which I have born witness in my lifetime:

I bear witness that Ali the Commander of the Faithful, and Hasan, Hussain, Ali ibn al-Hussain, Muhammad ibn Ali, Jafar ibn Muhammad, Musa ibn Jafar, Ali ibn Musa, Muhammad ibn Ali, Ali ibn Muhammad, Hasan ibn Ali,and Hujjah ibn al-Hasan—may Your blessings be upon all of them—are my Imams.

I also bear witness that all of those who have assassinated and fought against them are polytheists and that all of those who reject them shall be in the lowest class of Hellfire. I also bear witness that those who have fought against the Imams are our enemies and we disown them, because they are indeed the party of Satan.

The curse of Allah, His angels and all the peoples be upon those who murdered the Imams, and upon those who had any role in assassination them and those who were pleased for their having been killed.

O Allah, as I begin with invoking Your peace and blessings upon them, I pray you to bless Muhammad, Ali, Fatimah, Hasan, Hussain, Ali, Muhammad, Jafar, Musa, Ali, Muhammad, Ali, Hasan and al-Hujjah, and not to decide this visit of me to his tomb to be the last, and if you decide so, then (please) include me with these Imams to whom I have referred. O Allah, (please) cause our hearts to be subservient to them by showing obedience to them, well-wishing, love for them, support, and submission.

assalamo alayk warah matoollahe waba rakatooh, astawdeookllah wa astaryek wa aqraoo alyeks salaam, aamanna billahee wabe rasoole wa be ma jaaat behee wad aat elayhee wa dallat elayhee, faktubna maash shaheedin, allahumma la taj aalaohu aakheral ahadee menaz ziyeratee iyyaho, fa in tawaffaytani qabl dhalek fa inni ash hadoo fi mamatee alye ma shahid to alayhe fi hayatee, ash hadoo anna amiral momeneen alayyo wal Hasan wal hussain wa Ali ibanil Husaine wa moohammad ibne Ali wa Jafar ibne moohammad wa Musa iabne jaffar wa Ali ibne mussa wa moohammad ibne Ali wa Ali ibane moohammad wal Hasan ibne Ali wal hujjat ibnel Hasan salwatook alyehim ajamaeen aaimmatee, wa ash hadoo anna man qatalahoo wa harabahuum mushrekuun, wa man radda alyhim fee asfale dakeem menal jaheem, wa ash hadoo anna man ha rAbahuu lana aadaoon, wa nahnoo min hum borao wa anna hum hidhbo ash shaytane, wa aala man qatalahum lanatullahe wal malayekate wannase aajmayen, wa man sharek fee him wa man sharrahu qatloohum, allahumma inni as aalook bad as salwate wa tasleeme antoswalleya ala Muhammadiw wa Aliyuw wa Fatemat wal Hasane wal Husaine wa Aliyuw wa Muhammadiw wa jaffariw wa Musaa wa Aliyuw wa Hasane wal hujjate, wala taj aalahoo aakheral aahade min ziyaratehee, fa in jaaltahoo fahshurny maa ha ulayil mosammay nal aayimmate, allahumma wa dhalleel qoolubana lahum bit taa aate wal monasahate wal moohabbate wa husnil mowazzarate wa tasleem

Recall that hundreds of Prophets, as well as their followers, are buried in the land of Najaf, but we do not exactly know the locations of all the graves; and that the shrine of Imam Ali (A) has been, over the centuries, visited by important personalities of Islam.

It is located in the northeastern part of Najaf, towards the cities of Kufa and Karbala, and covers more than 20 km2.

According to a hadith of Imam as-Sadiq (A) - (6th Imam), the soul of every believer, whether he died in the East or in the West, will be brought into this cemetery.22

a) Entering the cemetery

It has been reported from Imam Ali (A) to recite this ziyarat when entering this cemetery :

بِسْمِ اللهِ الرَّحْمنِ الرَّحیمِ
اَلسَّلامُ عَلی اَهْلِ لا إِلهَ إلاَّ اللهُ مِنْ أَهْلِ لا إِلهَ إِلاّ اللهُ یا أَهْلِ لا إِلهَ إِلاّ اللهُ بِحَقِّ لا إِلهَ إِلاّ اللهُ کَیْفَ وَجَدْتُمْ قَوْلَ لا إِلهَ إِلاّ اللهُ مِنْ لا إِلهَ إِلاّ اللهُ یا لا إِلهَ إِلاّ اللهُ بِحَقِّ لا إِلهَ إِلاّ اللهُ اِغْفِرْ لِمَنْ قالَ لا إِلهَ إِلاّ اللهُ وَحْشُرْنا فی زُمْرَهِ مَنْ قالَ لا إِلهَ إِلاّ اللهُ مُحَمَّدٌ رَسُولُ اللهِ عَلِىٌّ وَلِیٌّ الله

Peace be upon the people, having faith (that) there is no god but Allah from the people, having faith (that) there is no god but Allah. O people, having faith (that) there is no god but Allah; (I beseech You) with the faith (that) there is no god but Allah; how did you find the word ‘there is no god but Allah’ from there is no god but Allah. O (Almighty) there is no god except Allah, (I beseech You) with the faith (that) there is no god but Allah (please) forgive one who syas (that) there is no god but Allah and make my resurrection with those who say that there is no god but Allah; Muhammad is the messenger of Allah; Ali is Allah’s representative.

Bismeellah hir rahma nir raheem Assaalamo ala ahale la elaha illallahoo min ahlee la elaha illallahoo be haqqee la elaha illallahoo kaif wajadtum qawl la elaha illallahoo min la elaha illallahoo ya la elaha illallahoo ighfeer leman qaal la elaha illallahoo wah'shurna fee dhumratee man qaal la elaha illallahoo mohammadun rasoolullahe Aliyun waliullahee.

God will grant him 50 years of sawabs, and will forgive 50 years of his sins, as well as those of his father and mother.

Wādi-ous-salâam cemetery hosts various stations/monuments (maqàme), such as that of Imam as-Sàdiq (a) - (6th Imam) or that of Hazrate Houjjat (aj) - (12th Imam), in the extreme part of the cemetery. It is recognized that these two Imams prayed in these places.

b) Houd and Saleh

In the same way, let us remember that at the entrance of the cemetery, is the court of Prophets Hud and Saleh (A), for which it is recommended to recite the following ziyarat :

السَّـلٰامُ عَلیٰ أَولِـیآءِ اللهِ وَ أَصْفِـیٰائِـهِ، السَّـلٰامُ عَلیٰ أُمَـنـآءِ اللهِ وَ أَحِـبّـٰائِـهِ، السَّلاٰمُ عَلیٰ أَنْـصٰارِ اللهِ وَ خُـلَفـآئِـهِ، السَّـلاٰمُ عَلیٰ مَحآلِّ مَعْرِفَـةِ اللهِ، السّلاٰمُ عَلیٰ مَسـٰاکِـنِ ذِکرِ اللهِ، السَّـلاٰمُ عَلیٰ مُظْهـري أَمرِ اللهِ وَ نَـهیِـهِ، السَّـلاٰمُ عَلیٰ الدُّعٰاةِ اللهِ، السَّـلاٰمُ علیٰ الـمُسْتَـقَرِّيْنَ في مَرْضـٰاتِ اللهِ، السَّـلاٰمُ عَلیٰ الْـمُخْـلِـصِيْـنَ فِي طٰاعَةِ اللهِ، السّـلاٰمُ علیٰ الأَدِلّـآءِ عَلیٰ اللهِ، السَّـلاٰمُ عَلیٰ الّذِينَ مَنْ وٰالاٰهُمْ فَقَدْ وٰالٰي اللهَ، وَ مَن عٰادٰاهُمْ فَقَدْ عٰادي الله، وَ مَنْ عَرَفَـهُمْ فَقَدْ عَرَفَ اللهُ، وَ مَنْ جَـهِلَهُمْ فَقَد جَهِلَ اللهَ، وَ مَنِ اعْتَـصَمَ بِـهِمْ فَقَدِ اعْتَـصَمَ بِاللهِ، وَ مَن تَخَلّٰي مِنهُمْ فَقَدْ تَخَلّٰي مِنَ اللهِ عَزَّوَجَلَّ. وَ أُشْـهِدُ اللهُ إِنّي سِلمٌ لِمَنْ سٰالَمْتُمْ، وَ حَرْبٌ لِمَنْ حٰارَبتُمْ، مُؤمِنٌ بِسِرِّکُمْ وَ عَلاٰنِيـَّتِکُمْ، مُفَوِّضٌ فِي ذٰلِكَ کُلِّهِ إِلَـيْکُمْ، لَعَنَ اللهُ عَدُوَّ آلِ مَحَمَّدٍ مِنَ الْجِنِّ وَالْـإِنْسِ، وَ أَبْـرَءُ إِلي اللهِ مِنْهُمْ، وَ صَلّي اللهُ عَلیٰ مُحَمَّدٍ وَّ آلِه.

Peace be on the sincere believers of Allah, who are also His exceptional favourites, peace be on the trustees of Allah, who are also His dearest friends, peace be on the supporters of Allah, who are also His representatives, peace be on the medium of the awareness of Allah, peace be on the centre of the remembrance of Allah, peace be on (you) who make clear His lawful and unlawful, peace be on (you) who invite mankind unto Allah, peace be on (you) who occupy and supervise the centre through which Allah's pleasure is routed, peace be on (you)( who truly obey and serve Allah, peace be on (you) who show the right path leading unto Allah, peace be on (you) whom who befriends, in fact, makes friends with Allah, whom who opposes, in fact, runs counter to Allah, whom who understands, in fact, recognises Allah, whom who passes over, in fact, ignores Allah, whom who defends, in fact, supports Allah, whom who so deserts, in fact, Abandons the Almighty Allah. I request Allah to vouch for me that I make peace with those who are at peace with you, I make war upon those who declare war on you, I believe in that which is concealed and in that which is evident concerning you, I give total control of my affairs in your hands. May Allah curse the enemies of 'Aal-e-Muhammad', be they jinn or men, I disconnect all links with them and turn to Allah, Allah's blessings be on Muhammad and on his children.

assalaamu a’laa awliyaaa-illaahi wa as’fiyaaa-ihi
assalaamu a’laa umanaaa-illaahi wa ah’ibbaaa-ihi
assalaamu a’laa ans’aarillaahi wa khulafaaa-ihi

Prophet Hud (A) was sent by God to the people of 'Aad, because these people, who lived in opulence, had forgotten their Creator by returning to idolatrous practices. Prophet Hud (A) tried for a long time to convince them to return to the Oneness of God, but he received only mockery and derision. In defiance the people of Aad invoked the curse of God upon themselves. From then on, they had to face a drought. After a while, a cloud appeared, followed by a storm that engulfed them all.

God gave this land to the Thamud people, who were also very prosperous. The Thamouds had large dwellings and beautiful gardens. But just like the 'Aad before them, they too began to worship idols. They also mocked the words of the Prophet Saleh (A) and asked him to perform a miracle to prove that he was telling the truth. God then sent down a red camel, which gave birth at once. They were amazed at this apparition, but it was not long before they rebelled again. In front of their stubbornness, God sent down a punishment which lasted 3 days, during which they always refused to accept the Truth of the Oneness of God. They were all annihilated.

In the western part of the city of Najaf, is the place of Imam Zaynul Abidin (A) - (4th Imam), who is also known as Imam as-Sajjad (A).

According to a hadith of Imam al-Baqir (A) - (5th Imam): « My father, after the martyrdom of his father Imam Hussein (A), had taken a modest house outside the city. He had spent several years there, in order to reduce his relations with people. When he went to the ziyarat of Imam Ali (A) or that of Imam Hussein (A), he made sure that people did not know anything about it and did not suspect his pilgrimage. »23

Through this hadeeth, we understand that the Imams, at certain periods of history, could not even openly visit the tomb of their forefathers. They then retired outside the city, to devote themselves more serenely to their prayers and their ziyarat. These monuments are today known as Maqam.
