a) Masjid Sa'sa'at ibn Sawhàne

This is a small masjid located near Masjid-e-Sahlah. It was the place of prayer of Sa'sa'at ibn Sawhàne, brother of Zayd ibn Sawhàne (whose Masjid is also nearby). It is one of the blessed masjids, and Imam Ali (A) has prayed there. According to some historians, Imame Zaman (A) also prayed there.41

Sa'sa'at ibn Sawhàne was one of the close companions of Imam Ali (A). He had been one of the few people outside the family who could attend his funeral. He had shown deep despair. He discredited Bani Umeyya and defended the authority of Ahl-al-Bayt through his eloquent poems. When Mu'awiyah wanted to force him to insult Imam Ali (A), he loudly proclaimed, "O people, Mu'awiyah wants to force me to insult Imam Ali (A), curse him instead!"

Ultimately, he was banished to Bahrain, where he spent the rest of his life. From his time on earth, he left us a strong message about faith and freedom. Indeed, although he had to face oppression and exile, he never denied the moral and legitimate authority of Ahl-al-Bayt.42

Recite a prayer of 2 rakaat then this dua :

اللَّهُمَّ یَا ذَا الْمِنَنِ السَّابِغَةِ وَ الْآلَاءِ الْوَازِعَةِ وَ الرَّحْمَةِ الْوَاسِعَةِ وَ الْقُدْرَةِ الْجَامِعَةِ وَ النِّعَمِ الْجَسِیمَةِ وَ الْمَوَاهِبِ الْعَظِیمَةِ وَ الْأَیَادِی الْجَمِیلَةِ وَالْعَطَایَا الْجَزِیلَةِ یَا مَنْ لَا یُنْعَتُ بِتَمْثِیلٍ وَلَا یُمَثَّلُ بِنَظِیرٍ وَلَا یُغْلَبُ بِظَهِیرٍ وَیَا مَنْ خَلَقَ فَرَزَقَ وَأَلْهَمَ فَأَنْطَقَ وَابْتَدَعَ فَشَرَعَ وَعَلَا فَارْتَفَعَ وَقَدَّرَ فَأَحْسَنَ وَصَوَّرَ فَأَتْقَنَ وَ احْتَجَّ فَأَبْلَغَ وَ أَنْعَمَ فَأَسْبَغَ وَ أَعْطَى فَأَجْزَلَ وَ مَنَحَ فَأَفْضَلَ یَا مَنْ سَمَا فِی الْعِزِّ فَفَاتَ نَواظِرَ الْأَبْصَارِ وَ دَنَا فِی اللُّطْفِ فَجَازَ هَوَاجِسَ الْأَفْکَارِ یَا مَنْ تَوَحَّدَ بِالْمُلْکِ فَلَا نِدَّ لَهُ فِی مَلَکُوتِ سُلْطَانِهِ وَ تَفَرَّدَ بِالْآلَاءِ بِالْکِبْرِیَاءِ فَلا ضِدَّ لَهُ فِی جَبَرُوتِ شَأْنِهِ یَا مَنْ حَارَتْ فِی کِبْرِیَاءِ هَیْبَتِهِ دَقَایِقُ لَطَایِفِ الْأَوْهَامِ وَ انْحَسَرَتْ دُونَ إِدْرَاکِ عَظَمَتِهِ خَطَایِفُ اَبْصَارِ الْأَنَامِ یَا مَنْ عَنَتِ الْوُجُوهُ لِهَیْبَتِهِ وَ خَضَعَتِ الرِّقَابُ لِعَظَمَتِهِ وَوَجِلَتِ الْقُلُوبُ مِنْ خِیفَتِهِ أَسْأَلُکَ بِهَذِهِ الْمِدْحَةِ الَّتِی لَا تَنْبَغِی إِلَّا لَکَ وَ بِمَا وَأَیْتَ بِهِ عَلَى نَفْسِکَ لِدَاعِیکَ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِینَ وَ بِمَا ضَمِنْتَ الْإِجَابَةَ فِیهِ عَلَى نَفْسِکَ لِلدَّاعِینَ یَا أَسْمَعَ السَّامِعِینَ وَ یَا أَبْصَرَ النَّاظِرِینَ وَ یَا أَسْرَعَ الْحَاسِبِینَ وَ یَا ذَا الْقُوَّةِ اَلْمَتینَ صَلِّ عَلَى مُحَمَّدٍ خَاتَمِ النَّبِیِّینَ وَ عَلَى أَهْلِ بَیْتِهِ واَقْسِمَ لی فی شَهْرِنَا هَذَا خَیْرَ مَا قَسَمْتَ وَ أَحْتِمَ لِی فِی قَضَائِکَ خَیْرَ مَا حَتَمْتَ وَ اخْتِمَ لِی بِالسَّعَادَةِ فِیمَنْ خَتَمْتَ وَ أَحْیِنی‏مَا اَحْیَیْتَنِی مَوْفُوراً وَ أَمِتْنِی مَسْرُوراً وَ مَغْفُوراً وَ تَوَلَّ أَنْتَ نَجَاتِی مِنْ مُسَائَلَةِ الْبَرْزَخِ وَ ادْرَأْ عَنِّی مُنْکَراً وَ نَکِیراً وَ أَرِ عَیْنِی مُبَشِّراً وَ بَشِیراً وَ اجْعَلْ لِی إِلَى رِضْوَانِکَ وَ جِنَانِکَ مَصِیراً وَ عَیْشاً قَرِیراً وَ مُلْکاً کَبِیراً وَ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَى مُحَمَّدٍ وَ آلِهِ کثیراً.

O’ Allah! He who possesses abundant favours, restraint benefactions, encompasses blessing, and comprehensive strength, and immense favour and great gifts, beautiful support and plentiful offers. O’ He who is not described by comparison, and not compared with a counterpart, and He is not overcome by anything with its helpers, O’ He who create and make all provision, He who inspire and make people to pronounce, He originate and commence, He ascends and elevates, He has power to punish but he does good, He who shapes things and does it excellently, He who raises objection and notify, He who bestowes and accomplishes it, He who gives in abundant, He who grants and makes it better. O’ He who is elevated in prestige and escaped by all sight, He whose kindness is near and traverses people’s notion and thought, O’ He who is alone in His kingdom and there is no any counterpart to Him in His authority. He is alone in benefaction and pride, there is no opposition to Him in His omnipotence. O’ He who glory of His solemnity is passionate in every moement of kind imaginations, and people’s sight diminishes in perceiving His greatness. O’ He whose Eyes are constraint to His solemnity, and all supervision, succumbed to His greatness and the minds are apprehensive due to His favour. I seek from You with this laudation (praise) that no one deserve it except You, for what You have made incumbent for Yourself, O’ the best that hear among all hearers, O’ the best that see among the viewers, O’ He who possess firm strength. Send Your blessing to the Seal of the Prophets and to his holy progeny, grant me a portion among the goods You have distributed in this holy month and make inevitable for me Your good destiny. Seal all my issues with contentment, let me Alive with abundant life, and take my life in happiness and forgiveness, take over my rescue from the problems of the period between death and resurrection (Barzakh) and turn away from me the affliction of Munkar and Nakeer, and my eye be of great tidings and hopeful, let me dwelled in your pleasure and paradise with a firm and stable living and mighty kingdom, abundant blessing be upon Muhammad and upon his holy family.

Allahumma yaa dhal menane assabeghate wa al walail wazeaate war rahmate al waseate wa alqudrate aljamiateh wan neame al jasimate wa al mawahebe aladheemate wal ayadi aljamilateh wal ataaya aljazilate yaa man laa yun’aatu be tamthilin wala ya mutthalo be nazeerin wala yughlabo be jahireen waya man khalaqa fardhaqa wa alhama fa antaqa wabtada’a fashara’a wa alaa fartafa’a wa qaddara fa ahsana wa sauwara fa atqana wa ahtajja fa ablagha wa anama fa asbagha wa a’aatee fa ajzalah wa manaha fa afdhalah yaa man sama fe’elizze fafaatah nawadhera al absare wa dana fillutfe fajaza hawajisal afkare yaa man tawahhad bilmulke fala niddalhu fee malakoote sultanehi wa tafarrad bil aa’alae beelkibriyae fala dhwiidda lahu fee jabroote sha’nehi yaa man haarath fee kibriya’e haybatehi daqayequ latayi fe a’l awhame wakh hasarat duna idrake a’dhwamatehi khatayefo a’bsaril aname yaa man aanate al woojuho le haybatehi wa khadha’atir reqabo le adhmatehee wa wajilatil qolubo min kheyafatehi as’aloka behadhehi al-midhatillatee laa tanbaghee illa laka wa bema wa ayta behi alla nafseka le daeeka menal mu’a meneen wa bema dhwameental ejabata feehe alla nafseka lid’daeen ya asma’a as’saemina wa ya absara an’nadherina wa yaa aasra’a al hasebin wa yaa dhalquwwate al’mateena swalle alla Muhammadin khatamin’nabiyyina wa alla ahle baytehi wa aqseema lee fee shahrena hadha khayra maa qasamta wa a’htema lee fee kadhaeka khaira maa hatam’ta wakhtema lee bis-sadateh feeman khatamta wa aa’hyinee maa ah’yaytanee maufooran wa a’amitni masrooran wa maghfooran wa tawalla a’anta najati min Musa’alate al barzakhe wadran annee munkaran wa nakiran wa aare ayni mobashsheran waja allee ridhwaneka wa jenaneka maseeran wa ayshan qareeran wa mulkan kabeeran wa swalle alla Muhammadin wa a’alehi kathira

b) Masjid Zayd ibn Sawhàne

Zayd ibn Sawhàne was one of the companions of the Holy Prophet (S) and Imam Ali (A). He died as a Martyr during the battle of the camel. It is recommended to recite in this Masjid the dua that he used to pronounce in his prayers of the night (namaz shab).

This Masjid is one of the most noble Masjids. Recite a prayer of 2 rakaat, raising your hands to heaven and saying :

اِلٰهى قَدْ مَدَّ اِلَيْكَ الْخاطِىءُ الْمُذْنِبُ يَدَيْهِبِحُسْنِ ظَنِّهِ بِكَ، اِلهى قَدْ جَلَسَ الْمُسيءُ بَيْنَ يَدَيْكَ مُقِرّاً لَكَ بِسُوءِعَمَلِهِ وَراجِياً مِنْكَ الصَّفْحَ عَنْ زَلَلِهِ اِلهى قَدْ رَفَعَ اِلَيْكَ الظّالِمُ كَفَّيْهِراجِياً لِما لَدَيْكَ فَلا تُخَيِّبُهُ بِرَحْمَتِكَ مِنْ فَضْلِكَ اِلهى قَدْ جَثَا الْعاَئِدُاِلَى الْمَعاصى بَيْنَ يَدَيْكَ خاَئِفاً مِنْ يَوْمٍ تَجْثُو فيهِ الْخَلاَئِقُ بَيْنَيَدَيْكَ، اِلهى جاءَكَ الْعَبْدُ الْخاطِئُ فَزِعاً مُشْفِقاً وَرَفَعَ اِلَيْكَ طَرْفَهُحَذِراً راجِياً، وَفاضَتْ عَبْرَتُهُ مُسْتَغْفِراً نادِماً، وَعِزَّتِكَ وَجَلالِكَ مااَرَدْتُ بِمَعْصِيَتى مُخالَفَتَكَ، وَما عَصَيْتُكَ اِذْ عَصَيْتُكَ وَاَنَا بِكَ جاهِلٌ، وَلا لِعُقُوبَتِكَ مُتَعَرِّضٌ، وَلا لِنَظَرِكَ مُسْتَخِفُّ وَلكِنْ سَوَّلَتْ لىنَفْسى، وَاَعانَتْنِى عَلى ذلِكَ شَقْوَتى، وَغَرَّنِى سِتْرُكَ المُرْخْى عَلَىَّ، فَمِنَ الاْنَ مِنْ عَذابِكَ مَنْ يَسْتَنْقِذُنى، وَبِحَبْلِ مَنْ اَعْتَصِمُ اِنْ قَطَعْتَحَبْلَكَ عَنّى، فَيا سَوْاَتاهُ غَداً مِنَ الْوُقُوفِ بَيْنَ يَدَيْكَ اِذا قيلَلِلْمُخِفّينَ جُوزُوا ولِلْمُثْقِلينَ حُطُّوا اَفَمَعَ الْمُخِفّينَ اَجُوزُ اَمْ مَعَالْمُثْقِلينَ اَحُطُّ وَيْلى كُلَّما كَبُرَ سِنّى كَثُرَتْ ذُنُوبى، وَيْلى كُلَّما طالَعُمْرى كَثُرَتْ مَعاصِیّى، فَكَمْ اَتُوبُ وَكَمْ اَعُودُ اَما آنَ لى اَنْ اَسْتَحْيِىَمِنْ رَبّى، اَللّهُمَ فَبِحَِقِّ مُحَمَّدٍ وَآلِ مُحَمَّدٍ اِغْفِرْ لى وَارْحَمْنى يااَرْحَمَ الرّاحِمينَ وَخَيْرَ الْغافِرينَ.

O my God, I, the wrongdoer and sinful, am extending my hands to You, on account of the good opinion that I carry about You. O my God, I, the evildoer, am sitting before You, confessing to You of my ill deeds and hoping for You to overlook my faults. O my God, I, the unjust, am raising my hands in the hope of attaining that which You have in possession; so, do not deprive me of Your favors, out of Your mercy. O my God, I, the reverter to disobedience, am kneeling before You, for I fear the day on which all created beings shall kneel before You. O my God, I, the faulty servant, am coming to You with panic and fear, raising my sight to You with caution and hope, shedding tears, seeking forgiveness, and showing regret. By Your Might and Majesty I swear! When I disobeyed You, I have not intended to violate You and when I disobeyed You, I have never been unaware of You. I have never intended to expose myself to Your punishment, and I have never belittled Your watching over me; rather, my soul has commended to me, my adversity has overcome me, and I was deceived by Your screen that covers all my defects. Now, who can save me from Your punishment? Whose rope can I maintain if You cut the rope that connects me with You? What a shame shall be on me tomorrow when I will be detained before You when the light-loaded ones will be allowed to pass, but the heavy-loaded ones will be stopped? Shall I pass with the lightloaded ones or shall I be stopped with the heavy-loaded ones? Woe to me! The older I am the more sinful I become! Woe to me! The more aged I am the more disobedient I become! So often have I declared repentance! And so often have I returned to committing acts of disobedience. Has not the time come that I be ashamed of my Lord? O Allah, (I beg You) in the name of Muhammad and the progeny of Muhammad, have and please forgive me and have mercy upon me. O most merciful of all those who show mercy and most excellent forgiver of all those who forgive!

Ilahi qa’d madda e’laykal khati’ul mudhnebo yadayhe be hoosne dhannehi beka ilhi qa’d jalasa’l musee o bayna yadayka muqir’ran laka be sooe amalehi warajiyan minkassafha aan dhalalehe ilhi qa’d rafa’a e’layka adhwalemu kaffayhe rajiyan lema ladyaka fala to khay’yebuho be rahmateka min fadhleka ilahi qa’d jatha al aayedo ilal ma aa si bayna yadyaka khayefan min yaumin tajthoo feehe al khalayeqo bayna yadyaka ilahi ja’akal abdul khateoo faziann mushfaqann warafa’aa elayka tarfahu hadiran radheeyan wafadhat a’bratohoo mustaghferann nademan wa izzateka wa jalaleka maa aradto be ma’asiyati mukha lafataka wama asaytoka id asaytoka wa ana beka jahelu,wala le oqubateka muta’arridh, wala le nadhareka mustakhefu walakeen sawwalat lee nafsi, wa a’aanatnee alla dhaleka saqwatee, wa gharrani sitroka murkhi alayya,famena al aana min adabeka man yastanqeduni,wa be habli man a’atasemu inn qata’ata hablaka annee,faya saw atahoo ghada an menal wuqoofe bayna yadayka ida qayla leel mukhiffayna juzoowa wa leel muthqelina huttuwa aafama’a al mukhiffayna ajuzoo amm ma al muthqeleen aahutto waylee kullama kabure sinni kathurat dhonubi,waylee kullama ta’la umri kathurat ma’aa siyyee fakam aatubo wakam aaudho ama aana lee ann astahyee mir’rabbi,allahumma fabe haqqe Muhammadin wa aale Muhammadin ighfirlee warhamnee yaa arhamar raahemeen.

Crying, put your forehead on the ground and say :

اِرْحَمْ مَنْ اَساءَ وَاقْتَرَفَ وَاسْتَكانَ وَاَعْتَرَفَ

(Please) have mercy upon him who had misbehaved and committed sins, but he then submitted and confessed.

Irham man asaa’a waqtarafa wastakana wa a’atarafa.

Put the right cheek on the ground and say :

اِنْ كُنْتُ بِئْسَ الْعَبْدُ فَاَنْتَ نِعْمَ الرَّبُّ

If I am the worst servant (of You), then You are the All-excellent Lord.

Inni kunto bea-sal abdo fa anta nea mar rabbo.

Lay the left cheek on the ground and say :

عَظُمَ الذَّنْبُ مِنْ عَبْدِكَفَلْيَحْسُنِ الْعَفْوُ مِنْ عِنْدِكَ يا كَريمُ

Your servant’s sin has been very flagrant; then let Your pardon be very excellent, O All-generous!

Aadhomal dhanbo min abdeka falyahsune al afoowo min i’ndeka yaa kareem.

Return to prostration and say 100 times :

اَلْعَفْوَ اَلْعَفْوَ

Pardon! Pardon!

Al-afwa al-afwa

Zayd ibn Sawnah's tomb is located outside the city of Basra where pilgrims also go.

c) Maytham at-tammar

The tomb of Maytham ibn Yahya At-tammar is located behind Masjid-e-Kufa, next to the house of Imam Ali (A).

Maytham was the slave of a woman belonging to the Bani Assad clan. He was released and educated by Imam Ali (A). He studied several sciences, including Interpretation (tafsir), the Bases of belief (aqaaid), Jurisprudence (fiqh) and also Occult Sciences (ghaybi).

Imam Ali (A) predicts that he will be called by Ibn Zyad one day to curse him. Maytham replied that he would be incapable of such a thing, and that he would rather endure the trials and tortures that would inevitably be inflicted upon him. The Imam (A) showed him where he would be martyred and pointed to the tree to which he would hang. « You'll stay hurt for three days. On the third day, blood will come out of your nose and mouth, covering your beard. » Maytham then made the habit of visiting his tree. He watered it affectionately and prayed to it.

In 60 AH, 10 days before the arrival of Imam Hussein (A) in Karbala, he was arrested by Ubaydullah ibn Zyad and suspended from this tree, as predicted by Imam Ali (A). He continued to praise the merits of the Ahl-al-Bayt in front of the people, and to curse the Bani Umeyya. Then Ibn Zyad ordered a bridle in his mouth to silence him.

Ziyarat :

السّلامُ عَلَیکَ یا رَسُولَ اللهِ السَّلامُ عَلَیکَ یاامیرَالمؤمنینَ اَلسَّلامُ عَلَیکِ یا فاطمَةُ الزَهراءَ سیِّدة نساءِ العالمین.السَّلامُ عَلَی الحَسَن وَالحُسَین سَیّدی شَبابِ أهلِ الجَنَّةِ السَّلامُ علی الاَئِمَةِ مِن ذُرِیّةِ الحُسینِ عَلَیهِمُ السَّلامُ وَ رَحمَةُ اللهِ و بَرَکاتهُ السَّلامُ عَلیکَ أیُّها العَبدُ الصالِحُ یا مَیثَمُ بنَ یَحیی التّمار المُطیعُ لِله ولِرسولِه و لِأمیرِالمُؤمنین و لِفاطِمَةَ والحَسَنِ والحُسینِ أشهَدُ اَنَّکَ قَد أقَمتَ الصَّلاةَ وَ آتَیتَ الزَّکاةَ وَ أمَرتَ بالمَعرُوفِ وَ نَهَیتَ عن المُنکَرِ و جاهَدتَ فی اللهِ حَقَّ جِهادِهِ و عَمِلتَ بِکِتابِهِ مُقتَدِیاً بالصالِحینَ وَ مُتّبِعاً لِلنَّبِییِنَ وَأشهَدُ أنَّکَ قُتِلتَ مَظلُوماً فَلَعَنَ اللهُ مَن ظلمَکَ وَ مَن افترَی عَلَیکَ وَلَعَن اللهُ مَن نَصَبَ لَکَ العَداوَةَ والبَغضاءَ إلی یَومِ القِیامةِ وحَشا اللهُ قُبُورَهُم ناراً و أعَدَّ لَهُم عذاباَ الیماً جِئتُکَ أیُّها العَبدُ الصالحُ زائِراً قَبرَکَ مُقِرّاً بِحَقِکَ مُعتَرِفا بِفَضلِکَ فَأَسأَلُ اللهُ بَالشَّأنِ الَّذی لَکَ ِعندَهُ أن یُصَلیَ علی مُحمَّدٍ وآل مُحمَدٍ وَأن یَقضِیَ لَنا حَوائِجَنا فِی الدُنیا و الآخِرَةِ وَ‌ رَحمَة اللهِ وَبَرَکاتُهُ

Peace be upon you O’ messenger of Allah, peace be upon Emir of Believers, peace be upon Fatima al-Zahra, the leader of the world's women, peace be upon Hasan, and Hussain, leaders of the youth of Paradise, peace, blessings and mercy be upon the offspring of Hussain. Peace be upon you, the pious servant of Allah, O’ Metham bin Yahya Al-Tammar, who is committed to Allah, His Messenger, Emir of believers, Fatimah, Hasan and Hussain. I bear witness that you have established the prayer and paid Zakat, and ordered what is good and forbade the evil and made the best of struggle for Allah, you acted upon His Book following the prophets and pious people. I bear witness that you were killed viciously, curse till the Doomsday be upon oppressors and those who declared you wrong, created (in people) enmity and prejudice (against you). May Allah fill their graves with fire and prepare painful punishment for them. I came to you, the pious servant of Allah, visiting your grave, confessing your right, acknowledging your integrity. I beseech Allah by your integrity to shower peace, blessings upon Muhammad and his progeny and fulfil our needs in this world and Hereafter.

Assalaamo a’layka yaa rasoolallahe assalaamo a’layka yaa ameeral momineen Assalaamo a’layka yaa Fatematuz-Zahra e saiyedetin nesaaeel aalameen, Assalaamo alal Hasana wal husaina sayyedee shAbabe ahlil jannate assalaamo alla al-aeemate min dhurriyatil hussayne a’layhe mussalaamo wa rahmatulaahe wa barakaatohu assalaamo a’layka ayyohal abdus salehu ya maythamo ban yaahyaa' taamar al-muteeo lillahe wa le rasulehi wa le ameeril momineena wa le faatemata wal Hasane wal hussayne ashhadoannaka qad aqamatassalatah wa aataytazakatah wa amarata bal maa-rufe wa na hayta anil moonkare wa jahadata feellahe haqqe jehadehi wa aamelat be ketabehi muqtadeyann bil saleheena wa muttabeaan linnabeeyeena wa ash-hado annaka qotelat madhlooman fala-aanallaaho man dhwalamaka wa man aff-tari a’layka wala-nallaho man nasaba laka al-adawatah wal baghza aa lee yaume al-qiyamate wa hashallaho qoburahumm narann wa aa’addah lahoom adaba alayman jea-toka ayyohal aabdo al salooh zayerann qabraka mooqirraan jeqeka mua-tarefa befadhleka fa assa-lullaho bashshanil-ladee laka andahoo ann yuslayee alla muhammadiw wa aale Muhammadin wa ann yaqdhiya lana hawaejana feed-duniya wal aakherate wa rahmatullaahe wa barakaatohu.

d) The house of Imam Ali (A)

After the battle of the camel (Jamal) and to thank the inhabitants of Kufa, Imam Ali (A) made this city the capital of the Muslim state and established his own residence there. He had no personal home and was accommodated by the kindness of his sister Ummah Hani. She was a generous woman, detached from the world. The Holy Prophet (S) used to praise his merits during his lifetime. He said : « O people! my children Hassan (A) and Hussein (A) have the best uncle and the best aunt. Their uncle is Jaafar ibn Abi Talib (brother of Ali (A)) and their aunt is Ummah Hani (his sister) »43

Ume Hani had made this house available to Imam Ali (A) so that he could live with his children. It is located southwest of Masjid-e-Kufa. One can visit in particular the room of Imam Hassan (A) and Imam Hussein (A), that of Bibi Zaynab (A), Hazrat Abbas (A) and that of his mother Ummul Baneen, as well as the well of the house.

e)Maqame Yunus ibn Mata (A)

The story of the Prophet Yunus (A) is described in the Holy Qur'an, as well as the episode of his captivity in the belly of a whale, then his release. According to historians, the place where he was released is near the banks of the Euphrates River (Nehre Furat), 1 km from Masjid-e-Kufa, in the street « alkurnish ». This place is known as Maqàme Yunus (A).

No specific Ziyarat was mentioned for the Prophets except for the Prophets Adam and Nuh (A). Sheikh Abbass Qoumi indicates that it is better to recite the Jaze'at Ziyarat on the tombs of the Prophets.

f) Khadija binte Amir al Mo’minine

No specific Ziyarat was mentioned for the Prophets except for the Prophets Adam and Nuh (A). Sheikh Abbass Qoumi indicates that it is better to recite the Jaze'at Ziyarat on the tombs of the Prophets.

g) The tomb of Ibrahim al Ghamar ibn Hassane Muthanna (the second)

His tomb is in Kufa, west of the tomb of Maytham at-tammar. Hassane Mouthanna is the son of Imam Hassan (A). He is thus known under the name of Hassan the second (Hassane Mouthannà). He married the daughter of Imam Hussein (A) and had three sons. One of them was called Ibrahim al Ghamar.

The latter is the grandson of Imam Hassan (A) by his father, and that of Imam Hussein by his mother. Renowned for his generosity, he is also part of the transmitters of hadith. The Abbasid caliph Mansoure Dawaneqi arrested him at the same time as his brother Abdullah, and tortured them for 5 years. Ibrahim was the first to be martyred at the age of 69. One cannot but note the implacable and ferocious repression that descended on all descendants of pure Imams.

Ziyarat :

السَّلامُ عَلَى جَدّكَ الْمُصْطَفَى ,السَّلامُ عَلَى أَبِيكَ الْمُرْتَضَى الرّضا ,السَّلامُ عَلَى السَّيّدَيْنِ الْحَسَنِ وَالْحُسَيْنِ ,السَّلامُ عَلَى خَدِيجَةَ أُمّ سَيّدَةِ نِساءِ الْعالَمِينَ , السَّلامُ عَلَى فاطِمَةَ أُمّ الأَئِمَّةِ الطَّاهِرِينَ السَّلامُ عَلَى جَدّكَ الْمُصْطَفَى ,السَّلامُ عَلَى أَبِيكَ الْمُرْتَضَى الرّضا ,السَّلامُ عَلَى السَّيّدَيْنِ الْحَسَنِ وَالْحُسَيْنِ ,السَّلامُ عَلَى خَدِيجَةَ أُمّ سَيّدَةِ نِساءِ الْعالَمِينَ , السَّلامُ عَلَى فاطِمَةَ أُمّ الأَئِمَّةِ الطَّاهِرِينَ ,السَّلامُ عَلَى النُّفُوسِ الْفاخِرَةِ بُحُورِ الْعُلُومِ الزَّاخِرَةِ شُفَعائِي فِي الآخِرَةِ وَأَوْلِيائِي عِنْدَ عَوْدِ الرُّوحِ إِلَى الْعِظامِ النَّاخِرَةِ أَئِمَّةِ الْخَلْقِ وَوُلاةِ الْحَقّ ,السَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ أَيُّها الشَّخْصُ الشَّرِيفُ الطَّاهِرُ الْكَرِيمُ ,أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لا إِلهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَأَنَّ مُحَمَّداً عَبْدُهُ وَمُصْطَفاهُ ,وَأَنَّ عَلِيّاً وَلِيُّهُ وَمُجْتَبَاهُ وَأَنَّ الإْمامَةَ فِي وُلْدِهِ إِلَى يَوْمِ الدّينِ ,نَعْلَمُ ذلِكَ عِلْمَ الْيَقِينِ وَنَحْنُ لِذلِكَ, مُعْتَقِدُونَ وَفِي نَصْرِهِمْ مُجْتَهِدُونَ .

Peace be upon your grandfather Mustafa, peace be upon your father Murtaza Al- Reza, prace be upon masters Hasan and Hussain. Peace be upon Khadija the mother of the leader of women of all the worlds. Peace br upon Fatima mother of immaculate Imams; peace be upon the gratified souls, the deep oceans of knowledge and my intercessors on Doomsday, my powers when the spirit returns to bones, (you are) Imams of ctratures and powers of righteousness. Peace be upon you the honest, pure and gracious soul. I bear witness that there is no God but Allah, and that Muhammad is his servant and his choice. Ali is his representative and selected and Imamat is in his family till Doomsday. We know that for sure and we have firm faith in it and we struggle to assist them.

Assalaamo alla jaddaka al-mustafa,assalaamo a’laa abeeyaka al-murtadhir-radha,assalaamo alla ass sayyednil Hasane wal hussayne, Assalaamo alla Khadijatah umma sayyedate nesaaa’il aalameena,Assalaamo alla faatemata ummal aa-immatit-taherina,Assalaamo allan’nofosil fakherate johure al-olume adh-dhakherate shofa aaee fee al-aakherate wa awliyaee i’nda aude ar-ruhe elal edhamee ann-nakherate a-immatil khalqe wa wulatil haqqa, assalaamo a’layka ayyohash-shakhso ash-sharifo att-tahero al-kareemo, Ash hado an laa elaaha illallaaho wa ash hado anna mohammadan a’bdohu wa mustafaho, wa anna aleeyyan waleeyyohu wa mujtAbaho wa annal imamata fee wuldehi elay’yaumiddine, naa’lamo daleka illmal yaqeene wa nahno le daleka,mua’taqedun wa fee nasrehim muj-tahedoon

h) Darul Imara

Located in the center of Kufa, this palace was in its time the center of power and oppression. It is from one of its towers that the bodies of Muslim ibn Aqil and Hani ibn Urwah were thrown into the void. The prisoners of Karbala and the head of Imam Hussein (A) were also brought to this place and exposed to the inhabitants.

What was, at one time in history, a symbol of domination has now completely disappeared. Only a few vestiges of the foundations still bear witness to an ephemeral existence.

i) Sayyad Hassan, grandson of Abul Fazl Abbas (Martyr of Karbala)

Son of Ubaydullah ibn Abbas ibn Ali ibn Abi Talib, his grave is in a place called Hashamya, in Kufa. Born in Madina, he died at the age of 76. He was a transmitter of hadith.

41: Ba man bw Karbala, page 197
42: Same, page 198
43: Safinat al-bihar, volume 2, page 724

children.name: Ziyarat for all Imam zadas (descendants of the Imams).

text.html:
اَلسَّلامُ عَلى جَدِّکَ الْمُصْطَفى، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى اَبيکَ الْمُرْتَضَى الرِّضا، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَى السَّيِّدَيْنِ الْحَسَنِ وَالْحُسَيْنِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى خَديجَةَ اُمِّ سَيِّدَةِ نِسآءِ الْعالَمينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى فاطِمَةَ اُمِّ الْاَئِمَّةِ الطّاهِرينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَى النُّفُوسِ الْفاخِرَةِ، بُحُورِ الْعُلُومِ الزّاخِرَةِ، شُفَعآئى فِى الاْخِرَةِ وَاَوْلِيآئى عِنْدَ عَوْدِ الرُّوحِ اِلَى الْعِظـامِ النّاخِرَةِ، اَئِمَّةِ الْخَلْقِ وَوُلاةِ الْحَقِّ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ اَيُّهَا الشَّخْصُ الشَّريفُ الطّاهِرُ الْكَريمُ، اَشْهَدُ اَنْ لا اِلـهَ اِلاَّ اللهُ، وَاَنَّ مُحَمَّداً عَبْدُهُ وَمُصْطَفاهُ، وَاَنَّ عَلِيّاً وَلِيُّهُ وَمُجْتَباهُ، وَاَنَّ الْاِمامَةَ فى وُلْدِهِ اِلى يَوْمِ الدّينِ، نَعْلَمُ ذلِکَ عِلْمَ الْيَقينِ، وَنَحْنُ لِذلِکَ مُعْتَقِدُونَ وَفى نَصْرِهِمْ مُجْتَهِدُونَ.

Peace be upon your grandfather Mustafa, peace be upon your father Murtaza Al- Reza, prace be upon masters Hasan and Hussain. Peace be upon Khadija the mother of the leader of women of all the worlds. Peace br upon Fatima mother of immaculate Imams; peace be upon the gratified souls, the deep oceans of knowledge and my intercessors on Doomsday, my powers when the spirit returns to bones, (you are) Imams of ctratures and powers of righteousness. Peace be upon you the honest, pure and gracious soul. I bear witness that there is no God but Allah, and that Muhammad is his servant and his choice. Ali is his representative and selected and Imamat is in his family till Doomsday. We know that for sure and we have firm faith in it and we struggle to assist them.

Assalaamo alla jaddeka al-mustafi, assalaamo alla abeeka al-murtadhee ar-redhaa, assalaamo alla as-sayyedayne al-Hasane wal Husayne, assalaamo alla khadijata umme sayyedate nesaail aalameen, assalaamo alla faatemata ummil a-immatit taahereen, assalaamo alla an-nofuse al-faakherate, bohuril olume az-zaakherate, shofa aaee fee al kherate wa awliyaaee inda awde ar-roohe elal ezaame an-naakherate, a-immate al-khalqe wa woolaate al-haqqe, assalaamo alayka ayyohash shakhsho ash-sharifo at-taahero al-kareemo, ash-hado an laa elaha illallaaho, wa anna Muhammadan abdohu wa mustafaao, wa anna Aliyyan waliyyohu wa mujtabaaho,wa annal imaamata fee wuldehi ela yawmiddeene, na’alamu dhaleka ilmal yaqeene, wa nahno le dhaleka moa’taqedoona wa fee nasrehim moojtahedun.

The holy city of Karbala is located southwest of Baghdad and north-west of Najaf.

The term Karbala is composed of two words : Karb and Bala, which signify : sadness and misfortune. This word meant a hot desert in the year 61 after the Hijra.

Once arrived at this place, Imam Hussein (A) asked the name of its rare inhabitants. When he was told "Karbala", He exclaimed : « O my God! I ask you for refuge against the difficulties and misfortunes of this earth! »

Following the tragedy of Karbala, a holy city was built there taking its name.

Imam Hussein (A), accompanied by his relatives, arrived in Karbala on the 2nd day of Moharram in year 61 AH. He bought this piece of desert of an area of 36 km² for the sum of 60,000 dirhams, asking its inhabitants to guide all those who come to visit his tomb, and offer them hospitality for 3 days. It now houses his grave and those of other martyrs.44

44: Rahnemaye moussawwar safar ziyarati Iraq, page 235

The Holy Qur'an mentions in the story of the Prophet Musa ibn Imran (A) : « When he came there [seeking fire], he was called, from the right bank of the valley, into the [blessed] place, by [a word created through] a tree : « Moses, I am God the Lord of the worlds. »45

Imam as-Sadiq (A) - (6th Imam) said that the « right bank » corresponds to the Euphrates, that « the blessed place » is Karbala and that « the tree » is the existence of the Holy Prophet (S). This hadeeth demonstrates the sanctity of the city of Karbala.46

45: Qur’an : Chapter 28, verse 30
46: Wasa'il al-Shia, volume 10, page 314

children.name: 2- The four privileges of Imam Hussein (A) :

text.html:
According to Imam as-Sadiq (A) - (6th Imam), God consecrated Imam Hussein (A) with four privileges because of his sacrifice :

- All Imams after him come from his offspring
- The earth of his tomb is a cure for diseases,
- The invocations near his tomb and under his dome are answered,
- The days spent during the visit of his tomb (Ziyarat) will not be counted in the life of the pilgrim (he will not count on the Day of Judgment).47

One of the unique graces bestowed on Imam Hussein (A) is that the land of his grave is holy. While it is strictly forbidden to ingest earth, even from the tomb of a Prophet or Imam, it is perfectly permissible to absorb - in minute quantities - when it comes from that of the tomb of Imam Hussein (A).

Indeed, according to Imam as-Sadiq (A), God has placed in this land a remedy against physical and mental diseases. Whoever wishes to obtain the blessing of this holy land, embrace it, put it on his eyes, put it on his head and on his face, and recite this Dua :

اَللّهُمَّ بِحَقِّ هذِهِ التُّربَةِ وَبِحَقِّ مَنْ حَلَّ بِها وَثَوى فيها وَبِحَقِّ جَدِّهِ وَاَبيهِ وَاُمِّهِ وَاَخيهِ وَالاَئِمَّةِ مِنْ وُلْدِهِ وَبِحَقِّ المَلائِكَةِ الحافّينَ بِهِ، اِلّا جَعَلْتَها شِفاءً مِنْ كُلِّ داءٍ وَبُرءآ مِنْ كُلِّ مَرَضٍ وَنَجاةً مِنْ كُلِّ آفَةٍ وَحِرزآ مِمّا اَخافُ وَاَحْذَرُ47

O’ Allah, by the right of this soil and by the right of one who rests in it, by the right of his grandfather, his father, his mother, his brother, Imams from his offspring, and by the right of angels who walk on this (soil) (please) do make it heal all my sickness, and cure of diseases, salvation from every calamity and protection from what I fear.

Allaahumma be haqqe hadhehit turbate wa be haqqe man halla beha wa thawi feeha wa be haqqe jaddehi wa abeehe wa ummihe wa akheehe wa al-a-immate min wuldehi wa be haqqe malaekate al-haffin behi, illa ja’altaha shifaann min kulle daeen wa bur’aa min kulle maradheen wa najatann min kulle aa fatin wa hirda mimma akhafo wa ahdharo.

47: Wasa'il al-Shia, volume 10, page 329

Imam Hussein (A) was born on the 3rd or 4th Shabaan of year 4 of the Hijra, in Medina. He is the youngest son of Imam Ali (A) and Fatema Zahra (A). He was 6 years old when the Holy Prophet (S) left this world. 30 years later, it was his father, murdered, who left him, and finally 10 years later, in year 50 AH, his elder brother Hassan (A), poisoned, left him in turn. At the death of the latter, he became our 3rd Imam, the Imam of his time. It was the time of Mu'awiyah's government. The Imam died as a martyr in 61 AH, following the coming to power of Yazid, the son of Mu'awiyah. He was then about 56 years old.

Imam Hussein (A) lived a pious and harsh life, and kept himself away from the attractions of this underworld. However, he was forced to sacrifice his life, that of many of his children, brothers and other members of his family. Faithful companions also sacrificed themselves beside him. For it was his divine mission to defend authentic Islam revealed by his grandfather the Prophet (S).

Mu'awiyah spread false hadith to distort the explanations of the verses of the Holy Qur'an, with the deliberate aim of justifying his depraved behavior. And poverty spread rapidly. After Mu'awiyah's death, his son Yazid, the debauched, came to power. He immediately ordered Imam Hussein (A) to swear allegiance to him, through Walid, the governor of Medina. Imam Hussein (A), obviously, could not accept to condone such a corrupt person. The idea itself was inconceivable. He, the guarantor of Islam, could not give his approval to make this religion disappear forever. Walid pressured him. The Imam then decided to leave Medina for Mecca. It was from there that he took the direction of the city of Kufa, Iraq, whose inhabitants had not ceased to claim it.

Imam Hussein (A) had a purely spiritual purpose in going to Kufa, that of saving Islam from perdition, and inciting people to righteousness (amr bil m'aruf and nahi 'anil munkar). He did not want to gain power. But he was not afraid of having to face the brutal reaction that the furious dictator would not fail to demonstrate in order to hinder his noble cause.

On 2nd Muharram 61 AH arrived, Imam Hussein (A) was with his family and companions in the land of Karbala, surrounded by the mighty army of Yazid, with tens of thousands of men. On the 10th of Moharram, apart from his son, who was suffering from poor health, all the men had given their lives. He had been there to support them. And he was the last to fall as a Martyr on the hot ground, thirsty for 3 days, alone and without help, as the day drew to a close.

On 12th Moharram 61 AH, his son Imam Sajjad (A) - (4th Imam), by divine inspiration, as well as the Bani Assad (tribe living nearby), buried the blessed bodies of Imam Hussein (A) and his companions.

The great scholar Sheikh Mufid indicates that the martyrs belonging to the Bani Hashim clan - the clan of the family of Imam Hussein (A) - are buried in a mass grave at the foot of the Imam's tomb (A). But there is no visible sign. The pilgrims nevertheless turn to the ground on the side of Imam Hussein's feet (A) and recite their Ziyarat.48

Ali Akbar, the son of Imam Hussein (A) who was the portrait of his grandfather the Prophet (A), is buried by his side, along with his other son, Ali Asghar, who was then only a little baby.

After the death of Imam Hussein (A), his enemies, in pursuit of their ruthless logic, applied themselves to trying to extinguish the Light of God. They became more and more engaged with the Shiites in order to make forget the immense sacrifice made by their revered Imam. They tortured the pilgrims or threatened them with death. In 236 AH, Mutawakkil Abbassi even gave the order to destroy all the visible signs of the tomb of Imam Hussein (A) as well as the surrounding houses.

He threatened the inhabitants with reprisals if they decided to return to settle there. But even today, the pilgrims flock from all sides with as much fervor to salute Imam Hussein (A) with dignity.

48: Al Irshad, volume 11 page 125

children.name: 2- There are other shrines inside the Haram within Imam Hussein's haram (A) :

text.html:
a) Habib ibn Mazahir

His tomb is located 10 meters southwest of the tomb of Imam Hussein (A). Noble with a big heart, he came to the call of his Imam and knew the glory of martyrdom at the age of 75 on the battlefield of Karbala. He had been a companion of the Holy Prophet (S) and Imam Ali (A) and had participated in the battles of Siffin, Nahrawan and Jamal. He was a staunch defender of Imam Ali (A) and one of his most outstanding students in Qur'anic Science. When Muslim ibn Aqil arrived in his city at Kufa, he proudly defended his cause and incited the inhabitants to pledge allegiance to him. From Karbala where he was besieged, Imam Hussein (A) sent him a message asking for his help; and without delay, began to make a standard. Some companions wanted to have the immense honor of wearing this standard, but the Imam (A) replied that he to whom the standard was destined would soon arrive. It was his friend Habib ibn Mazahir who arrived. Imam Hussein (A) greeted him with indescribable joy, and his sister Janabe Zaynab (A) sent her greetings. Habib faced his death, tranquil and smiling.

Ziyarat :

السَّلامُ عَليْكَ أَيُّهَا العَبْدُ الصَّالِحُ المُطِيعُ للهِ وَلِرَسُولِهِ وَلأَمِيرِ المُؤْمِنِينَ وَلِفاطِمَةَ الزَّهْرَاءِ وَالحَسَنِ وَالحُسَيْنِ عَلَيْهِمُ السَّلامُ الغَرِيبُ المُواسِى، أَشْهَدُ أَنَّكَ جَاهَدْتَ فِى سَبِيلِ اللهِ، وَنَصَرْتَ الحُسَيْنَ بْنَ بِنْتِ رَسُولِ اللهِ، وَوَاسَيْتَ بِنَفْسِكَ، وَبَذَلْتَ مُهْجَتَكَ، فَعَلَيْكَ مِنَ اللهِ السَّلامُ التَّامُّ، السَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ أَيُّهَا القَمَرُ الزَّاهِرُ، السَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يَا حَبِيبَ بنَ مُظاهِرِ الأَسَدِى وَرَحْمَةُ اللهِ وَبَرَكاتُهُ

Peace be on you, O’ the pious and obedient servant of Allah, His Messenger, Ameer ul Momineen, Fatima Zahra, Hassan and Hussain (peace be on them). O’ banished person, O intimate friend I bear witness that you fought in the way of Allah and helped Hussain, the son of the daughter of the Messenger of Allah, defended him and gave your life to protect him. Therefore, peace be on you from Allah, the complete peace. Peace be upon you. O’ the bright moon, peace be upon you, O Habib son of Mazahir Asadi, and also mercy and benedictions of Allah.

Assalaamo a’layka ayyoha al abdo as-saleho al-mutio lillahe wa le rasoolehi wala mire al-momineena wale Faatemataz Zahra e wal Hasane wal hussayne alayhemus-salamo al ghareebo al muwasi, ash-hado annaka jahad ta fee sabeelillaahe, wa nasarta al hussaynabna binte rasoolillahe, wa wa sayta be nafseka, waba-dalta muhjataka, fa a’lyaka me nallahis-salamo att-tammoo, assalaamo a’layka ayyohal qamaro ad-dahero, assalaamo a’layka yaa habeeba ban mudhahere al-asadee wa rahmatullaahe wa barakaatohu.

b) Ibrahim Moujjab :

To the northwest of the haram, there is a small shrine, which is the holy place of Ibrahim Mujjab, descendant of Imam Mussa ibn Jaffar (A) - our 7th Imam. He was so named, because one day, while he was in the haram (mausoleum) of his grandfather Imam Hussein (A), a voice had risen from the grave to respond to his greetings.

Ziyarat :

اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ اَيُّهَا السَّيِّدُ الزَّكِىُّ، اَلطّاهِرُ الْوَلِىُّ وَالدّاعِى الْحَفِىُّ اَشْهَدُ اَنَّکَ قُلْتَ حَقّاً وَنَطَقْتَ صِدْقاً وَدَعَوْتَ اِلى مَوْلاىَ وَمَوْلاکَ الْحُسَيْنِ (عَلَیهِ السَّلام) عَلٰانِيَةً وَ سِرّاً، فٰازَ مُـتَّـبِعُكَ وَ نَجٰا مُصَدِّقُكَ وَ خٰابَ وَ خَسِرَ مُکذِّبُكَ وَالـمُتَخَلِّفُ عَنْك، یا سَيِّدي وابْنَ سيِّدِي و یا مَوْلٰایَ وابْنَ مَوْلٰایَ إِشْـهَـدْ لِـي بِهٰذِهِ الشَّهٰادَةِ لِـأَکُونَ مِنَ الفٰائِزِينَ بِـمَعْرِفَتِكَ وَ طٰاعَتِكَ وَ تَصْدِيقِكَ وَاتِّـبٰاعِكَ، الصّلٰاةُ وَالسّلٰامُ عَلَيْكَ یٰا سَيِّدِي وابْنَ سَيِّدِي وَ یٰا مَوْلٰايَ وَابْنَ مَوْلٰايَ یٰا سَيِّدُ إِبرٰاهِيمُ الـمُجٰابُ ابْنُ الـمُحمّدِ العٰابِدِينَ الإمٰام مُوسي بْنِ جَعفَرٍ (عَلَيْهِمُ السّلام) وَ رَحْمَةُ اللهِ وَ بَرَکٰاتُهُ.

Peace be upon you, O pious master, pure saint, and generous caller. I bear witness that you said the truth, and spoke the truth rightfully and called for my master and yours publicly and secretly. Won who followed you, survived who believed in you, disappointed and lost who denied you, and fall behind you. Bear witness to me this testimony next to you so I could be one of the winners of knowing you, and obeying you, believing you, and following you. And peace be upon you, o my master, and the son of my master, O sayed Ibrahim Almujab, son of Mohammed Al-Abideen, son of Imam Musa, the son of Ja’far, and also mercy and benedictions of Allah.

Assalaamo a’layka ayyohas-sayyedo azz-zakiyo,at-tahero al-waliyyo waddaee al-hafiyyo a’sh-hado annaka qulta haqqan wa nataqta sidqan wa da auta alla maulaee wa maulakal hussayne (a.s) aa la niyatan wa sirran, faza muttabeuka wa naja mosaddeqoka wa khAba wa khasera mokad-dheboka wal mutakhallefo anka,yaa sayyedee wabna sayyedee wa yaa maulaee wabna maulaee ish-hadh lee be hadehish-shahadate le akuna menal faezeena be ma’arefateka wa ta ateka wa tasdi qeka watt-tebaeka,assalaato wassalaamo a’layka ya sayyedi wa yaa maulaee wabna maulaee yaa sayyedo Ibrahimo al-mojabo abno al-muhammadil abedeena al-imama musi ibne Jafarin(a.s) wa rahmatullaahe wa barakaatohu.

c)The place of martyrdom (Katlagah) :

This is the place of martyrdom of Imam Hussein (A), where he was savagely beheaded. It is near the tomb of Habib ibn Mazahir. Pilgrims here remember the day of Ashura, when Imam Hussein (A) and his companions sacrificed for the defense of Islam and Freedom.

According to Imam as-Sàdiq (A) - (6th Imam), the ziyarat of Imam Hussein (A) is obligatory (wajib) for all men and for all women.49

According to Imam as-Sàdiq (A), whoever performed the Hajj several times but did not complete the pilgrimage of Imam Hussein (A), neglected one of the most important rights of the Holy Prophet (S). For the pilgrimage of Imam Hussein (A) is a mandatory duty for every Muslim.50

49: Kamil al-ziyarat, page 122
50: Ba man be Karbala, page 232

children.name: 1- The rewards of Ziyarat of Imam Hussein (A) :

text.html:
The Holy Prophet (S) said : « O Hussein! Whoever comes to you (in Ziyarat), I will also come to him on the Day of Judgment. »51

Selon According to Imam al-Baqir (A) - (5th Imam), the one who performs the Ziyarat of Imam Hussein (A) his sins are forgiven and is like the newly born child.52

Imam as-Sadiq (A) - (6th Imam) said: « Do not abandon the Ziyarat of Imam Hussein (A), it is a cause of lengthening of life, opening of benefits (rizq), of prosperity, and offers the reward of a Martyr.» 53

According to the Holy Prophet (S), God gives the pilgrim the reward of a thousand Hajj and Umra.54

According to Imam as-Sàdiq (A), anyone among our supporters who has the opportunity but does not visit Imam Hussein (A), has incomplete faith. Even if he is part of the people of Paradise, he will feel despicable in the face of Imam Hussein's pilgrims (A).55

A man named Suleyman recounts that he had a neighbor in Kufa who considered Ziyarat to Imam Hussein (A) as a heresy/innovation (bid'at); he said such pilgrims would go to hell. One Friday morning, Suleyman came to visit him. But he learned from his wife that he had hurriedly left for Ziyarat at Karbala the night before. Astonished, he also set out for Karbala, and saw his neighbor in the haram, bathed in tears, imploring forgiveness. When their eyes met, Suleyman said : « You considered the Ziyarat as a heresy, and the pilgrims were lost to you! » He replied : « O Suleyman, do not blame me! I saw in a dream the Holy Prophet (S), Ali (A), Fatima (A), Khadija (A) and Hassan-e- Mujtaba (A) surrender to the Ziyarat of Imam Hussein (A). They distributed leaves of Grace. I approached to receive one as well, but they said to me « You consider the Ziyarat of Imam Hussein (A) as a heresy. This leaf is especially dedicated to those who come here in Ziyarat on Thursdays. » When I woke up, I rushed to Karbala. As long as I am alive, I will not leave the grave of Imam Hussein (A). »56

children.name: 2- Crying and Mourning upon Imam Hussein (A)

text.html:
Crying and lamenting the trials of the Ahl-al-Bayt and especially Imam Hussein (A) has been approved by the Holy Qur'an, as well as by the traditions of the Holy Prophet (S) and Imams (A).

The Holy Qur'an says that Prophet Yacub (A) lamented so much about the removal of his son Yusuf (A) that his eyes became white.57

The Holy Prophet (A) cried over the misfortunes of his relatives. He cried so much at his mother's grave that his companions also began to cry. He also mourned over what was to happen to Imam Hussain (A) at Kerbala.

The first to cry about the Imam (A) were the Prophets (A), the Angels, and the People of the House (A), especially Bibi Fatema (a). At the time of the martyrdom of Imam Hussein (A), the angels wept over him, lamenting.58

The Holy Prophet (S) said that all eyes will weep on the Day of Resurrection, except those who have cried over the misfortunes of Imam Hussein (A).59

Imam Zaman (A) - (12th Imam) said : « O my grandfather! May peace be upon you ! I was not there at your time to help you, and I lament it night and day. »60

57: Qur’an : Chapter 12, verse 84-85
58: Al Kafi, volume 1 page 465
59: Bihar al Anwar, volume 44 page 292
60: Bihar al Anwar, volume 101 page 320

It is recommended to fast three days before departure, and on the third day, perform ghusl. Then gather one's family and recite this dua :

اَللّهُمَّ اِنّى اَسْتَوْدِعُکَ الْيَوْمَ نَفْسى، وَاَهْلى وَمالى وَوُلْدى، وَكُلَّ مَنْ كانَ مِنّى بِسَبيلٍ، اَلشّاهِدَ مِنْهُمْ وَالْغائِبَ، اَللّهُمَّ احْفَظْنا بِحِفْظِکَ بِحِفْظِ الاْيمانِ، وَاحْفَظْ عَلَيْنا، اَللّهُمَّ اجْعَلْنا فى حِرْزِکَ، وَلا تَسْلُبْنا نِعْمَتَکَ، وَلا تُغَيِّرْ ما بِنامِنْ نِعْمَةٍ وَعافِيَةٍ، وَزِدْنا مِنْ فَضْلِکَ، اِنّا اِلَيْکَ راغِبُونَ

O Allah, I beseech You on this day to accept as trusts with You my self, my family members, my property, my children, whatever belongs to me, and whatever for which I am responsible, the present and the absent. O Allah, (please do) protect us with the protection of faith and safeguard us. O Allah, (please do) make us under Your shelter, do not deprive us of Your bounty, do not change the bliss and good health that we are enjoying, and provide us with more favor of You. Indeed, we desire for You.

Allahhumma inni asstawdeoka al-yauma nafsee,wa ahli wa ma lee wa wuldee,wa kulla man kan minni be sabilinn,ash-shaheda minhoom wal ghaeba,allahhumma ahhfadhna be hifdheka be-hifdhe al-imane, wahfadh alayna,allahhummaj-alna fee hirdheka, wala taslubna neamateka, wala tughaiyyur ma bena min neamatin wa aafiyateh,wa zidna min fadhleka,inna elayka raghebun.

Then go out of the house with humility and repeat several times :

لا اِلهَ اِلاَّ اللّهُ وَاللّهُ اَكْبَرُ وَالْحَمْدُ لِلّهِ

There is no God but Allah, and He is the Greatest and all praise be to Allah.

Laa elaaha illallaaho wallaho akbaro wal hamdo lillahe.

When one arrives at the edge of the Euphrates, recite 100 times « Allahou Akbar », 100 times « La ilaha Illallah » and 100 times the salawat. Then perform ghusl with the water of the Euphrates, and recite this dua :

بِسْمِ اللّهِ وَبِاللّهِ،اَللّهُمَّ اجْعَلْهُ نُوراً وَطَهُوراً وَحِرْزاً، وَشِفاءً مِنْ كُلِّ داءٍ وَسُقْمٍ وافَةٍ وَعاهَةٍ،اَللّهُمَّ طَهِّرْ بِهِ قَلْبى، وَاشْرَحْ بِهِ صَدْرى، وَسَهِّلْ لى بِهِ اَمْرى

I commence by the name of Allah and seek help from Him. O Allah! Render this (Act) an illumination for me and that it may purify me, protect me (from all fears) and be a cure for all ills. O Allah! Purify my heart by this, broaden my chest and make the things easy for me.

Bismillahe wa billahe,allahhummaj-alho nurann wa tahurann wa hirzann wa shefa ann min kulle dainn wa suqmin wa fatinn wa aa hatinn, allahhumma tah-hhir behi qalbee, wash-rah behi sadri, wa sah-hhill lee behi amri.

According to Imam as-Sadiq (A) - (6th Imam), whoever performs ghusl with the water of the Euphrates and then goes into Ziyarat with Imam Hussein (A), purifies himself of sins as if he had just come out of his mother's womb, even though he had committed major sins.61

As much as possible, recite your obligatory and Mustahab prayers near the tomb of Imam Hussein (A), as the prayers near his grave are accepted. According to Imam al-Baqir (A) - (5th Imam), « when you have a wish to formulate, go to the tomb of Imam Hussein (A), pray 4 rakaat and ask for what you want. »62

According to Imam as-Sadiq (A), whoever goes to Ziyarat of Imam Hussein (A) while walking, God inscribes for every step he makes 1000 hassanat (good deeds), forgives his 1000 sins, and raises him by 1000 degrees.63

According to Imam as-Sàdiq (A), when you intend to do the Ziyarat of Imam Hussein (A), take a bath (ghusl) but do not apply oil, perfume or kohl.64

Likewise, as a visitor to Imam Hussein (A), one must move away from illicit looks, sins, disputes, grudges and not swear. As long as you stay in Karbala, it is not right to eat meat and enjoy fine food. Similarly, ointment or kohl should not be applied.

Before going to Imam Hussein's haram (A), one must wear clean clothes, simple clothes and not apply perfume. It is also necessary, as far as possible, to abstain from eating and drinking, because the Imam experienced martyrdom in this state.

Move towards the haram slowly, with gravity, sadness and away from useless discussions, to devote oneself to reciting the zikr, salawât and invocations. Become aware of the greatness of Imam Hussein (A) and remember the hardships he has endured. On the way, help other pilgrims and assist the weaker ones.

It is recommended to enter through the eastern gate (east).

Stand in front of the forecourt and recite the Izne Dukhoul :

اَلّلهُمَّ اِنّى وَقَفْتُ عَلى بابٍ مِنْ اَبْوابِ بُيُوتِ نَبِيِّکَ صَلَواتُکَ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ، وَ قَدْ مَنَعْتَ النّاسَ اَنْ يَدْخُلُوآ اِلّا بِاِذْنِهِ، فَقُلْتَ يآ اَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنُوا لا تَدْخُلوُا بُيُوتَ النَّبِىِّ اِلّا اَنْ يُؤْذَنَ لَكُمْ، اَلّلهُمَّ إِنّى اَعْتَقِدُ حُرْمَةَ صاحِبِ هذَا الْمَشْهَدِ الشَّريفِ، فى غَيْبَتِهِ كَمآ اَعْتَقِدُها فى حَضْرَتِهِ، وَاَعْلَمُ اَنَّ رَسُولَکَ وَ خُلَفآئَکَ عَلَيْهُمِ السَّلامُ اَحْيآءٌ عِنْدَکَ يُرْزَقُونَ، يَرَوْنَ مَقامى وَ يَسْمَعُونَ كَلامى وَ يَرُدُّونَ سَلامى، وَ اَنَّکَ حَجَبْتَ عَنْ سَمْعى كَلامَهُمْ وَ فَتَحْتَ بابَ فَهْمى بِلَذيذِ مُناجاتِهِمْ، وَ اِنّى اَسْتَأْذِنُکَ يا رَبِّ اَوَّلاً، وَ اَسْتَاْذِنُ رَسُولَکَ صَلَّى‌اللّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ ثانِياً، وَ اَسْتَأْذِنُ خَليفَتَکَ الاْمامَ الْمَفْرُوضَ عَلَىَّ طاعَتُهُ اَلْحُسَيْنَ بْنَ عَلىٍّ عَلَيْهِ السَّلامُ، وَالْمَلائِكَةَ الْمُوَكَّلينَ بِهٰذِهِ الْبُقْعَةِ الْمُبارَكَةِ ثالِثاً، ءَاَدْخُلُ يا رَسُولَ اللّهِ، ءَاَدْخُلُ يا حُجَّةَ اللّهِ، ءَاَدْخُلُ يا مَلائِكَةَ اللّهِ الْمُقَرَّبينَ الْمُقيمينَ فى هذَا الْمَشْهَدِ، فَاْذَنْ لى يا مَوْلاىَ فِى الدُّخُولِ، اَفْضَلَ مآ اَذِنْتَ لاَحَدٍ مِنْ اَوْلِيآئِکَ، فَاِنْ لَمْ اَكُنْ اَهْلاً لِذٰلِکَ فَاَنْتَ اَهْلٌ لِذٰلِکَ.

O Allah, I am standing at the door of one of the houses of Your Prophet; Your peace be upon him and his family. You have prohibited the people from entering his house except by the permission of Your Prophet and You said: “O You who believe do not enter the house of the Prophet unless permitted to do so”. O Allah, I believe in this in his absence just as I believe it in his presence and I know that Your Prophet and Your vicegerents upon whom be peace, are Alive in Your presence, they are being nourished, they see my position and hear my speech and they return my greetings and (I believe) that You have covered my ears from hearing their speech and have opened the door of perception of their secret conversations (with You); I seek Your permission first, O’ my Lord; then I seek the permission of Your Prophet_ peace be upon him and his family_ secondly, and I seek the permission of Your vicegerent, Imam Hussain Bin Ali (A.S) whose obedience is incumbent upon me and (the permission of) Your angels entrusted over this blessed site thirdly. May I enter, O Prophet of Allah, may I enter O the proof of Allah, may I enter, O angels of Allah who are stationed close to this shrine, so permit me O my master to enter the best of way that You have permitted any of Your friends, if I am not deserving of that then You surely are deserving of that.

Allahhumma innee wa qafto alla babinn min abwabe boyute nabiyyeka salawaatoka a’layhe Wa alehi, wa qad mana’ta ann-nasa ann yad kholu illa be idhnehi faqulta yaa ayyohal ladhina aamanu laa tad kholu boyutan-nabiyeenn illa ann yu dha na lakum, allahhumma inni aa’ataqedo Hurmata sahebe hadha al mash-hade ash-shareefe, fee ghaybatehi kamaa aa’ataqedoha fee hazratehi,wa aa’alamo anna rasoolaka wa kholafaoka alayhome assalaamo ahhyao indaka yurzaqoona,yarawna maqaamee wa yasmaoona kalamee wa yarudduna salamee,wa annaka hajabta ann sam’ee kalamahum wa fatahhta baba fahmi be ladide munajatehim,wa inni astadhenoka yaa rabbe awwalan,wa astadenu rasoolaka sallallaaho a’layhe wa aalehi thaneyan, wa asstadheno khalayafataka al-imamal mafruza alaiyya ta aatohu al-hussaynabna Aliyan alayhissalamo,wal malaaa-ekata al-mowakkalina behadhehi al-buq’aatil mobarakate thalethan, aa adkhulu yaa rasoolallahe, aa adkhulu yaa hujjatallaahe, aa adkhulu yaa malaaa-ekatallahe al-moqarrabina al-muqimeena fee hadha al mash-hade,fa dann lee yaa maulaee feedd-dokhule,afdhala maa adinta laa hadinn min awleyaaa-eka, fa inn lam akun ahlann ledaleka fa anta ahlun le dhaleka.
