In spite of this, Harun conceived the indecent idea of sending to his cell an attractive young woman whose mission was to distract him from his prayers. But the Imam (A) paid no attention to her. And, against all odds, it was she who was so moved by his devotion that she began to pray fervently behind him.

Harun realized that from day to day people were won over by the qualities of the Imam (A). From the depths of the dark underground dungeon, where he was locked up almost permanently, he aroused such sympathy that the number of his followers only increased. Fearing for his prestige and power, the caliph took the infamous decision to physically eliminate him, through poisoned dates. The Imam's agony lasted for 3 days, away from his own, but so close to God, and he died on 25 Rajab 183 AH.

Imam Muhammad ibn Ali al-Jawad (A) is the 9th Imam of the Shiites. He is the son of Imam ar-Redha (A) and Janabe Sabika. He was about 8 years old at the time of the martyrdom of his father. He had to endure the oppression of two successive caliphs : Ma'moun and his brother Mo'tassim. Indeed, once installed in Iraq, Ma'moun, in a final strategy, wanted to consolidate his power by renewing good relations with the 9th Imam of the Shiites. Because he knew he was accused by the sincere Muslims of the murder of the 8th Imam. So he summoned him to Baghdad, where great old and experienced scientists as well as the notables of the Bani Abbass (the clan of the Abbasid dynasty, in power) had also been invited. During this solemn assembly, he married his daughter Umul Fazl to Imam al-Jawad (A). This allowed him, on the one hand, to put an end to the suspicions and accusations against him, and on the other hand to closely monitor the new Imam who already showed immense knowledge and a great personality.

After this event, the Imam returned to Medina where he lived with his wife for 15 years. As they were unable to have children, he took as a second wife a servant called Samana (the future mother of Imam Hadi (A), who is our 10th Imam). Ummul Fazl could not bear it, letting herself be consumed with jealousy.

At the death of Ma'moun, his brother Mo'tassim succeeded him to power. He was even more cruel than Ma'moun.

He also could not bear to see the aura of the Imam grow with the public. In order to plan his assassination, he summoned him with his first wife (so his own niece) to Baghdad. He then ordered her to poison her husband, which she did with his help and that of her brother Ja'far, through poisoned grapes. Imam al-Jawad (A) was only 25 years old when he experienced martyrdom and his imamat lasted 17 years. His grave is located near that of his grandfather Imam al-Kadhim (A).

74: Soghname Ale Mohammad, page 95

According to Imam ar-Redha (A) - (8th Imam), the one who performs the Ziyarat of his father Imam al-Kadhim (A) in Baghdad (more precisely in Kadhmayn), will have as a reward the Ziyarat of the tomb of the Holy Prophet (S) and Imam Ali (A).75

According to Imam as-Sadiq (A) - (6th Imam), the reward of the Ziyarat of every Imam is equivalent to the Ziyarat of the Holy Prophet (S).76

One day, a woman ran to the tomb of Imam al-Kadhim (A) - (7th Imam) and his grandson Imam al-Jawad (A) - (9th Imam), to beg them to release her son who had been taken prisoner. Another woman, an enemy of the Ahl-al-Bayt, made fun of her. However, when they returned home, the first found her free son while the son of the second had been taken prisoner. This authentic story demonstrates the powers of our Imams.77

75: Ba man be Karbala, page 316
76: Same, page 318
77: Ba man be Karbala, page 319

They are identical to those presented above concerning the Ziyarat of Imam Ali (A).

After ghusl, go to the haram with humility, stop before the haram and recite :

اَللّهُ اَكْبَرُ اَللّهُ اَكْبَرُ ، لا اِلهَ اِلاَّ اللّهُ وَ اللّهُ اَكْبَرُ، اَلْحَمْدُلِلّهِ عَلى هِدايَتِهِ لِدينِهِ، وَ التَّوْفيقِ لِما دَعا اِلَيْهِ مِنْ سَبيلِهِ، اَلّلهُمَّ اِنَّکَ اَكْرَمُ مَقْصُودٍ وَ اَكْرَمُ مَاْتِىٍّ، وَ قَدْ اَتَيْتُکَ مُتَقَرِّباً اِلَيْکَ بِابْنِ بِنْتِ نَبِيِّکَ، صَلَواتُکَ عَلَيْهِ وَ عَلى آبآئِهِ الطّاهِرينَ وَ اَبْنائِهِ الطَّيِّبينَ، اَلّلهُمَّ صَلِّ عَلى مُحَمَّدٍ وَ آلِ مُحَمَّدٍ، وَ لا تُخَيِّبْ سَعْيى وَ لا تَقْطَعْ رَجآئى، وَ اجْعَلْنى عِنْدَکَ وَجيهاً فِى الدُّنْيا وَ الاْخِرَةِ وَ مِنَ المُقَرَّبينَ.

Allah is the Greatest. Allah is the Greatest. There is no god except Allah. And Allah is the Greatst. All praise be to Allah for guiding (me) to His religion and for leading (me) successfully to His Course to which He has invited (us). O Allah, You are verily the most Honorable Besought One and the most Honorable Purposed One. I thus have come to You, seeking nearness to You in the name of the son of Your Prophet’s daughter, Your blessings be upon him and upon his immaculate fathers and pure sons. O Allah, (please) send blessings upon Muhammad and the offspring of Muhammad, never frustrate my efforts, never cut off my hope, make me illustrious in Your view in this world as well as the world to come, and make me of those brought near to You.

Allaho akbaro allaho akbaro, laa elaha illallaaho wallaho akbaro, alhamdullilahe alla hedayatehi le denehi, wat’taufiqe lema da’aa elayhe min sabeelehi, allahumma innaka aakramo maqsudinn wa aakramo maa tiyyin, wa qad ataytoka mutaqarreban elayka be ibne binte nabiyyeka, salawatoka alayhe wa alla aabaehit-tahereena wa abnaehit’tayyebina, allahhumma sa’lle a’lla muha’mmadiw wa aale Muhammad,wa laa tokhayyeb saa’ayee wa laa taqtaa’a raja-yee,waj alnee indaka wa jeehan feed-dunya wal aakherate menal moqarrabin.

When entering, say :

بِسْمِ اللّهِ وَ بِاللّهِ وَ فى سَبيلِ اللّهِ، وَ عَلى مِلَّةِ رَسُولِ اللّهِ، صَلَّى اللّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ، اَلّلهُمَّ اغْفِرْلى وَ لِوالِدَىَّ وَ لِجَميعِ المُؤْمِنينَ وَ المُؤْمِناتِ

In the Name of Allah (I begin), in Allah (I trust), and on the way of Allah and on the norm of the Messenger of Allah (I proceed), may Allah bless him and his progeny. O Allah, (please do) forgive me, my parents, and all the believing men and women.

Bismillahe wa billahe wa fee sabillilahe, wa alla millate rasoolillahe, sallallaho wa alayhe wa aalehi, allahummaghfirli wale waledaiyya wa le jameeil momenina wal momenate

When you arrive at the door of the dome, stop and ask permission to enter :

ءَاَدْخُلُ يا رَسُولَ اللّهِ، ءَاَدْخُلُ يا نَبِىَّ اللّهِ، ءَاَدْخُلُ يا مُحَمَّدَ بْنَ عَبْدِاللّهِ، ءَاَدْخُلُ يا اَميرَالْمُؤْمِنينَ، ءَاَدْخُلُ يا اَبا مُحَمَّدٍن الْحَسَنَ، ءَاَدْخُلُ يا اَبا عَبْدِاللّهِ الْحُسَيْنَ، ءَاَدْخُلُ يا اَبا مُحَمَّدٍ عَلِىَّ بْنَ الْحُسَيْنِ، ءَاَدْخُلُ يا اَبا جَعْفَرٍ مُحَمَّدَ بْنَ عَلِىٍّ، ءَاَدْخُلُ يا اَبا عَبْدِاللّهِ جَعْفَرَ بْنَ مُحَمَّدٍ، ءَاَدْخُلُ يا مَوْلاىَ يا اَبَا الْحَسَنِ مُوسَى بْنَ جَعْفَرٍ، ءَاَدْخُلُ يا مَوْلاىَ يا اَبا جَعْفَرٍ، ءَاَدْخُلُ يا مَوْلاىَ مُحَمَّدَ بْنَ عَلِىٍّ

O Allah’s Messenger, may I enter? O Allah’ Prophet, may I enter? O Muhammad the son of Abdullah, may I enter? O Commander of the Faithful, may I enter? O Abu-Muhammad al-Hasan, may I enter? O Abu-Abdullah al-Hussain, may I enter? O Abu-Muhammad Ali Ibn al-Hussain, may I enter? O Abu-Jafar Muhammad Ibn Ali, may I enter? O Abu-Abdullah Jafar Ibn Muhammad, may I enter? O my master Abul-Hasan Musa Ibn Jafar, may I enter? O my master Abu-Jafar, may I enter? O my master Muhammad Ibn Ali, may I enter?

A-adkholu yaa rasoolallahe, a-adkholu yaa nabiyyallahe, a-adkholu yaa Muhammadabna Abdillahe, a-adkholu yaa Ameeral momineena, a-adkholu yaa Aba Muhammadin al-Hasan, a-adkholu yaa Aba abdeellahil Husayna, a-adkholu yaa Aba Muhammadin Aliyeeb-nal Husayane, a-adkholu yaa Aba Ja’afarin Muhammadabna Aliyeen, a-adkholu yaa abillahe Ja’afarabna Muhammadin, a-adkholu yaa maulai yaa Abal Hasane Musa’abna ja’afarin, a-adkholu yaa maulai yaa Aba ja’afarin, a-adkholu yaa maulai Muhammad’abna Aliyeenn

children.name: 3- The Ziyarat common to both Imams

text.html:
اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكُما يا وَلِيَّىِ اللهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكُما يا حُجَّتَىِ اللهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكُما يا نوُرَىِ اللهِ فى ظُلُماتِ الاَرْضِ، اَشْهَدُ اَنَّكُما قَدْ بَلَّغْتُما عَنِ اللهِ ما حَمَّلَكُما، وَحَفِظْتُما مَا اسْتَوْدِعْتُما، وَحَلَّلْتُما حَلالَ اللهِ وَحَرَّمْتُما حَرامَ اللهِ، وَاَقَمْتُما حُدوُدَ اللهِ، وَتَلَوْتُما كِتابَ اللهِ، وَصَبَرْتُما عَلَى الاَذى فى جَنْبِ اللهِ، مُحْتَسِبَيْنِ حَتّى اَتيكُمَا الْيَقينُ، اَبْرَءُ اِلَى اللهِ مِنْ اَعْدآئِكُما وَاَتَقَرَّبُ اِلَى اللهِ بِوِلايَتِكُما، اَتَيْتُكُما زائِراً عارِفاً بِحَقِّكُما، مُوالِياً لاِوْلِيآئِكُما مُعادِياً لاِعْدآئِكُما، مُسْتَبْصِراً بِالْهُدَى، الَّذى اَنْتُما عَلَيْهِ، عارِفاً بِضَلالَةِ مَنْ خالَفَكُما، فَاشْفَعا لى عِنْدَ رَبِّكُما، فَاِنَّ لَكُما عِنْدَاللهِ جاهاً عَظيماً وَمَقاماً مَحْموُداً.

Peace be upon both of you, O the representatives of Allah! Peace be upon both of you, O the decisive arguments of Allah! Peace be upon both of you, O the lights of Allah in the darkness of the (ignorant) world! I bear witness that, verily, you had successfully carried and delivered that for which Allah had commissioned you, protected that which was entrusted to you, prescribed that which Allah has made lawful, proscribed that which Allah has made unlawful, made clear the divine rules, studied and interpreted the Book of Allah, while directing affairs in the light of the divine rules, exercised self-control bravely in the midst of offensive provocations, till the inevitable came unto you I turn to Allah by disconnecting all links with your enemies, I seek nearness to Allah through my love for you, I have come near you, fully aware of your rights, attached to your friends, averse to your enemies, well acquainted with the guidance you adhered to, mindful of the depravity of your opponents, so speak on my behalf before your Lord, because, verily, your grandeur, before Allah, is the most exalted, your position is highly celebrated.

Assalaamo a’layka yaa waleeyallahe, assalaamo a’laykoma yaa hujjatillahe, assalaamo a’laykoma yaa nurillahe fee dholomatil ardhe, ash-hado annakoma qad ballaghtoma anillahe maa hammalkoma, wa hafidhtoma mas taw de’atoma, wa hallal’toma halallallahe wa harramtoma haramallahe, wa aqam’toma hoda wudallahe, wa talawtoma ketaballahe, wa sabartoma alla al-ladhee fee janbillahe,muhtasebayne hatti ataykomal yaqeeno,abraoo elallaahe min aa’a-daekoma wa ata qarrabo elallaahe be wilayatekoma, atay’tokoma zaerann aa’refann be haqqekoma,mowaleyan le awleyakoma mo aa deyan le a-adaekoma, mustabseran bil hodee, al-ladhee antoma alayhe, aa-refan be dhalalate man kha lafakoma, fash-fa’aa lee inda rabbekoma, fa inna lakoma indallahe ja hann adheeman wa maqaman mahmudan.

Then kiss the grave and say :

اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكُما يا حُجَّتَىِ اللهِ فى اَرْضِهِ وَسَمآئِهِ، عَبْدُكُما وَوَلِيُّكُما زآئِرُكُما مُتَقَرِّبآ اِلَى اللهِ بِزِيارَتِكُما، اَللّهُمَّ اجْعَلْ لى لِسانَ صِدْقٍ فى اَوْلِيآئِکَ الْمُصْطَفَيْنَ، وَحَبِّبْ اِلَىَّ مَشاهِدَهُمْ، وَاجْعَلْنى مَعَهُمْ فِى الدُّنْيا وَالاْخِرَةِ يا اَرْحَمَ الرّاحِمينَ.

Peace be upon both of you, O the decisive proofs of Allah on His earth and in His heavens. Your servant, your friend, has come to visit you, in order to seek Allah's nearness through your “Ziyaarat”. O Allah make me speak the truth about Thy chosen friends, render my visit to them winsome, and let me be with them in this world and in the Hereafter, O the Most Merciful!

Assalaamo a’laykoma yaa hujjatillahe fee ar’dhehi wa samaa’ehi, abdokoma wa waliyyokoma dhaa e rokoma mutaqarrebaa ilallahe be ziyaratekoma, allahhummaj-al lee lesana sidqin fee awleyaeka al-mustafina, wa habbib elayya masha hedahum, waj alnee ma’a-hum feed dunya wal-aakherate yaa arhamar raahemin.

Say the Ziyarat prayer for each Imam (2 rakaat) and ask your Hajat.

children.name: 4- The Ziyarat specific to Imam Musa ibn Ja'far al-Kadhim (A)

text.html:
السَّلامُ عَلَیْكَ یَا وَلِیَّ اللَّهِ وَ ابْنَ وَلِیِّهِ، السَّلامُ عَلَیْكَ یَا حُجَّةَ اللَّهِ وَ ابْنَ حُجَّتِهِ السَّلامُ عَلَیْكَ یَا صَفِیَّ اللَّهِ وَ ابْنَ صَفِیِّهِ، السَّلامُ عَلَیْكَ یَا أَمِینَ اللَّهِ وَ ابْنَ أَمِینِهِ، السَّلامُ عَلَیْكَ یَا نُورَ اللَّهِ فِی ظُلُمَاتِ الْأَرْضِ، السَّلامُ عَلَیْكَ یَا إِمَامَ الْهُدَى، السَّلامُ عَلَیْكَ یَا عَلَمَ الدِّینِ وَ التُّقَى، السَّلامُ عَلَیْكَ یَا خَازِنَ عِلْمِ النَّبِیِّینَ، السَّلامُ عَلَیْكَ یَا خَازِنَ عِلْمِ الْمُرْسَلِینَ، السَّلامُ عَلَیْكَ یَا نَائِبَ الْأَوْصِیَاءِ السَّابِقِینَ، السَّلامُ عَلَیْكَ یَا مَعْدِنَ الْوَحْیِ الْمُبِینِ، السَّلامُ عَلَیْكَ یَا صَاحِبَ الْعِلْمِ الْیَقِینِ، السَّلامُ عَلَیْكَ یَا عَیْبَةَ عِلْمِ الْمُرْسَلِینَ، السَّلامُ عَلَیْكَ أَیُّهَا الْإِمَامُ الصَّالِحُ، السَّلامُ عَلَیْكَ أَیُّهَا الْإِمَامُ الزَّاهِدُ، السَّلامُ عَلَیْكَ أَیُّهَا الْإِمَامُ الْعَابِدُ، السَّلامُ عَلَیْكَ أَیُّهَا الْإِمَامُ السَّیِّدُ الرَّشِیدُ، السَّلامُ عَلَیْكَ أَیُّهَا الْمَقْتُولُ الشَّهِیدُ، السَّلامُ عَلَیْكَ یَا ابْنَ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ وَ ابْنَ وَصِیِّهِ، السَّلامُ عَلَیْكَ یَا مَوْلایَ مُوسَى بْنَ جَعْفَرٍ وَ رَحْمَةُ اللَّهِ وَ بَرَكَاتُهُ، أَشْهَدُ أَنَّكَ قَدْ بَلَّغْتَ عَنِ اللَّهِ مَا حَمَّلَكَ وَ حَفِظْتَ مَا اسْتَوْدَعَكَ، وَ حَلَّلْتَ حَلالَ اللَّهِ وَ حَرَّمْتَ حَرَامَ اللَّهِ، وَ أَقَمْتَ أَحْكَامَ اللَّهِ ، وَ تَلَوْتَ كِتَابَ اللَّهِ وَ صَبَرْتَ عَلَى الْأَذَى فِی جَنْبِ اللَّهِ، وَ جَاهَدْتَ فِی اللَّهِ حَقَّ جِهَادِهِ حَتَّى أَتَاكَ الْیَقِینُ، وَ أَشْهَدُ أَنَّكَ مَضَیْتَ عَلَى مَا مَضَى عَلَیْهِ آبَاؤُكَ الطَّاهِرُونَ وَ أَجْدَادُكَ الطَّیِّبُونَ الْأَوْصِیَاءُ الْهَادُونَ الْأَئِمَّةُ الْمَهْدِیُّونَ، لَمْ تُؤْثِرْ عَمًى عَلَى هُدًى، وَ لَمْ تَمِلْ مِنْ حَقٍّ إِلَى بَاطِلٍ، وَ أَشْهَدُ أَنَّكَ نَصَحْتَ لِلَّهِ وَ لِرَسُولِهِ وَ لِأَمِیرِ الْمُؤْمِنِینَ، وَ أَنَّكَ أَدَّیْتَ الْأَمَانَةَ، وَ اجْتَنَبْتَ الْخِیَانَةَ، وَ أَقَمْتَ الصَّلاةَ، وَ آتَیْتَ الزَّكَاةَ، وَ أَمَرْتَ بِالْمَعْرُوفِ وَ نَهَیْتَ عَنِ الْمُنْكَرِ، وَ عَبَدْتَ اللَهَ مُخْلِصًا مُجْتَهِدًا مُحْتَسِبًا حَتَّى أَتَاكَ الْیَقِینُ فَجَزاكَ اللَهُ عَنِ الْأِسْلامِ وَاَهْلِهِ‏ افْضَلَ الْجَزآءِ،وَاَشْرَفَ الْجَزآء، اَتَيْتُكَ يَا بْنَ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ زآئِراً، عارِفاً بِحَقِّكَ، مُقِرّاً بِفَضْلِكَ، مُحْتَمِلاً لِعِلْمِكَ، مُحْتَجِباً بِذِمَّتِكَ، عآئِذاً بِقَبْرِكَ، لاَئِذاً بِضَريحِكَ، مُسْتَشْفِعاً بِكَ اِلَى اللَهِ، مُوالِياً لِأَوْلِيآئِكَ، مُعادِياً لِأَعْدآئِكَ، و مُسْتَبْصِراً بِشَأْنِكَ و بِالْهُدَىَ الَّذى‏ اَنْتَ عَلَيْهِ، عالِماً بِضَلالَةِ مَنْ خالَفَكَ وَبِالْعَمَى الَّذى‏ هُمْ عَلَيْهِ، بِاَبى‏ اَنْتَ وَاُمِّى‏ وَنَفْسِى‏ وَاَهْلِى‏ وَمالِى‏ وَوَلَدِى‏ يَا بْنَ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ، اَتَيْتُكَ مُتَقَرِّباً بِزِيارَتِكَ اِلَى اللَّهِ تَعالى‏، وَمُسْتَشْفِعاً بِكَ اِلَيْهِ فَاشْفَعْ لى‏ عِنْدَ رِبِّكَ‏ لِيَغْفِرَ لى‏ ذُنُوبى‏، وَيَعْفُوَ عَنْ جُرْمى‏، وَيَتَجاوَزَ عَنْ سَيِّئاتى‏، وَيَمْحُوَ عَنّى‏ خَطيئاتِى‏، وَيُدْخِلَنِى الْجَنَّةَ، وَيَتَفَضَّلَ عَلَىَّ بِما هُوَ اَهْلُهُ، َ وَيَغْفِر لى‏ وَلِأبائِى‏، وَلِأِخْوانى‏ وَاَخَواتِى‏، وَلِجَميعِ الْمُؤْمِنينَ وَالْمُؤْمِناتِ‏ فى‏ مَشارِقِ الْأَرْضِ وَمَغارِبِها، بِفَضْلِهِ وَجُودِهِ وَمَنِّهِ.

Que la paix soit sur toi, ô Wali de Dieu, et fils de Son Wali ! Que la paix soit sur toi, ô Argument de Dieu et fils de Son Argument ! Que la paix soit sur toi, ô Pur de Dieu et fils de Son Pur ! Que la paix soit sur toi, ô Fidèle de Dieu et fils du Fidèle de Dieu ! Que la paix soit sur toi, ô Lumière de Dieu dans les ténèbres de la terre ! Que la paix soit sur toi, ô Guide de la bonne direction ! Que la paix soit sur toi, ô Etendard de la religion et de la dévotion ! Que la paix soit sur toi, ô Trésorier du savoir des Prophètes ! Que la paix soit sur toi, ô Gardien du savoir des Messagers ! Peace be upon you, O the representative of Allah, and the son of His representative! Peace be upon you, O the decisive argument of Allah, ant the son of His decisive argument! Peace be on you, O the sincerely attached friend of Allah, and the son of His sincerely attached friend! Peace be on you, O the confidant of Allah, and the son of His confidant! Peace be on you, O the light of Allah in the darkness of the (ignorant) world! Peace be on you, O the guide who showed the right path! Peace be on you, O the symbol of religion and piety! Peace be on you, O the treasurer of the wisdom of the prophets! Peace be upon you, O the treasurer of the wisdom of the Messengers! Peace be upon you, O the vicegerent of the earlier guardians, Peace be on you, O the depository of the evident revelations! Peace be upon you,O the possessor of sure knowledge! Peace be upon you, O the treasury of the Messenger’s knowledge! Peace be upon you, O the virtuous guide! Peace be upon you, O the devout guide! Peace be upon you, O the worshipful guide! Peace be upon you, O the principal guide who followed the right path! Peace be upon you, O the murdered martyr! Peace be upon you, O the son of the Messenger of Allah, and the son of his successor! Peace be upon you, O my master Moosa bin Jafar, and also mercy and blessings of Allah!

I bear witness that you carried and delivered that for which Allah has commissioned you, protected that which was entrusted to you, prescribed that which Allah has made lawful, proscribed that which Allah has made unlawful, made clear the divine rules, studied and interpreted the Book of Allah, exercised self-control in the midst sake of Allah, strived in the cause of Allah, leaving no stone unturned, till the inevitable came unto you. I bear witness that you followed the path which your pure forefathers, pious ancestors and the rightly guided guides, the successors of the Holy Prophet, had followed never accommodated waywardness to jeopardize guidance, never turned aside truth to make room for falsehood. I bear witness that, verily, you always gave sincere advice to the people in the matter of Allah, His Messenger, and the Ameer - ul - Moomineen; verily, you conscientiously returned the deposits kept in you safe custody, kept away from abuse of confidence established prayers, gave the prescribed share to the needy, commanded to do that which is lawful, not to do that which is unlawful, sincerely served Allah, gave just decisions and took proper action, till the inevitable came unto you. Allah compensated you for (your) total submission to Him, with superior most and continuous rewards. I have come to visit you, O the son of the Messenger of Allah, aware of your rights, conscious of your excellence, equipped with you knowledge, covered with your guarantee. I have taken refuge near your grave; your “Zarih” is my sanctuary. You are my advocate before Allah, I am a friend of your friends, I am averse to your enemies, well acquainted with your rank, and with the guidance you adhered to, mindful of the depravity of your opponents, and of the waywardness in which they are wandering. I, my father, and my mother, my family, my possessions and my children are at your disposal, O the son of the Messenger of Allah! I have come to you to seek nearness of Allah through my visit to you, and to nominate you as my advocate before Him, therefore, speak to your Lord to forgive my sins, to pardon my transgressions, to overlook my wrongdoings to wipe off my mistakes, to let me enter the Paradise, to treat me with kindness which He is able to do, to grant me amnesty, and to my fathers, to my brothers, to my sisters, to all the believing men and the believing women, wherever they are in the earth, (from east to west) in the name of His obligingness, in the name of His generosity, in the name of His kindness. Peace be upon you.

Assalaamo a’layka yaa waliyallahe wabna waliyehi, assalaamo a’layka yaa hujjatallahe wabna hujjatehi assalaamo a’layka safiyallahe wabna safiyyehi, assalaamo a’layka yaa aminallahe wabna aminehi, assalaamo a’layka yaa noorallahe fee dholomatil arrdhe, assalaamo a’layka yaa imaamal hodee, assalaamo a’layka yaa alamaddine wat’tuqee, assalaamo a’layka yaa khazena ilamin-nabiyyina, assalaamo a’layka yaa khazena illmil mursaleen, assalaamo a’layka yaa naaebal awsiya-is’sabeqeen, assalaamo a’layka yaa ma’adeenal wah’yil mobine, assalaamo a’layka yaa sahebal ilmeel yaqeen, assalaamo a’layka yaa aybata ilmeel moorsaleen, assalaamo a’layka ayyohal imamus-saleho, assalaamo a’layka ayyohal imamuz-zahedo, assalaamo a’layka ayyohal imamul-aabedo, assalaamo a’layka ayyohal imamus-sayyedur’rasheedo. Assalaamo a’layka ayyohal maqtoolush-shaheedo, assalaamo a’layka yaabna rasoolillahe wabna wasiyyehi, assalaamo a’layka yaa maulaee Musa’ibna Ja’fareen wa rahmatullahe wabarakatohu,

ash-hado annaka qad ballaghta aneellahe maa hammalaka wa hafidhta mastaw da’aka, wa hallat halaalallahe wa harrammta haramallahe, wa aqammta ah-kamallahe, wa talawta ketAballahe wa sabarta alla al-adhee fee janbillahe, wa ja had’ta fellahe haqqa jehadehi hatti a’takal yaqeeno, wa ash-hado annaka madhayta alla maa madhee alayhe aabaokat-taaheroona wa aj’daadoka at-tayyeboonal awseyaul haduna al a-aimmatul mahdiyyun, lam tuthir ameen alla hodinn, wa lam tamil min haqqin elaa batelinn, wa ash-hado annaka nasah-tallahe wa le rasoolehi wa le ameeril momenina, wa annaka ad’daytal amaanata,waj tanabtal kheyanata, wa aqamtas-salat, wa aataytaz zakat, wa amarta bil ma’aroofe wa nahayta anil moonkare, wa Abadtallah mukhlesan mujtahedan muhtaseban hatti a-taakal yaqeenu fa jazakallaho anil islame wa ahhlehi af-dhala al-jazaa e , wa asharafal jazaa-a’ ataytoka yabna rasoolillahe jaaerann, aarefann be haqqeka, moqirran be fadhleka,muhtamelan le ilmeka,muhtajeban be dhimmateka, aa’e-dhann be qabreka, la e dhann be dhareeheka,mushtashfeann beka elal’llahe, mowaleyann le awleyaaeka, moaadeyann le a-adaaeka, wa mustabserann be shaaneka wa bil hodayall’ladhi anta alayhe, aaleman be dhalaalate man khalafaka wa bil amilladhi hum alayhe, be abi anta wa ummiyi wa nafsee wa ahlee wa ma lee wa waladee yabna rasoolillahe,aataytoka mutaqrreban be ziyarateka elal’llahe ta’aalee, wa mushtashfeann beka elayahe fash-fa’aa lee inda rabbeka le yaghfeer lee dhunbee, wa ya’a-fowa ann jurmee, wa ya tajawaja ann sayyeaatee, wa yamhowa anni khatayaatee, wa yudkhelanee al-jannata, wayatafadhal alayyee bema howa ahlohu, wa yaghfeer lee wa le abaee, wa le ikhwanee wa akhawatee, wa le jamee e al-momineena wal mumenaate fee mashareqe al-ardhe wa magharebeha,be fadhlehi wajoodehi wa mannehi.

Then kiss the grave, put both sides of the face on the grave and ask your Hajat. Then return to his holy face and say :

السَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يَا مَوْلايَ يَا مُوسَى بْنَ جَعْفَرٍ وَ رَحْمَةُ اللَّهِ وَ بَرَكَاتُهُ، أَشْهَدُ أَنَّكَ الْإِمَامُ الْهَادِي وَ الْوَلِيُّ الْمُرْشِدُ وَ أَنَّكَ مَعْدِنُ التَّنْزِيلِ وَ صَاحِبُ التَّأْوِيلِ وَ حَامِلُ التَّوْرَاةِ وَ الْإِنْجِيلِ، وَ الْعَالِمُ الْعَادِلُ وَ الصَّادِقُ الْعَامِلُ، يَا مَوْلايَ أَنَا أَبْرَأُ إِلَى اللَهِ مِنْ أَعْدَائِكَ وَ أَتَقَرَّبُ إِلَى اللَّهِ بِمُوَالاتِكَ، فَصَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْكَ وَ عَلَى آبَائِكَ وَ أَجْدَادِكَ وَ أَبْنَائِكَ وَ شِيعَتِكَ وَ مُحِبِّيكَ وَ رَحْمَةُ اللَهِ وَ بَرَكَاتُهُ

O my master, O Moosa bin Jafar, and also mercy and blessings of Allah! I bear witness that, verily, you are the guide who showed the right path, the guardian who adhered to the true path, verily, you are the depository of the revelation, and exposed its true meanings; you are the bearer of the Torah and Bible; you are an honest scholar, and a truthful performer. O my Mawlaa! I turn to Allah by avoiding your enemies, I seek nearness of Allah through my love for you, blessings of Allah be upon you, on your forefathers, on your ancestors, on your children and your friends and followers.

Assalaamo a’layka yaa mawlaee yaa Musa I’bna ja’fareen wa rahmatullahe wabarakatohu, ashhado annakal imamul hadi wa al-waliyyul murshedo wa annaka ma-adenuttanzeele wa sahebo at-taweele wa hamelut-taurate wal injile, wal aalemul aadelo was sadeqo al-aamelo, yaa mawlaee anaa abrau elallahe min a-adaaeka wa ataqarrabo elalllahe be mowalateka, fa sallallaho alayka wa alla aabaeka wa aj-daadeka wa abnaeka wa shiateka wa mohibbeka wa rahmatulaahe wabarakaatohu

Then pray 2 rakaat, recite Surat al-Hamd and one Surah Yasin, then Surah Rahman or any other surah and ask your hajat from God.

This prayer about Imam al-Kadhim (A) describes some of his great qualities, and recalls his suffering.

اَللّهُمَّ صَلِّ عَلى مُحَمَّدٍ وَاَهْلِ بَيْتِهِ، وَصَلِّ عَلى موُسَى بْنِ جَعْفَرٍ وَصِىِّ الاَبْرارِ، وَاِمامِ الاَخْيارِ وَ عَيْبَةِ الاَنْوارِ، وَوارِثِ السَّكينَةِ وَالْوَقارِ، وَالْحِكَمِ وَالاْثارِ، الَّذى كانَ يُحْيِى اللَّيْلَ بِالسَّهَرِ اِلَى السَّحَرِ بِمُواصَلَةِ الاِسْتِغْفارِ، حَليفِ السَّجْدَةِ الطَّويلَةِ، وَالدُّمُوعِ الْغَزيرَةِ وَالْمُناجاتِ الْكَثيرَةِ، وَالضَّراعاتِ الْمُتَّصِلَةِ، وَمَقَرِّ النُّهى وَالْعَدْلِ وَالْخَيْرِ، وَالفَضْلِ وَالنَّدى، وَالْبَذْلِ وَمَأْلَفِ الْبَلْوى وَالصَّبْرِ، وَالْمُضْطَهَدِ بِالظُّلْمِ وَالْمَقْبُورِ بِالْجَوْرِ، وَالْمُعَذَّبِ فى قَعْرِ السُّجُونِ وَظُلَمِ الْمَطاميرِ، ذِى السّاقِ الْمَرْضُوضِ بِحَلَقِ الْقُيُودِ، وَالْجَنازَةِ الْمُنادى عَلَيْها بِذُلِّ الاِسْتِخْفافِ، وَالْوارِدِ عَلى جَدِّهِ الْمُصْطَفى وَاَبيهِ الْمُرْتَضى، وَاُمِّهِ سَيِّدَةِ النِّسآءِ بِاِرْثٍ مَغْصُوبٍ وَ وَلاءٍ مَسْلُوبٍ، وَاَمْرٍ مَغْلُوبٍ وَدَمٍ مَطْلُوبٍ، وَسَمٍّ مَشْرُوبٍ، اَللّهُمَّ وَكَما صَبَرَ عَلى غَليظِ الْمِحَنِ، وَتَجَرَّعَ غُصَصَ الْكُرَبِ وَاسْتَسْلَمَ لِرِضاکَ، وَاَخْلَصَ الطّاعَةَ لَکَ وَمَحَضَ الْخُشُوعَ، وَاسْتَشْعَرَ الْخُضُوعَ وَ عادَى الْبِدْعَةَ وَاَهْلَها، وَلَمْ يْلحَقْهُ وَفى شَىْءٍ مِنْ اَوامِرِکَ وَ نَواهيکَ لَوْمَةُ لائِمٍ، صَلِّ عَلَيْهِ صَلَوةً نامِيَةً مُنيفَةً زاكِيَةً، توُجِبُ لَهُ بِها شَفاعَةَ اُمَمٍ مِنْ خَلْقِکَ، وَقُروُنٍ مِنْ بَراياکَ، وَبَلِّغْهُ عَنّا تَحِيَّةً وَسَلامآ، وَاتِنا مِنْ لَدُنْکَ فى مُوالاتِهِ فَضْلا وَ اِحسانآ وَمَغْفِرَةً وَرِضْوانآ، اِنَّکَ ذُوالْفَضْلِ الْعَميمِ، وَالتَّجاوُزِ الْعَظيمِ بِرَحْمَتِکَ يا اَرْحَمَ الرّاحِمينَ.

O Allah! (Please) send blessings upon Muhammad and his progeny and send blessings upon Musa the son of Jafar, the successor of the righteous ones, the leader of the excellent ones, the case of illuminations, and the inheritor of tranquility, solemnity, wisdoms, and traditions, who used to spend nights sleeplessly up to the early dawn with continuous implorations for forgiveness. He was inseparable associate of lengthy prostrations, heavy tears, very much confidential talks, and incessant implorations. He was the center of understanding, justice, goodness, virtue, generosity, and liberAlity. He was also accustomed to ordeals and endurance and he was persecuted wrongfully, entombed unjustly, and tortured in the bottom of jails and darkness of cells. He is the one whose leg was injured by the rings of chains and whose funeral was called with calls of humility of belittling. He is the one who joined his grandfather the Chosen Prophet, his father the Well-pleased leader, and his mother the leader of women with usurped inheritance, robbed loyalty, overpowered state, unavenged blood, and poisoned drink. O Allah, just as he suffered hard-hitting ordeals tolerantly, swallowed chokes of agonies, surrendered to Your pleasure, obeyed You sincerely, adopted reverence for You, adapted himself with submission to You, stood against heresies and their bearers, and did not care for the blame of any blamer in the course of following Your orders and refraining from Your prohibitions; so, (please) bless him with ever-increasing, towering, and purifying blessings due to which You endue him with the intercession of nations from Your creatures and centuries of Your beings. And convey to him greetings and salutation from us; give us from You on account of our loyalty to him favors, bounty, forgiveness, and pleasure. Verily, You are the Lord of prevalent favor and great exoneration, in the name of Your mercy; O most merciful of all those who show mercy!

Allahhumma swalle a’laa Muhammadin ahlebaitehi, wa swalle alla Musa I’bne ja’farinn wa siyyin al-abraare, wa iamaame la akhyare wa a’ybate al-anwaare, wa warithe as-sakinate wa al-waqare, wal hekame wal athare, al-ladhee kana yuhyee al-laila bis-sahre elaa as-sahre be muwasalate lis-teghfare, haleefis-sajdate at-taweelate, waddomooe al-ghazirate wal monajaate al-kathirate, wadharaa’aate al-muttasilate, wa maqarre annoohi wal adle wal khayre, wal fadhle wan-nadee, wal badhle wa maa lafe al-balwee was sabre, wal mudhtahade bidhulme wal maqboore bil jawre, wal moadhabe fee qa-a’re as-sujoone wa dhoolamil matameere, dhee as-saqee al-mardhoodhe be halaqil qoyude, wal janazate wal munadee alayha be dhoolle Alis-tikhfafe, wal warede alla jaddehi al-mustafi wa abeehe al-murtadhee, wa ummihe sayyedatin-nesaae birthin maghsoobin wa walain masloobin,wa amreen maghloobin wa damin matloobin, wa sammin mashroobin, allahumma wa kama sabara alla ghalayzil mehane, wa tajarr’aa ghosasa al-korabe was-taslame le redhaka,wa akhlasa atta’ata laka wa mahadha al-khosho’a, wastashaara al-khodhoo’aa wa aadee al-bid’ata wa ahhlaha, wa lam yalhaq ho wa fee shayinn min awa mereka wa nawahika lawmatu laa emin, swalle alayhe salawatan na meyatan munifatan zakeyatan, tojeebo lahoo beha shafa’ata omamin min khalqeka, wa qurwoonin min baraayaka, wa balligh ho annan tahiyyatan wa salamaa, watena min ladoonka fee mowalatehi fadhla wa ehsanaa wa maghferatann wa ridhwanaa,innaka dhoo wal fadhlil ameeme, wattajawooze al-adheeme be rahmateka yaa arrhamaar raahemeen.

children.name: 6- The Ziyarat specific to Imam Mohammad ibn Ali al-Jawad (A)

text.html:
اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ يا اَبا جَعْفَرٍ مُحَمَّدَ بْنَ عَلِىٍّ، الْبَرَّ التَّقِىَّ الاِمامَ الْوَفِىَّ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ اَيُّهَا الرَّضِىُّ الزَّكِىُّ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ يا وَلِىَّ اللهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ يا نَجِىَّ اللهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ يا سَفيرَ اللهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ يا سِرَّ اللهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ يا ضِيآءَ اللهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ يا سَناءَ اللهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ يا كَلِمَةَ اللهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ يا رَحْمَةَ اللهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ اَيُّهَا النُّورُ السّاطِعُ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ اَيُّهَا الْبَدْرُ الطّالِعُ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ اَيُّهَا الطَّيِّبُ مِنَ الطَّيِّبينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ اَيُّهَا الطّاهِرُ مِنَ الْمُطَهَّرينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ اَيُّهَا الاْيَةُ الْعُظْمى، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ اَيُّهَا الْحُجَّةُ الْكُبْرى، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ اَيُّهَا الْمُطَهَّرُ مِنَ الزَّلّاتِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ اَيُّهَا الْمُنَزَّهُ عَنِ الْمُعْضِلاتِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ اَيُّهَا الْعَلِىُّ عَنْ نَقْصِ الاَوْصافِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ اَيُّهَا الرَّضِىُّ عِنْدَ الاَشْرافِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ يا عَمُودَ الدّينِ، اَشْهَدُ اَنَّکَ وَلِىُّ اللهِ وَحُجَّتُهُ فى اَرْضِهِ، وَاَنَّکَ جَنْبُ اللهِ وَخِيَرَةُ اللهِ، وَمُسْتَوْدَعُ عِلْمِ اللهِ وَعِلْمِ الاَنْبِيآءِ وَرُكْنُ الاْيمانِ وَتَرْجُمانُ الْقُرْآنِ، وَاَشْهَدُ اَنَّ مَنِ اتَّبَعَکَ عَلَى الْحَقِّ وَالْهُدى، وَاَنَّ مَنْ اَنْكَرَکَ وَنَصَبَ لَکَ الْعَداوَةَ عَلَى الضَّلالَةِ وَالرَّدى، اَبْرَءُ اِلَى اللهِ وَاِلَيْکَ مِنْهُمْ فِى الدُّنْيا وَالاْخِرَةِ، وَالسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ ما بَقيتُ وَبَقِىَ اللَّيْلُ وَالنَّهارُ.

Peace be upon you, O Aba-Jafar Muhammad, son of Ali, the pious, the devout, the guide, and the loyal (to Almighty Allah). Peace be upon you, O the pleased, the pure, peace be upon you, O the intimate servant of Allah peace be upon you, O the confidant of Allah, peace be upon you, O the envoy of Allah. Peace be upon you, O the secret of Allah. Peace be upon you, O the light of Allah, peace be upon you, O the brilliance of Allah. Peace be upon you, O the word of Allah. Peace be upon you; O the Mercy of Allah. Peace be upon you; O the dazzling light. Peace be upon you, O the rising full moon. Peace be upon you; O the pure and the offspring of the pure ones. Peace be upon you, O the immaculate and the offspring of the immaculate ones. Peace be upon you, O the grand sign (of Allah), peace be upon you, O the greatest impervious. Peace be upon you; O the purified from slips. Peace be upon you; O the cleaned from filths. Peace be upon you; O the elevated against imperfect attributes. Peace be upon you, O the pleased in the view of the notables. Peace be upon you; O the pillar of the religion. I bear witness that you are verily the representative and the argument of Allah on His lands and that you are verily the duty and the choice of Allah and you are the trust of the knowledge of Allah and the prophets and the support of faith and the interpreter of the Quran. I bear witness that he who follows you is on the truth and true guidance while he who denies and antagonizes you is on the wrong and perdition before Allah and before you do. I declare my disavowal of those (enemies) in this world as well as the Next World. Peace be upon you as long as I am Alive and as long as there are days and nights.

Assalaamo a’layka yaa Aba ja’farin Muhammad I’bna aleeyeen, al-barra att-taqiyyan al-imama al-wafee, assalaamo a’layka ayyohar-radhiyyuz-zaqeeyyo, assalaamo a’layka yaa waliyallahe, assalaamo a’layka yaa nabiyallahe, assalaamo a’layka yaa safirallahe, assalaamo a’layka yaa sirrallahe, assalaamo a’layka yaa zeyaa allahe, assalaamo a’layka yaa sana allahe, assalaamo a’layka yaa kalematallahe, assalaamo a’layka yaa sirrallahe, assalaamo a’layka yaa rahmatallahe, assalaamo a’layka ayyohan-noorus saateo, assalaamo a’layka ayyohal badrut-taleo, assalaamo a’layka ayyohat-tayyebo menat’tayyebin, assalaamo a’layka ayyohat-tahero menal mutahhareen, assalaamo a’layka ayyohal aytul udhmee, assalaamo a’layka ayyohal hujjato al-kubree, assalaamo a’layka ayyohal motah-haro menaj sallate, assalaamo a’layka ayyohal monadhaho anil mua’zelaate, assalaamo a’layka yaa ayyohal aleeyyo ann naqse al-awsaafe, assalaamo a’layka ayyohar-radheeyyo indal ash-raafe, assalaamo a’layka yaa amoodad-deene, ash-hado annaka waliyullahe wa hujjatohu fee arr-jehi, wa annaka janboollahe wa khiyaratullahe, wa mustawdaoo ilamillahe wa ilme al-ambeyaa e warooknoo al-aymane wa tarjoomano al-quraane, wa ash-hado anna manit-taba’aaka alla al-haqqe wal hodee, wa anna man annkaraka wa nasaba laka al-adawata alla adhalaalate war radee, abraoo elallahe wa elayka minhoom feed dunya wal aakherate, was-salaamo a’layka maa baqeeto wa baqeeyyal laylo wan-nahar

اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ يا مَوْلاىَ يا اَبَاالْحَسَنِ وَ رَحْمَةُ اللّهِ وَبَرَكاتُهُ، اَسْتَوْدِعْکَ اللّهَ وَاَقْرَءُ عَلَيْکَ اَلسَّلامَ، امَنّا بِاللّهِ وَبِالرَّسُولِ وَ بِما جِئْتَ بِهِ وَدَلَلْتَ عَلَيْهِ، اَللّهُمَّ اكْتُبْنا مَعَ الشّاهِدينَ.

Peace, mercy and blessing of Allah be upon you O my master O Aba Al-Hasan. I ask Allah for peace upon you, I say Salam (peace) on you. We believe in Allah, the Messenger and what you brought and guided us towards. Consider us from witnesses.

Assalaamo a’layka yaa mawlaee yaa Abal Hasane wa rahmatullahe wabarakaatohu, as-tawde-a-kallaha wa aqraoo a’laykas salam, amanna billahe wabir-rasoole wa bema je’ata behi wad a lalta alayhe, allahhumma ak-tubna ma’ashshahedin

اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ يا مِوْلاىَ يا بْنَ رَسُولِ اللّهِ وَرَحْمَةُ اللّهِ وَبَرَكاتُهُ، اَسْتَوْدِعُکَ اللّهَ وَاَقْرَءُ عَلَيْکَ اَلسَّلامَ امَنّا بِاللّهِ وَبِرَسُولِهِ، وَبِما جِئْتَ بِهِ وَدَلَلْتَ عَلَيْهِ، اَللّهُمَّ اكْتُبْنا مَعَ الشّاهِدينَ.

Peace, mercy and blessing of Allah be upon you O the son of Allah’s prophet. I ask Allah for peace upon you, I say Salam (peace) on you. We believe in Allah, the Messenger and what you brought and guided us towards. Consider us from witnesses.

Assalaamo a’layka yaa mawlayee yabna rasoolillahe wa rahmatullahe wabarakatohu, astawdeokallaha wa aqq-rao a’laykassalaam amanna billahe wabe rsoolehi, wa bema je’a-ta behi wa dalal-ta alayhe, allahhummak tubna ma’a-shshahedin.
In the city of Kadhmayn and especially inside the haram, are buried some Sadat (descendants of the Imams), great scholars and transmitters of hadith. We will mention some of them.

He was a great transmitter of hadith and, in particular, author of the famous Kaimilouz-zyrat, he was also one of the masters of Sheikh Moufid. He died in 369 AH and his grave is located in the haram, near the tomb of his disciple Sheikh Moufid.

His grave is in the eastern part of the haram. Sheikh Moufid was an illustrious scholar. He lived 77 years, and put right many attackers of Islam through simple argumentation. He educated great scholars such as Sayad Razi, Sayad Mourtadha and Sheikh Toussi. Even today, he is the pride of the Shia.

Sheikh Toussi recounts that during his burial there was an immense crowd, such as never before, and that the audience was in tears.

One day, Sheikh Moufid dreams that Hazrate Fatima (A) comes to him with her children Hassan (A) and Houssein (A) inside the Masjid and she asked him to educate them ! He was troubled by this surprising dream. When he went to the Masjid, he soon saw a woman with two children, Sayyad Razi and Sayyad Murtadhà, arrive. This lady repeated to him the same sentence that Hazrate Fatima (A) had pronounced in his dream.78

78: Safinat al-bihar, volume 2 page 389
He lived 75 years, from 597 AH to 672 AH, and rests in a place near the top of the sacred tomb of the Imams. He was one of the great scientists of his time and wrote many books.

He lived 87 years. He is a descendant, 5 generations after his father, of Imam Musa ibn Jaffar (A) - (7th Imam), and 7 generations after his mother, from Imam Zaynul Abidine (A) - (4th Imam). He taught different sciences. One day, his teacher Sheikh Moufid attended one of his classes and was amazed by the extent of his knowledge.79

His grave is outside the haram, about 20 meters away.

79: Safinat al-bihar, volume 1 page 525

His tomb is near the grave of his brother Sayyad Murtadhà. Although he lived only 47 years, he left an important legacy to posterity, especially the famous compilation of the words of Imam Ali (A), Nahjul Balagha, translated into English as « The way of eloquence ».

children.name: Ziyarat for all Imam zadas (descendants of the Imams).

text.html:
اَلسَّلامُ عَلى جَدِّکَ الْمُصْطَفى، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى اَبيکَ الْمُرْتَضَى الرِّضا، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَى السَّيِّدَيْنِ الْحَسَنِ وَالْحُسَيْنِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى خَديجَةَ اُمِّ سَيِّدَةِ نِسآءِ الْعالَمينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى فاطِمَةَ اُمِّ الْاَئِمَّةِ الطّاهِرينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَى النُّفُوسِ الْفاخِرَةِ، بُحُورِ الْعُلُومِ الزّاخِرَةِ، شُفَعآئى فِى الاْخِرَةِ وَاَوْلِيآئى عِنْدَ عَوْدِ الرُّوحِ اِلَى الْعِظـامِ النّاخِرَةِ، اَئِمَّةِ الْخَلْقِ وَوُلاةِ الْحَقِّ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ اَيُّهَا الشَّخْصُ الشَّريفُ الطّاهِرُ الْكَريمُ، اَشْهَدُ اَنْ لا اِلـهَ اِلاَّ اللهُ، وَاَنَّ مُحَمَّداً عَبْدُهُ وَمُصْطَفاهُ، وَاَنَّ عَلِيّاً وَلِيُّهُ وَمُجْتَباهُ، وَاَنَّ الْاِمامَةَ فى وُلْدِهِ اِلى يَوْمِ الدّينِ، نَعْلَمُ ذلِکَ عِلْمَ الْيَقينِ، وَنَحْنُ لِذلِکَ مُعْتَقِدُونَ وَفى نَصْرِهِمْ مُجْتَهِدُونَ.

Peace be upon your grandfather Mustafa, peace be upon your father Murtaza Al- Reza, prace be upon masters Hasan and Hussain. Peace be upon Khadija the mother of the leader of women of all the worlds. Peace br upon Fatima mother of immaculate Imams; peace be upon the gratified souls, the deep oceans of knowledge and my intercessors on Doomsday, my powers when the spirit returns to bones, (you are) Imams of ctratures and powers of righteousness. Peace be upon you the honest, pure and gracious soul. I bear witness that there is no God but Allah, and that Muhammad is his servant and his choice. Ali is his representative and selected and Imamat is in his family till Doomsday. We know that for sure and we have firm faith in it and we struggle to assist them.

Assalaamo alla jaddeka al-mustafi, assalaamo alla abeeka al-murtadhee ar-redhaa, assalaamo alla as-sayyedayne al-Hasane wal Husayne, assalaamo alla khadijata umme sayyedate nesaail aalameen, assalaamo alla faatemata ummil a-immatit taahereen, assalaamo alla an-nofuse al-faakherate, bohuril olume az-zaakherate, shofa aaee fee al kherate wa awliyaaee inda awde ar-roohe elal ezaame an-naakherate, a-immate al-khalqe wa woolaate al-haqqe, assalaamo alayka ayyohash shakhsho ash-sharifo at-taahero al-kareemo, ash-hado an laa elaha illallaaho, wa anna Muhammadan abdohu wa mustafaao, wa anna Aliyyan waliyyohu wa mujtabaaho,wa annal imaamata fee wuldehi ela yawmiddeene, na’alamu dhaleka ilmal yaqeene, wa nahno le dhaleka moa’taqedoona wa fee nasrehim moojtahedun.

Baghdad is today the capital and the largest city of Iraq. It was built in the year 141 AH by Mansour Dawaneqi to make it its capital. Between 262 AH and 271 AH, it was temporarily transferred by Mo'tassim to Samarra, then Bagdad regained its graces.

Located on the Kadhmayn road in Baghdad, this Masjid witnessed several revelations. Indeed, upon the return of the battle of Nahrawane, Imam Ali (A) revealed a number of truths. We will mention some of them.

a) The discovery of the truth by a monk

For many years, a Christian monk had settled in this place. He had read in the old books that the successor of a prophet would spend one day there and pray there. Imam Ali (A), returning from the battle that had opposed him to the Khawarij, stopped there and prayed. The monk approached the Imam and said to him : « May peace be on you, O truthful Prince of the Believers ! » The Imam asked, « How do you know that I am truthful? » The monk replied that this revelation had been made to him by great scholars. The Imam then called him by his name: « Ô Houbbab ! » The monk was surprised that he knew his name. The Imam tells him that it was the Holy Prophet (A) himself who had revealed his name to him. The monk converted to Islam and spent the rest of his life with Imam Ali (A).80

b) The discovery of the source of fresh water

Imam Ali (A) asked the monk where he got the water he drank. He replied that this water came from the Tigris River. The Imam told him : « Why take so much trouble when it would be easier to dig a well? » He replied that there was no drinking water here. The Imam tells him to dig in a specific place, and a source of fresh water gushes out of it miraculously. This source was that of Bibi Maryam (Holy Mary).

c) The news of the construction of a city of corruption and oppression

The Imam (A) described to him future events : a city will be built here, where the oppressors will be very powerful, with difficulties and misfortunes at their peak, and widespread corruption. In fact, one hundred years after this prediction, Mansoor Dawanqi built the famous city of Baghdad there. The Abbasid caliphs established their capital there for 5 centuries. Corruption and oppression took root there and spread beyond.

d) The discovery of the white stone

Imam Ali (A), after unveiling the source of Maryam, told the monk to dig at 17 cubits from this location. The white stone was there. This is the stone on which Bibi Maryam had laid her newborn son Prophet Issa (A) (Jesus) so he could sleep, and had herself prayed on the stone.

It was after seeing all these miracles that Houbbab decided to follow the Imam forever. And only after his martyrdom did he return to his old home until the end of his life.81

80: Ba man be Karbala, page 340
81: Bihar al Anwar, volume 102, page 26

children.name: 2- The four ambassadors of Imam Mahdi (A)

text.html:
Between the years 260 and 329 after the Hijra, during the period of the small occultation, Imam Mahdi (A) had 4 special representatives who allowed him to keep in touch with his followers and answer their questions.

The graves of these representatives are all located in Baghdad.

a) Uthman ibn Said

He had represented the 10th, then the 11th Imam. He then served Imam Mahdi (A) and was his appointed representative for 5 years (from 260 to 265 AH). He pretended to be an oil salesman, so as not to arouse the suspicions of those who followed the 12th Imam (A). His grave is located in the center of Baghdad, in a place known as Bab ash-Sheikh.

b) Mohammad ibn Uthman

After the death of his father Uthman ibn Said, Mohammad ibn Uthman was appointed by Imam (A) to succeed him. He served him for 40 years. He transmitted the letters of the Shiites to Imam (A) and then reported to them his written answer. He died in the year 305 AH. His grave is near his father's, inside their house. It was reported that during his lifetime he had dug his own grave and embellished it with inscriptions of the names of all the Imams (A) and verses of the Holy Qur'an. He went down to his grave every day to recite part of the Qur'an. He meditated and questioned : « What have you done? What did you bring? »

c) Hussein ibn Rawh

He was the 3rd appointed representative of Imam (A). He served him for 21 years, from 305 to 326 AH. He also remained cautious with people and concealed his activities. His grave is on the site of Nawbakhtyah.

d) Ali ibn Mohammad Samary

He was the last to be appointed by Imam (A), whom he represented for 4 years (from 326 to 329 AH). While he was healthy with nothing indicating a close end, Imam (A) announced his death within 6 days. He also told him that there would be no Representative after him, and that the period of the major occultation, of a duration known only to the Creator, would begin. The Imam (A) will no longer appear during this period, until he has received the Order of God. At this future time, hearts will have hardened, the whole planet will be full of misfortunes. A moment will even come when many of the Shi'ites of Imam (A), will demand his reappearance insistently, but without sincerity. The tomb of Ali ibn Mohammad Samary is inside the Sawq al-Khafafine bazaar.

Ziyarat :

بِسمِ اللهِ الرَّحمنِ الرَّحیم
يَا عَلِيَّ بْنَ مُحَمَّدٍ السَّمُرِيَّ أَعْظَمَ اللَّهُ أَجْرَ إِخْوَانِكَ فِيكَ فَإِنَّكَ مَيِّتٌ مَا بَيْنَكَ وَ بَيْنَ سِتَّةِ أَيَّامٍ، فَاجْمَعْ أَمْرَكَ وَ لَا تُوصِ إِلَى أَحَدٍ فَيَقُومَ مَقَامَكَ بَعْدَ وَفَاتِكَ فَقَدْ وَقَعَتِ الْغَيْبَةُ التَّامَّةُ فَلَا ظُهُورَ وَ بَعْدَ إِذْنِ اللَّهِ تَعَالَى ذِكْرُهُ وَ ذَلِكَ بَعْدَ طُولِ الْأَمَدِ وَ قَسْوَةِ الْقُلُوبِ وَ امْتِلَاءِ الْأَرْضِ جَوْراً وَ سَيَأْتِي مَنْ يَدَّعُ الْمُشَاهَدَةَ أَلَا فَمَنِ ادَّعَى الْمُشَاهَدَةَ قَبْلَ خُرُوجِ السُّفْيَانِيِّ وَ الصَّيْحَةِ فَهُوَ كَذَّابٌ مُفْتَرُ وَ لَا حَوْلَ وَ لَا قُوَّةَ إِلَّا بِاللَّهِ الْعَلِيِّ الْعَظِيمِ

In the name of Allah the Beneficent and the Merciful
O Ali Ibn Muhammad Samari! May Allah increase the reward of your brothers concerning you! Death will come to you within the next six days. So you complete your works and do not nominate any person after you. The sequence of special deputies will come to an end and the Major Occulation (Ghaibat-e Kubra) will commence with your demise. Now the reappearance will occur only with the permission of Allah, after a prolonged period and after the hearts of people are hardened. And such a period will emerge on my Shias when people will claim that they have seen me. Whoever makes such a claim before the advent of Sufyani and the heavenly voice, is a liar, an impostor. There is no strength and power save that of Allah, the Highest and the Greatest

Bis’millah-ir-rahman-ir-rahim
Yaa Ali yabna Muhammadin as-samu riyya a-adhamallaho ajra ikhwaneka feeka fa innaka mayyetu ma baynaka wa bayna sit-tate ayyamin, faj-ma’a amraka wa laa toose elaa ahadin fayaqooma maqamaka ba’a-da wa faateka faqad waqa’aate al-ghaybato at-tammatu fala dhohura wa ba’-a-da idhnillahe ta-aa-lee dhikrohu wa dhaleka ba’a-da toolil aamade wa qaswatil quloobe wa am-tela e al-ardhe jawrann wa sayaatee man yaddaoo al-moshahadata alla famanid-dayee al-moshahadata qabla khorroje as-sufyani was-sayhate fahowa kadhabo muftaru wa laa hawla wa laa quwwata illa billahil aleeyyil adheem.

If one wishes to recite the Ziyarat of the four ambassadors of the Imam (A), it is first necessary, to send Salaams on the Holy Prophet (S), Imam Ali, Khadijatul Kubra, Fatima az-Zahra, Imam Hassan and Imam Hussein, as well as at all the Imams until the Imam of Time (A), to say :

السَّلامُ عَلَیْكَ یَا فُلانَ بْنَ فُلان

Peace be upon you! (Name any of the four deputies of Imam)

Assalaamo a’layka yaa Fulaana-bna fulaan.

أَشْهَدُ أَنَّكَ بَابُ الْمَوْلَی أَدَّیْتَ عَنْهُ وَ أَدَّیْتَ إِلَیْهِ مَا خَالَفْتَهُ وَ لا خَالَفْتَ عَلَیْهِ، قُمْتَ خَاصّاً وَ انْصَرَفْتَ سَابِقاً جِئْتُكَ عَارِفاً بِالْحَقِّ الَّذِی أَنْتَ عَلَیْهِ وَ أَنَّكَ مَا خُنْتَ فِی التَّأْدِیَةِ وَ السَّفَارَةِ. السَّلامُ عَلَیْكَ مِنْ بَاب مَا أَوْسَعَكَوَ مِنْ سَفِیر مَا آمَنَكَ وَ مِنْ ثِقَةٍ مَا أَمْكَنَكَ. أَشْهَدُ أَنَّ اللهَ اخْتَصَّكَ بِنُورِهِ حَتَّی عَایَنْتَ الشَّخْصَ فَأَدَّیْتَ عَنْهُ وَ أَدَّیْتَ إِلَیْهِ.

I bear witness you are the door to master (Mehdi). You were a representative between him and his followes. You did not disagree him and did not stand with those against him. You stood as a special vice of (Imam) and returned earlier. I have come to know your right that you deserve and verily you did not show negligence in duties and legation. Peace be upon you, how benefited you are from the door (of Imam)! How trustee (of Imam) in legation you are! And how reliable (of Imam) you are! I bear witness; verily the Allah Almighty has specified you with His light (Noor) till that you helped the person (Imam) and performed duty of him and for him.

Ash-hado annaka babul mawlee ad-dayyta anho wa ad-dayyta elayhe maa kha laftahoo wa laa kha lafta alayhe, qumta kha sayyan wan sarafta saabeqan je-a’toka aarefan bilhaqqil ladhee anta alayhe wa annaka maa khunta fee attadeyate was-safaarate, assalaamo a’layka min bab ma awsa’aaka wa min safira maa aamanaka wa min thekatin maa am’kanaka, ash-hado annallaah akh-tassaka be noorehi hatti aa yanta ash-shakhsa fa’addayta anhu wa ad-dayta elayhe.

Recite greetings to the Messenger of God, to the Imam of Time (A), then say :

جِئْتُكَ مُخْلِصا بِتَوْحِیدِ اللهِ وَ مُوَالاةِ أَوْلِیَائِهِ وَ الْبَرَاءَةِ مِنْ أَعْدَائِهِمْ وَ مِنَ الَّذِینَ خَالَفُوكَ یَا حُجَّةَ الْمَوْلَی وَ بِكَ إِلَیْهِمْ تَوَجُّهِی وَ بِهِمْ إِلَی اللهِ تَوَسُّلِى.

I have come to you believing purely in oneness of Allah, in (pure) love of his representatives and acquittance from their enemies and from those who are against you. O the argument of Lord, by you I think about them, and by them I link to Allah.

Je’a-toka mukhlesa be tawheedillahe wa mowalaate awleyaaehi wal baraa’ate min aa’a-daehim wa menalladheena kha lafooka yaa hujjatal mawlee wa beka elayhim tawajjohi wa bahem elallahe tawas-sulee.

In Iraq, Salman-e-Farsi is known as Salman-e-Paak. His tomb is in the city of Ctesiphon (Mada'in), 40 km south of Baghdad.

Born in Persia (Iran) - which earned him the nickname Farsi (Persia) - he left his home country to live in Medina alongside the Holy Prophet (S). He devoted his life to religion and science. The Holy Prophet (S) said that : « Salman is part of the Ahl-al-Bayt », that he is : « an inexhaustible sea and inexhaustible wealth. »82

According to Imam as-Sadiq (A) - (6th Imam), there are 10 degrees in the faith. Miqdad had reached the eighth; Abu Dhar the 9th; and Salman the 10th.83

Imam Ali (A) compared him to Luqman the Wise. Angel Jibraa’il (A) continually transmitted the greetings of God through the Holy Prophet (S).

Ziyarat :

السَّلَامُ عَلَى رَسُولِ اللَّهِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ خَاتَمِ النَّبِیِّینَ السَّلَامُ عَلَى أَمِیرِ الْمُؤْمِنِینَ وَ سَیِّدِ الْوَصِیِّینَ السَّلَامُ عَلَى الْأَئِمَّةِ الْمَعْصُومِینَ الرَّاشِدِینَ السَّلَامُ عَلَى الْمَلَائِكَةِ الْمُقَرَّبِینَ السَّلَامُ عَلَیْكَ یَا صَاحِبَ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ الْأَمِینِ السَّلَامُ عَلَیْكَ یَا وَلِیَّ أَمِیرِ الْمُؤْمِنِینَ السَّلَامُ عَلَیْكَ یَا مُودَعَ أَسْرَارِ السَّادَةِ الْمَیَامِینِ السَّلَامُ عَلَیْكَ یَا بَقِیَّةَ اللَّهِ مِنَ الْبَرَرَةِ الْمَاضِینَ السَّلَامُ عَلَیْكَ یَا أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ وَ رَحْمَةُ اللَّهِ وَ بَرَكَاتُهُ أَشْهَدُ أَنَّكَ أَطَعْتَ اللَّهَ كَمَا أَمَرَكَ وَ اتَّبَعْتَ الرَّسُولَ كَمَا نَدَبَكَ وَ تَوَلَّیْتَ خَلِیفَتَهُ كَمَا أَلْزَمَكَ وَ دَعَوْتَ إِلَى الِاهْتِمَامِ بِذُرِّیَّتِهِ كَمَا وَقَّفَكَ وَ عَلِمْتَ الْحَقَّ یَقِینا وَ اعْتَمَدْتَهُ‏ كَمَا أَمَرَكَ وَ أَشْهَدُ أَنَّكَ بَابُ وَصِیِّ الْمُصْطَفَى وَ طَرِیقُ حُجَّةِ اللَّهِ الْمُرْتَضَى وَ أَمِینُ اللَّهِ فِیمَا اسْتُودِعْتَ مِنْ عُلُومِ الْأَصْفِیَاءِ أَشْهَدُ أَنَّكَ مِنْ أَهْلِ بَیْتِ النَّبِیِّ النُّجَبَاءِ الْمُخْتَارِینَ لِنُصْرَةِ الْوَصِیِّ أَشْهَدُ أَنَّكَ صَاحِبُ الْعَاشِرَةِ وَ الْبَرَاهِینِ وَ الدَّلَائِلِ الْقَاهِرَةِ وَ أَقَمْتَ الصَّلَاةَ وَ آتَیْتَ الزَّكَاةَ وَ أَمَرْتَ بِالْمَعْرُوفِ وَ نَهَیْتَ عَنِ الْمُنْكَرِ وَ أَدَّیْتَ الْأَمَانَةَ وَ نَصَحْتَ لِلَّهِ وَ لِرَسُولِهِ وَ صَبَرْتَ عَلَى الْأَذَى فِی جَنْبِهِ حَتَّى أَتَاكَ الْیَقِینُ لَعَنَ اللَّهُ مَنْ جَحَدَكَ حَقَّكَ وَ حَطَّ مِنْ قَدْرِكَ لَعَنَ اللَّهُ مَنْ آذَاكَ فِی مَوَالِیكَ لَعَنَ اللَّهُ مَنْ أَعْنَتَكَ فِی أَهْلِ بَیْتِ نَبِیِّكَ لَعَنَ اللَّهُ مَنْ لَامَكَ فِی سَادَاتِكَ لَعَنَ اللَّهُ عَدُوَّ آلِ مُحَمَّدٍ مِنَ الْجِنِّ وَ الْإِنْسِ مِنَ الْأَوَّلِینَ وَ الْآخِرِینَ وَ ضَاعَفَ عَلَیْهِمُ الْعَذَابَ الْأَلِیمَ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَیْكَ یَا أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَیْكَ یَا صَاحِبَ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَیْهِ وَ آلِهِ وَ عَلَیْكَ یَا مَوْلَى أَمِیرِ الْمُؤْمِنِینَ وَ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَى رُوحِكَ الطَّیِّبَةِ وَ جَسَدِكَ الطَّاهِرِ وَ أَلْحَقَنَا بِمَنِّهِ وَ رَأْفَتِهِ إِذَا تَوَفَّانَا بِكَ وَ بِمَحَلِّ السَّادَةِ الْمَیَامِینِ وَ جَمَعَنَا مَعَهُمْ بِجِوَارِهِمْ فِی جَنَّاتِ النَّعِیمِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَیْكَ یَا أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ وَ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَى إِخْوَانِكَ الشِّیعَةِ الْبَرَرَةِ مِنَ السَّلَفِ الْمَیَامِینِ وَ أَدْخَلَ الرَّوْحَ وَ الرِّضْوَانَ عَلَى الْخَلَفِ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِینَ وَ أَلْحَقَنَا وَ إِیَّاهُمْ بِمَنْ تَوَلَّاهُ‏ مِنَ‏ الْعِتْرَةِ الطَّاهِرِینَ‏ وَ عَلَیْكَ‏ وَ عَلَیْهِمُ‏ السَّلَامُ‏ وَ رَحْمَةُ اللَّهِ وَ بَرَكَاتُه.

Peace be upon the Messenger of Allah Muhammad bin Abdullah Seal of the Prophets. Peace be upon the Emir of believers and the master of successors, peace be upon the guided, infallible imams. Peace be upon the angels, close to Allah, peace be upon you the companion of the faithful messenger of Allah. Peace be upon you the friend of the commander of faithful. Peace be upon you who is given the secrets of gentlemen. Peace be upon you who is the Allah’s remained of the past pious people. Peace, mercy and blessing of Allah be upon you O Aba Abdillah. I bear witness that you obeyed Allah as He commanded you and followed the Prophet as he asked you and showed loyalty to his successor as he took promise from you and you called people as your duty towards the significance of his progeny and you recognized the right (path) with surety and trusted upon it as you were required. And I bear witness that you are the door of the successor of Mustafa and the path to Murtaza, the Allah's argument. You are the trustee of the sciences of chosen ones. I bear witness that you are among the certain people of the Prophet's house who have been chosen for successor’s assistance. I bear witness you are the fellow of tenth and burning evidence and proof. You offered the prayers, gave alms (zakat), you enjoined the right, forbade the wrong, did your duty, advised for Allah and His prophet, faced troubles on his side patiently till that believed. May Allah curse those who denied your right and demeaned your value! May Allah curse those troubled you for (your love with) your Masters, who troubled you because of (your relation with) progeny of prophet. May Allah curse those who condemned you because of your leaders! May Allah curse the enemy of the Muhammad’s family from the jinn and mankind from the first and the last and give them double severe punishment. Peace be upon you O Aba Abdillah, peace be upon you O companion of Prophet (PBUH & his progeny) and upon you O commander of faithful. Peace be upon your pure soul and body. May Allah join us with you and gentle leaders by his mercy and sympathy and gather us with them in their neighborhood in the gardens of blessings. Peace of Allah be upon you O Aba Abdillah, peace of Allah be upon your brothers, the Shias from early ages and enter (their) spirit and the contentment in the succeeding believers and join us and them with those with whom we love i.e. the infallible Imams. Peace, mercy and blessings be upon you and them!

Assalaamo alla rasoolillahe Muhammad I’bne Abdillahe khatameen nabiyyeena, assalaamo alla ameeril mumenina wa sayyedil wasiyyina, assalaamo alla a-immate al-ma’a-soomina arrashedeena assalaamo alal mala ekatil moqarrabina assalaamo a’layka yaa saheba rasoolillahil ameene assalaamo a’layka yaa waleeyyal ameeril momenina assalaamo a’layka yaa mu da aa asraris saadate al-mayamine, assalaamo a’layka yaa baqiyyatallahe menal bararatil madheena assalaamo a’layka yaa Aba Abdillahe wa rahmatullahe wabarakatohu ash-hado annaka a-ta’tallaha kama amaraka wat-taba’tar rasoola kama nadabaka wa tawallayta khaleefathu kama al-zamaka wa da-awta elaa al-ehtemame be dhurriyatehi kama waq-qafaka wa a’limta al-haqqa yaqeena wa a-atamadtahu kama amaraka wa ash-hado annaka babu wasiyye al-mustafee wa tareeqo hujjatallahe al-murtadhee wa ameenullahe feemas tode’a-ta min olumil assfiyaae ash-hado a’nnaka min a’hlebayteen nabiyeen nojabae al-mukhtareena le nusratil wasiyyeen ash-hado a’nnaka sahebul aasherate wal baraheene wad-dalaaele al-qaherate wa aqamta ass-salata wa aataytaz-zakata wa amarta bil ma-a’roofe wa nahayta anil munkare wa ad-dayta al-amanata wa nasah’ta lillahe wa rasoolehi wa sabarta alal adhee fee janbehi hatti ataaka al-yaqeeno la-a’nallaho man jahadaka haqqaka wa hatta minqadreka la’anallaho man aazaaka fee mawaleeka la’anallaho man a-a’nataka fee ahle bayte nabiyyeka la’anallaho man laamaka fee saadaateka la’anallaho aduwwa aale Muhammadin menal jinne wal innse menal awwalina wal-akhereena wa zaa afa alayhimul azaAbal aleema sallallaaho a’layka yaa Abaa Abdillahe sallallaaho a’layka yaa saaheba rasoolillahe sallallaaho alayhe wa aalehi wa a’layka yaa mawlee ameeril momenina wa sallallaaho alaa rooheka at-tayyebate wa jasadeka at-taahere wa al-haqana be mannehe wa raafatehi edhaa tawaffanaa beka wa be mahalle as-saadate al-mayaamine wa jama’a-na ma-a’hoom be jewarehim fee jannaatin naeeme sallallaho a’layka yaa Aba Abdillahe wa sallallaho alla ikhwaneka ash-shiyate al-bararate menas-salafe al-mayameene wa adkhala arrooha wa ar-ridhwana alal khalafe menal momenina wa al-haqna wa iyyahum be man tawallaho menal itrate at-taherina wa a’layka wa a’layhemoo assalaamo wa rahmatullahe wabarakaatohu.

Then recite 7 times surah al Qadr, and pray the mustahab prayers that one wishes near his tomb, and at the time of leaving, say :

السَّلامُ عَلَيكَ يَا اَباعبداللهِ، أنتَ بَابُ اللهِ الموتي مِنه وَ المـَأخـُوذُ عَنهُ، اَشهَدُ أنَّكَ قُلْتَ حَقّاً وَ نَطَقْتَ حَقّاً وَ صِدقاً، وَ دَعَوْتَ إلي مَولايَ وَ مَولاكَ عَلانِيَةً وَ سِرّاً، أتَيتُكَ زائـِراً وَ حاجاتِي لَكَ مُسْتَودِعاً، وَهَا أنَاذامُوَدَّعُکَ،،أسْتَودِعُكَ دِيني وَ أمانَتي وَ خَواتِيمَ عَمَلِي وَ جَوامِعَ أمَلي إلي مُنْتَهي أجَلِي، وَ السَّلامُ عَلَيكَ وَ رَحمَةُ اللهِ وَ بَرَكاتُهُ، وَ صَلَّي اللهُ عَلَي مُحَمَّدٍ وَ آلِ مُحَمَّدٍ الاخْیارِ.

Peace be upon you O Aba Abdillah! You are the door from where (benefit) is provided and taken. I bear witness, verily you told aright and spoke truth and invited to my and your lord publicly and secretly. I have come to you for pilgrimage and ask you for my needs. Fulfil my needs of religion, duty, (better) costs of my deeds and (fulfil) all my hopes before my death. Peace, mercy and blessings of Allah be upon you. Peace of Allah be upon Muhammad and his chosen progeny.

Assalaamo a’layka yaa Aba A’bdillaahe, anta baboollahe al-mawti minha wal makhoojo anho, ash-hado annaka qulta haqqan wa nataq’ta haqqan wa sidqann, wa da’a-wta lee mawlaaee wa mawlaaka alaaniyatann wa sirran, aataytoka zaaerann wa hajaatee laka mustaw deann wa haa anaa dhaa mowaddaoka, as-tawdeoka dini wa amaanati wa khawateema amaleee wa jawame’aa a’malee elay muntahee a’jalee, was-sallaamo a’layka wa rahmatullahe wabarakaatohu, wa sallallaaho alla Muhammadin wa aale Muhammadin al-akhyare.

82: Rahnemaye Mussawwar safar zyarati Iraq, page 372
83: Rahnemaye Moussawwar safar zyarati Iraq, page 372

His grave is located near that of Salman. He was a noble companion of the Holy Prophet (S) and a close friend of Imam Ali (A).

He stood beside the Holy Prophet (S) during the Battle of Tabuk. Ammar-e-Yassir protected him in front and Hodhayfat in the back. At the time of his death, he gathered his children and told them his last recommendations: « Never go away from Ali (A) and remain faithful to your oath of allegiance to him ; never covet the riches of others in order to feel yourself rich ; as much as possible, never reach out to ask others ; make sure that the present day is better than the day before ; pray as if it were your last prayer ; never realize an act that you would have to conceal. »

This man was so good that when, at the battle of Uhud, the companions of the Holy Prophet (S) mistakenly killed his father thinking he was a disbeliever, he forgave them and implored for them the Forgiveness of God.84

Ziyarat :

اَلسَّلامُ عَلى رَسُولِ اللهِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ اللهِ خاتَمِ النَّبِيّينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى اَميرِ الْمُؤْمِنينَ سَيِّدِ الْوَصِيّينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَى الْاَئِمَّةِ الْمَعْصُومينَ الرّاشِدينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلـَى الْمَلائِكَةِ الْمُقَرَّبينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ يا صاحِبَ رَسُولِ اللهِ الْاَمينِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ يا مُودَعَ اَسْرارِ السّادَةِ الْمَيامينِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ يا مَنْ اُوتِیَ الْعِلْمَ بِاَسْمَاءِ الْمُنَافِقِینَ، اَشْهَدُ اَنَّکَ اَطَعْتَ اللهَ كَما اَمَرَکَ، وَاتَّبَعْتَ الرَّسُولَ كَما نَدَبَکَ، وَتَوَلَّيْتَ خَليفَتَهُ كَما اَلْزَمَکَ، وَدَعَوْتَ اِلَى الْاِهْتِمامِ بِذُرِّيَّتِهِ كَما وَقَفَکَ، وَعَلِمْتَ الْحَقَّ يَقيناً وَاعْتَمَدْتَهُ، كَما اَمَرَکَ، وَاَقَمْتَ الصَّلاةَ، وَ آتَيْتَ الزَّكاةَ، وَ اَمَرْتَ بِالْمَعْرُوفِ، وَنَهَيْتَ عَنِ الْمُنْكَرِ، وَاَدَّيْتَ الْاَمانَةَ، وَنَصَحْتَ لِلهِ وَلِرَسُولِهِ، صَلَّى اللهُ عَلى رُوحِکَ الطَّيِّبِ، وَ جَسَدِکَ الطّاهِرِ، وَاَلْحَقَنا بِکَ وَبِمَحَلَّةِ السّادَةِ الْمَيامينِ، وَجَمَعَنا مَعَهُمْ بِجِوارِهِمْ فى جَنّاتِ النَّعيِمِ، وَلا جَعَلَهُ اللهُ آخِرَ الْعَهْدِ مِنَّا لِزِیَارَتِکَ والسَّلامُ وَرَحْمَةُ اللهِ وَبَرَكاتُهُ.

Peace be upon the Messenger of Allah Muhammad bin Abdullah Seal of the Prophets. Peace be upon the Emir of believers and the master of successors, peace be upon the guided, infallible imams. Peace be upon the angels, close to Allah, peace be upon you the companion of the faithful messenger of Allah. Peace be upon you who is given the secrets of gentlemen. Peace be upon you who knew the names of hypocrites. I bear witness that you obeyed Allah as He commanded you and followed the Prophet as he asked you and showed loyalty to his successor as he took promise from you and you called people as your duty towards the significance of his progeny and you recognized the right (path) with surety and trusted upon it as you were required. You offered the prayers, gave alms (zakat), you enjoined the right, forbade the wrong, did your duty, advised for Allah and His prophet. Peace be upon your pure soul and body. May Allah join us with you and gentle leaders by his mercy and sympathy and gather us with them in their neighborhood in the gardens of blessings. May Allah not decide this time of our visit to be the last! Peace, mercy and blessing of Allah be upon you!

Assalaamo a’laa rasoolillaahe Muhammad I’bne A’bdillaahe khaatamin nabiyyeen. Assalaamo alaa ameeril momineen sayyedil wasiyyeen, assalaamo alaa a-immate al-ma’asoomina ar-rashedeen, assalaamo alal malaaekate al-muqarrabin, assalaamo a’layka yaa saheba rasoolillahil ameene, assalaamo a’layka yaa muda aa asraris saadate al-mayaameene, assalaamo a’layka yaa man ootiyal ilma be asmaae al munafeqina, ash-hado annaka ata’atallaho kama amaraka, wattaba’ata arrasoola kamaa nadabaka, wa ta wallayta khaleefatahu kama al-dhamaka, wa da-awta elal ehtemame be dhurriyatehi kamaa wa qafaka, wa alimtal haqqan yaqeenan wa-a-tamadtahu kama amaraka, wa aqaamtas-salat wa aataytuz-zakat, wa a-marta bill ma’aroofe, wa nahayta anil moonkare, wa ad-daytal amaanata, wa nasahta lillahe wale rasoolehi sallallaaho alaa rooheka at-tayyebe, wa jasadeka at-taahere, wa alhaqna beka wabe mahallate as-saadatal mayaamine,wa jama ana ma-a’hoom be jewarehim fee jannatin naeeme, wala ja’alahullaho aakheral ahde minna le ziyarateka was-salaamo wa rahmatullahe wabarakaatohu.

84: Ba man be Karbala, page 352

Abu Jaffar Mohammad ibn Yaqub Qulayni is one of the great scholars and reporters of the hadith. In his day, he was the leader of the Shiites. He is also the author of the famous Al-Kafi, a monumental work of about 80,000 authentic hadiths, to the realization of which he devoted 20 years of his life. This book is today an essential reference for the study of Shiite hadiths. He died in the year 329 of Hijra in Baghdad, the same year as the last representative of the 12th Imam (A), Ali ibn Mohammad Samary. Their graves are a few meters apart.

There is a tomb bearing his name in the eastern part of Baghdad, in a neighborhood also named after him. But it is not proven that this tomb is indeed that of the famous companion of Imam Ali (A).

Qambar, the son of Hamdan, was the faithful friend of Imam Ali (A) and he was entirely devoted to him. Imam (A) had predicted that he would die from Hajjaj's hand. He was indeed murdered by Hajjaj ibn Yusuf in the year 95 AH, Kufa. Hajjaj had first demanded that he abandon the religion of Ali (A). Qambar replied : « Which religion is better than that of Ali (A)? ».

If one places this episode in its historical context, it is doubtful whether Qambar's body could have been transported from Kufa to Baghdad, 165 km away, which at that time was hardly feasible. On the other hand, no reliable source confirms that his tomb is located in Baghdad.

According to one scholar, Qambar's tomb is actually in Iraq, but its exact location is not known. For Hajjaj had contented himself with killing him and hanging him on gallows.

It has been deduced that the tomb located in Baghdad is probably that of another Qambar, the faithful servant of the 10th Imam, Imam Ali al-Hadi (A).85

85: Maraqid al Maarif, volume 2 page 206.

Recall that Imam Musa al-Kadhim (A) - (7th Imam), had 37 children. Sayyad Ibrahim was one of them. Sayyad Razi and Sayyad Mourtadha belong to his descendants. According to Sheikh Moufid, Sayyad Ibrahim was a being of immense generosity. In particular, he invited people to pledge allegiance to his own brother, Imam ar-Redha (A).
He is a descendant of Imam Musa al-Kadhim (A) who died in 948 AH. His grave is located in the eastern part of Baghdad.

Here is the tomb of Ubaydullah ibn Mohammad ibn Amir al-Mo'minin in Baghdad. This place is known as Mashad Nouzour because there people come to formulate vows (nuzur, plural of nazr which means vow). Ubaydullah was assassinated by Caliph Mansour Dawaneqi in the year 150 AH. To exterminate the Sadats (descendants of the Imams and consequently of the Holy Prophet (S) himself), Mansour had deep ditches dug on the paths they had to walk, in order to bury them alive.

Although Haroon Rashid's cousin, he was a remarkable Shiite, sincere and faithful to his faith. His anecdotes remained famous, especially for the dazzling reply he gave to his cousin caliph, through subtle nonsense that had eminently spiritual undertones. His tomb is located in a place called « Souk al Ghazal ».

children.name: Ziyarat for all Imam zadas (descendants of the Imams).

text.html:
اَلسَّلامُ عَلى جَدِّکَ الْمُصْطَفى، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى اَبيکَ الْمُرْتَضَى الرِّضا، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَى السَّيِّدَيْنِ الْحَسَنِ وَالْحُسَيْنِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى خَديجَةَ اُمِّ سَيِّدَةِ نِسآءِ الْعالَمينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى فاطِمَةَ اُمِّ الْاَئِمَّةِ الطّاهِرينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَى النُّفُوسِ الْفاخِرَةِ، بُحُورِ الْعُلُومِ الزّاخِرَةِ، شُفَعآئى فِى الاْخِرَةِ وَاَوْلِيآئى عِنْدَ عَوْدِ الرُّوحِ اِلَى الْعِظـامِ النّاخِرَةِ، اَئِمَّةِ الْخَلْقِ وَوُلاةِ الْحَقِّ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ اَيُّهَا الشَّخْصُ الشَّريفُ الطّاهِرُ الْكَريمُ، اَشْهَدُ اَنْ لا اِلـهَ اِلاَّ اللهُ، وَاَنَّ مُحَمَّداً عَبْدُهُ وَمُصْطَفاهُ، وَاَنَّ عَلِيّاً وَلِيُّهُ وَمُجْتَباهُ، وَاَنَّ الْاِمامَةَ فى وُلْدِهِ اِلى يَوْمِ الدّينِ، نَعْلَمُ ذلِکَ عِلْمَ الْيَقينِ، وَنَحْنُ لِذلِکَ مُعْتَقِدُونَ وَفى نَصْرِهِمْ مُجْتَهِدُونَ.

Peace be upon your grandfather Mustafa, peace be upon your father Murtaza Al- Reza, prace be upon masters Hasan and Hussain. Peace be upon Khadija the mother of the leader of women of all the worlds. Peace br upon Fatima mother of immaculate Imams; peace be upon the gratified souls, the deep oceans of knowledge and my intercessors on Doomsday, my powers when the spirit returns to bones, (you are) Imams of ctratures and powers of righteousness. Peace be upon you the honest, pure and gracious soul. I bear witness that there is no God but Allah, and that Muhammad is his servant and his choice. Ali is his representative and selected and Imamat is in his family till Doomsday. We know that for sure and we have firm faith in it and we struggle to assist them.

Assalaamo alla jaddeka al-mustafi, assalaamo alla abeeka al-murtadhee ar-redhaa, assalaamo alla as-sayyedayne al-Hasane wal Husayne, assalaamo alla khadijata umme sayyedate nesaail aalameen, assalaamo alla faatemata ummil a-immatit taahereen, assalaamo alla an-nofuse al-faakherate, bohuril olume az-zaakherate, shofa aaee fee al kherate wa awliyaaee inda awde ar-roohe elal ezaame an-naakherate, a-immate al-khalqe wa woolaate al-haqqe, assalaamo alayka ayyohash shakhsho ash-sharifo at-taahero al-kareemo, ash-hado an laa elaha illallaaho, wa anna Muhammadan abdohu wa mustafaao, wa anna Aliyyan waliyyohu wa mujtabaaho,wa annal imaamata fee wuldehi ela yawmiddeene, na’alamu dhaleka ilmal yaqeene, wa nahno le dhaleka moa’taqedoona wa fee nasrehim moojtahedun.

The shrine of Samarra, better known as Askaryein (the suffix "ein" (or "ayn", as in « kadhmayn ») refers to 2 entities that can be grouped together because of their affinities), is centrally located in the city of Samarra. There are two pure Imams, Imam Ali al-Hadi (A) - (10th Imam) and Imam Hassan al-Askari (A) - (11th Imam), and Hakimah Khatun, the sister of Imam al-Hadi (A) and Narjis Khatoun, the mother of Imam Mahdi (A).

L’Imam Ali ibne Mohammad al-Hadi (A) is the tenth Imam of the Twelver Shiites. He was born on the 15th of Zilhajj from the year 212 of the Hijra in Medina, and died in Martyr on 3 Rajab of the year 254 in Samarra at the age of 42, poisoned by Mo'taz (the 15th Abbasid caliph). His imamate lasted 33 years.

He is the son of Imam Mohammad al-Jawad (A) - (9th Imam) and Samana Khatoun.

Upon the death of his father, Imam al-Hadi (A) was six or eight years old. His imamate at such an early age did not give rise to any particular controversy, for the Shi'ites had already experienced such a situation when Imam al-Jawad was elevated to the Imamate (A) at the age of about eight years old too.

The most unfavorable period of his imamate was that of the Abbasid caliph Mutawakkil, fierce enemy of Ale Mohammad (A). Cruelty to the descendants of Ali (A) had never reached such a high level. He robbed all those who had any friendship for the Ahl-al-Bayt and prevented by all means the pilgrims from visiting the tomb of Imam Hussein (A), ordering his guards to capture and kill them. He even dared to destroy the sacred monument.

The faithful of the Imam increased in number in Medina, and the spies of Caliph Mutawwakkil informed him. Furious and out of fear of losing his illegitimate power, he forced Imam Hadi (A) to leave Medina for Samarra, where he kept him under house arrest, controlling his deeds and the visits he received.

The Imam thus remained in house arrest for 20 years - until his death - far from his family. The period of his imamate was very difficult because he had no freedom of action to carry out the tabligh. He wrote, answered the questions of his faithful followers and formed some transmissions of hadith.

The Imam had moved away from all materialism, and his days were dedicated to the worship of God. When Mutawwakil's soldiers suddenly appeared at his home, they found him busy praying in an almost empty room, where only the Qur'an and some books were present.

Imam Hadi (A) has left us the Ziyarat Jame'at, one of the most famous Ziyarat concerning our Imams.

Like his ancestors, Imam Hadi (A) did not leave this world of natural death ; he was poisoned by Mo'taz in the month of Rajab of 254 AH, and buried in his home in Samarra.

L’Imam Hassan ibne ‘Ali Askari (A) - (11th Imam), was born in 232 AH in Medina. His father is Imam Hadi (A) and his mother Hadithà Khatoun (or according to other Riwayat Salil or Sawsen). He was martyred at the age of 28. His imamat lasted only six years.

During his short life, he suffered the oppression of 3 Abbasid caliphs : Al Mo'taz-billah, al Mohtadi-billah, Al Mo'tamid-billah. This oppression had increased in Samarra since the time of Mutawwakil, Imams Jawad (A), Hadi (A) and Askari (A). These 3 Imams had a very short life : Imam Jawad lived 25 years, Imam Hadi 41 years and Imam Askari 28 years.

Imam Hassan Askari (A) has suffered particularly from the cruelty of power. The Abbasid caliphs were aware that Imam Mahdi (A) - (12th and last Imam), would be his son since the Prophet (S) had announced it himself. They kept him under close surveillance, in order to suppress any offspring. The Imam spent most of his life in exile - either inside a prison or under close surveillance.

To illustrate the situation of the Imam, it was reported that when the Shiites wanted to send him a sum of money, they handed it over to one of his close companions, Uthman ibn Sa'id - the oil salesman - who put it in the containers of his goods.

Mo'tamid, seeing that people felt more and more close to the Imam and that his imprisonment did not slow down his popularity, made the decision to poison him secretly. The Imam died a martyr on 8 Rabbiul awwal 260 AH, after several days of agony. Mo'tamid wanted to make his death a natural one, sending the best doctors to him.

- Narjis Khatoun

The tomb of Narjis Khatoun, mother of Imame Zaman (A), is located next to the tomb of her husband, Imam Hassan Askari (A) - (11th Imam).

Narjis Khatoun's father was Yeshua, son of the Byzantine Emperor. The lineage of his mother goes back to Sham'un (Simon), an apostle of the Prophet Issa (A).

She had a dream in which the Holy Prophet (S), asked her hand to the Prophet Issa (A), for her descendant Imam Hassan Askari (A). In another dream, she saw Bibi Fatima (A) make her recite the profession of faith (Shahada), which converted her to Islam.

Then, as a result of special circumstances, she found herself among a group of captives in Baghdad. Her stubborn attitude discouraged all suitors, until a person mandated by the father of her future husband, that is to say by Imam Hadi (a) - (10th Imam), arrived with precise instructions. Filled with joy, she finally agreed to accompany him to Samarra, where she became the wife of Imam Hassan al-Askari (A) - (11th Imam) according to his dream, and the mother of the Imam Mahdi (A) - (our 12th Imam).

She died in 260 AD, and was buried in her own home.

- Hakimah Khatoun

She is the daughter of Imam Jawad (A) - (9th Imam) and Samana Khatoun, and the sister of Imam Hadi (A) - (10th Imam). Her tomb is at the foot of the previous tombs.

When Narjis Khatoun, the future mother of Imam Mahdi (A), arrived in Samarra, Imam Hadi (A) entrusted her to her sister Hakimah Khatoun to teach her Islam and the Holy Qur'an. Hakimah Khatoun was the first person in the world to have seen and kissed Imam Mahdi (A) at birth.

A woman of great virtue, endowed with privileged qualities, she was one of the intermediaries between Imam Mahdi (A) and her visitors after the death of her father, Imam Hassan Askari (A).

text.html:
According to Imam as-Sadiq (A) - (6th Imam), whoever recites the Ziyarat to an Imam is similar to the one who recited the Ziyarat to the Holy Prophet (S).

And whoever recites the Ziyarat to an Imam and prays 4 rakaat by his side, will get the reward of a Hajj and an Umra.86

children.name: 2- A prayer for the fulfillment of vows

text.html:
A man asked Imam Hadi (A) - (10th Imam) to tell him a dua that would allow him to get closer to God. The Imam taught him this dua and told him that he recited it himself frequently. He asked God not to dismiss or disappoint anyone who would recite this dua in his haram.87

يا عُدَّتى عِنْدَ الْعُدَدِ، وَيا رَجآئى وَالْمُعْتَمَدَ، وَيا كَهْفى وَالسَّنَدَ، يا واحِدُ يا اَحَدُ، وَيا قُلْ هُوَ اللهُ اَحَدٌ، اَسْئَلُکَ الّلهُمَّ بِحَقِّ مَنْ خَلَقْتَ مِنْ خَلْقِکَ، وَلَمْ تَجْعَلْ فى خَلْقِکَ مِثْلَهُمْ اَحَداً، صَلِّ عَلى جَماعَتِهِمْ، وَافْعَلْ بى كَذا وَكَذا

O my means when I lack means! O my hope and my trust! O my haven and my support! O One! O One and Only! O (described in) Say: « He is Allah, the One. »}, I beseech You in the name of those whom You created from among Your creations but You have not made anyone to be like them at all, (please do) send blessings upon them all and submit my requests …

Yaa ooddati indal odade, wa yaa rajaaee wal mua’tamad, wa yaa kahfee was-sanada, yaa wahedo yaa ahado, wa yaa qool ho wallaho a’had, assaloka allahhumma be haqqe man khalaqta min khaleqeka, wa lam taj’all fee khalekeka mithlahoom ahadann, swalle alla jamaatehim waf’all bee « kadha wa kadha »

Instead of «af'al bi kadha wa kadha», present one's requests to God. This dua, recited in the haram, is recognized as having great power.

As before each Ziyarat, it is recommended to do ghusl, to put on clean clothes and to go to the haram in a state of spirituality and attention, then to recite before entering the haram permission to enter :

87: Rahnemaye Moussawwar safar ziyarati Iraq, page 388

اَللّهُمَّ اِنّى وَقَفْتُ عَلى بابٍ مِنْ اَبْوابِ بُيُوتِ نَبِيِّکَ، صَلَواتُکَ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ، وَ قَدْ مَنَعْتَ النّاسَ اَنْ يَدْخُلُوآ اِلّا بِاِذْنِهِ، فَقُلْتَ يآ اَيُّهَا الَّذينَ آمَنُوا لا تَدْخُلوُا بُيُوتَ النَّبِىِّ اِلّا اَنْ يُؤْذَنَ لَكُمْ، اَلّلهُمَّ إِنّى اَعْتَقِدُ حُرْمَةَ صاحِبِ هذَا الْمَشْهَدِ الشَّريفِ فى غَيْبَتِهِ كَمآ اَعْتَقِدُها فى حَضْرَتِهِ، وَاَعْلَمُ اَنَّ رَسُولَکَ وَ خُلَفآئَکَ عَلَيْهُمِ السَّلامُ اَحْيآءٌ عِنْدَکَ يُرْزَقُونَ، يَرَوْنَ مَقامى وَ يَسْمَعُونَ كَلامى وَ يَرُدُّونَ سَلامى، وَ اَنَّکَ حَجَبْتَ عَنْ سَمْعى كَلامَهُمْ، وَ فَتَحْتَ بابَ فَهْمى بِلَذيذِ مُناجاتِهِمْ، وَ اِنّى اَسْتَأْذِنُکَ يا رَبِّ اَوَّلاً، وَ اَسْتَاْذِنُ رَسُولَکَ صَلَّى‌اللّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَ آلِهِ ثانِياً، وَ اَسْتَأْذِنُ خَليفَتَکَ الاْمامَ الْمَفْرُوضَ عَلَىَّ طاعَتُهُ عَلِىَّ بْنَ محمّدٍ وَ حَسَنَ بْنَ عَلِىٍّ عَلَيْهمَا السَّلامُ، وَ الْمَلائِكَةَ الْمُوَكَّلينَ بِهذِهِ الْبُقْعَةِ الْمُبارَكَةِ ثالِثاً، ءَاَدْخُلُ يا رَسُولَ اللّهِ، ءَاَدْخُلُ يا حُجَّةَ اللّهِ، ءَاَدْخُلُ يا مَلائِكَةَ اللّهِ الْمُقَرَّبينَ الْمُقيمينَ فى هذَا الْمَشْهَدِ، فَاْذَنْ لى يا مَوْلاىَ فِى الدُّخُولِ اَفْضَلَ مآ اَذِنْتَ لاِحَدٍ مِنْ اَوْلِيآئِکَ، فَاِنْ لَمْ اَكُنْ اَهْلاً لِذلِکَ فَاَنْتَ اَهْلٌ لِذٰلِکَ

O Allah, I am standing at the door of one of the houses of Your Prophet; Your peace be upon him and his family. You have prohibited the people from entering his house except by the permission of Your Prophet and You said: {O You who believe do not enter the house of the Prophet unless permitted to do so}. ”. O Allah, I believe in this in his absence just as I believe it in his presence and I know that Your Prophet and Your vicegerents upon whom be peace, are Alive in Your presence, they are being nourished, they see my position and hear my speech and they return my greetings and (I believe) that You have covered my ears from hearing their speech and have opened the door of perception of their secret conversations (with You); I seek Your permission first, O’ my Lord; then I seek the permission of Your Prophet_ peace be upon him and his family_ secondly, and I seek the permission of Your vicegerent, Imam Hussain Bin Ali (A) whose obedience is incumbent upon me and (the permission of) Your angels entrusted over this blessed site thirdly. May I enter, O Prophet of Allah, may I enter O the proof of Allah, may I enter, O angels of Allah who are stationed close to this shrine, so permit me O my master to enter the best of way that You have permitted any of Your friends, if I am not deserving of that then You surely are deserving of that.
