فَكُنْ لِوَلِيِّکَ يا مَوْلاىَ عِنْدَ تَحْقيقِ اَمَلِهِ وَ اسْئَلِ اللّهَ غُفْرانَ زَلَلِهِ، فَقَدْ تَعَلَّقَ بِحَبْلِکَ وَ تَمَسَّکَ بِوِلايَتِکَ وَ تَبَرَّءَ مِنْ اَعْدآئِکَ، اَلّلهُمَّ صَلِّ عَلى مُحَمَّدٍ وَ آلِهِ وَ اَنْجِزْ لِوَلِيِّکَ ما وَعَدْتَهُ، اَلّلهُمَّ اَظْهِرْ كَلِمَتَهُ وَ اَعْلِ دَعْوَتَهُ وَ انْصُرْهُ عَلى عَدُوِّهِ وَ عَدُوِّکَ يا رَبَّ الْعالَمينَ، اَلّلهُمَّ صَلِّ عَلى مُحَمَّدٍ وَ آلِ مُحَمَّدٍ وَ اَظْهِرْ كَلِمَتَکَ التّآمَّةَ، وَمُغَيَّبَکَ فى اَرْضِکَ الْخآئِفَ الْمُتَرَقِّبَ، اَلّلهُمَّ انْصُرْهُ نَصْراً عَزيزاً وَ افْتَحْ لَهُ فَتْحاً يَسيراً، اَلّلهُمَّ وَاَعِزَّ بِهِ الدّينَ بَعْدَ الْخُمُولِ، وَاَطْلِعْ بِهِ الْحَقَّ بَعْدَ الْاُفُولِ، وَ اَجْلِ بِهِ الظُّلْمَةَ وَ اكْشِفْ بِهِ الْغُمَّةَ، اَلّلهُمَّ وَ آمِنْ بِهِ الْبِلادَ وَ اهْدِ بِهِ الْعِبادَ، اَلّلهُمَّ امْلَاْ بِهِ الْاَرْضَ عَدْلاً وَ قِسْطاً، كَما مُلِئَتْ ظُلْماً وَ جُوراً، اِنَّکَ سَميعٌ مُجيبٌ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ يا وَلِىَّ اللّهِ، اِئْذَنْ لِوَلِيِّکَ فى الدُّخُولِ اِلى حَرَمِکَ صَلَواتُاللّهِ عَلَيْکَ وَ عَلى آبائِکَ الطّاهِرينَ وَرَحْمَةُ اللّهِ وَ بَـرَكـاتُهُ.

Peace be upon you, O vicegerent of Allah and vicegerent of your well-guided fathers. Peace be upon you, O successor of the past successors (of the Prophets). Peace be upon you, O keeper of the secrets of the Lord of the worlds. Peace be upon you, O Allah’s remainder from among the elite, select ones. Peace be upon you, O son of the luminous lights. Peace be upon you, O son of the splendid signs. Peace be upon you, O son of the immaculate progeny. Peace be upon you, O essence of the Prophetic knowledge. Peace be upon you, O Allah’s gate; the only gate from which one can enter to Him. Peace be upon you, O Allah’s course that perdition will be the result of anyone who takes other than it. Peace be upon you, O observer of the Tree of Bliss (§£b¡) and the Farthest Lot-tree. Peace be upon you, O Allah’s light that never extinguishes. Peace be upon you, O Allah’s decisive argument that is never hidden. Peace be upon you, O Allah’s decisive argument against all those on the earth and in the heavens. Peace be upon you; a salutation of one who recognizes you as exactly as Allah has introduced you and one who mentions only some of your characteristics that you are worthy of and even more. I bear witness that you are the argument against the past and the coming generations, your party are the true triumphant, your friends are the true winners, your enemies are truly losers, you are the keeper of the entire knowledge, you are the opener of all closed things, you are the establisher of all truths, and you are the eradicator of all wrong things. O my master, I accept you as my leader, guide, master, and adviser. I never seek any alternative and I never betake myself any master save You. I bear witness that you are verily the unchanging truth that is free of any defect and that Allah’s promise concerning you is so true that I never doubt no matter how long the occultation will take and the time (of your advent) will be far and I will never have misgivings like those who ignore you and ignore the truth that you represent and I am waiting and expecting your age, for you are the unmatched intercessor and the irrefutable master. Allah has saved you for the support of the religion, for the fortification of the believers, and for retAliating upon the deniers and the apostates. I bear witness that through the loyalty to you, deeds are approved, acts are purified, rewards are doubled, and punishments for wrongdoings are erased. Therefore, he who bears loyalty to you and recognizes your Imamate will have his deeds approved, his sayings credited, his rewards doubled, and his wrongdoings erased; while if he rejects loyalty to you, ignores the recognition of you, and follows anyone else, Allah shall throw him down in Hellfire on the nose, shall never approve of any of his acts, and shall never set up a balance for him on the Day of Resurrection. I ask Allah and His angels and you, my master, to testify to this for me; the outward of this declaration is as same as its inward, and its secret is as same as its overtness; and you are the witness on this declaration, and this is my pledge with you and my covenant to you since you are verily the system of the religion, the leader of the pious ones, and the dignity of the monotheists. This is the command of the Lord of the Worlds to me. Even if times take longer periods and ages extend, this will increase in me nothing but more belief in you, love for you, reliance on and trust in you, anticipation and expectation of your advent, and waiting to strive hard in your presence. So, I sacrifice myself, my fortune, my sons, my family members, and all that which my Lord has granted me for your sake and for obeying your orders and refraining from that which you order me not to do. O my master, If I catch your thriving days and see your splendid signs, then, here I, a servant of you, am yielding to your orders and abstaining from that which you order me not to do. Through all that, I hope for martyrdom in your presence and success in your view. O my master, but if death comes upon me before your advent, then I beseech you and your immaculate fathers to mediate for me before Allah the All-exalted Whom I pray to send blessings upon Muhammad and the offspring of Muhammad and to decide for me a return after your advent and a second life during your days so that I will attain obedience to you, which is my desire, and to heal my heart from your enemies.

O my master, while I am visiting you, I am standing in the position of the repentant wrongdoers, who fear the chastisement of the Lord of the Worlds and I am, meanwhile, depending upon your intercession for me and I, through my loyalty to you and your intercession for me, wish for eradication of my sins, covering of my defects, and forgiveness of my slips. So, O my master, (please) help me—your servant— to achieve my hope and (please) ask Allah to forgive my slips. Verily, I am clinging to your rope, holding on my loyalty to you, and declaring my disavowal of your enemies. O Allah, (please) bless Muhammad and his progeny and fulfill Your promise to Your Vicegerent. O Allah, (please) make prevalent his word, elevate his mission, and support him against Your and his enemies, O Lord of the Worlds! O Allah, (please) send blessings upon Muhammad and the Family of Muhammad and allow Your Perfect Word, Your concealed one in Your lands, the afraid, and the vigilant, to reappear. O Allah, (please) support him with powerful support and give him a nigh victory. O Allah, (please) fortify the religion through him after it has been sluggish, demonstrate the truth through him after it has declined, remove darkness through him, and relieve the grief through him. O Allah (please) spread security over the lands through him and guide the servants (of You) through him. O Allah, (please) fill the earth with justice and equAlity through him as it is filled with injustice and wrong. Verily, You are All-hearing and Responding.
Peace be upon you, O Allah’s vicegerent (Please) permit me, your servant, to enter your sanctuary. May Allah’s blessings be upon you and upon your immaculate fathers! Allah’s mercy and benedictions be upon you.

Assalaamo a’layka yaa khalifatallaahe wa khalifata aabaaehi al-mahdiyyina, assalaamo a’layka yaa wasiyyal awsiyaaa’il maazina, assalaamo a’layka yaa haafedha as-raare rabbil aalameen, assalaamo a’layka yaa baqiyatallaahe menas safwatil moontaajabeena, assalaamo a’layka yabna al-anwaare adh-dhaaherate, assalaamo a’layka yabnal a’a-laamil baaherate, assalaamo a’layka yabnal itratit taaherate, assalaamo a’layka yaa ma’a-denal olume an-nabwiyyate, assalaamo a’layka yaa baaballaahil ladhee laa yutee illaa minho, assalaamo a’layka yaa sabeelallaahil ladhee man salaka ghayrahu halaka, assalaamo a’layka yaa naadhera shajarate toobi wa sidratil moontahee, assalaamo a’layka yaa noorallaahil ladhee laa yutfee, assalaamo a’layka yaa hujjatallaahil latee laa takhfee, asaalaamo a’layka yaa hujjatallaahe alla man fil ardhe was samaa’e, assalaamo a’layka salaama man arafaka bemaa arrafaka behillaaho, wa na’ataka be ba’a-dhe no’ootekal latee anta ahlohaa wa fawqahaa, ash-hado annaka al-hujjato alla man madhee wa man baqeya, wa anna hizbaka homul ghaaleboon wa awleyaa’aka homul faaa’ezoon, wa a-adaa’aka homul khaaseroon, wa annaka khaazenu kulle ilmin wa faateqo kulle ratqin, wa mohaq-qeqo kulle haqqin wa moobtelo kulle baatelin, razaytoka yaa mawlaee imaaman wa haadeyan wa waliyyan wa murshidan laa ab-taghee beka badalan wa laa at-takheju min dooneka waliyyan, ash-hado annaka al-haqqun ath-thaabeto, al-ladhee laa ayba feehe wa anna wa’adallaahe feeka haqqun, laa ar-taabo le toolil ghaybate wa bo’a-dil amade, wa laa atahayyaro ma a man jahelaka wa jahela beka, moontadhero motawaqqeo le ayyaameka wa antash shaafeo al-ladhee laa tonaazao, wal waliyyo al-ladhee laa todaafao, zakharakallaaho le nusrate ad-dine wa e’a-zaaze al-momineena, wal inteqaame menal jaahedina al-maareqina, ash-hado anna be wilaayateka tuqbalo al-a’amaalo wa tozakki al-af’aalo, wa tozaa afo al-hasanaato wa tumhee as-sayyeaato, faman jaaa’a be wilaayateka wa a’tarafa be imaamateka qobelat a-a’maalohu, wa suddeqat aqwaalohu wa tazaa afat hasanaatohu wa mohiyyat sayyeaatohu, wa man adala ann wilaayateka wajahela ma’arefateka was tabdala beka ghayraka, kabbahullaho alla minkharehe feennaare, wa lam yaqbalillaaho lahu amalan wa lam yoqim lahu yawmal qeyaamate waznan ooshhedulalaaha wa ooshhedu malaaekatahu wa oosh-hedoka yaa mawlaya be hadhaa, zaahero kabaatenehi wa sirrohu ka’alaaniyatehi, wa antash-shaahedo alla dhaaleka wa howa ahdee elayka wa mithaaqee ladayka, idh anta nizaamo ad-deene wa ya’a-subo al-muttaqina wa izzul mowahhedeena, wa bedhaaleka amarani rabbo al-aalamina, falaw tataawalate ad-dohuro wa tamaadate al a’amaaro lam azdad feeka illaa yaqinan, wa laka illan hubban wa a’layka illaa moottakalan wa mo’a-tamadan, wa le dhohooreka illaa motawaqqan wa moontadheran wa le zehaadi bayna yadayka motaraqqeban, fa abzulo nafsi wa maali wa waladee wa ahlee, wa jamee’a maa khawwalanee rabbi bayna yadayka wat-tasarroofa bayna, amreka wa nahyeka, mawlayee fa’in adrakto ayyaamaka adh-dhaaherata wa a’a-laamaka al-baaherata, fahaa anaazaa a’bdoka al-mutasarrefo bayna amreka wa nahyeka, ardhoo behi shahaadata bayna yadayka wal-fauza ladayka, mawlaa ya fa’in adraknee al-mawto qabla dhohureka fa inni atawassalo beka wa be baaaeka at-taaherina elallaahe ta’aalee, wa asalohu ann yoswalle alla Muhammadin, wa ann yaj’ala lee karratan fee dhohureka wa raj’atan fee ayyaameka, le ab-logha mintaa’ateka muraadi wa ash-fiya min a’adaaeka fuwaadi, mawlaaya wa qafto fee zeyaarateka mawqefa al-khaateina, an-naademina al-khaaefina min eqaabe rabbil aalameen, wa qade at-takalto alla shafaa’ateka wa rajawto be mowaalateka wa shafaa’ateka, mahwa dhonubee wa satra oyubee wa maghferata dhalalee, fakun le waliyyeka yaa mawlaaya inda tahqeeqe amalehi was-Alillaaha, ghufrana zallahe, faqad ta’allaqa be hableka wa tamassaka be wilaayateka wa tAbarra’a min a’adaaeka, allaahumma swalle alla Muhammadin wa aalehi wa anjeez le waliyyeka maa wa adtahu, allahumma adh-hir kalematahu wa a’ale da’awatahu wan soorhu alla aduwwehi wa aduwweka yaa rabbal aalameen, allaahumma swalle alla Muhammadin wa aale Muhammadin wa adh-hir kalemataka at-taamata, wa moghayyabaka fee ar-zeka al-khaaefa al-mutaraqqeba, allaahumma ansoorho nasran azeezan wa aftah lahu fathan yasiran, allahumma wa aamin behi al-belaada wa ahde behil ebaada, allahumma amla’a behil arza adlan wa qistan kamaa mule’at dhulman wa zooran, innaka sameeo mojeebo, assalaamo a’layka yaa waliyyallaahe, e’azan le waliyyeka fee ad-dokhule ela harameka salawaatullahe a’layka wa alla aabaaeka at-taahereena wa rahmatullaahe wabarakaatohu.
According to other Riwayat, she would be called Hadithà, or Salil. She was one of the intermediaries of Imam Hujjat (A) - (12th Imam).

children.name: 2- Sayyad Hussein ibn Ali al-Hadi, brother of Imam Hassan Askari (A) - (11th Imam)

text.html:
Northeast of the tombs of the 10th and 11th Imam, is that of Hussein ibn Ali al-Hadi, the brother of Imam Hassan al-Askari (A). He was a very pious man of great rank.

According to some Riwayat, he and his brother Imam Hassan Askari (A) were called « Sibtein ».

children.name: 3- Ja'far al-kadh-dhab (the brother of Imam Hassan Askari (A))

text.html: Although he is the son of Imam Hadi (A), Ja'far is known by the pejorative nickname of « al kadh-dhàb » that is « the liar ». Imam Hadi (A) says : « Move away from my son Ja'far, he is to me as Kanaan was to Nouh (Noah). » Imam Hassan Askari (A) said : « Me and Ja'far are like Hābil (Abel) and Kābil (Caïen), the two sons of Adam (a). If it had been possible for him, he would have killed me. » After the death of Imam Hadi (A), Ja'far proclaimed himself Imam. He even offered a large sum of money to the caliph so that he would recognize him as such in place of his brother Imam Askari (A). The caliph replied : « If the imamate were in our hands, we would have kept it for ourselves!»

children.name: 4- Samana, the Mother of Imam Hadi (a) - (10th Imam)

text.html: She was a very godly woman. She fasted during the day and prayed at night. She died in the house of Imam Hadi (A) where she was buried near her son.

He is a descendant of Ja'far Tayyar (the brother of Imam Ali (A)). He was the companion of Imams ar-Redha (A) (8th I.), Jawad (a) (9th), Hadi (A) (10th) and Askari (a) (11th). His grave is inside the Askaryein haram.

Ibrahim is the son of Malik-e-Ashtar, fervent defender of Islam and loyal companion of Imam Ali (A) who, while being of humble and pious nature, held eminent positions. In the year 64 AH, Ibrahim was with Mukhtar-e-Thaqafi, the one who had risen to avenge Imam Hussein (a). In the year 72 AH, he fell fighting the soldiers of Abdul Malik Marwan, and his body was burned. His ashes are buried near the town of Balad which is located 30 km south of Samarra.

children.name: 7- Jamil, the son of Darraj Koufi

text.html: He was an authentic transmitter of hadith. His grave is 12 km from Baghdad.

children.name: 8- Sayyad Mohammad, the eldest son of Imam Ali al-Hadi (A) - (10th Imam)

text.html:
Imam Hadi (A) had 4 sons and a daughter, the eldest of whom is Syed Mohammad. The latter enjoyed a special position and respect with the Shiites. He was very close to his brother Imam Hassan al-Askari (A).

When Imam Hadi (A) was forced to exile to Samarra in 243 AD, Syed Mohammad remained in Medina. He then came to Samarra in 252 AH, and died on his return to Balad, 30 km south of Samarra.

It is acknowledged that the prayers formulated on his grave are answered.

children.name: Ziyarat for all Imam zadas (descendants of the Imams).

text.html:
اَلسَّلامُ عَلى جَدِّکَ الْمُصْطَفى، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى اَبيکَ الْمُرْتَضَى الرِّضا، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَى السَّيِّدَيْنِ الْحَسَنِ وَالْحُسَيْنِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى خَديجَةَ اُمِّ سَيِّدَةِ نِسآءِ الْعالَمينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلى فاطِمَةَ اُمِّ الْاَئِمَّةِ الطّاهِرينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَى النُّفُوسِ الْفاخِرَةِ، بُحُورِ الْعُلُومِ الزّاخِرَةِ، شُفَعآئى فِى الاْخِرَةِ وَاَوْلِيآئى عِنْدَ عَوْدِ الرُّوحِ اِلَى الْعِظـامِ النّاخِرَةِ، اَئِمَّةِ الْخَلْقِ وَوُلاةِ الْحَقِّ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْکَ اَيُّهَا الشَّخْصُ الشَّريفُ الطّاهِرُ الْكَريمُ، اَشْهَدُ اَنْ لا اِلـهَ اِلاَّ اللهُ، وَاَنَّ مُحَمَّداً عَبْدُهُ وَمُصْطَفاهُ، وَاَنَّ عَلِيّاً وَلِيُّهُ وَمُجْتَباهُ، وَاَنَّ الْاِمامَةَ فى وُلْدِهِ اِلى يَوْمِ الدّينِ، نَعْلَمُ ذلِکَ عِلْمَ الْيَقينِ، وَنَحْنُ لِذلِکَ مُعْتَقِدُونَ وَفى نَصْرِهِمْ مُجْتَهِدُونَ.

Peace be upon your grandfather Mustafa, peace be upon your father Murtaza Al- Reza, prace be upon masters Hasan and Hussain. Peace be upon Khadija the mother of the leader of women of all the worlds. Peace br upon Fatima mother of immaculate Imams; peace be upon the gratified souls, the deep oceans of knowledge and my intercessors on Doomsday, my powers when the spirit returns to bones, (you are) Imams of ctratures and powers of righteousness. Peace be upon you the honest, pure and gracious soul. I bear witness that there is no God but Allah, and that Muhammad is his servant and his choice. Ali is his representative and selected and Imamat is in his family till Doomsday. We know that for sure and we have firm faith in it and we struggle to assist them.

Assalaamo alla jaddeka al-mustafi, assalaamo alla abeeka al-murtadhee ar-redhaa, assalaamo alla as-sayyedayne al-Hasane wal Husayne, assalaamo alla khadijata umme sayyedate nesaail aalameen, assalaamo alla faatemata ummil a-immatit taahereen, assalaamo alla an-nofuse al-faakherate, bohuril olume az-zaakherate, shofa aaee fee al kherate wa awliyaaee inda awde ar-roohe elal ezaame an-naakherate, a-immate al-khalqe wa woolaate al-haqqe, assalaamo alayka ayyohash shakhsho ash-sharifo at-taahero al-kareemo, ash-hado an laa elaha illallaaho, wa anna Muhammadan abdohu wa mustafaao, wa anna Aliyyan waliyyohu wa mujtabaaho,wa annal imaamata fee wuldehi ela yawmiddeene, na’alamu dhaleka ilmal yaqeene, wa nahno le dhaleka moa’taqedoona wa fee nasrehim moojtahedun.

Syria is a country of the Near East located on the eastern coast of the Mediterranean Sea. Until the 19th century, Syria was known as 'Bilad al-Cham'. Border countries are Lebanon, Turkey, Jordan, Iraq and Palestine.

Zaynab (A) also called Zaynab al-Kubra (the Great) is the daughter of Imam Ali (A) and Sayeda Fatima az-Zahra (A), daughter of the Holy Prophet (S). She was born on the 5th Jamadil al-awal in Medina in the 5th year AH.

When she came to the world, Imam Ali (A) told Fatima az-Zahra (A) that they had to wait for the return of the Prophet (S) who was traveling for the choice of the name of the child. When the Prophet (S) returned 3 days later, the angel Gabriel came down to earth with the name 'Zaynab', which means 'the ornament of his father'.

She was lucky enough to spend 5 years under the protection of her grandfather, the Envoy of God (S). The Holy prophet liked to spend a lot of time with her and had her sit on her lap to chat. The title of Sayeda Zaynab (A) was 'Umm al-Massaeb', which means 'the mother of calamities', because she suffered a lot from childhood.

She married her cousin Abdullah ibn Ja'far al-Tayaar in the 17th year AH. Abdullah had been raised by the Holy Prophet (S) and Imam Ali (A).

One of the conditions of the marriage was that Abdullah should not deny Zaynab (A) a possible trip with his brother Imam Hussein.

4 children were born from this union: Awn and Mohammad, 2 teenage martyrs in Karbala, Abbas and a girl named Umm Kulthum.

Sayeda Zaynab (A) was raised in a prophetic environment and she gained a lot of knowledge in this environment, hence her title of 'scholar' by her nephew Imam Sajjad (A).

Her reasoned speeches based on clear reasoning as well as Quranic verses in Kufa and in Yazid’s Palace prove this knowledge. The story of Karbala would not have had the same magnitude without Sayeda Zaynab (A). The memory of Karbala remains alive today thanks to her courage in front of all the opponents who questioned the authenticity of the story of Karbala. After being taken prisoner in Damascus at Yazid Palace, It brought to light the violence of this tyrant, which had an impact on the hearts of the inhabitants of this city. It was the fear of the repercussions of Sayeda Zaynab's speeches (A) that forced Yazid to send the caravan back to Medina. But even in Medina, Sayeda Zaynab (A) did not remain silent, she continued spreading the story of Karbala and countering the Umayads, forcing the governor of Medina to send a letter to Yazid. Yazid then left the choice to Sayeda Zaynab (A) for the place of her exile because she no longer had the right to stay in Mecca or Medina. Sayeda Zaynab (A) finally chooses to return to Damascus, and she left this world a few days after her exile. There are discrepancies as to her date of death, but the best known date is Rajab 14, 62 AH, aged 57, 2 years after the Karbala tragedy. Her tomb is in the southern suburbs of Damascus, 7 kilometers from the capital.1

a) Izne Dukhul ( Permission to enter)

بِاِذْنِ اللَّهِ وَاِذْنِ رَسُولِهِ وَاِذْنِ مَلائِكَتِهِ الْمُقَرَّبينَ وَاَنْبِيائِهِ الْمُرسَلينَ، وَالْأَئِمَّةِ الْمَعْصُومينَ، وَبِاِذْنِ السَيِّدَةِ زَيْنَبَ الْكُبْرى‏ بِنْتِ الْاِمامِ اَميرِ الْمُؤْمِنينَ عَلَيْهِ السَّلامُ، اَدْخُلُ هذِهِ الرَّوْضَةَ الْمُبارَكَةَ، وَادْعُو اللَّهَ بِفُنُونِ الدَّعَواتِ، وَاَعْتَرِفُ لِلَّهِ بِالْعُبُودِيَّةِ، وَلِلنَّبىِّ وَالْأَئِمَّةِ الْمَعْصُومينَ عَلَيْهِمُ السَّلامُ بِالطاعَةِ، رَبِّ اَدْخِلْنى مُدْخَلَ صِدْقٍ، وَاَخْرِجْنى مُخْرَجَ صِدْقٍ، وَاجْعَلْ لى مِنْ لَدُنْكَ سُلْطاناً نَصيراً.

Be idhnillahe wa idhne rasoolehi wa idhne malaaekatehil moqarrabina wa anbiyaaehil moorsalina, wal a-immatil ma-a’sumina,wa be idhne sayyedate zaynabal kubraa bintil imaame ameeril momineena alayhis salaamo, adkholo hadhehir rawdhatal mubaarakata, wad-ullaaha be fonune ad- da’a-waate, wa a-a’tarefo lillaahe bil obudiy’yate, wale nabiyyi wal a’immatil ma’a-soomina alayhemo as-salaamo bil taa’ate, rabbe adkhilni mudkhala sidqin, wa akhrieejni mukhraja sidqeen, waj-al lee min ladunka sultaanan naseeraa.

With the permission of Allah, his Messenger, his intimate angels, his prophets, the messengers and with the permission of infallible leaders and Lady Zaibab Al-Kubra the daughter of Imam Emir of believers, peace be upon him, I am going to enter this holy shrine. I pray Allah with skills of appeals and I admit bondage to Allah and submission to the prophet and the infallible Imams. O my Lord, cause me to enter a sound entering and to exit a sound exit and grant me from yourself a supporting authority.»

b) Ziyarat :

السّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا بِنْتَ سَيِّدِ الأنبِياء،السّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا بِنْتَ صاحِبِ الحَوْضِ واللِّواءِ، السّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا بِنْتَ مَنْ عُرِجَ بِهِ إِلى السّماءِ ووَصَلَ إلى مَقَامِ قابَ قَوْسَيْنِ أو أَدْنَى، السّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا بِنْتَ نَبِيِّ الهُدَى وسَيِّدِ الوَرَى ومُنْقِذِ العِبادِ مِنَ الرَّدَى، السّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا بِنْتَ صاحِبِ الخُلُقِ العَظيمِ والشَرَفِ العَميمِ والذِّكْرِ الحَكيمِ، السّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا بِنْتَ صاحِبِ المقامِ المَحْمودِ والحَوْضِ المَوْرودِ واللِّواءِ المَشْهودِ، السّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا بِنْتَ مَنْهَجِ دِينِ الإسْلاموصاحِبِ القِبْلَةِ والقُرْآَنِ وعَلَمِ الصِّدْقِ مُحَمَّدُ هَذَا حُسَيْنٌ تَشْفَى عَلَيْهِ رِيحُ الصَّبَا مَجْذُوذُ الرَّأْسِ مِنَ الْقَفَا قَتِيلُ أَوْلادِ الْبَغَا، وَاحُزْنَاهُ عَلَيْكَ يا أبا عَبْدِ اللهِ، السَّلامُ عَلَى مَنْ تَهَيَّجَ قَلْبُها لِلْحُسَيْنِ الْمَظْلُومِ الْعُرْيَانِ الْمَطْرُوحِ عَلَى الثَّرَى، وَقَالَتْ بِصَوْتٍ حَزِينٍ بِأَبِي مَنْ نَفْسِي لَهُ الْفِدَاءُ بِأبِي الْمَهْمُومِ حَتَّى قَضَى بِأَبِي العَطْشَانِ حَتَّى مَضَىبِأَبِي مَنْ شَيْبَتُهُ تَقْطُرُ بِالْدِمَاءِ، السَّلامُ عَلَى مَنْ بَكَتْ عَلَى جَسَدِ أَخِيها بَيْنَ الْقَتْلَى حَتَّى بَكَى لِبُكائِها كُلُّ عَدُوٍّ وَصَدِيقٍ وَرَأَى النَّاسُ دُمُوعَ الْخَيْلِ تَنْحَدِرُ عَلَى حَوَافِرِها عَلَى الْتَحْقِيقِ، السَّلامُ عَلَى مَنْ تَكَفَّلَتْ وَجَمَعَتْ فِي عَصْرِ عاشُوراءَ بَناتِ رَسُولِ اللهِ وَأطْفَالَ الْحُسَيْنِوَقَامَتْ لَهَا الْقِيَامَةُ فِي شَهَادَةِ الطِّفْلَيْنِ الْغَرِيبَيْنِ الْمَظْلُومَيْنِ، السَّلامُ عَلَى مَنْ لَمْ تَنَمْ عَيْنُها ِلأَجْلِ حِرَاسَةِ آلِ رَسُولِ اللهِ فِي طَفِّ نَيْنَوَى وَصَارَتْ أَسِيراً ذَلِيلاً بِيَدِ الأعْدَاءِ، السَّلامُ عَلَى مَنْ رَكِبَتْ بَعِيراً بِغَيْرِ وَطاءٍ وَنَادَتْ أَخِيها أبَا الفَضْلِ بِهَذا النِّدَاءِ أَخِي أبَا الفَضْلِ أَنْتَ الَّذي أرْكَبْتَنِي إذْ أَرَدْتُ الْخُرُوجَ مِنَ الْمَدِينَةِ، السَّلامُ عَلَى مَنْ خَطَبَتْ فِي مَيْدانِ الْكُوفةِ بِخُطْبَةٍ نَافِعَةٍ حَتَّى سَكَنَتْ الأصْوَاتُ مِنْ كُلِّ نَاحِيَةٍ، السَّلامُ عَلَى مَنِ احْتَجَّتْ فِي مَجْلِسِ ابْنِ زِيَادٍ باحْتِجَاجَاتٍ وَاضِحَةٍ وَقَالَتْ فِي جَوَابِهِ بِبَيِّنَاتٍ صَادِقَةٍ إذْ قَالَ ابْنُ زِيَادٍ لِزَيْنَبَ سَلامُ اللهِ عَلَيْها كَيْفَ رَأَيْتِ صُنْعَ اللهِ بِأَخِيكِ الْحُسَيْنِ قَالَتْ مَا رَأَيْتُ إلاَّ جَمِيلاً،السَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا أَسِيرَةً بِأيْدِي الأعْدَاءِ فِي الْفَلَوَاتِ وَرَأَيْتِ أَهْلَ الشَّامِ فِي حَالَةِ الْعَيْشِ وَالسُّرُورِ وَنّشْرِ الْرَايَاتِ، السَّلامُ عَلَى مَنْ شُدَّ الْحَبْلُ عَلَى عَضُدِهَا وَعُنُقِ الإمامِ زَيْنِ الْعَابِدِينَ وَأَدْخَلُوها مَعَ سِتَّةِ عَشَرَ نَفَراً مِنْ آَلِ رَسُولِ اللهِ وَهُمْ كَالأَسَرَاءِ مُقَرَّنِينَ بِالْحَدِيدِ مَظْلُومِينَ وَقَالَ عَلِيُّ بْنُ الْحُسَيْنِ عَلَيْهِ السّلامُ لِيَزِيدَ يا يَزِيدُ ما ظَنُّكَ بِرَسُولِ اللهِ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَآَلِهِ لَوْ رَآَنا عَلَى هَذِهِ الْحَالَةِ ثُمَّ قَالَتْ أُمُّ الْمَصَائِبِ زَيْنَبُ لَهُ قَائِلاً لأَهَلُّوا وَاسْتَهَلُّوا فَرَحاً ثُمَّ قَالُوا يا يَزِيدُ لا تُشَلْمُنْتَحِياً عَلَى ثَنَايَا أَبِي عَبْدِ اللهِ سَيِّدِ شَبَابِ أَهْلِ الْجَنَّةِ تَنْكُتَها بِمِخْصَرَتِكَ ثُمَّ قَالَتْ لَهُ وَلَئِنْ جَرَّتْ عَلَيَّ الدَّوَاهِي مُخَاطَبَتَك فَإِنِّي لأَسْتَصْغِرُ قَدْرَكَ وَأَسْتَعْظِمُ تَقْرِيعَكَ وَأسْتَكْثِرُ تَوْبِيخَكَ لَكِنَّ الْعُيُونَ عَبْرَا وَالْصُدُورَ حَرَّا ألا فَالْعَجَبُ كُلُّ الْعَجَبِ مِنْ إقْدَامِكَ عَلَى قَتْلِ حِزْبِ اللهِ النُّجَبَاءِ بِحِزْبِ الشَّيْطانِ الطُّلَقَاءِوَلَئِنْ اتَّخَذْتَنَا مَغْنَماً لَتَجِدْنا وَشِيكاً مَغْرَماً حِينَ لا تَجِدُ إلاَّ ما قَدَّمَتْ يَدَاكَ وَما رَبُّكَ بِظَلاَّمٍ لِلْعَبِيدِ وَإلى اللهِ الْمُشْتَكَى وَعَلَيْهِ الْمُعَوَّلُّ فِي الْشِدَّةِ وَالْرَخاءِ، فَكِدْ كَيْدَكَ وَاسْعَ سَعْيَكَ وَنَاصِبْ جُهْدَكَ فَوَاللهِ لا تَمْحُو ذِكْرَنَا وَلا تُمِيتُ وَحْيَنَا وَلا تُدْرِكُ أَمَدَنا وَلا تَرْحَضُ عَنْكَ عَارَها وَهَلْ رَأَيُكَ إلاَّ فَنَداً وَأيَّامُكَ إلاَّ عَدَدَاً وَجَمْعُكَ إلاّ بَدَدَاً،يا يَزِيدُ أَما سَمِعْتَ قَوْلَ اللهِ تَعالَى {وَلا تَحْسَبَنَّ الَّذِينَ قُتِلُوا فِي سَبِيلِ اللهِ أَمْوَاتاً بَلْ أَحْيَاءٌ عِنْدَ رَبِّهِمْ يُرْزَقُونَ}، وَحَسْبُكَ بِاللهِ حَاكِماً وَبِمُحَمَّدٍ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَآَلِهِ خَصْماً وَبِجِبْرِيلَ عَدُوَّاً، ثُمَّ قَالَتْ الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِي خَتَمَ لأوَّلِنَا بِالسَّعادةِ وَالْمَغْفِرَةِ وَلآخِرِنا بِالْشَهادَةِ وَالْرَحْمَةِ إنَّهُ رَحِيمٌ وَدُودٌ وَهُوَ حَسْبُنا وَنِعْمَ الْوَكِيلُ وَصَلَّى اللهُ عَلَى مُحَمَّدٍ وَأَهْلِ بَيْتِهِ الطَّاهِرِينَ.

Assalaamo a’layke yaa binta sayyedil anbiyaa’a, assalaamo a’layke yaa binta saahebe al-hawdhe walal-liwaae, assalaamo A’layke yaa binta man orooja behi elas samaa’e wa wasala elaa maqaame qaaba qawsayne aw ad-naa, assalaamo a’layke yaa binte nabiyyin al-hodee wa sayyedi al wari wa munqedhe al ibaade menar radaa, assalaamo a’layke yaa binte saahebe al-kholuqe al adheeme wal sharafe al ameeme wadh dhikre al-hakeeme, assalaamo alayke yaa binte saahebil maqaame al mahmude wal hawdhe al maw roode wal lewaae al-mash’hude, asssalaamo a’layke yaa binta manhaje deene al islaame wa saahebe al qiblate wal qur’aane wa alamis sidqe wal haqqe wal ehsaane, assalaamo a’layke yaa binta safwate al ambiyaae wa alame al atqiyaae wa mash-hoore adh-dhikre fee al ardhe was samaa’e wa rahmatullaahe wa barakaatohu, assalaamo a’layka yaa binta khayre khalqillaahe wa sayyede khalqehi wa awwale al-adade qabla ijaade ar dhehi wa samaa waate wa aakhere al abade ba’a-da fanaa e al dunyaa wa ahlehaa al-ladhee ruhooho nuskhato al-lahoote wa sooratohu nuskhato al mulke wal malakute wa qalbohu khuzaanato al hayyi al ladhee laa yamuto wa rahmatullaahe wa barakaatohu, assalaamo alayke yaa binta al mudhallale bil ghamaame sayyedil kawnayne wa mawlath thaqlayne wa shafee-ill ummate yawma al mahshare wa rahmatullaahe wa baakaatohu, assalaamo a’layke yaa binta sayyedil awsiyaae, assalaamo a’layke yaa binta imaamil at-qeyaae, assalaamo a’layke yaa binta rukne al awliyaae, assalaamo a’layke yaa binta emaade asfiyaae, assalaamo a’layke yaa binta ya’asoobe al-dine, assalaamo a’layke yaa binta amireel momineene, assalaamo a’layke yaa binta sayyadil wasiyyina, assalaamo a’layke yaa binta qaa’ede al bararate, assalaamo alayke yaa binta qaaeme al kafarate wal fajarate, assalaamo a’layke yaa binta waarethe an nabiyyina, assalaamo a’layke yaa binta khalifate sayyedil murasalina, assalaamo a’layke yaa binta zeyaaid-dine, assalaamo a’layke yaa binta al nabaae al adheeme alal yaqeene, assalaamo a’layke yaa binta man hisaabun naase alayhe wal kawtharo fee yadayhe wan-nasso yawmal ghadire alayhe wa rahmatullaahe wabaakaatohu, assalaamo a’layke yaa binta man qaada dhemaama naaqatehaa jibrailo wa shaarakahaa fee mosaabehaa israafeelo wa ghadheba be sababehaa ar-rabo al jaleelo wa bakee le mosaabehaa ibraahimo al khalilo wa nuho wa musi al kaleemo fee karbalaa’a, assalaamo a’layke yaa binta al bodure as sawaate e, assalaamo a’layke yaa bintash shomuse at tawaale’e wa rahmatullaahe wabarakaatohu, assalaamo a’layke yaa binta zamzama was safaa, assalaamo a’layke yaa binta makkata wa manee, assalaamo a’layke yaa binta man homela alal buraaqe feel hawaa’e, assalaamo a’layke yaa binta man hamala az-zakaata bit taraafe ar redaa e wa badhalahu alal foqaraa’e, assalaamo a’layke yaa binta man usriya behi menal masjedil haraame elal masjedil aqsee,assalaamo a’layke yaa binta man dhwaraba bis-sayfayne,assalaamo alayke yaa man sallil qiblatayne, assalaamo a’layke yaa binta muhammadil mustafi,assalaamo a’layke yaa binta aliyyil murtadhee, assalaamo a’layke yaa binta faatemata zahraa’e, assalaamo a’layke yaa binta khadijatal kubra, assalaamo a’layke wa alaa jaddeke mohammadil mukhtaare, assalaamo a’layke wa alaa abeeke haydaril karraare, assalaamo a’layke wa alaa as saadaate al at’haare al akhiyaare wahoom hojajullaahe alaa al aqtaare sadaate al ardhe was samaae al ladheena hubbuhomu fardho alaa a’a-naaqe kulle al khalaa’eke, assalaamo a’layke yaa binta wa liyallaahil a’dhame mokarrame,assalaamo a’layke yaa ukhta waliyillaahil moadhdhame,assalaamo alayke yaa ammata waliyillaahil makarrame, assalaamo a’layke yaa ummal masaaebe yaa zaynabo wa rahmatullaahe wa baakaatohu, assalaamo a’layke ayyatohaa as siddiqato al mardhiyyato, assalaamo a’layke ayyatoha al faazelato ar rasheedato, assalaamo a’layke ayyatohal kaamelato al aalemato al aamelato, assalaamo a’layke ayyatohaa al kareemato an nabilato, assalaamo a’layke ayyatohaa at-taqiyyato an-naqiyyato, assalaamo a’layke yaa man dhwaharat mahabbatoha lil husayne, al mazloome fee mawaareda adidatin wa tahammulil masaaebal muhreqate lil qolube ma’a tahammulaatin shadidatin, assalaamo a’layke yaa man hafazat al imaama fee yawme aashuraa’a feel qatlee wa bazalat nafsahaa fee najaate zaynil aabedina fee majlise ashqee al ashqeyaa’e wa nataqat ka nutqe aliyyin alayhe assalaamo fee sekake al kufate wa hawlahaa kathiro menal a’a-daae, assalaamo alayke yaa man nasahat jabeenahaa be moqaddamil mahmale iz ra’at ra’a-sa sayyedish shohada’e wa yakhrojo ad-dammo min tahte qenaaehaa wa min mahmalehaa be haytho yari min hawlehaa al a’a-daa’o, assalaamo a’layke yaa taaleyal ma’a-soome,assalaamo a’layke yaa mumtahanatan fee tahammulaate al masaaebe kal husayne al madhloome wa rahmatullaahe wa baakaatohu, assalaamo a’layke ayyatohal baeedato anil awthaane, assalaamo a’layke ayyatohaal asirato feel buldaane, assalaamo a’layke ayyatohal motahayyerato fee khoraabatis shaame, assalaamo a’layke ayyatohal motahayyerato fee wo qufeke alaa jasade sayyedil shohadaa e wa khaatabte jaddeke rasoolilaahe sallallaaho a’layhe wa aalehi be hadhaa an nedaa’e salla a’layka malaaekatu as samaae hadhaa husayno bil araae maslubo al emaamate war redaa’e moqattao al a’a-ddaae wa banaatoka sabaaya wa elallaahe al mushtaqi wa qulte yaa muhammado hazaa husayno tashfee alayhe reehus sabbaa maj’dhudho ar raase menal qafaa qatelo awlaadil baghaa, wa huznaho a’layka yaa abaa abdillaahe, assalaamo alaa man tayyaj qalbohaa lil husyane al madhloome al ouryaane al matroohe alath tharee, wa qaalat be sawtin hazeenin be abee man nafsee lahu al fedaao be abi al mahmume hatti kazi be abil at shaane hatti mazee be abi man shaybatohu taqturo bil demaa’e, assalaamo alaa man bakat alaa jasade akhihaa baynal qatlee hatti bekee le bokaaeha kullo aduwwin wa sadiqin wa raaya an-naaso domual khaylo tan’hadero alaa hawaaferehaa alal tahqeeqe, assalaamo alaa man takaf-falat wa jama’att fee asre aashuraa’a banaate rasoolillaahe wa atfaala al-husayne wa qaamat lahaa al qeyaamato fee shahaadate wa jama’att fee asre aashuraa’a banaate rasoolillaahe wa atfaala al husayne wa qaamat lahal qeyaamato fee shahaadate at-tiflayne al-gharibaynil madhloomine, assalaamo alaa man lam tanam aynohaa la ajle heraasate aale rasoolillaahe fee taffe naynawi wa saarat asiran dhaleelan be yadil a’a-daae, assalaamo alaa man rakebat bayyiran be ghayre wa taain wa naadat akheehaa abaa al fadhle be hazaa an nedaa’e akhee abaa al fadhle antal ladhee ar kabtanee idh aradto al khorooja menal madinate, assalaamo alaa man khatabat fee maydaanil kufate be khutbatin naafe’ate hatti sakanat al aswaato min kullin naaheyatin, assalaamo alaa maneh tajjat fee majlisibne ziyaadin bahtejaajaatin waadhehatin wa qaalat fee jawaabehi be bayyenaatin saadeqin idh qaalabno ziyaadin le zaynaba salaamullaahe alayhaa kayfa ra a’yte sun’allaahe be akhike al husayne qaalat maa ra’ayto illaa jameelan, assalaamo a’layke yaa asiratan be aydi al a’a-daae feel falawaate wa ra’ayte ahlash’shaame fee haalate al ayshe was suroore wan nashril rayaate,assalaamo alaa man shuddal hablo alaa adhudehaa wa onuqe al imaame zaynil aabedina wa adkhalohaa ma’a sittate ashara nafaran min aale rasoolillaahe wa hum kaala saraa’e moqarranine bil hadide mazloomina wa qaala aliyubno al husayne alayhis salaamo le yazida yaa yazido maa dhannuka be rasoolillaahe sallallaaho alayhe wa aalehi law ra’aana alaa hadhehil haalate thumma qaalat ummul masaa’ebe zaynabo lahu qaaelan la ahallo was tahallo farahan thumma qaaluwaa yaa yazeedo laa tushal muntahiyan alaa thanaaya abee abdillaahe sayyedi shabaabe ahlil jannate tankotahaa be makhsarateka thumma qaalat lahu walainn jarrat alayya ad dawaahi mukhaatabataka fa inni la as tasghero qadraka wa asta’a-dhemo taqri’aka wa astakthero tawbeekhaka lakinnal oyuna abraa wal sodura haraa alaa fal ajabo kullul ajabe min iqdaameka alaa qatle hizbillaahe anno-jabaae hijbish shytaane at-tolaqaae walainn at-takhaztanaa maghnaman latajidnaa wa shikan maghraman heena laa tajedo ilaa maa qaddamat yadaaka wamaa rabboka be dhallamin lil abeede wa alallaahe al mushtaki wa alayhil moaw’walun feel shiddate wal rakhaae, fakid kaydaka was’a sa’a-yaka wa naasib juhdaka fawallaahe laa tamho dhikranaa walaa tomeeto wa hayna walaa tudreko amadanaa walaa tarhadh ‘anka a’raha whal ra-uyuka illa fanadan wa ayyaamoka illal adadan wa jam’oka ilaa badadan, yaa yazido amaa same’a-ta qawlallaahe {walaa tahsabanna al-ladheena qotelo fee sabilillaahe amwaatan bal ahyaa’o inda rabbehim yurzaquna} wa hasboka billaahe haakeman wa be mohammadin sallallaaho alayhe wa aalehi khasman wabe jibrila aduwwan, thumma qaalat al hamdolillaahil ladhee khatama la awwalenaa bis-sa’aadate wal maghferate walaa kherenaa bil shahaadate wal rahmate innahu raheemo wa dudo wahowa hasbonaa wa ne’amal wa keelo wa sallallaaho alaa muhammadin wa ahlebaytehit taahereena.

Peace be upon you, O the daughter of the leader of prophets! Peace be upon you, O the daughter of the owner of the blissful pond and the banner! Peace be upon you, O the daughter of one who was lifted to the heavens and reached the (specific) place about the length of two arrows or even closer. Peace be upon you, O the daughter of the prophet of right guidance, the master of all human beings, and the savior of the servants (of Allah) from being devastated. Peace be upon you, O the daughter of the one who possessed the sublime morality, the extensive honor, and possessed the divine Signs and the wise remembrance of Allah. Peace be upon you, O the daughter of the owner of the commendable position, the (owner of) the pond from which people will drink (on the Resurrection Day), and the (owner of) the banner, which shall be witnessed by everybody. Peace be upon you, O the daughter of the path of Islam and the one given Qiblah and Quran! (the daughter of ) the example of truth, right and benevolence. Peace and Allah's mercy and blessings be upon you, O thr daughter of the choice of the Prophets, the example of the pious ones, and the well known in both the earth and the heavens.
Peace, mercy and blessings of Allah be upon you, O the daughter of the best of Allah's creation, the master of His creatures, the foremost created individual before the existence of earth and heavens, and the last of the existent ones (who shall endure) after the extinction of this world and its beings, and the one whose soul is a copy of the Divinity and face is copy of Angels and whose heart is the treasury of the Eternal, Everlasting God. Peace, mercy and blessings of Allah be upon you, O the daughter of the one who was shaded by clouds, the master of the Two Worlds and the chief of the two beings (man and genies), and the arbitrator of the (his) Ummah on the Resurrection Day. Peace be upon you, O the daughter of the master of the (Prophets) successors. Peace be upon you, O the daughter of the leader of the God-fearing ones. Peace be upon you, O the daughter of the shelter of the saints. Peace be upon you, O the daughter of the support of the chosen ones. Peace be upon you, O the daughter of the leader of the religion. Peace be upon you, O the daughter of the commander of the faithful ones. Peace be upon you, O the daughter of the chief of the successors (of prophets). Peace be upon you, O the daughter of the leader of the pious ones. Peace be upon you, O daughter of the preventer of the infidels and the wantons. Peace be upon you, O daughter of the inheritor of the Prophets. Peace be upon you, O daughter of the successor of the Apostles' chief. Peace be upon you, O daughter of luminosity of the Religion. Peace be upon you, O daughter of the inevitable great news! Peace and mercy and blessings of Allah be upon you, O the daughter of the one who has to settle the accounts of people (on the Resurrection Day), (who has) the Heavenly Pond (of Al-Kauthar) in front of him, and who has been intended by the (Prophet's) Statement on the day of Ghadir. Peace be upon you, O the daughter of the lady whose she-camel was driven by Gabriel (the angel), and whose misfortune (of Imam Hussain's martyrdom) was shared by Israfil (the angel), and due to whose anger the Majestic Lord got annoyed, and for whose misfortune of Karbala, (the Prophets like) Abraham, the Friend of Allah, Noah, and Moses wept. Peace be upon you, O the daughter of the shining full moons. Peace, mercy and blessings of Allah be upon you, O the daughter of the dazzling suns. Peace be upon you, O the daughter of Zamzam and Safaa! Peace be upon you, O the daughter of Mecca and Mina! Peace be upon you, O the daughter of the one was carried by Buraq to the heavens. Peace be upon you, O the daughter of one who carried the zakat (alms) by the margins of his dress to give it to the poor. Peace be upon you, O the daughter of one who was taken by night from the Masjid Al-Haraam to the Masjid Al- Aqsaa. Peace be upon you, O the daughter of one who fought with two swords. Peace be upon you, O the daughter of one who offered prayers facing the two qiblas. Peace be upon you, O the daughter of Muhammad Al-Mustafa (the chosen by God). Peace be upon you, O the daughter of Ali Al-Murtaza. Peace be upon you, O the daughter of Fatimah Al-Zahraa. Peace be upon you, O the daughter of Khadijah Al-Kubra. Peace be upon you and upon your grandfather, Muhammad the Chosen one. Peace be upon you and upon your father, Haider Al-Karrar (the Attacking). Peace be upon you and upon the pure, choicest masters who are the arguments of Allah on lands, the chiefs of the earth and the heavens, and love for whom is obligatory upon all creatures. Peace be upon you, O the daughter of the glorified, holy servant of Allah. Peace be upon you, O the aunt of dignified, holy servant of Allah. Peace, mercy and blessings of Allah be upon you, O the mother of misfortunes; O Zainab. Peace be upon you, O the glorified, the rightly guided one! Peace be upon you, O the perfect, educated and good-doer. Peace be upon you, O the generous, the noble woman. Peace be upon you, O the pure, the pious one. Peace be upon you, the one who showed her love for Hussain, the aggrieved one at many situations and had to suffer awful heartbreaking misfortunes. Peace be upon you, the one who secured the Imam on the day of Ashura from being killed; and offered herself for the salvation of Zain-ul-Abidin at the assembly of the most wretched one (Ubaidullah bin Ziyad), and delivered a speech just like (Imam) Ali's, in the streets of Kufa despite the presence of her enemies around her. Peace be upon you, O the one who thrust her forehead with the front part of the howdah, when she saw the severed head of the chief of martyrs (Imam Hussain), and caused the blood to flow from beneath her veil and from the howdah, which was seen by the enemies around her. Peace be upon you, O the representative of the infallible Imam. Peace, mercy and blessings of Allah be upon you, O the one who was tested through patience against misfortunes, like that of Hussain, the oppressed. Peace be upon you O the one who is far away from her home. Peace be upon you, the one who was wandered as captive in cities. Peace be upon you, the one who was bewildered in the ruined (place of) Syria. Peace be upon you when you were bewildered as you stood by the (severed) body of the Chief of Martyrs and addressed to your grandfather, the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him and his family, saying, « O Muhammad! The angels in the heavens send peace upon you! This is Hussain under the open sky! His turban and his clothes are nabbed! His limbs are severed! And your daughters are taken captives! I complain (about this) only to Allah. She (also) said : « O Muhammad! This is Hussain, winds are blowing his body! His head is cut off from the back! He is killed by the descendants of the strayed people! Oh, for my grief for you, O Abu Abdullah! »Peace be upon you whose heart cried out for Hussain; the oppressed, the stripped, and the thrown on dust. She said in a sad tone: « May my father be sacrificed for the one whom I may sacrifice my soul! May my father be sacrificed for him who was depressed until passed away! May my father be sacrificed for him who had been thirsty until departed! May my father be sacrificed for him from whose beard the blood is falling! »Peace be upon the one who wept for the (severed) body of her brother (laying) among the killed ones; she cried so painfully that every one whether friend or foe, wept for her and, moreover, people, as it is proved by authenticated narrations, saw even horses shed tears, which flew on their legs. Peace be upon her who took the responsibility of gathering and guarding the daughters of the Messenger of Allah and the children of Hussain in the afternoon of the Day of Ashura, and she stirred up the situation when the two oppressed, poor children were martyred. Peace be upon her whose eyes did not sleep so as to guard the family of the Messenger of Allah at Taff of Nineveh, and was taken as captive as she was humiliated at the hands of her enemies. Peace be upon her who had to ride a saddleless camel and then called on her brother Abu'l Fadhl (al-Abbas), saying : « O brother! O Abu'l Fadhl! It was you who helped me ride on a camel when I left Medina. » Peace be upon her who delivered such a remarkably expressive speech at the center of Kufa that made all voices keep silent (to listen to her with astonishment). Peace be upon her who made straightforward arguments at the assembly of (Ubaidullah) son of Ziyad. When he said to her : « How did you see that which Allah had done to your brother? » she answered him with straightforward evidences : « I saw nothing but good ! » Peace be upon you who had to be captive by the enemies under an open sky, and had to see people of Syria celebrating (the martyrdom of her brother) with pleasure, joy, and raised flags. Peace be upon her who was tied with a rope on the arm and the neck of Imam Zain al-Abidin, and she, along with sixteen persons from the family of the Messenger of Allah, was forced to enter (the session of Yazid) while they were viciously enchained with iron fetters. Meanwhile, Ali son of Hussain said to Yazid : « O Yazid! What do you think of the Messenger of Allah if he sees us in this condition? (What will be his feelings?) ? » Then, Lady Zainab, the mother of misfortunes addressed Yazid, who was saying poetry : « (Had my forefathers whom were killed at the Battle of Badr witnessed this,) they would have been very much delighted then they’d have said « May your hands, O Yazid, never be paralyzed », “(O Yazid!) How dare you hit with your stick the lips of Abu Abdullah, the Master of the Youths of Paradise? »She said : « Although calamities have forced me to speak to you, I see you trivial in my eyes and find your verbal attacks great and I regard your scolding too much to tolerate, but the eyes are tearful, and the chests are filled with depression. What is even stranger is that the honorable Party of Allah is being killed by the Party of the ‘Released ones’ (Party of Satan.) If you regard us as your booty, you shall soon find us as your rivals, that will be when you will find nothing except what your hands had committed, “And your Lord never treats His servants unjustly.” (Quran 41:46) To Allah is my complaint, and upon Him do I rely in calamity and ease. So plan whatever you want to plan and make struggles and intensify your efforts as much as you can, by Allah, you shall never be able to demolish our mention, nor will you ever be able to eradicate the revelation (that was revealed to us), nor will you ever exalt to our position, nor will your shame ever be washed away. Your interpretation shall be proven futile, your days shall be restricted in number, and your wealth shall be wasted. O Yazid, haven’t you listened the saying of Allah: “Think not of those who are slain in Allah’s way as dead. Nay, they live, finding their sustenance in the presence of their Lord.” (Quran 3:169) Allah as sovereign, Muhammad as a rival and (the angel) Gabriel as an enemy is enough for your accountability. » Then she said : « All praise be to Allah, the Benefactor of the worlds, Who sealed the life of our early ones with happiness and forgiveness, and that of our last ones with martyrdom and mercy. We beseech Allah to complete His rewards for them, grant them an increase, and recompense us pleasingly. He is the most Merciful, the most compassionate. Allah is sufficient for us, and He is the best Guardian. »
Peace of Allah be upon Muhammad and his pure, immaculate progeny!

children.name: 1) Tombs of great scholars buried at the mausoleum of Sayeda Zaynab (A).

text.html:
« [...] Only fear [respectfully] God, among His worshipers, scholars. »2

Imam al-Kadhim (A) said : « Whoever cannot come to visit us, visit our godly and worthy friends, he will have the same benefit as the one who will have made our own visit.»3

a) Ayatollah Sayed Mohsen al-Amin Ameli

He was born in Lebanon in the year 1284 AH. A descendant of Imam Sajjad (A), he memorized the entire Quran at the age of seven and continued his studies in Najaf where he specialized in jurisprudence and obtained Ijtihad.4
He was a writer and author of the famous book 'Ayan al-Shia'. Following the request of the Syrians, he left Najaf to spread Shi'ism in Damascus. He died in 1371 AH and was buried in the mausoleum of Sayeda Zaynab (A).5

b) Allama Sayed Hussein Yusuf Makki

He was born in Lebanon in the year 1284 AH. His lineage goes back to Imam Sajjad (A) as well. He studied at Najaf in the year 1350 AH. Ayatullah Mohsin al-Hakim granted him the supreme rank of Ijtihad, conferring on him the title of Mujtahid. He has written about fifty books. After the death of Ayatullah Sayed Mohsen al-Amin, he left Najaf to become Ayatullah in 1391 and became Marja (Supreme Leader). He died on the 11th of Zilhajj 1397 AH at the age of 71 and was buried in the mausoleum of Sayeda Zaynab (A) also.6

c) Dr. Ali Shariati

He was born in 1933 and is one of the great intellectuals of the 20th century. It can be measured by Sheikh Mourtouza Moutahari. He received his education in both the East and the West. He studied in Mashhad and then in Europe, more particularly in France. He presented Islam in modern language. He was assassinated in 1977 in London by the men of the Shah of Iran at the age of 44 years. He was imprisoned and abused many times during his life. When his body was found at home, his friend Sayed Moussa al-Sadr asked Syrian President Hafez al-Assad at the time and Dr. Ali Shariati was buried near the grave of Sayeda Zaynab (A).7

3: Kamil al-Ziyarat, page 958
4: Definition of ijtihad : The ability to establish an independent legal judgment, to assume the role of supreme religious authorities.
5: Amakin-e-Ziyarati va siyahati-e-Souriye, page 55 : A'yan al-Shia, volume 10, page 383

Sayeda Sakina (A) also known as Ruqaya (A) was born in Shaban in the year 57 AH. She was the adored daughter of Imam Hussein (A). She suffered many misfortunes and hardships from Karbala to Kufa and from Kufa to Damascus. She was confronted with intense heat, thirst, and witnessed the martyrs of Karbala. In Damascus prison, Yazid grew tired of the complaints and tears of little Sakina (A), who was missing her father terribly. He then ordered to bring the decapitated head of Imam Hussein (A) in front of her. When Sayeda Sakina (A) received the head of her father, she pressed it against her chest very hard and gave up the soul, soothed. She died on 5 Safar of the year 61 AH in the Damascus prison.8

a) Izne Dukhul ( Permission to enter) :

بِاذْنِ اللَّهِ وَاِذْنِ رَسُولِهِ وَاِذْنِ مَلائِكَتِهِ الْمُقَرَّبينَ وَاَنْبِيائِهِ الْمُرسَلينَ، وَالْأَئِمَّةِ الْمَعْصُومينَ، وَبِاِذْنِ السَيِّدَةِ رُقَيَّةَ بِنْتِ الحُسَيْنِ الشَّهيدِ عَلَيْهِ السَّلامُ، اَدْخُلُ هذِهِ الرَّوْضَةَ الْمُبارَكَةَ، وَادْعُو اللَّهَ بِفُنُونِ الدَّعَواتِ، وَاعْتَرِفُ للَّهِ بِالْعُبُوديَّةِ، وَلِلنَّبىِّ وَالْأَئِمَّةِ الْمَعْصُومينَ عَلَيْهِمُ السَّلامُ بِالطاعَةِ، رَبِّ اَدْخِلْنى مُدْخَلَ صِدْقٍ، وَاَخْرِجْنى مُخْرَجَ صِدْقٍ، وَاجْعَلْ لى مِنْ لَدُنْكَ سُلْطاناً نَصيراً.

Be idhnilllaahe wa idhne rasoolehi wa iddhne malaaekatehi al moqar-rabina wa anbiyaaehi al mursalina, wal a-im’matil ma’asoomina, wa be idhne as-sayyedate Ruqayyat bintil Husaynis shahide alayhis salaamo, adkholo hadhehi ar rawdhata al mubaaakata, wad’ullaaha be fonune ad-da’awaate, wa’atarefo lillaahe bil obudayyate, walin nabiyyi wal a-immatil ma’a-soomina alayhemo, assalaamo be lataa’ate, rabbe ad khilni mudkhala sidqin, wa akhrijni mukhraja sidqin, waj’all lee min ladunka sultaanan naseeraa.

With the permission of Allah, His Messenger, His intimate angels, His prophets, the messengers and with the permission of infallible leaders and Lady Ruqayya the daughter of Hussain the martyr, peace be upon him, I am going to enter this holy shrine. I pray Allah with skills of appeals and I admit bondage to Allah and submission to the prophet and the infallible Imams. O my Lord, cause me to enter a sound entering and to exit a sound exit and grant me from yourself a supporting authority.

b) Ziyarat :

اَلسَّلامُ عَلَیْکِ یا بِنْتَ الْحُسَیْنِ الشَّهیدِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَیْکِ اَیَّتُهَا الصِّدّیقَةُ الشَّهیدَةِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَیْکِ اَیَّتُهَا الرَّضِیَّةُ الْمَرْضِیَّةُ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَیْکِ اَیَّتُهَا التَّقیّةُ النَّقیَّةُ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَیْکِ اَیَّتُهَا الزَّکِیَّةُ الْفاضِلَةُ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَیْکِ اَیَّتُهَا الْمَظْلُومَةُ الْبَهِیَّةُ، صَلَّی اللهُ عَلَیْکِ وَعَلی رُوحِکِ وَبَدَنِکِاَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا سَيّدَتَنا رُقَيَّةَ، عَلَيْكِ التَّحيَّةُ وَالسَّلامُ وَرَحْمَةُ اللَّهِ وَبَرَكاتُهُ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا بِنْتَ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ،اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا بِنْتَ اَميرِ الْمُؤْمِنينَ عَلىّ بْنِ اَبى‏طالِبِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا بِنْتَ فاطِمَةَ الزَّهْراءِ سَيّدَةِ نِساءِ الْعالَمينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا بِنْتَ خَديجَةَ الْكُبْرى‏ اُمّ الْمُؤْمِنينَ وَالْمُؤْمِناتِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا بِنْتَ وَلىّ اللَّهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا اُخْتَ وَلىّ اللَّهِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا بِنْتَ الْحُسَيْنِ الشَّهيدِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ اَيَّتُهَا الصّدّيقَةُ الشَّهيدَةِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ اَيَّتُهَا الرَّضيَّةُ الْمَرْضيَّةُ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ اَيَّتُهَا التَّقيّةُ النَّقيَّةُ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ اَيَّتُهَا الزَّكيَّةُ الْفاضِلَةُ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ اَيَّتُهَا الْمَظْلُومَةُ الْبَهيَّةُ، صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْكِ وَعَلى‏ رُوحِكِ وَبَدَنِكِ، فَجَعَلَ اللَّهُ مَنْزِلَكِ وَمَاْواكِ فِى الْجَنَّةِ مَعَ آبائِكِ وَاَجْدادِكِ، الطَّيِّبينَ الطاهِرينَ الْمَعْصُومينَ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكُمْ بِما صَبَرْتُمْ فَنِعْمَ عُقْبَى الدَّارِ، وَعَلَى الْمَلآئِكَةِ الْحافينَ حَوْلَ حَرَمِكِ الشَّريفِ، وَرَحْمَةُ اللَّهِ وَبَرَكاتُهُ، وَصَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلى‏ سَيّدِنا مُحَمَّدٍ وَآلِهِ الطَّيِّبينَ الطاهِرينَ‏وَسَلَّمَ تَسْليماً بِرَحْمَتِكَ يا اَرْحَمَ الرَّاحِمينَ.

Assalaamo a’layke yaa bintal husaynis shaheede, assalaamo a’layke ayyatoha as-siddiqato ash-shaheedate, assalaamo a’layke ayyatohar radheeyato al mardhiyyato, assalaamo a’layke ayyatohaa at-taqayyato an naqayyato, assalaamo a’layke ayyatohaz zakiyyato al faadhelato,assalaamo a’layke ayyatohal madhloomato al bahiyyato, sallalaaho a’layke wa alaa rooheke wa badaneke assalaamo a’layke yaa sayyadatnaa ruqayyata, a’laykit tahayyato was salaamo wa rahmatullaahe wa barakaatohu,assalaamo a’layke yaa binta rasoolillaahe, assalaamo a’layke yaa binta ameeril momineena alayabne abi taalebe, assalaamo a’layke yaa binta faatemataz zahraae sayyadate nesaa’il aalameena,assalaamo a’layke yaa binta khadijatal kubraa ummal momineena wal mo’amenaate, assalaamo a’layke yaa binta waliyallaahe, assalaamo a’layke yaa ukhta walillaahe,assalaamo a’layke yaa bintal husaynis shaheede,assalaamo a’layke ayyatohaa as-saddiqato as-shahidate,assalaamo a’layke ayyatohaa ar-radhiyyato al marziyyato, assalaamo a’layke ayyatohaa at-taqayyato an-naqayyato, assalaamo a’layke ayyatoha az-zakkayato al faazelato,assalaamo a’layke ayyatohaa al madhloomato al bahayyato,sallallaaho a’layke wa alaa rooheka wabadaneke, fa ja’alallaaho manzelake wa maawaake feel jannnate ma’a aabaaeke wa aj’daadeke,at tayyebina at taaherina al ma’a-soomina,assalaamo a’laykum bemaa sabartum fa ne’a-ma uqbiddaare,wa alal malaaekatil haafeena hawla harameke ash shareefe, wa rahmatullaahe wabarakaatoh, wa sallallaaho alaa sayydenaa muhammadin wa aalehi at tayeebina at taaherina wa sallam tasliman be rahmateka yaa arhamar raahemina.

Peace be upon you, O the daughter of Hussain, the martyr! Peace be upon you, O the truthful, the martyress! Peace be upon you, O the gratified, the contented! Peace be upon you, O the pious, the righteous! Peace be upon you, O the pure, the glorified! Peace be upon you, O the one who was oppressed, the endured. Peace of Allah be upon you and upon your soul and body! Peace be upon you, O lady Ruqayya! Salutation, peace, mercy and blessings of Allah be upon you! Peace be upon you, O daughter of the Messenger of Allah! Peace be upon you, O daughter of the Emir of believers, Ali son of Abu Talib. Peace be upon you, O the daughter of Fatima Al-Zahra, the leader of the women of worlds. Peace be upon you, O the daughter of Khadija Al- Kubra, the mother of male and female believers! Peace be upon you, O the daughter of the representative of Allah! Peace be upon you, O the sister of the representative of Allah! Peace be upon you, O the daughter of Hussain, the martyr! Peace be upon you, O the truthful, the martyress! Peace be upon you, O the gratified, the contented! Peace be upon you, O the pious, the righteous! Peace be upon you, O the pure, the glorified! Peace be upon you, O the one who was oppressed but endured. Peace of Allah be upon you and upon your soul and body! May Allah appoint your house and abode in paradise with your forefathers, the pure ones, the infallibles. Very excellent be the reward of the eternal life for your patience. Peace, mercy and blessings of Allah be upon the angels at the campus around your sanctuary! Peace of Allah be upon our master Muhammad and his progeny, the pure and the purified ones, give them abundant peace! O the most Merciful of the merciful.

8: Kamil-e-Bahai, page 523 ; Muntaha al-Âmâl, volume 1, page 317

children.name: 1) The Great Mosque of the Umayyads of Damascus

text.html:
The Umayyad Mosque of Damascus is the largest mosque, built by the 6th Umayyad Caliph Al-Walid ibn Abd al-Malik in the year 86 AH around the tomb of Prophet Yahya (A).9

It was Friday, the Umayyad Mosque was filled with people, and the caravan and captives of Karbala were brought to this mosque in front of a large assembly. Imam Sajjad (A) recited his speech on the mimbar, and the situation in Damascus completely changed : the population became aware of the atrocities suffered by the family of the Prophet (S). Yazid ordered to gather the heads of the martyrs and bring them back to him. He behaved as if he had regrets, and put all the atrocities on the back of ibn Zyad, and he cursed him.10

a) Maqame Ra'sse Hussein (A)

On the orders of Yazid, the heads of the martyrs of Karbala were suspended on spears in his palace. Then he ordered the head of Imam Hussein (A) to come down and keep it there, which has become a holy place now. There are several accounts of the place where the head of Imam Hussein was buried (A). Thus, it is said that Imam Sajjad (A) brought Imam Hussein's (A) head back to Karbala and buried him close to his body. This hypothesis is the most probable and confirmed by many scholars.11

Ziyarat

اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يَا وَارِثَ آدَمَ صَفْوَةِ اللَّهِ اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يَا وَارِثَ نُوحٍ نَبِيِّ اللَّهِ اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يَا وَارِثَ إِبْرَاهِيمَ خَلِيلِ اللَّهِ اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكَ يَا Peace be upon you, O inheritor of Adam the choice of Allah. Peace be upon you, O inheritor of Noah the prophet of Allah. Peace be upon you, O inheritor of Abraham the intimate friend of Allah. Peace be upon you, O inheritor of Moses the chatterer with Allah. Peace be upon you, O inheritor of Jesus the spirit of Allah. Peace be upon you, O inheritor of Muhammad the most beloved by Allah. Peace be upon you, O inheritor of the Commander of the Faithful, peace be upon him. Peace be upon you, O son of Muhammad the well-chosen Prophet. Peace be upon you, O son of Ali the well-pleased. Peace be upon you, O son of Fatimah the luminous lady. Peace be upon you, O son of Khadijah the grand lady. Peace be upon you, O vengeance of Allah, son of His vengeance, and the unavenged so far. I bear witness that you performed the prayers, defrayed the poor-rate, enjoined the right, forbade the wrong and obeyed Allah and His Messenger until death came upon you. So, may Allah curse the people who killed you! May Allah curse the people who persecuted you! May Allah curse the people who were pleased when they had heard of that! O’ my Master, O’ Abu- Abdillah! I bear witness that you were light in the sublime loins and purified wombs; the impurities of the Ignorance Era could not object you to filth nor could it dress you its murky clothes. I also bear witness that you are one of the mainstays of the religion and the supports of the faithful believers. I also bear witness that you are the God-fearing, pious, pleased, immaculate, guide, and well-guided Imam. And (I bear witness) that the Imams from your progeny are the spokesmen of piety, the signs of guidance, the firmest handle (of Islam), and the decisive argument against the inhabitants of the world. And I call Allah, His angels, His Prophets, and His Messenger to witness for me that I believe in you all and in your return, I have full confidence in the laws of my religion and in the seals of my deeds, my heart is at peace with you all, and all my affairs are based on your commands. May Allah’s benedictions be on your souls, your bodies, your forms, the present and the absent from you, and the apparent and the invisible from you. My father and mother be sacrificed for you, O son of the Messenger of Allah! My father and mother be sacrificed for you, O Aba Abdillah! Extremely terrible was the calamity and astounding is the misfortune that you suffered upon us and upon all the inhabitants of the heavens and the earth. Therefore, Allah may curse the people who saddled up, gave rein to their horses, and prepared themselves to kill you. O my Master, O Aba Abdillah! I moved towards your sanctuary and came to your shrine beseeching Allah in the name of the standing that you enjoy with Him and the position that you occupy with Him to send blessings on Muhammad and on the offspring of Muhammad and to keep me with you in this world and in the Hereafter.

b) The place of Imam as-Sajjad (A)

This is the place of prayer of Imam as-Sajjad (A) during his period of captivity at the Umayyad mosque.12

c) The visit of the saint head of the Prophet Yahya (A)

Prophet Yahya (A) is the son of Prophet Zakariya (A), who is mentioned in the Bible as John the Baptist. His head is buried in this mosque. He was the cousin of Jesus. Christians and Muslims come here to pray. At the time, the king of Palestine wanted to marry his niece, but the Prophet Yahya (A) did not allow this union because it was against the religious law. The niece was impatient to marry the king because she wanted to become the Queen of Palestine. But when she heard Prophet Yahya's (A) opposition to the marriage, she became her sworn enemy and ordered the king to assassinate Prophet Yahya (A).13

d) Prophet Hud's Visit (A)

The tomb of Prophet Hud (A) is located in the Umayyad Mosque, specifically on the left side of the head of the Prophet Yahya (A), because in the time of Walid, this last had seen inscriptions (epigraph, writing) and advice of the Prophet Hud (A) in this place said and the historians have thus confirmed his tomb, but according to other narrations, He is more likely to be buried in the Wadi al-Salam (Najaf) cemetery with Prophet Saleh (A).14

The Bab al-Saghir Cemetery is located near the door of the same name, which is south-west of the Umayyad Mosque. It is an important place of pilgrimage because there are the heads of the martyrs of Karbala, the tombs of the companions of the Holy Prophet (S), the tombs of the women of the Hashemites.

a) The tombs of the children of the Imams (A)

1) Sayeda Sakina (A) (another Sakina (A))

Sayeda Sakina (A) was one of the other girls of Imam Hussein (A), who was also present in Karbala, and who was also among the prisoners. Sayeda Sakina (A) was the wife of Abdullah, son of Imam Hassan (A) who was martyred in Karbala. Sayeda Sakina (A) died in 117 AH at the age of 70. There is a discrepancy between scholars at her place of death.15
Some say she died in Medina.16

2 ) Umm Kulthum (A), the daughter of Imam Ali (A)

Beside the tomb of Sayeda Sakina (A), the daughter of Imam Hussein (A), there is the tomb of Umm Kulthum (A) the daughter of Imam Ali (A). She was also present in Karbala and among the captives.17

3) The grave attributed to Fatima (A), one of Imam Hussein's daughters (A)

Sayeda Fatima (A) was 30 years old in Karbala and was among the captives too. She was born about the year 51 AH, and is the eldest daughter of Imam Hussein (A). When Hassan al-Muthana, son of Imam Hassan (A), came to ask for the hand of one of Imam Hussein's daughters, he said: 'I chose Fatima for you because she has a lot of resemblance to my mother Fatima az-Zahra (A).’

They were married before the event of Karbala. She died in 110 AH but there is a discrepancy between scholars at her place of death. Some say she died in Medina.

4) Abdallah son of Imam as-Sadiq (A)

The tomb of Abdallah son of Imam as-Sàdiq (A), is near that of Fatima as-Sughra (A), the daughter of the Imam Hussein (A).18

Abdallah was the eldest son of Imam as-Sadiq (A), he was not a believer and he was always at odds with his father. After the death of his father, he claimed to be Imam, and many followed him.
Imam al-Sadiq (A) told his son Imam Moussa al-Kazim (A) : « My son, your brother Abdallah will sit in my place, and he will say that he is Imam after me, but you do not say anything, because he will be the first to join us ». And Abdallah dies 70 days after the death of Imam as-Sadiq (A).19

5) Abdallah the son of Imam Sajjad (A)

The tomb of Abdallah, son of Imam Sajjad (A), is outside the cemetery. Abdallah and his brother Imam al-Baqir (A) were from the same mother.
Abdallah was a jurisconsult (faqih) and he was a man of knowledge. He recounted many hadiths of the Prophet (S). He died at the age of 57.20

b) The heads of the martyrs of Karbala

After the massacre of Imam Hussein (A), his family and his companions in Karbala, Omar ibn Saad, commander of the Yazid’s army gave orders to cut off the martyrs' heads and transport them to Damascus to present them to Yazid. The heads arrived in Damascus on 1st Safar. There are the names of the 16 martyrs in this place :
Hazrat Abbas (A), Habib ibn Mazahir, Qassim ibn Hassan (A), Abdallah ibn Ali (A), Omar ibn Ali, Hour ibn Yazid ar-Riyahi21 , Mohammad ibn Ali, Awn ibn Abdullah, Ali ibn Abi Bakr, Othman ibn Ali, Ja'far ibn Ali, Ja'far ibn Aqil, Muhammad ibn Muslim, Abdullah ibn Aqil, Hussein ibn Abdullah.

But these 3 martyrs are more likely :

Hazrat Abbas (A), Ali Akbar ibn Hussein (A), and Habib ibne Mazahir.22

The Ziyarat of the Martyrs of Karbala

اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكُمْ يا اَنْصارَ اللَّهِ، وَاَنْصارَ رَسُولِهِ، وَاَنْصارَ اَميرِ الْمُؤْمِنينَ عَلىِّ بْنِ اَبى طالِبٍ، وَاَنْصارَ فاطِمَةَ، وَاَنْصارَ الْحَسَنِ والْحُسَيْنِ، وَاَنْصارَ الْاِسْلامِ، اَشْهَدُ اَنَّكُمْ لَقَدْ نَصَحْتُمْ للَّهِ، وَجاهَدْتُمْ فى سَبيلِهِ، فَجَزاكُمُ اللَّهُ عَنِ اْلِاسْلامِ وَاَهْلِهِ اَفْضَلَ الْجَزاءِ، فُزْتُمْ وَاللَّهِ فَوْزاً عَظيماً، فَيالَيْتَنى كُنْتُ مَعَكُمْ فَافُوزَ فَوْزاً عَظيماً، وَاَشْهَدُ انَّكُمْ اَحْياءٌ عِنْدَ رَبِّكُمْ تُرْزَقُونَ، وَاَشْهَدُ اَنَّكُمْ الشُّهَداءُ وَالسُّعَداءُ، وَاَنَّكُمْ الْفائِزُونَ فِى الدَّرَجاتِ الْعُلى‏، وَالسَّلامُ عَلَيْكُمْ وَرَحْمَةُ اللَّهِ وَبَرَكاتُهُ.

Assalaamo a’laykum yaa ansarallaahe, wa ansaa ra rasoolehi, wa ansaa ra ameeril momineena aliyibne abi taalebin, wa ansaa ra faatemata, wa ansaa ral hasane wal husayne, wa ansaaral islaame, ash-hado annakum laqad nasah’tum lillaahe,wa jaahad’tum fee sabeelehi, fa jazaakomullaaho anil islaame wa ahlehi afdhala al jazaae, fuztum wallaahe fawzan adheemaa, fayaalaytani kunto ma’a-kum faafuza fawzan adheema,wa ash-hado annakum ahyaa’o inda rabbekum turzaquna, wa ash-hado annakum ash-shohdaa’o was so’a-daa o, wa annakum al faaezuna feed darjaatil oulaa, wassalaamo a’laykum wa rahmatullaahe wa barakaatohu.

Peace be upon you, O the supporters of Allah, the supporters of His messenger, the supporters of commander of faithful ones Ali Bin Abi Talib, the supporters of Fatima, the supporters of Hasan and Hussain and the supporters of Islam. I bear witness, verily you advised for Allah and struggled in His way; so Allah bless you with the best of rewards from Islam and its followers. By God, you attained great triumph. Would that I were with you so that I could also share the achievement with you! I bear witness you are martyrs, dignified ones; and you are appointed at the highest ranks. Peace, mercy and blessings of Allah be upon you.

c) The graves of the companions of the Prophet (S)

1) Bilal al-Habashi

Bilal was one of the companions of the Holy Prophet (S) and he was one of the first converts to Islam. Born slave, he had no choice but to work for his master Omayah, who was an enemy of Islam. He tortured Bilal to renounce Islam, but Bilal always responded with monotheism. Regarded as the first Muadhin23 , He was known for his beautiful voice, with which he called people to prayer. After the death of the Holy Prophet (S), Bilal no longer recited the call to prayer. He once agreed to recite at the request of Sayeda Fatima az-Zahra (A), but when he came in the name of the Holy Prophet (S), he cried so hard that he could not continue. Bilal left Medina for Syria. He died in the year 20 AH at the age of 63 in Damascus and is buried in Bab al-Saghir cemetery.24

2) The tomb attributed to Abdullah ibn Ja'far at-Tayaar

Abdullah son of Ja'far ibn Abu Talib25 and Asma bint Umais was the husband of Sayeda Zaynab (A) and the son-in-law of Imam Ali (A). He was among the companions of the Holy Prophet (S). The Prophet (S) said that Abdullah resembled him physically and also in his behavior. When the Prophet (S) passed away, Abdullah was 10 years old.
In 60 Hijri, when Imam Hussein (A) left Medina, he not only accepted that Sayeda Zaynab (A) accompany his brother, but he ordered his two children, Awn and Muhammad, to be taken away. Abdullah could not attend the battle of Karbala because he had lost his eyes. He died in 80 AH. The tomb near Bilal, attributed to Abdullah, is not really his tomb, because he died in Medina and is buried in the cemetery of Baqi.26

d) The graves of the women of Bani Hashim

1) Hazrate Fizaa

Hazrate Fizaa was the daughter of the king of Ethiopia. During one of the wars, she was captive and enslaved. Then the Holy Prophet (S) bought her and released her, she was thereafter the servant of Sayeda Fatima az-Zahra (A). She was a very pious woman and close to Ahl-ul-Bayt (A). She helped Sayeda Fatima (A) in the household chores of the house. She also knew the Quran by heart. When Hazrate Fizaa came to the house of Sayeda Fatima (A), Imam Ali (A) asked Allah : 'May her coming into my house bring us blessing.'After the death of Sayeda Fatima (A), she continued to serve Imam Hassan (A), Imam Hussein (A) and Sayeda Zaynab (A). Imam Hussein (A) brought her to Karbala, he respected her very much, and she was among the captives of Karbala. Then she accompanied Sayeda Zaynab (A) on her second journey to Syria, and after the death of Sayeda Zaynab (A), she remained in Damascus until the end of her days. She was buried in the Bab al-Saghir cemetery. His tomb is located 100 m from the tomb of Abdullah son of Imam as-Sadiq (A).27

The Ziyarat of Hazrate Fizaa

اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا مَوْلاتى وَسَيِّدَتى يا فِضَّةُ يا اَمَةَ فاطِمَةَ الزَّهْراءِ عَلَيْهَا السَّلامُ،َ السَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ يا مُرَبيَةَ الْحَسَنِ وَالْحُسَيْنِ عَلَيْهِمَا السَّلامُ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ اَيَّتُهَا الْفاضِلَةُ الرَّشيدَةُ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ اَيَّتُهَا الْعالِمَةُ الْعامِلَةُ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ اَيَّتُهَا الرَّضيَّةُ الْمَرْضيَّةُ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ اَيَّتُهَا الْحَليمَةُ الْكَريمَةُ، السَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ عَرَّفَ اللَّهُ بَيْنَنا وَبَيْنَكُمْ فِى الْجَنَّةِ وَحَشَرَنا فى زُمْرَتِكُمْ وَسَقانا مِنْ يَدِ عَلىِّ بْنِ اَبى طالِبٍ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ وَعَلى‏ فَاطِمَةَالزَّهْراءِ، اَلسَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ وَعَلَى النِّساءِ الْمَسْبياتِ، السَّلامُ عَلَيْكِ وَعَلى‏ نِساءِ الْائِمَّةِ الطاهِرينَ وَرَحْمَةُ اللَّهِ وَبَرَكاتُهُ.اَللَّهُمَّ اِغْفِرْ لى وَلِوالِدَىَّ وَلِلْمُؤْمِنينَ وَالْمُؤْمِناتِ بِرَحْمَتِكَ يا اَرْحَمَ الرَّاحِمينَ وَبِحُرْمَةِ السُّورَةِ الْمُبارَكَةِ الْفاتِحَةِ

Assalaamo a’layke yaa mawlaati wa sayyedati yaa fadhato yaa amata faatemataz zahraa’e a’layhaa assalaamo, assalaamo a’layke murabayatal hasane wal husayne alayhemaa assalaamo, assalaamo a’layke ayyatohal faadhelato ar-rasheedato, assalaamo a’layke ayyatohal aalematul aamelato, assalaamo a’layke ayyatohaa ar radhayyato al mardhiyyato, assalaamo a’layke ayyatohal halimatul kareemato, assalaamo a’layke arrafallaaho baynanaa wa baynakum feel jannate wa hasharanaa fee zumratekum wa saqaana min yade aliyyibne abi taalebin,assalaamo a’layke wa alaa faatemataz zahraae, assalaamo a’layke wa alan nesaa’il masbayaate,assalaamo a’layke wa alaa nesaa’il a’immate at taaheina wa rahmatullaahe wa barakaatohu, allaahumma ighfir lee wale waaledayye walil momineena wal mo’a-menaate be rahmateka yaa arhamar raahemina wabe hurmate as-surratil mubaarakatil faatehate.

Peace be upon you, O my mistress and my leader, O Fiza, O the maidservant of Fatima Al- Zahra, peace be upon her. Peace be upon you, O one who brought up Hasan and Hussain, peace be upon both of them. Peace be upon you, O the glorified, the guided one. Peace be upon you, O the one who gained knowledge and practiced upon! Peace be upon you, O the gratified and the contented one! Peace be upon you, O the tolerant, the open-handed one! Peace be on you. May Allah introduce us in paradise and include us in your group and quench our thirst from the hand of Ali son of Abu Talib. Peace be upon you and upon Fatima Al-Zahra! Peace be upon you and other captive women! Peace, mercy and blessings of Allah be upon you and upon the ladies of pure Imams. O God, forgive us and forgive my parents and forgive the male and female believers. By your Mercy, O the most Merciful of the merciful and by the dignity of holy surah Al-Fateha!

2) Asma bint Umays

She was close to the Holy Prophet (S). Her first husband was Ja'far al-Tayar ibn Abi Talib, so she was the mother-in-law of Sayeda Zaynab (A) who was married to Abdullah. After the death of Ja'far ibn Abi Talib, she married Abu Bakr, who gave her a son named Mohammad who died in Egypt, and then married Imam Ali (A) with whom she had 2 children : Awn and Yahya. She attended Sayeda Fatima's Ghusl (A). The Holy Prophet (S) said of her : 'She is one of the women of Paradise.' She died in 40 AH, and was buried in the Bab al-Saghir cemetery. They are 3 to be buried in the same place, with Maymuna bint Imam Hassan (A), and Hamida bint Muslim ibn Aqil (A).

After the death of Fatima az-Zahra (A), it was Asma bint Umays who raised the children of Fatima az-Zahra (A). Asma was one of the transmitters of hadiths.28

3) Maymuna bint Imam Hassan (A)

Maymuna was the daughter of Imam Hassan (A), she was among the captives of Karbala. She is buried in Bab al-Saghir cemetery.29

4) Hamida bint Muslim ibn Aqil (A)

Hamida is the daughter of Muslim ibn Aqil (A) who was the first cousin of Imam Hussein (A) and his ambassador. Hamida's mother's name was Roqayah : she was the daughter of Imam Ali (A). Hamida was among those who accompanied Imam Hussein (A) to Karbala ; she was then 11 years old. She is buried in Bab al-Saghir cemetery.30

5) The tombs attributed to Umm Salama and Umm Habiba, the wives of the Holy Prophet (S)

Umm Salama and Umm Habiba were the wives of the Holy Prophet (S). The graves attributed to them are near the tomb of Abdullah, the son of Imam Zaynul Abidine (A). But they are not buried here, but in Al-Baqi, in Medina.

- Umm Salama Hind bint Abu Ummayah : Her name was Hind, but she is known as Umm Salama. She was one of the first converts to Islam. For months, Umm Salama refused to deny Islam, despite all the torment her family inflicted on her. Imam as-Sadiq (A) said : 'Um Salama after Hazrat Khadija (A) was the best wives of the Prophet (S). She loved Ahl-ul-Bayt (A) and defended them. 'Imam Hussein's (A) education was entrusted to her because she was very fond of the Ahl-ul-Bayt (A). After the death of Imam Hussein (A), she did the azadari (mourning). The Prophet (S) had given her the sand of Karbala and she had preserved it in a bottle ; the Prophet (S) had told him that when this sand would turn into blood, at that time his grandson Hussein (A) would be killed. She died at the age of 84 in the year 62 AH.31

- Umm Habiba : Her name was Ramlah, known as Umm Habiba. She was the daughter of Abu Sufiyan ibn Harb and Mu'awiyah's sister. She was born 17 years before the prophetic mission. She converted to Islam secretly because her father Abu Sufiyan was a great enemy of the Prophet (S). She suffered a lot because she remained very faithful to Islam. Abu Sufiyan used every means to bring back his daughter to the religion of their ancestors, but he did not succeed. One day, Abu Sufiyan came to his daughter Um Habiba and wanted to sit on the carpet of the Prophet (S). Umm Habiba picked up the rug and told his father that he could not sit on the carpet on which the Prophet (S) was sitting ; she also told him that he was idolatrous and impure. She died in year 44 AH.32
